Genshin Impact Helper

Characters

Albedo's Weapons

Best Weapon

Uraku Misugiri

Normal Attack DMG is increased by 16% and Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 24%. After a nearby active character deals Geo DMG, the aforementioned effects increase by 100% for 15s. Additionally, the wielder's DEF is increased by 20%.

Alternative Weapons

    Cinnabar Spindle

    Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 40% of DEF. The effect will be triggered no more than once every 1.5s and will be cleared 0.1s after the Elemental Skill deals DMG.

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Comment

This Albedo build utilizes either Husk of Opulent Dreams that buffs Albedo's DEF and Geo DMG, or Golden Troupe, which directly buffs his Elemental Skill DMG. If you don't have Uraku Misugiri or Cinnabar Spindle, the latter being an event-exclusive weapon, you may opt to use Harbinger of Dawn or Wolf-Fang.

Albedo's Artifacts

Best Artifact Set

Husk of Opulent Dreams

2-Piece: DEF +30%; 4-Piece: A character equipped with this Artifact set will obtain the Curiosity effect in the following conditions: When on the field, the character gains 1 stack after hitting an opponent with a Geo attack, triggering a maximum of once every 0.3s. When off the field, the character gains 1 stack every 3s. Curiosity can stack up to 4 times, each providing 6% DEF and a 6% Geo DMG Bonus. When 6 seconds pass without gaining a Curiosity stack, 1 stack is lost.

Secondary Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%; 4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Third Option Artifact Set

&

Husk of Opulent Dreams & Golden Troupe

2-Piece: DEF +30%; 2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • DEF%
  • Flat DEF

Comment

This Albedo build utilizes either Husk of Opulent Dreams that buffs Albedo's DEF and Geo DMG, or Golden Troupe, which directly buffs his Elemental Skill DMG. If you don't have Uraku Misugiri or Cinnabar Spindle, the latter being an event-exclusive weapon, you may opt to use Harbinger of Dawn or Wolf-Fang.

Albedo's Teams

Mono Geo 1 Team

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Itto

Main DPS

Gorou

Support

Zhongli

Support

Mono-Geo team comps are Albedo's best teams to utilize the Geo Resonance. He also serves as a battery for Geo characters with high energy requirements like Itto and Gorou.

Mono Geo 2 Team

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Noelle

Main DPS

Gorou

Support

Shinobu

Support

Mono-Geo team comps are Albedo's best teams to utilize the Geo Resonance. He also serves as a battery for Geo characters with high energy requirements like Itto and Gorou.

Double Geo 1 Team

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Support

Zhongli

Support

Double Geo teams allow Albedo's Sub-DPS capabilities to shine with paired with a support like Zhongli, who offers both geo resonance and a resistance-shredding shield. Combining them with other potent duos such as Hu Tao and Xingqiu can make for a well-rounded team, especially when they can make use of Albedo's Elemental Mastery increase from his Elemental Burst.

Double Geo 2 Team

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Double Geo teams allow Albedo's Sub-DPS capabilities to shine with paired with a support like Zhongli, who offers both geo resonance and a resistance-shredding shield. Combining them with other potent duos such as Hu Tao and Xingqiu can make for a well-rounded team, especially when they can make use of Albedo's Elemental Mastery increase from his Elemental Burst.

Rainbow Team 1

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Venti

Support

Rainbow teams that can have an additional slot for Albedo is decent enough as it provides free off-field DPS at no cost whatsover. His Elemental Mastery buff on his burst is also good for teams that have transformative reactions such as Vaporize or Electro-Charged.

Rainbow Team 2

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Main DPS

Venti

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Rainbow teams that can have an additional slot for Albedo is decent enough as it provides free off-field DPS at no cost whatsover. His Elemental Mastery buff on his burst is also good for teams that have transformative reactions such as Vaporize or Electro-Charged.

Rainbow Team 3

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Navia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Rainbow teams that can have an additional slot for Albedo is decent enough as it provides free off-field DPS at no cost whatsover. His Elemental Mastery buff on his burst is also good for teams that have transformative reactions such as Vaporize or Electro-Charged.

Albedo's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Provides a consistent and free off-field Geo DMG as long as the enemies are hit by any sources of damage.
  • Has one of the lowest Elemental Skill CD and lasts for 30 seconds, essentially making it a semi-permanent ability as long as it says on the field.
  • Gives an additional 125 Elemental Mastery after using Elemental Burst.

Weaknesses

  • Solar Isotoma's platform can easily be destroyed by certain bosses or enemies. In some cases, some arenas won't allow you to create one at all.
  • Before C2, skill (DEF) and burst (ATK) have split-scaling. As Albedo should focus on building DEF for his Elemental Skill, the damage of his burst will not be significant.

Alhaitham's Weapons

Dendro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Light of Foliar Incision

CRIT Rate is increased by 4%. After Normal Attacks deal Elemental DMG, the Foliar Incision effect will be obtained, increasing DMG dealt by Normal Attacks and Elemental Skills by 120% of Elemental Mastery. This effect will disappear after 28 DMG instances or 12s. You can obtain Foliar Incision once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Uraku Misugiri

    Normal Attack DMG is increased by 16% and Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 24%. After a nearby active character deals Geo DMG, the aforementioned effects increase by 100% for 15s. Additionally, the wielder's DEF is increased by 20%.

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

Alhaitham needs as much Elemental Mastery and CRIT stats he can get with the Gilded Dreams build as a Dendro Main DPS. You will also need a Dendro support who can use the Deepwood Memories artifact set to provide the Dendro RES shred. This build focuses on maximizing his Projection Attack damage from his Elemental Skill.

Solo Dendro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Light of Foliar Incision

CRIT Rate is increased by 4%. After Normal Attacks deal Elemental DMG, the Foliar Incision effect will be obtained, increasing DMG dealt by Normal Attacks and Elemental Skills by 120% of Elemental Mastery. This effect will disappear after 28 DMG instances or 12s. You can obtain Foliar Incision once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Uraku Misugiri

    Normal Attack DMG is increased by 16% and Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 24%. After a nearby active character deals Geo DMG, the aforementioned effects increase by 100% for 15s. Additionally, the wielder's DEF is increased by 20%.

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

Alternatively, you can have Alhaitham equip the Deepwood Memories artifact set if there are no other characters in the party who can equip it. Since he's alone, he will need more energy to recharge his burst. We recommend equipping your supports with Favonius weapons to fund his energy cost.

Alhaitham's Artifacts

Dendro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80; 4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Alhaitham needs as much Elemental Mastery and CRIT stats he can get with the Gilded Dreams build as a Dendro Main DPS. You will also need a Dendro support who can use the Deepwood Memories artifact set to provide the Dendro RES shred. This build focuses on maximizing his Projection Attack damage from his Elemental Skill.

Solo Dendro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Alternatively, you can have Alhaitham equip the Deepwood Memories artifact set if there are no other characters in the party who can equip it. Since he's alone, he will need more energy to recharge his burst. We recommend equipping your supports with Favonius weapons to fund his energy cost.

Alhaitham's Teams

Quickbloom 1 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS/Support

Yelan

Sub-DPS

This Alhaitham team comp focuses on applying as much Dendro as possible to cause or trigger a combination of Hyperbloom and Quicken. The Dendro in this team can be substituted with another Electro if you have enough Energy Recharge for Alhaitham. If you do not have Nahida, Raiden, or Yelan, a more free to play option with Yaoyao, Xingqiu, and Shinobu are also good.

Quickbloom 2 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Sub-DPS/Support

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

This Alhaitham team comp focuses on applying as much Dendro as possible to cause or trigger a combination of Hyperbloom and Quicken. The Dendro in this team can be substituted with another Electro if you have enough Energy Recharge for Alhaitham. If you do not have Nahida, Raiden, or Yelan, a more free to play option with Yaoyao, Xingqiu, and Shinobu are also good.

Quickbloom 3 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Sub-DPS/Support

Raiden

Sub-DPS

This Alhaitham team comp focuses on applying as much Dendro as possible to cause or trigger a combination of Hyperbloom and Quicken. The Dendro in this team can be substituted with another Electro if you have enough Energy Recharge for Alhaitham. If you do not have Nahida, Raiden, or Yelan, a more free to play option with Yaoyao, Xingqiu, and Shinobu are also good.

Spread 1 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

A party consisting of Dendro and Electro characters enables Alhaitham to focus on maximizing his own personal damage with Spread. Other supprortive characters like Zhongli, or buffers for Electro like Kazuha are okay alternatives.

Spread 2 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

A party consisting of Dendro and Electro characters enables Alhaitham to focus on maximizing his own personal damage with Spread. Other supprortive characters like Zhongli, or buffers for Electro like Kazuha are okay alternatives.

Alhaitham Furina 1 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

Furina is one of Alhaitham's best supports when it comes to increasing his damage, and perfectly slots into a traditional Alhaitham quickbloom team albeit losing out on some Hydro Application. The tradeoff is worth it however, as the buffs that Furina offers in exchange for a lack of comfort can significantly increase the overall damage output of the team.

Alhaitham Furina 2 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Furina is one of Alhaitham's best supports when it comes to increasing his damage, and perfectly slots into a traditional Alhaitham quickbloom team albeit losing out on some Hydro Application. The tradeoff is worth it however, as the buffs that Furina offers in exchange for a lack of comfort can significantly increase the overall damage output of the team.

Burgeon Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

This team comp for Alhaitham centers around him enabling the formation of cores for Thoma to trigger Bugeon. For the reaction to not cause Burning, two Hydro Characters (or an Anemo to swirl Hydro) are recommended to facilitate the reaction.

Free-to-Play Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Lisa

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

If you don't have premium characters, this free-to-play party that centers on Hyperbloom or Quicken can perform well for Alhaitham. Lisa, however, will need a lot of Energy Recharge to make her accessible.

Alhaitham's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Can deal high single and multi-target DMG.
  • Flexible to perform all Dendro-related reactions on-field.
  • Extremely fast Dendro application.
  • Infusion cannot be overriden, and it's not tied to Burst.

Weaknesses

  • Takes time to master due to strict timings and rotations.
  • No interruption resistance.

Aloy's Weapons

Best Weapon

Thundering Pulse

Increases ATK by 20% and grants Thunder Emblem. At stacks 1/2/3, Normal Attack DMG is further increased by 12/24/40%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

  • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s)
  • Casting an Elemental Skill (duration 10s)
  • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

Comment

This Main DPS build for Aloy focuses on dealing reaction-based Elemental DMG from her Elemental Burst. It is best suited for Reverse Melt (Cryo on Pyro) quickswap teams where characters simply use their Elemental Skills and Bursts to deal DMG.

Aloy's Artifacts

Best Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Wanderer's Troupe

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%; 2-Piece: Increases Elemental Mastery by 80

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%; 2-Piece: ATK +18%.

Third Option Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%; 4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Main DPS build for Aloy focuses on dealing reaction-based Elemental DMG from her Elemental Burst. It is best suited for Reverse Melt (Cryo on Pyro) quickswap teams where characters simply use their Elemental Skills and Bursts to deal DMG.

Aloy's Teams

Melt Team

Aloy

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Bennett

Support

Aloy is the main DPS dealing Melt DMG using Normal, Skill and Burst. Kazuha increases the DMG of Aloy. Bennett and Xiangling can provide off-field Pyro.

Aloy's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High Cryo Elemental Burst DMG with low Energy Cost.
  • Can convert her own Normal ATKs into Cryo.
  • Debuffs Enemy ATK while buffs Party Members' ATK.

Weaknesses

  • Coil Stacks depend on Enemies being hit by the scattered Bombs deployed by her Elemental Skill.
  • Conversion of Normal ATK into Cryo depends on Coil stacks.
  • No Constellations.
  • Low Normal Attack DMG

Amber's Weapons

Burst Support / Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Comment

This is a standard Support Build for Amber that focuses on her Pyro application and usage of 4-pc Noblesse Oblige. With this build, it is important to have Amber's Elemental Burst whenever it is off-cooldown to ensure smooth rotations.

Melt DPS

Best Weapon

The First Great Magic

DMG dealt by Charged Attacks increased by 16%. For every party member with the same Elemental Type as the wielder (including the wielder themselves), gain 1 Gimmick stack. For every party member with a different Elemental Type from the wielder, gain 1 Theatrics stack. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Gimmick stacks, ATK will be increased by 16%/32%/48%. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Theatrics stacks, Movement SPD will be increased by 4%/7%/10%.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Ibis Piercer

    The character's Elemental Mastery will increase by 40 within 6s after Charged Attacks hit opponents. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s.

    Hamayumi

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 16% and Charged Attack DMG by 12%. When the equipping character's Energy reaches 100%, this effect is increased by 100%.

Comment

This Amber build takes advantage of her Charged-Shot playstyle and Pyro application to function as a Melt DPS when paired with Cryo units. It is worth noting that after C4, she can frontload her damage into her Baron Bunnies for frontloaded damage.

Amber's Artifacts

Burst Support / Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%; 4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge or ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This is a standard Support Build for Amber that focuses on her Pyro application and usage of 4-pc Noblesse Oblige. With this build, it is important to have Amber's Elemental Burst whenever it is off-cooldown to ensure smooth rotations.

Melt DPS

Best Artifact Set

Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%; 4-Piece: When casting an Elemental Skill, if the character has 15 or more Energy, they lose 15 Energy and Normal/Charge/Plunging Attack DMG is increased by 50% for 10s. This effect will not trigger again during that duration.

Secondary Artifact Set

Wanderer's Troupe

2-Piece: Increases Elemental Mastery by 80; 4-Piece: Increases Charged Attack DMG by 35% if the character uses a Catalyst or a Bow

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery or ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Amber build takes advantage of her Charged-Shot playstyle and Pyro application to function as a Melt DPS when paired with Cryo units. It is worth noting that after C4, she can frontload her damage into her Baron Bunnies for frontloaded damage.

Amber's Teams

Amber Burst Support 1 Team

Amber

Support

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Amber's supportive role focuses on her soaking up enemy aggro with Baron Bunny and applying Pyro for units that can take advantage of them, such as Kazuha in a Hu Tao team for the Viridescent Venerer shred, and Lyney.

Amber Burst Support 2 Team

Amber

Support

Lyney

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Amber's supportive role focuses on her soaking up enemy aggro with Baron Bunny and applying Pyro for units that can take advantage of them, such as Kazuha in a Hu Tao team for the Viridescent Venerer shred, and Lyney.

Melt Burst DPS 1 Team

Amber

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Layla

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This team takes advantage of Cryo applications, as well as Bennett's buffs to enable Amber to deal a good amount of Melt DMG. This can either be played via a prolonged Charged Shot playstyle, or by detonating two of her Baron Bunnies as a Frontloaded DPS.

Melt Burst DPS 2 Team

Amber

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This team takes advantage of Cryo applications, as well as Bennett's buffs to enable Amber to deal a good amount of Melt DMG. This can either be played via a prolonged Charged Shot playstyle, or by detonating two of her Baron Bunnies as a Frontloaded DPS.

Amber's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High-Constellation gameplay has potential for damage with proper investment.
  • Melt DPS playstyle is already viable at C0.

Weaknesses

  • Severely outshined by almost every other pyro option.
  • Long cooldown on her skills before C4.
  • Small Elemental Skill and Burst AoE, with the Burst's projectiles not being guaranteed to hit everything in the full AoE range.

Arlecchino's Weapons

Best Weapon

Crimson Moon's Semblance

Grants a Bond of Life equal to 25% of Max HP when a Charged Attack hits an opponent. This effect can be triggered up to once every 14s. In addition, when the equipping character has a Bond of Life, they gain a 12% DMG Bonus; if the value of the Bond of Life is greater than or equal to 30% of Max HP, then gain an additional 24% DMG Bonus.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

    On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    Blackcliff Pole

    After defeating an enemy, ATK is increased by 12% for 30s. This effect has a maximum of 3 stacks, and the duration of each stack is independent of the others.

    White Tassel

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 24%.

Comment

Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy is tailor-made for Arlecchino due to how often she applies and cleanses the Bond of Life effect, ensuring that the artifact set's passive almost has 100% uptime. As this is a new set, you may use Echoes of An Offerting, Gladiator's Finale, Crimson Witch of Flames, or a mix of both in the meantime while farming her best artifacts.

Arlecchino's Artifacts

Best Artifact Set

Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy

2-Piece: ATK +18%; 4-Piece: When the value of a Bond of Life increases or decreases, this character deals 18% increased DMG for 6s. Max 3 stacks.

Secondary Artifact Set

Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: ATK +18%; 4-Piece: If the wielder of this artifact set uses a Sword, Claymore or Polearm, increases their Normal Attack DMG by 35%.

Third Option Artifact Set

&

Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: ATK +18%; 2-Piece: ATK +18%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy is tailor-made for Arlecchino due to how often she applies and cleanses the Bond of Life effect, ensuring that the artifact set's passive almost has 100% uptime. As this is a new set, you may use Echoes of An Offerting, Gladiator's Finale, Crimson Witch of Flames, or a mix of both in the meantime while farming her best artifacts.

Arlecchino's Teams

Vape 1 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Because of Arlecchino's consistent Pyro application, she excels in double-hydro teams where she is able to consistently Vaporize the opponent. Having a shielder like Zhongli and a buffer like Bennett ensures that her on-field time is maximized and uninterrupted.

Vape 2 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Because of Arlecchino's consistent Pyro application, she excels in double-hydro teams where she is able to consistently Vaporize the opponent. Having a shielder like Zhongli and a buffer like Bennett ensures that her on-field time is maximized and uninterrupted.

Overloaded 1 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

Bennett

Support

Pairing her up with Overload's premier support, Chevreuse, can allow Arlecchino to be one of the more formidable characters to utilize Overload. It is advised to pair her up with a shielder support such as Thoma or C1 Beidou, as they can help with survivability as well as offer extra application and damage.

Overloaded 2 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

Beidou

Support

Pairing her up with Overload's premier support, Chevreuse, can allow Arlecchino to be one of the more formidable characters to utilize Overload. It is advised to pair her up with a shielder support such as Thoma or C1 Beidou, as they can help with survivability as well as offer extra application and damage.

Overloaded 3 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

Thoma

Support

Pairing her up with Overload's premier support, Chevreuse, can allow Arlecchino to be one of the more formidable characters to utilize Overload. It is advised to pair her up with a shielder support such as Thoma or C1 Beidou, as they can help with survivability as well as offer extra application and damage.

Mono Pyro 1 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Since Arlecchino's damage is already respectable, she can be made to run in Mono Pyro, providing her a Sub-DPS like Xiangling, and buffers like Kazuha and Bennett. It is worth noting that she can fully take advantage of C6 Bennett's Pyro DMG Bonus, further skyrocketing her own numbers.

Mono Pyro 2 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

Since Arlecchino's damage is already respectable, she can be made to run in Mono Pyro, providing her a Sub-DPS like Xiangling, and buffers like Kazuha and Bennett. It is worth noting that she can fully take advantage of C6 Bennett's Pyro DMG Bonus, further skyrocketing her own numbers.

Mono Pyro 3 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

Since Arlecchino's damage is already respectable, she can be made to run in Mono Pyro, providing her a Sub-DPS like Xiangling, and buffers like Kazuha and Bennett. It is worth noting that she can fully take advantage of C6 Bennett's Pyro DMG Bonus, further skyrocketing her own numbers.

Burn 1 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Arlecchino can benefit off of Dendro Sub-DPSes like Emilie and Nahida in a Burn Team, with the main strength of the team having two forms of consistent damage. The Dendro units are able to piggyback off of Arlecchino's already good raw damage, supporting her with their own damage, and applying Burning to shred opponents faster.

Burn 2 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Arlecchino can benefit off of Dendro Sub-DPSes like Emilie and Nahida in a Burn Team, with the main strength of the team having two forms of consistent damage. The Dendro units are able to piggyback off of Arlecchino's already good raw damage, supporting her with their own damage, and applying Burning to shred opponents faster.

Double Geo 1 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Arlecchino team takes advantage of the off-field Hydro DMG from a Hydro Sub-DPS, and Geo Resonance and Off-field DMG from Chiori or Albedo paired with Zhongli. This is more efficient for Arlecchino because of the presence of a strong shielder like Zhongli, allowing her entire kit to shine.

Double Geo 2 Team

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

>

Zhongli

Support

This Arlecchino team takes advantage of the off-field Hydro DMG from a Hydro Sub-DPS, and Geo Resonance and Off-field DMG from Chiori or Albedo paired with Zhongli. This is more efficient for Arlecchino because of the presence of a strong shielder like Zhongli, allowing her entire kit to shine.

Arlecchino's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Bond of Life allows an artificial way of tracking her infusion.
  • Is self-sufficient and thus players can opt to pair her with a team of 3 buffers or with a shielder.
  • Insanely high raw scalings and abundant buffs built into her kit allow for easy building.
  • Intuitively simple combos allow for consistent DPS with minimal downtime.
  • Charged Attack can be used for exploration purposes, although it costs stamina.

Weaknesses

  • Because she can only be healed by herself, her playstyle leans heavily towards being high-risk without a shielder.
  • Combo-centric playstyle requires her to either have C1 or some form of interruption resistance, or else she suffers a DPS loss.

Ayaka's Weapons

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Haran Geppaku Futsu

    Obtain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. When other nearby party members use Elemental Skills, the character equipping this weapon will gain 1 Wavespike stack. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character equipping this weapon uses an Elemental Skill, all stacks of Wavespike will be consumed to gain Rippling Upheaval: each stack of Wavespike consumed will increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 8s.

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

The Blizzard Strayer set is the best artifact set for Ayaka. Against enemies that can't be frozen, it is better to get any 2pc set that provides 18% ATK or the 20% Elemental Burst bonus from Noblesse.

Ayaka's Artifacts

Best Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%; 2-Piece: ATK +18%

Third Option Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%; 2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

The Blizzard Strayer set is the best artifact set for Ayaka. Against enemies that can't be frozen, it is better to get any 2pc set that provides 18% ATK or the 20% Elemental Burst bonus from Noblesse.

Ayaka's Teams

Freeze Team

Ayaka

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Support

Kokomi

Support

This high-rarity freeze team provides the ideal scenario for freezing multiple enemies and dealing high single target and AoE damage. Shenhe provides the damage buff, Kokomi applies hydro and heals the team, and Kazuha groups enemies together and decreases their Cryo Resistance thanks to the Viridescent Venerer Artifact Set .

Ayaka F2P Team Comp

Ayaka

Main DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

Traveler(Anemo)

Support

This Ayaka F2P team will require her to get very close to enemies to apply the Wet status from Barbara's Elemental Skill. Kaeya will help refill Ayaka's Elemental Burst while the Anemo Traveler can slightly help with grouping enemies together.

Ayaka's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Ayaka has an extremely high scaling on her Elemental Burst DMG, which can be very useful for speedrunning bosses.
  • Each talent in her entire kit can easily apply Cryo with relatively high scaling, which makes her a great pick as a Cryo Main DPS.
  • Uses a special sprint that's useful for both exploration and combat.

Weaknesses

  • High Energy Cost for her Elemental Burst.
  • High investement is needed not only for herself but also for her teammates, which usually comprises of all 5-star characters.

Ayato's Weapons

Low-Ping Hydro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Haran Geppaku Futsu

Obtain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. When other nearby party members use Elemental Skills, the character equipping this weapon will gain 1 Wavespike stack. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character equipping this weapon uses an Elemental Skill, all stacks of Wavespike will be consumed to gain Rippling Upheaval: each stack of Wavespike consumed will increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 8s.

Alternative Weapons

    Mistsplitter Reforged

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

Comment

The Echoes of an Offering artifact set should only be used if players have a low ping to Genshin Impact servers. This is because the chance of triggering the 4pc effect gradually gets more inconsistent the higher the ping is. With a constant green ping, found on the top right, this build has the bigger potential to deal more damage than the Heart of Depth set.

Hydro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Haran Geppaku Futsu

Obtain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. When other nearby party members use Elemental Skills, the character equipping this weapon will gain 1 Wavespike stack. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character equipping this weapon uses an Elemental Skill, all stacks of Wavespike will be consumed to gain Rippling Upheaval: each stack of Wavespike consumed will increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 8s.

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.
  • Mistsplitter Reforged

    • Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

Comment

This is Ayato's most consistent build for Ayato as a Main DPS, especially for players with high ping. Not only does it increase his Normal Attack damage, but it also increases his Elemental Burst damage as well. You may also use Gladiator's Finale or Nymph's Dream as placeholders, but Heart of Depth should theoretically be his second-best artifact set.

Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

This Sub-DPS build utilizes Ayato's Elemental Burst. His burst window will be used for buffing damage and setting up Elemental Reactions for the Main DPS.

Ayato's Artifacts

Low-Ping Hydro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Echoes of An Offering

2-Piece: ATK +18%; 4-Piece: When Normal Attacks hit opponents, there is a 36% chance that it will trigger Valley Rite, which will increase Normal Attack DMG by 70% of ATK. This effect will be dispelled 0.05s after a Normal Attack deals DMG. If a Normal Attack fails to trigger Valley Rite, the odds of it triggering the next time will increase by 20%. This trigger can occur once every 0.2s

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

The Echoes of an Offering artifact set should only be used if players have a low ping to Genshin Impact servers. This is because the chance of triggering the 4pc effect gradually gets more inconsistent the higher the ping is. With a constant green ping, found on the top right, this build has the bigger potential to deal more damage than the Heart of Depth set.

Hydro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Heart of Depth

2-Piece: Hydro DMG Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: After using Elemental Skill, increases Normal Attack and Charged Attack DMG by 30% for 15s

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

This is Ayato's most consistent build for Ayato as a Main DPS, especially for players with high ping. Not only does it increase his Normal Attack damage, but it also increases his Elemental Burst damage as well. You may also use Gladiator's Finale or Nymph's Dream as placeholders, but Heart of Depth should theoretically be his second-best artifact set.

Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%; 4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

This Sub-DPS build utilizes Ayato's Elemental Burst. His burst window will be used for buffing damage and setting up Elemental Reactions for the Main DPS.

Ayato's Teams

Mixed Party Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Ayato will be the trigger in this Electro-Charged plus Vaporize team. Fischl (especially at C6) can help recharge Ayato's energy while Bennett can boost Ayato's damage and heal the party. Make sure to swirl Pyro first by using Kazuha's burst while standing on Bennett's burst for Kazuha to self-swirl Pyro!

Vaporize Party Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Kazuha

Support

Ayato can achieve his highest peronsal DPS by triggering Vaporize reactions during his Elemental Skill. Xiangling and Bennett will provide the Pyro status effect while also activating a damage-boosting Pyro resonance. Kazuha will buff the whole party's Elemental DMG. You can replace Kazuha with Yun Jin if you don't have him. This will limit the damage buff to only Ayato's.

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Ayato is also a great enabler for the Hyperbloom reaction. His Elemental Skill will help create Dendro Cores while the off-field Electro Character will trigger the Hyperbloom reaction.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

Ayato is also a great enabler for the Hyperbloom reaction. His Elemental Skill will help create Dendro Cores while the off-field Electro Character will trigger the Hyperbloom reaction.

Burgeon 1 Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

This Dendro Team Comp for Ayato will only need 2 core teammates, a Pyro and Dendro off-field damage dealer. The goal is to create Dendro Cores by using Ayato and the Dendro Traveler's Elemental Burst. Afterwards, the off-field Pyro unit will trigger the Burgeon reaction with Pyro damage. Afterwards, you can swap Ayato back in and do damage with his Elemental Skill.

Burgeon 2 Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

This Dendro Team Comp for Ayato will only need 2 core teammates, a Pyro and Dendro off-field damage dealer. The goal is to create Dendro Cores by using Ayato and the Dendro Traveler's Elemental Burst. Afterwards, the off-field Pyro unit will trigger the Burgeon reaction with Pyro damage. Afterwards, you can swap Ayato back in and do damage with his Elemental Skill.

Freeze Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Venti

Sub-DPS

Diona

Support

Ayato and Ganyu will freeze enemies, easily letting Ayato do his Normal Attacks on enemies. Venti's on the team for crowd control and because his Elemental Burst syncs great with Ganyu's. Diona will give you shields, heals, and Cryo Resonance.

Free-to-Play Team

Ayato

Main DPS

Lisa

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

For newer players, a Hyperbloom team comp can be used as an early game option for Ayato. You may opt to using Collei as well!

Sub-DPS Team

Ayato

Sub-DPS

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Use Ayato's Elemental Burst to buff Yoimiya's Normal Attacks. He can also use his Elemental Skill to trigger Yoimiya's burst, while Bennett and Kazuha can further buff her! Note that Ayato will be the one Vaporizing in this team comp due to poor application. Yoimiya can be replaced with Raiden Shogun or by any character who would appreciate the Hydro DMG Ayato provides with his Elemental burst.

Ayato's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • His biggest pro is that he is extremely versatile towards any Hydro-related reaction team comps. If any given party requires a Hydro DPS, Ayato can fill in one way or another.
  • Can deal high single and multi-target AoE DMG.
  • Elemental Burst can support teammates and himself.

Weaknesses

  • While highly flexible and versatile, he is a jack of all trades but master of none. As he can slot in to many Hydro team comps, he is not considered as a staple in those parties.
  • High Elemental Burst cost. This is slightly fixed thanks to his passive.

Baizhu's Weapons

Dendro Support

Best Weapon

Jadefall's Splendor

For 3s after using an Elemental Burst or creating a shield, the equipping character can gain the Primordial Jade Regalia effect: Restore 4.5 Energy every 2.5s, and gain 0.3% Elemental DMG Bonus for their corresponding Elemental Type for every 1,000 Max HP they possess, up to 12%. Primordial Jade Regalia will still take effect even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sacrificial Fragments

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

    When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Comment

This Support Baizhu build focuses on applying Dendro to set-up reactions while providing healing and shielding. This is best used for team comps that focuses on Dendro reactions such as Hyperbloom or Aggravate.

Full Healer

Best Weapon

Jadefall's Splendor

For 3s after using an Elemental Burst or creating a shield, the equipping character can gain the Primordial Jade Regalia effect: Restore 4.5 Energy every 2.5s, and gain 0.3% Elemental DMG Bonus for their corresponding Elemental Type for every 1,000 Max HP they possess, up to 12%. Primordial Jade Regalia will still take effect even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

    When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Comment

This alternative Baizhu build focuses on pure healing. Equipping HP stats with Ocean-Hued Clam can also provide some off-field DMG. You can also substitute with Noblesse Oblige if you don't necessarily need the benefits of overheal, especially if your party isn't Dendro-centric.

Dendro Driver

Best Weapon

A Thousand Floating Dreams

Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

Alternative Weapons

    Wandering Evenstar

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Hakushin Ring

    After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 10% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

Comment

This Pseudo-DPS Build for Baizhu focuses on using his Normal Attacks to drive Dendro and set up or trigger Dendro reactions for Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon reactions.

Baizhu's Artifacts

Dendro Support

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • HP
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Support Baizhu build focuses on applying Dendro to set-up reactions while providing healing and shielding. This is best used for team comps that focuses on Dendro reactions such as Hyperbloom or Aggravate.

Full Healer

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: When the character equipping this artifact set heals a character in the party, a Sea-Dyed Foam will appear for 3 seconds, accumulating the amount of HP recovered from healing (including overflow healing). At the end of the duration, the Sea-Dyed Foam will explode, dealing DMG to nearby opponents based on 90% of the accumulated healing. (This DMG is calculated similarly to Reactions such as Electro-Charged, and Superconduct, but is not affected by Elemental Mastery, Character Levels, or Reaction DMG Bonuses). Only one Sea-Dyed Foam can be produced every 3.5 seconds. Each Sea-Dyed Foam can accumulate up to 30,000 HP (including overflow healing). There can be no more than one Sea-Dyed Foam active at any given time. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Song of Days Past

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: When the equipping character heals a party member, the Yearning effect will be created for 6s, which records the total amount of healing provided (including overflow healing). When the duration expires, the Yearning effect will be transformed into the Waves of Days Past effect: When your active party member hits an opponent with a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Plunging Attack, Elemental Skill, or Elemental Burst, the DMG dealt will be increased by 8% of the total healing amount recorded by the Yearning effect. The Waves of Days Past effect is removed after it has taken effect 5 times or after 10s. A single instance of the Yearning effect can record up to 15,000 healing, and only a single instance can exist at once, but it can record the healing from multiple equipping characters. Equipping characters on standby can still trigger this effect.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP% or Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • HP
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This alternative Baizhu build focuses on pure healing. Equipping HP stats with Ocean-Hued Clam can also provide some off-field DMG. You can also substitute with Noblesse Oblige if you don't necessarily need the benefits of overheal, especially if your party isn't Dendro-centric.

Dendro Driver

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • HP

Comment

This Pseudo-DPS Build for Baizhu focuses on using his Normal Attacks to drive Dendro and set up or trigger Dendro reactions for Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon reactions.

Support

Cyno

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS

This Baizhu team is focused on triggering Hyperbloom to buff the reaction while off-field. We recommend bringing a second dendro to get resonance for the Elemental Mastery buff. Some of teams above can also combine Quicken to add damage.

Aggravate/Spread 1 Team

Baizhu

Support

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Baizhu can replace Zhongli in Quicken teams, as well as cover a Dendro slot for you to add in another Electro or Dendro. Triple Dendro teams with Alhaitham and Nahida is also viable as long as you have an effective Electro applicator like Yae Miko.

Aggravate/Spread 2 Team

Baizhu

Support

Cyno

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Baizhu can replace Zhongli in Quicken teams, as well as cover a Dendro slot for you to add in another Electro or Dendro. Triple Dendro teams with Alhaitham and Nahida is also viable as long as you have an effective Electro applicator like Yae Miko.

Main DPS

Baizhu can replace Zhongli in Quicken teams, as well as cover a Dendro slot for you to add in another Electro or Dendro. Triple Dendro teams with Alhaitham and Nahida is also viable as long as you have an effective Electro applicator like Yae Miko.

Baizhu can replace Zhongli in Quicken teams, as well as cover a Dendro slot for you to add in another Electro or Dendro. Triple Dendro teams with Alhaitham and Nahida is also viable as long as you have an effective Electro applicator like Yae Miko.

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Burgeon teams with Baizhu covers up the healing from the self-inflicted explosions as well as applying the Dendro while off-field. Baizhu can also act as a solo Dendro driver if he's the Main DPS in the party.

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Baizhu provides healing for Nilou Bloom team comps, which frees characters like Kokomi, Barbara, or Yaoyao for other teams.

Nilou Bloom 2 Team

Baizhu

Support

Nahida

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Support

Baizhu provides healing for Nilou Bloom team comps, which frees characters like Kokomi, Barbara, or Yaoyao for other teams.

Baizhu's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Extremely comfortable party healing from his Elemental Skill.
  • Off-field Dendro application on his burst.
  • HP% scaling benefits both his healing and Dendro buffs.

Weaknesses

  • High Energy requirements.
  • Dendro application is below average in AoE situations.
  • Shield can act as an interrupt resist but not as a reliable protection against big hits.

Barbara's Weapons

Bloom DPS

Best Weapon

Sacrificial Fragments

After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Magic Guide

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 12%.

    Wandering Evenstar

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

Comment

A Barbara build focused on creating Dendro Cores through her Elemental Skill or Normal ATtacks will require her to use the Gilded Dreams Artifact Set with Elemental Mastery mainstats. This build works especially well for Bloom teams or as Free to Play team for Nilou as a replacement for Kokomi.

Support

Best Weapon

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    Everlasting Moonglow

    Healing Bonus is increased by 10%, Normal ATK DMG is increased by 1% of the Max HP of the character equipping this weapon. For 12s after using an Elemental Burst, Normal Attacks that hit opponents will restore 0.6 Energy. Energy can be restored this way once every 0.1s.

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

Comment

This Barbara build allows you to deal DMG while healing at the same time through using the bubble from the Ocean-Hued Clam set. The Bubble can easily deal maximum DMG when Barbara uses her Elemental Burst. Alternatively, you can use the Maiden Beloved 4-piece set to opt for a purely healer-focused Barbara.

Barbara's Artifacts

Bloom DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80; 4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • HP%

Comment

A Barbara build focused on creating Dendro Cores through her Elemental Skill or Normal ATtacks will require her to use the Gilded Dreams Artifact Set with Elemental Mastery mainstats. This build works especially well for Bloom teams or as Free to Play team for Nilou as a replacement for Kokomi.

Support

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%; 4-Piece: When the character equipping this artifact set heals a character in the party, a Sea-Dyed Foam will appear for 3 seconds, accumulating the amount of HP recovered from healing (including overflow healing). At the end of the duration, the Sea-Dyed Foam will explode, dealing DMG to nearby opponents based on 90% of the accumulated healing. (This DMG is calculated similarly to Reactions such as Electro-Charged, and Superconduct, but is not affected by Elemental Mastery, Character Levels, or Reaction DMG Bonuses). Only one Sea-Dyed Foam can be produced every 3.5 seconds. Each Sea-Dyed Foam can accumulate up to 30,000 HP (including overflow healing). There can be no more than one Sea-Dyed Foam active at any given time. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Maiden Beloved

2-Piece: Character Healing Effectiveness +15%; 4-Piece: Using an Elemental Skill or Burst increases healing received by all party members by 20% for 10s

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • HP%

Comment

This Barbara build allows you to deal DMG while healing at the same time through using the bubble from the Ocean-Hued Clam set. The Bubble can easily deal maximum DMG when Barbara uses her Elemental Burst. Alternatively, you can use the Maiden Beloved 4-piece set to opt for a purely healer-focused Barbara.

Barbara's Teams

Dendro Core 1 Team

Barbara

Support

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Support

Barbara Dendro Core teams focuses on Barbara generating Dendro Cores in tandem with her Dendro allies. With fridge teams, there is the added benefit of freezing enemies in place, allowing bloom cores to reliably pop around them.

Dendro Core 2 Team

Barbara

Support

Nilou

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Support

Barbara Dendro Core teams focuses on Barbara generating Dendro Cores in tandem with her Dendro allies. With fridge teams, there is the added benefit of freezing enemies in place, allowing bloom cores to reliably pop around them.

Support Role Team

Barbara

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Barbara as a support can be fitted in any team comp. She applies very little Hydro through her Elemental Skill, which can help in not interfering with other Elemental Reactions. In this team comp we have Barbara as a support and the second Hydro unit just so we can enable the Hydro Resonance, which will increase Yelan's damage.

Barbara's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill can burst heal or heal over time.
  • Can auto revive characters at C6, which gives Barbara the benefit of having a rare safety net.
  • As a catalyst user, her hydro application is incredibly consistent, allowing her to slot into Dendro-focused teams as an on-field driver for Bloom and Hyperbloom.

Weaknesses

  • One-trick pony character, as most of her kit only revolves around Hydro application and healing.
  • Skills have long cooldowns, giving her an extremely limited time where she is effective if not played on-field.
  • Applies the Wet status on to herself and her teammates when casting her Elemental Skill, which may lead to enemies triggering reactions against you.

Beidou's Weapons

Electro Main DPS

Best Weapon

The Unforged

Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, ATK increase effect is increased by 100%.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

Comment

This Beidou build focuses on dealing DMG while on-field through her Elemental Skill and Normal Attacks.

Burst Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Wolf's Gravestone

Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Comment

This Beidou build specializes on dealing tons of Electro DMG through her Elemental Burst. Make sure you have at least 180 Energy Recharge to use her Elemental Burst as frequently as you can.

Beidou's Artifacts

Electro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Gladiator's Finale & Thundering Fury

2-Piece: ATK +18%; 2-Piece: Electro DMG Bonus +15%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Beidou build focuses on dealing DMG while on-field through her Elemental Skill and Normal Attacks.

Burst Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%; 4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Beidou build specializes on dealing tons of Electro DMG through her Elemental Burst. Make sure you have at least 180 Energy Recharge to use her Elemental Burst as frequently as you can.

Beidou's Teams

Taser Team

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This team specializes in taking out multiple enemies with the Electo-charged reaction. Beidou provides Electro thanks to her Elemental Burst so that Tartaglia can trigger Electro-charged and deal tons of AoE DMG.

Superconduct Team

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Diona

Support

Beidou acts as an Electro supplement to trigger Superconduct, allowing Eula to deal more Physical DMG with her already DMG dealing Elemental Burst.

Hyperbloom Team

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Support

While Beidou won't be participating in activating Dendro Cores for Hyperbloom, Beidou still acts as an Electro supplement to trigger Quicken to increase Hyperbloom DMG.

F2P Team

Beidou

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

This is Beidou's best team without any 5-star characters. A combination of Beidou and Xingqiu's Elemental Bursts combined with Fischl's Oz and Sucrose's Swirl through her Normal Attacks allows you to deal a lot of Electro-charged DMG in the process!

Beidou's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Perfect Counters reward players with High Electro DMG
  • Can provide off-field High Electro DMG with Elemental Burst

Weaknesses

  • High energy cost for Elemental Burst. Almost always requires a battery
  • Elemental Skill needs precise timing to get the most out of it
  • Needs to take DMG before she can maximize her DPS with Constellation Lv. 4

Bennett's Weapons

Pyro Burst DPS Support

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Aquila Favonia

    ATK is increased by 20%. Triggers on taking DMG: the soul of the Falcon of the West awakens, holding the banner of resistance aloft, regenerating HP equal to 100% of ATK and dealing 200% of ATK as DMG to surrounding enemies. This effect can only occur once every 15s.

    The Alley Flash

    Increases DMG dealt by the character equipping this weapon by 12%. Taking DMG dismantles the effect for 5s.

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Freedom-Sworn

    Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Comment

This build allows Bennett to not only buff the party's ATK, but will also deal above average Pyro DMG and reactions. Bennett's healing is still very effective in this build despite the lack of HP or Healing Bonus. Aim for weapons that have the highest Base ATK to make use of his ATK buffs to the fullest, then focus on Energy Recharge before moving to the offensive stats.

Pyro Healer Support

Best Weapon

Skyward Blade

CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sapwood Blade

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This Bennett build specializes in pure and effective healing to keep your party alive by building Energy Recharge swords and HP sub stats. Be sure to have his Base ATK really high to have a better ATK buff by levelling both him and his weapon to max.

Bennett's Artifacts

Pyro Burst DPS Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

This build allows Bennett to not only buff the party's ATK, but will also deal above average Pyro DMG and reactions. Bennett's healing is still very effective in this build despite the lack of HP or Healing Bonus. Aim for weapons that have the highest Base ATK to make use of his ATK buffs to the fullest, then focus on Energy Recharge before moving to the offensive stats.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack

  • Energy Recharge

Bennett's Teams

Bennett-Xiangling Duo 1 Team

Bennett

Support

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett and Xiangling are two core duos that are almost inseperable when speaking of Pyro-focused team comps. Any teams that rely on fast Pyro Application and great off-field damage can make use of their synergy, as well as Bennett's energy and ATK buffs.

Any standard team comps which requires a buffer and healer support can find it in one character, Bennett! As he can fulfill both roles at once, you may opt on taking out other defensive Supports for other Sub-DPS characters.

Sunfire 1 Team

Bennett

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Jean

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Commonly coined with Jean, Bennett's field applies Pyro to to the active character, which Jean can rapidly swirl if you're standing on both his and her Elemental Bursts. If she's built with Elemental Mastery and Viridescent Venerer, you may see sparks fly! Characters with them may vary, but ultimately, this effect applies fast Pyro, so any team comps involving Melt, Vaporize, Overloaded, and Swirl are good for these duo.

Sunfire 2 Team

Bennett

Support

Yelan

Main DPS

Jean

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Commonly coined with Jean, Bennett's field applies Pyro to to the active character, which Jean can rapidly swirl if you're standing on both his and her Elemental Bursts. If she's built with Elemental Mastery and Viridescent Venerer, you may see sparks fly! Characters with them may vary, but ultimately, this effect applies fast Pyro, so any team comps involving Melt, Vaporize, Overloaded, and Swirl are good for these duo.

Bennett's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • One of the best ATK buffers in the game that also provides fast healing and energy at a low cost.
  • Can accumulate large amounts of energy with his low-cooldown Elemental Skill, making his Elemental Burst spammable.
  • Can easily apply Pyro to set-up reactions. The burst also provides a field of Pyro that can be used for applying reactions in Sunfire builds or Kazuha's swirl.

Weaknesses

  • Fully charged Elemental Skill outside of Burst field causes knockback.

Candace's Weapons

Off-Field Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

The Catch

Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP

    Skyward Spine

    Increases CRIT Rate by 8% and increases Normal ATK SPD by 12%. Additionally, Normal and Charged Attacks hits on enemies have a 50% chance to trigger a vacuum blade that deals 40% of ATK as DMG in a small AoE. This effect can occur no more than once every 2s

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field

Comment

This Candace build is for players who want to increase Candace's personal damage. Choose between an ER/HP/HP build or an HP/Hydro/CRIT build if you want provide more buffs or deal more damage. We recommend around ±180% Energy Recharge for this build.

Support Buffer

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the fieldp>

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%

    Kitain Cross Spear

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field

Comment

Candace as a support is her best build, as she goes all-in on improving her role as a buffer by increasing her HP% and providing Elemental DMG bonus to your party's normal attacks. You will want around ±180% Energy Recharge to make Candace's buffs more frequent. Make sure to use a CRIT Rate circlet if you're using a Favonius Lance!

Candace's Artifacts

Off-Field Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%/Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: HP%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Candace build is for players who want to increase Candace's personal damage. Choose between an ER/HP/HP build or an HP/Hydro/CRIT build if you want provide more buffs or deal more damage. We recommend around ±180% Energy Recharge for this build.

  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
