Candace as a support is her best build, as she goes all-in on improving her role as a buffer by increasing her HP% and providing Elemental DMG bonus to your party's normal attacks. You will want around ±180% Energy Recharge to make Candace's buffs more frequent. Make sure to use a CRIT Rate circlet if you're using a Favonius Lance!

Candace's Teams

Bloom Team

Candace

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Yaoyao

Sub-DPS

Nilou

Support

This team build focuses on the synergy of Candace and Yaoyao's Elemental Burst. Nilou will provide the aura that gives off Bountiful Cores, while Yaoyao with Hydro infusion can spread a lot of Dendro to enemies while mitigating Dendro DMG taken from the cores.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Candace

Sub-DPS

Cyno

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

This Candace team build focuses on triggering Electro-Charged elemental reactions. Cyno works particularly well with Candace since she can increase his Elemental Normal Attack damage without overriding his Electro Infused normal attacks.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Candace

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Candace team build focuses on triggering Electro-Charged elemental reactions. Cyno works particularly well with Candace since she can increase his Elemental Normal Attack damage without overriding his Electro Infused normal attacks.

Vaporize Team

Candace

Sub-DPS

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Candace can act as an enabler for Vaporize teams with her off-field Hydro DMG, especially at C6. In combination with Yun Jin, they will both enhance the Elemental Normal Attacks of the Main DPS!

Candace's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Enhances Elemental Normal Attacks with Elemental Burst.
  • Decent Elemental Burst DMG.
  • Has a Shield and Parry mechanic that can help mitigate damage.
  • Becomes a great off-field Sub-DPS at C6.

Weaknesses

  • Low Elemental Particle generation.
  • Hydro infusion from Elemental Burst can be bad for some characters.
  • Below average DMG buffs compared to other characters.

Charlotte's Weapons

Cryo Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Kagura's Verity

Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Oathsworn Eye

    Increases Energy Recharge by 24% for 10s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

If you're looking to take advantage of Charlotte's off-field damage potential, Golden Troupe is her all-around best build. You can also equip a full Blizzard Strayer build to provide her with enough CRIT Rate, giving leeway for a higher CRIT DMG for Freeze teams.

Hybrid Support Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Kagura's Verity

Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Oathsworn Eye

    Increases Energy Recharge by 24% for 10s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

A full Noblesse Oblige build filled with ATK and a side of Energy Recharge will make Charlotte a flexible Sub-DPS unit! This will lead to a perfect balance of her support and offensive capabilities, and also increase the ATK of all party members after her Burst!

Pure Healer

Best Weapon

Skyward Atlas

Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Oathsworn Eye

    Increases Energy Recharge by 24% for 10s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

Comment

Charlotte as a Support prioritizes her Elemental Burst's effectiveness. Should you wish to focus on her heals, go for Healing Artifacts and a Healing Bonus circlet. You may also use Noblesse Oblige or Tenacity of the Millelith should you wish to prioritize offensive buffs.

Charlotte's Artifacts

Cryo Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%/Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

If you're looking to take advantage of Charlotte's off-field damage potential, Golden Troupe is her all-around best build. You can also equip a full Blizzard Strayer build to provide her with enough CRIT Rate, giving leeway for a higher CRIT DMG for Freeze teams.

Hybrid Support Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%/Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

A full Noblesse Oblige build filled with ATK and a side of Energy Recharge will make Charlotte a flexible Sub-DPS unit! This will lead to a perfect balance of her support and offensive capabilities, and also increase the ATK of all party members after her Burst!

Best Artifact Set

&

Gladiator's Finale & Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

Secondary Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: ATK%/Healing Bonus

  • Energy Recharge

Charlotte as a Support prioritizes her Elemental Burst's effectiveness. Should you wish to focus on her heals, go for Healing Artifacts and a Healing Bonus circlet. You may also use Noblesse Oblige or Tenacity of the Millelith should you wish to prioritize offensive buffs.

Charlotte's Teams

Freeze 1 Team

Charlotte

Support

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Charlotte's magnificent Cryo application and AoE will work wonders in Freeze teams, provided that you can keep Hydro propped up. Yelan and Xingqiu will be able to do this no problem. Additionally, putting Charlotte in a team filled with Fontanians like Wriothesley, Neuvillette, and Furina will be able to take advantage of her Passive Talent!

Sub-DPS

Main DPS

Charlotte's magnificent Cryo application and AoE will work wonders in Freeze teams, provided that you can keep Hydro propped up. Yelan and Xingqiu will be able to do this no problem. Additionally, putting Charlotte in a team filled with Fontanians like Wriothesley, Neuvillette, and Furina will be able to take advantage of her Passive Talent!

Support

Main DPS

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS

Charlotte's magnificent Cryo application and AoE will work wonders in Freeze teams, provided that you can keep Hydro propped up. Yelan and Xingqiu will be able to do this no problem. Additionally, putting Charlotte in a team filled with Fontanians like Wriothesley, Neuvillette, and Furina will be able to take advantage of her Passive Talent!

Hyperfridge 1 Team

Charlotte

Sub-DPS/Support

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

If you wish to still take advantage of one of the strongest Elemental Reactions in the game, then having Charlotte co-exist in Hyperbloom teams will add several reactions into the mix, including Frozen and Superconduct.

Hyperfridge 2 Team

Charlotte

Sub-DPS/Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

If you wish to still take advantage of one of the strongest Elemental Reactions in the game, then having Charlotte co-exist in Hyperbloom teams will add several reactions into the mix, including Frozen and Superconduct.

Charlotte's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Consistent Cryo application due to her Elemental Skill, which is useful for Reactions.
  • Elemental Skill capable of dealing Cryo DMG to multiple targets simultaneously.
  • Can be a Sub-DPS and a Support unit at the same time due to Elemental Skill and Burst, respectively.
  • Highly versatile depending on build.

Weaknesses

  • Buff of Passive Talent restricted to characters from Fontaine.
  • Elemental Skill can only mark up to 5 targets at maximum.

Chevreuse's Weapons

Overloaded Full Support

Best Weapon

Black Tassel

Increases DMG against slimes by 40%.

Alternative Weapons

    Dialogues of the Desert Sages

    When the wielder performs healing, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Comment

Stacking full HP stats with Black Tassel with buffs from Noblesse Oblige is Chevreuse's best build for Overloaded-focused team comps as a healer-buffer support. Try to achieve 40,000 HP to gain the full ATK buffs of her passive! You may also use Favonius Lance or Rightful Reward if you've already reached the HP threshold.

Energy Recharge is the only other relevant stat for this specific build. This way, you will have enough energy to fund your burst to activate the buffs of Noblesse Oblige!

You may also use Song of Days Past if a party member is already equipping Noblesse Oblige, or if you have a Hypercarry in your team.

Hybrid Pyro Support-DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Dialogues of the Desert Sages

    When the wielder performs healing, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Prospector's Drill

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Unity's Symbol that lasts 30s, up to a maximum of 3 Symbols. When using their Elemental Skill or Burst, all Symbols will be consumed and the Struggle effect will be granted for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 3% ATK and 7% All Elemental DMG Bonus. The Struggle effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is not on the field.

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

If you already have Noblesse Oblige buffers in your team comp like Kujou Sara or Bennett, you may build Chevreuse with Crimson Witch of Flames set with offensive substats like CRIT and ATK as a hybrid Support and Sub-DPS in Overloaded teams.

This means you will have to balance HP, CRIT Rate, CRIT DMG, and Energy Recharge. Because her damaging skills do not scale with HP, you will also have to focus on ATK depending on your chosen weapon. If you have Staff of Homa, this should help her solve this issue!

Overloaded Pyro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of the Scarlet Sands

    The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

    Prospector's Drill

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Unity's Symbol that lasts 30s, up to a maximum of 3 Symbols. When using their Elemental Skill or Burst, all Symbols will be consumed and the Struggle effect will be granted for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 3% ATK and 7% All Elemental DMG Bonus. The Struggle effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is not on the field.

    Wavebreaker's Fin

    For every point of the entire party's combined maximum Energy capacity, the Elemental Burst DMG of the character equipping this weapon is increased by 0.12%. A maximum of 40% increased Elemental Burst DMG can be achieved this way.

    Kitain Cross Spear

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

This build shifts the focus to increase Chevreuse's overall personal damage. She will be mostly used as a quickswap unit to trigger her Skill and Burst, before switching out.

The Crimson Witch of Flames boosts both Pyro Damage and Overload Reaction damage, making it a suitable choice for Sub-DPS Chevreuse as long as you also have ATK%, CRIT Rate, CRIT DMG, and Elemental Mastery.

Chevreuse's Artifacts

Overloaded Full Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Secondary Artifact Set

Song of Days Past

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the equipping character heals a party member, the Yearning effect will be created for 6s, which records the total amount of healing provided (including overflow healing). When the duration expires, the Yearning effect will be transformed into the Waves of Days Past effect: When your active party member hits an opponent with a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Plunging Attack, Elemental Skill, or Elemental Burst, the DMG dealt will be increased by 8% of the total healing amount recorded by the Yearning effect. The Waves of Days Past effect is removed after it has taken effect 5 times or after 10s. A single instance of the Yearning effect can record up to 15,000 healing, and only a single instance can exist at once, but it can record the healing from multiple equipping characters. Equipping characters on standby can still trigger this effect.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Stacking full HP stats with Black Tassel with buffs from Noblesse Oblige is Chevreuse's best build for Overloaded-focused team comps as a healer-buffer support. Try to achieve 40,000 HP to gain the full ATK buffs of her passive! You may also use Favonius Lance or Rightful Reward if you've already reached the HP threshold.

Energy Recharge is the only other relevant stat for this specific build. This way, you will have enough energy to fund your burst to activate the buffs of Noblesse Oblige!

You may also use Song of Days Past if a party member is already equipping Noblesse Oblige, or if you have a Hypercarry in your team.

Hybrid Pyro Support-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Secondary Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%.

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP% (with high ATK% weapon or substats)/ATK% (with high HP% weapon or substats)
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

If you already have Noblesse Oblige buffers in your team comp like Kujou Sara or Bennett, you may build Chevreuse with Crimson Witch of Flames set with offensive substats like CRIT and ATK as a hybrid Support and Sub-DPS in Overloaded teams.

This means you will have to balance HP, CRIT Rate, CRIT DMG, and Energy Recharge. Because her damaging skills do not scale with HP, you will also have to focus on ATK depending on your chosen weapon. If you have Staff of Homa, this should help her solve this issue!

Overloaded Pyro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%.

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Golden Troupe & Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK% or Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This build shifts the focus to increase Chevreuse's overall personal damage. She will be mostly used as a quickswap unit to trigger her Skill and Burst, before switching out.

The Crimson Witch of Flames boosts both Pyro Damage and Overload Reaction damage, making it a suitable choice for Sub-DPS Chevreuse as long as you also have ATK%, CRIT Rate, CRIT DMG, and Elemental Mastery.

Chevreuse's Teams

Raiden Hypercarry 1 Team

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Sara

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

In Raiden's Hypercarry teams, Chevreuse replaces Kazuha for the ATK buffs and Electro RES Shred. This in combination with Sara and Bennett buffs, Raiden Shogun's damage should skyrocket more or less at a similar height! If your Raiden is not at C2, then you may want to swap out Sara for another damage dealer like Xiangling.

Raiden Hypercarry 2 Team

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

In Raiden's Hypercarry teams, Chevreuse replaces Kazuha for the ATK buffs and Electro RES Shred. This in combination with Sara and Bennett buffs, Raiden Shogun's damage should skyrocket more or less at a similar height! If your Raiden is not at C2, then you may want to swap out Sara for another damage dealer like Xiangling.

Yoimiya Overloaded 1 Team

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Yoimiya is one of the best partners for Chevreuse as the knockback effect from the Overloaded reaction isn't a big issue with her ranged attacks. Chevreuse essentially works as the support buffer for this team. For your party members, you may use a combination of Raiden, Fischl, Beidou, Yae Miko, or Sara for Electro, but you can still have one more Pyro with Bennett or Thoma should you wish to give her more buffs and protection.

Yoimiya Overloaded 2 Team

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS/Support

Yoimiya is one of the best partners for Chevreuse as the knockback effect from the Overloaded reaction isn't a big issue with her ranged attacks. Chevreuse essentially works as the support buffer for this team. For your party members, you may use a combination of Raiden, Fischl, Beidou, Yae Miko, or Sara for Electro, but you can still have one more Pyro with Bennett or Thoma should you wish to give her more buffs and protection.

Mono-Pyro Lyney Team

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Lyney

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS/Support

Chevreuse replaces Anemo supports for Lyney triple-Pyro mono team as she gives him ATK buffs and Pyro RES reduction. Your Electro character can be any off-fielders or buffer supports, but we recommend slower Electro or faster Pyro application for Lyney's passive to work.

Overloaded Free-to-Play 1 Team

Chevreuse

Support

Yanfei

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS/Support

If you're looking for F2P options, Yanfei and Xiangling are usable as the Main DPS for Chevreuse support. Yanfei specifically is ranged, so she can follow-up on enemies launched by the knockback effect of Overloaded.

Overloaded Free-to-Play 2 Team

Chevreuse

Support

Xiangling

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

If you're looking for F2P options, Yanfei and Xiangling are usable as the Main DPS for Chevreuse support. Yanfei specifically is ranged, so she can follow-up on enemies launched by the knockback effect of Overloaded.

Chevreuse's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Strong buffer with her potent Pyro and Electro RES Shred and ATK buffs for the entire party simply by triggering Overloaded and using her Skill. Moreover, her ATK buffs lasts for 30 long seconds.
  • Chevreuse's buffs makes up for the lack of Anemo support from Viridescent Venerer in her dedicated teams. She can substitute the likes of Kazuha for those who want to insert him in other team comps.
  • On top of all the buffs, she can also heal the active character with her Elemental Skill.
  • Can generate around 4 energy orbs, while only having 60 energy cost.

Weaknesses

  • Her team comps must only consist of Pyro and Electro or else she'll lose her important RES shred utility.
  • You'll want to pull more constellations should you wish to invest in her teams, as these constellations greatly improve her damage and supporting capabilities, sometimes fixing the following weaknesses:

    • • Skill cooldown is 15 seconds, but C4 allows her to use it more than once.

    • Healing is only for active character, but C6 unlocks initial party recovery for her entire team.

    • Chevreuse is mostly comparable with C0 Kazuha with no crowd control, but her C6 can potentially surpass his buffs.

Chiori's Weapons

Geo Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Uraku Misugiri

Normal Attack DMG is increased by 16% and Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 24%. After a nearby active character deals Geo DMG, the aforementioned effects increase by 100% for 15s. Additionally, the wielder's DEF is increased by 20%.

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Mistsplitter Reforged

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Cinnabar Spindle

    Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 40% of DEF. The effect will be triggered no more than once every 1.5s and will be cleared 0.1s after the Elemental Skill deals DMG.

    Harbinger of Dawn

    When HP is above 90%, increases CRIT Rate by 14%.

Comment

This Chiori build focuses on prioritizing on maximizing her off-field capabilities through her Elemental skill.

Since she scales on both ATK% and DEF%, having a good balance of Main Stat and Sub Stat is necessary. Adjust these artifacts accordingly based on your artifact rolls and what you currently have.

Husk of Opulent Dreams and the Golden Troupe artifact set essentially has slight differences in terms of damage output. However Golden Troupe has less conditions to set up.

Chiori's Artifacts

Geo Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Husk of Opulent Dreams

2-Piece: DEF +30%

4-Piece: A character equipped with this Artifact set will obtain the Curiosity effect in the following conditions: When on the field, the character gains 1 stack after hitting an opponent with a Geo attack, triggering a maximum of once every 0.3s. When off the field, the character gains 1 stack every 3s. Curiosity can stack up to 4 times, each providing 6% DEF and a 6% Geo DMG Bonus. When 6 seconds pass without gaining a Curiosity stack, 1 stack is lost.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%/ATK%
  • Goblet: GEO DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • DEF%
  • ATK%

Comment

This Chiori build focuses on prioritizing on maximizing her off-field capabilities through her Elemental skill.

Since she scales on both ATK% and DEF%, having a good balance of Main Stat and Sub Stat is necessary. Adjust these artifacts accordingly based on your artifact rolls and what you currently have.

Husk of Opulent Dreams and the Golden Troupe artifact set essentially has slight differences in terms of damage output. However Golden Troupe has less conditions to set up.

Chiori's Teams

Mono Geo 1 Team

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Itto

Main DPS

Gorou

Support

Zhongli

Support

Chiori can excel well in a Mono-Geo team, as to utilize her passive and Geo Resonance. The team also contains multiple team members who can generate Geo Constructs, to ensure smoother team rotations. Chiori mostly utilizes her Elemental Skill in these team comps, ensuring delivering constant Geo Damage Off-Field.

Mono Geo 2 Team

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Ningguang

Main DPS

Gorou

Support

Albedo

Support

Chiori can excel well in a Mono-Geo team, as to utilize her passive and Geo Resonance. The team also contains multiple team members who can generate Geo Constructs, to ensure smoother team rotations. Chiori mostly utilizes her Elemental Skill in these team comps, ensuring delivering constant Geo Damage Off-Field.

Double Geo 1 Team

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Xiao

Main DPS

Xianyun

Support

Zhongli

Support

An alternative is running her alongside one other geo unit like Albedo and Zhongli who can provide both geo resonance and Geo Constructs that can supplement Chiori's Elemental Skill. It is important to note that other non-construct Geo units can be used, but their synergy will be limited due to Chiori's DPS being restricted to one Tamoto on the field prior to C1.

Double Geo 2 Team

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

An alternative is running her alongside one other geo unit like Albedo and Zhongli who can provide both geo resonance and Geo Constructs that can supplement Chiori's Elemental Skill. It is important to note that other non-construct Geo units can be used, but their synergy will be limited due to Chiori's DPS being restricted to one Tamoto on the field prior to C1.

Chiori-Navia 1 Team

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Navia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

At C1, Chiori can function outside of Mono Geo and Construct-Geo characters, allowing her to pair up with Navia more optimally to enable Geo resonance and produce more Crystallize shards for them, all without stunting Chiori's personal damage.

Chiori-Navia 2 Team

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Navia

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Charlotte

Support

At C1, Chiori can function outside of Mono Geo and Construct-Geo characters, allowing her to pair up with Navia more optimally to enable Geo resonance and produce more Crystallize shards for them, all without stunting Chiori's personal damage.

Chiori's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Chiori provides a consistent and reliable off-field Geo DMG without needing any trigger, as Tamoto is not considered a destructable Geo Construct.
  • Her Elemental Skill has decent range and damage multipliers which can be useful when dealing with multiple enemies.
  • Elemental Skill's On-Hit Passive is independent of Tamoto's attack timing, allowing for three forms of Geo DMG at maximum.
  • Elemental Burst has high scalings, giving her good Burst potential.
  • Split scaling allows for flexible substats on her build.

Weaknesses

  • Low Normal Attack multipliers even with Geo infusion, which locks her in as a niche Sub-DPS.
  • Requires C1 for more team flexibility. As C0 requires a team member who can create Geo Constructs to maximize her Elemental Skill damage

Chongyun's Weapons

Cryo Main DPS

Best Weapon

Wolf's Gravestone

Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Luxurious Sea-Lord

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 12%. When Elemental Burst hits opponents, there is a 100% chance of summoning a huge onrush of tuna that deals 100% ATK as AoE DMG. This effect can occur once every 15s.

    Prototype Archaic

    On hit, Normal or Charge Attacks have a 50% chance to deal an additional 240% ATK DMG to enemies with a small AoE. Can only occur once every 15s.

Comment

Chongyun in this Main DPS build is for increasing the damage he can do with his Normal or Charged Attacks while infused with Cryo. This is best used for team comps that focus on Frozen or Shatter reactions.

Gladiator's Finale can be replaced with any +18% ATK artifact such as the Shimenawa's or Echoes of An Offering.

Cryo Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Wolf's Gravestone

Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Sacrificial Greatsword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Comment

This Sub DPS build would use his Elemental Skill and Burst to set-up Cryo reactions and damage opponents before immediately swapping. Pairing him with the Sacrificial Greatsword weapon works well to keep his skill field up.

Cryo Burst Support

Best Weapon

Wolf's Gravestone

Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Greatsword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

Just like the Sub-DPS build, this Support build for Chongyun uses his Elemental Skill and Burst to help the party. However, it trades DMG from the Emblem of Severed Fate with a party-wide buff from the Nobless set instead.

Chongyun's Artifacts

Cryo Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

2-Piece: ATK +18%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

Chongyun in this Main DPS build is for increasing the damage he can do with his Normal or Charged Attacks while infused with Cryo. This is best used for team comps that focus on Frozen or Shatter reactions.

Gladiator's Finale can be replaced with any +18% ATK artifact such as the Shimenawa's or Echoes of An Offering.

Cryo Sub DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%.

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Sub DPS build would use his Elemental Skill and Burst to set-up Cryo reactions and damage opponents before immediately swapping. Pairing him with the Sacrificial Greatsword weapon works well to keep his skill field up.

Cryo Burst Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Just like the Sub-DPS build, this Support build for Chongyun uses his Elemental Skill and Burst to help the party. However, it trades DMG from the Emblem of Severed Fate with a party-wide buff from the Nobless set instead.

Chongyun's Teams

Main DPS

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS

This Main DPS build for Chongyun can be good for both single target and multiple enemies. Adding an Anemo character to debuff enemies by using the Viridescent Venerer set and to group enemes will be ideal.

Chongyun

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

This Main DPS build for Chongyun can be good for both single target and multiple enemies. Adding an Anemo character to debuff enemies by using the Viridescent Venerer set and to group enemes will be ideal.

Freeze and Shatter 3 Team

Chongyun

Main DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Main DPS build for Chongyun can be good for both single target and multiple enemies. Adding an Anemo character to debuff enemies by using the Viridescent Venerer set and to group enemes will be ideal. Zhongli could be placed in the support slot, just keep his pillar away from the fight to prevent it from stealing shatters.

National Team

Chongyun

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Chongyun with Hydro and Pyro party members is a good budget team to mix Elemental Reaction DMG

Melt Team

Chongyun

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

This Melt team for Chongyun focuses on triggering Melt Elemental Reaction. Chongyun's Elemental Skill at C2 works very well with Bennett's, making his Elemental Skill have a very short cooldown.

Chongyun's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Enables niche Cryo infusion builds for the party.
  • One of the only few characters who can buff ATK SPD.
  • Low Elemantal Burst energy cost for quick swap Burst.
  • Elemental Skill helps cross rivers or long stretches of seas.

Weaknesses

  • Slow Normal Attacks as a Main DPS.
  • Area of Effect on his Skill is small.
  • Few characters benefit from his infusion meta-wise.
  • Claymore disrupts Freeze reaction outside of Shatter builds.
  • Anti-synergy with characters who don't want his Cryo infusion.

Clorinde's Weapons

Electro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Absolution

CRIT DMG increased by 20%. Increasing the value of a Bond of Life increases the DMG the equipping character deals by 16% for 6s. Max 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Haran Geppaku Futsu

    Obtain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. When other nearby party members use Elemental Skills, the character equipping this weapon will gain 1 Wavespike stack. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character equipping this weapon uses an Elemental Skill, all stacks of Wavespike will be consumed to gain Rippling Upheaval: each stack of Wavespike consumed will increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 8s.

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

    Finale of the Deep

    When using an Elemental Skill, ATK will be increased by 12% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 25% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, a maximum of 150 ATK will be gained based on 2.4% of the Bond when cleared for 15s.

Comment

Clorinde's best build is similar to Standard DPS characters despite her Bond of Life mechanics, so focusing on CRIT Stats and ATK for Standard Electro and CRIT and Elemental Mastery for Aggravate should be your goal.

The builds between Standard and Aggravate remain the same, with the only difference being your choice in whether your Sands is ATK or Elemental Mastery.

Clorinde's Artifacts

Electro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: When the value of a Bond of Life increases or decreases, this character deals 18% increased DMG for 6s. Max 3 stacks.

Secondary Artifact Set

Thundering Fury

2-Piece: Electro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases damage caused by Overloaded, Electro-Charged, Superconduct, and Hyperbloom by 40%, and the DMG Bonus conferred by Aggravate is increased by 20%. When Quicked or the aforementioned Elemental Reactions are triggered, Elemental Skill CD is decreased by 1s. Can only occur once every 0.8s

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK% or Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK

Comment

Clorinde's best build is similar to Standard DPS characters despite her Bond of Life mechanics, so focusing on CRIT Stats and ATK for Standard Electro and CRIT and Elemental Mastery for Aggravate should be your goal.

The builds between Standard and Aggravate remain the same, with the only difference being your choice in whether your Sands is ATK or Elemental Mastery.

Since Dendro and Electro will stick onto the enemy, Clorinde can easily trigger Aggravate DMG with her already enhanced Elemental Skill, leading to her already strong attacks receiving a near-consistent buff.

Overload has plenty of options that can work well with Clorinde, so she can become a viable Overload DPS due to having good on-field Electro application that can match off-field DMG dealers like Xiangling.

Electro-Charge 1 Team

Clorinde

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Sucrose

Support

Clorinde's A1 Passive gives her a decent increase to her damage without the need of standard damage buffers, letting her slot into Electro-Charge teams as the main damage dealer to great effect. When paired with 2 Hydro applicators and especially someone like Furina, the team's damage and Electro-Charge's frequency skyrockets, making this one of Clorinde's best teams.

Electro-Charge 2 Team

Clorinde

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Jean

Support

Clorinde's A1 Passive gives her a decent increase to her damage without the need of standard damage buffers, letting her slot into Electro-Charge teams as the main damage dealer to great effect. When paired with 2 Hydro applicators and especially someone like Furina, the team's damage and Electro-Charge's frequency skyrockets, making this one of Clorinde's best teams.

Hypercarry 1 Team

Clorinde

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sara

Sub-DPS/Support

Kazuha

Support

Clorinde's own damage paired with either more buffs and some form of sustain gives her access to a near solo-onfield hypercarry playstyle to brute force through content. This is in contrast to her more team-oriented playstyle, trading Elemental Reactions for overwhelming electro damage.

Hypercarry 2 Team

Clorinde

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chiori

Sub-DPS/Support

Zhongli

Support

Clorinde's own damage paired with either more buffs and some form of sustain gives her access to a near solo-onfield hypercarry playstyle to brute force through content. This is in contrast to her more team-oriented playstyle, trading Elemental Reactions for overwhelming electro damage.

Clorinde's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Quick electro application with good overall damage from her Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst, allowing her to be a great on-field Electro applicator.
  • Augmented Elemental Skill lets Clorinde either stay in place or weave around the battlefield, allowing for a deceptively agile playstyle.
  • Gains access to healers that can offset her Bond of Life acquisition, allowing her to spam Augmented Normal Attacks without having to move.
  • Self-healing with Impale the Night gives her incredible self-sustain and lets her run 3 buffers without too much risk.
  • Her Normal Attack button can be held down during her Elemental Skill, allowing for ease of use when fighting.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Skill has limited uptime, forcing Clorinde into very strict rotations that lead to a DPS loss if she cannot fully utilize her Elemental Skill.
  • Her overall damage is more team-oriented compared to traditional on-field DPSes, encouraging her to have a solid team that works with her.
  • She can be interrupted during her Elemental Skill, requiring some form of interruption resistance to ensure that she cannot be damaged and stunned during her combo.

Collei's Weapons

Dendro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Collei Build is her highest damaging set for maximizing her Elemental Skill and Burst. Deepwood Memories also serves as a support set for Dendro characters.

As a Sub-DPS, Collei would need around +170% ER to use her burst off cooldown without characters like Raiden Shogun. Use either an ER weapon or Sands piece as you see fit! EM should only be considered if she can reliably trigger her own Dendro Reactions.

Emblem of Severed Fate Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Sub-DPS Collei build focuses on maximizing her Elemental Burst DMG. The goal is to stack ER up to around 200%. This build trades more ER for slightly less damage and loses the debuff applied to enemies from the Deepwood set.

Burst Support Build

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

If you already have a Deepwood carrier in the party and want to further buff the party, then this Collei Support build is for you. This set sacrifices her personal DMG for more team-wide utility.

Collei's Artifacts

Dendro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Collei Build is her highest damaging set for maximizing her Elemental Skill and Burst. Deepwood Memories also serves as a support set for Dendro characters.

As a Sub-DPS, Collei would need around +170% ER to use her burst off cooldown without characters like Raiden Shogun. Use either an ER weapon or Sands piece as you see fit! EM should only be considered if she can reliably trigger her own Dendro Reactions.

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%.

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

This Sub-DPS Collei build focuses on maximizing her Elemental Burst DMG. The goal is to stack ER up to around 200%. This build trades more ER for slightly less damage and loses the debuff applied to enemies from the Deepwood set.

Burst Support Build

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

If you already have a Deepwood carrier in the party and want to further buff the party, then this Collei Support build is for you. This set sacrifices her personal DMG for more team-wide utility.

Collei's Teams

Quicken Team

Collei

Sub-DPS

Tighnari

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

This Collei Team Comp focuses on triggering Quicken reactions. Collei can support Tighnari with the Deepwood set while also providing decent damage for herself. Fischl, Shinobu, and Collei's off-field Elemental damage will help keep Quicken active on the enemies, which helps Tighnari to deal massive Spread-type damage!

Burgeon Team

Collei

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

This Collei team comp focuses on creating Dendro Cores with a Hydro Main DPS and then triggering the Burgeon reaction with Thoma's Elemental Burst. Thoma will need an ER/EM/EM set for this build. Be careful not to set the Dendro Traveler's Lamp on fire!

F2P Team

Collei

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Main DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Kaeya

Support

This F2P-friendly team for Collei focuses on barbara's Hydro attacks to create Dendro Cores and freezing enemies to gurantee the Dendro Core's explosion damage. Kaeya can be replaced with Diona in this build. At C6, Diona provides a massive EM boost to all characters within her Burst field!

Collei's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill can trigger Quicken and Spread reaction on its own.
  • Elemental Burst has a wide area of effect.
  • Kit offers variety in Dendro Application.
  • Applies more Dendro compared to Dendro MC, which can be beneficial in Bloom teams.

Weaknesses

  • Long Elemental Skill Cooldown
  • Elemental Burst applies Dendro only a few times.
  • Weak Normal Attack multipliers.
  • Elemental Skill locks you in a brief animation which can leaves you vulnerable.

Cyno's Weapons

DPS Build 1

Best Weapon

Staff of the Scarlet Sands

The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

    On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    White Tassel (F2P)

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 24%

Comment

NO COMMENT

DPS Build 2

Best Weapon

Staff of the Scarlet Sands

The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

    On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    White Tassel (F2P)

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 24%

Comment

NO COMMENT

Cyno's Artifacts

DPS Build 1

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro Damage Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

NO COMMENT

DPS Build 2

Best Artifact Set

Thundering Fury

2-Piece: Electro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases damage caused by Overloaded, Electro-Charged, Superconduct, and Hyperbloom by 40%, and the DMG Bonus conferred by Aggravate is increased by 20%. When Quicked or the aforementioned Elemental Reactions are triggered, Elemental Skill CD is decreased by 1s. Can only occur once every 0.8s

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro Damage Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

NO COMMENT

Cyno's Teams

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Cyno

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

This Cyno Hyperbloom team focuses on creating Dendro Cores from off-field Dendro and Hydro damage, then hitting those Dendro Cores with Electro attacks. This team comp also enables Aggravate and Spread reactions.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Cyno

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

This Cyno Hyperbloom team focuses on creating Dendro Cores from off-field Dendro and Hydro damage, then hitting those Dendro Cores with Electro attacks. This team comp also enables Aggravate and Spread reactions.

Hyperbloom 3 Team

Cyno

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

This Cyno Hyperbloom team focuses on creating Dendro Cores from off-field Dendro and Hydro damage, then hitting those Dendro Cores with Electro attacks. This team comp also enables Aggravate and Spread reactions.

Aggravate 1 Team

Cyno

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

Zhongli

Support

Cyno is a perfect fit for any kind of Aggravate team since it enhances his Normal Attack damage during his Elemental Burst! Nahida works particularly well with Cyno since Nahida's off-field Dendro damage can match Cyno's long on-field duration.

Aggravate 2 Team

Cyno

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Collei

Support

Shinobu

Support

Cyno is a perfect fit for any kind of Aggravate team since it enhances his Normal Attack damage during his Elemental Burst! Nahida works particularly well with Cyno since Nahida's off-field Dendro damage can match Cyno's long on-field duration.

Aggravate 3 Team

Cyno

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

Zhongli

Support

Cyno is a perfect fit for any kind of Aggravate team since it enhances his Normal Attack damage during his Elemental Burst! Nahida works particularly well with Cyno since Nahida's off-field Dendro damage can match Cyno's long on-field duration. Cyno and Beidou can work if Cyno uses the Thundering Fury set or if Beidou has a high ER stat. You may also need to supplement your ER requirements with Favonius weapons on your supports.

Cyno's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Near permanent Elemental Burst uptime.
  • Decent Electro hypercarry for Hyperbloom and Aggravate teams.

Weaknesses

  • Recommended to have at least a shielder in any team comp due to his poor interruption resistance.
  • Bulk of his DPS is locked behind his expensive Elemental Burst.
  • Requires teammates that have off-field abilities with long durations to match Cyno's on-field duration.

Dehya's Weapons

Main DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Luxurious Sea-Lord

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 12%. When Elemental Burst hits opponents, there is a 100% chance of summoning a huge onrush of tuna that deals 100% ATK as AoE DMG. This effect can occur once every 15s.

    Earth Shaker

    After a party member triggers a Pyro-related reaction, the equipping character's Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 16% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even when the triggering party member is not on the field.

    Comment

    As a Main DPS, Dehya's best Artifact is Vourukasha's Glow. This set will let her deal the most damage from her Elemental Skill and Burst.

Burgeon Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Mailed Flower

Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

Alternative Weapons

    Makhaira Aquamarine

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

    Earth Shaker

    After a party member triggers a Pyro-related reaction, the equipping character's Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 16% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even when the triggering party member is not on the field.

Comment

If running as a Sub-DPS, Burgeon is one of her best teams for off-field damage. You will need strong Dendro and Hydro application to keep up the Bloom reaction, which also prevents Dehya from accidentally burning the enemy.

Standard Quick Swap Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Luxurious Sea-Lord

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 12%. When Elemental Burst hits opponents, there is a 100% chance of summoning a huge onrush of tuna that deals 100% ATK as AoE DMG. This effect can occur once every 15s.

    Earth Shaker

    After a party member triggers a Pyro-related reaction, the equipping character's Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 16% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even when the triggering party member is not on the field.

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

On paper, Vourukasha's Glow deals more damage compared to the Emblem of Severed Fate for Dehya. However, this comes at the cost of losing Energy Recharge, which the Emblem Set helps a lot with.

Vourukasha's Glow is your best choice if you don't need +180% Energy Recharge or if you are only relying on Dehya's Elemental Skill for her source of damage.

You should only consider HP% on the Sands artifact piece if you have her at C1. At C0, she will deal more damage with ATK% instead.

Support

Best Weapon

Portable Power Saw

When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    The Bell

    Taking DMG generates a shield which absorbs DMG up to 20% of Max HP. This shield lasts for 10s or until broken, and can only be triggered once every 45s. While protected by the shield, the character gains 12% increased DMG.

Comment

With its ability to increase her HP and provide off-field ATK buffs for the team, Dehya in a support build should use Tenacity of the Millelith to buff her teammates and mitigate the damage they get effectively.

You can opt to use Triple HP% main stats if you want to sacrifice her damage to tank more damage.

Dehya's Artifacts

Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Vourukasha's Glow

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG will be increased by 10%. After the equipping character takes DMG, the aforementioned DMG Bonus is increased by 80% for 5s. This effect increase can have 5 stacks. The duration of each stack is counted independently. These effects can be triggered even when the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Pyro Damage Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

As a Main DPS, Dehya's best Artifact is Vourukasha's Glow. This set will let her deal the most damage from her Elemental Skill and Burst.

Burgeon Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

If running as a Sub-DPS, Burgeon is one of her best teams for off-field damage. You will need strong Dendro and Hydro application to keep up the Bloom reaction, which also prevents Dehya from accidentally burning the enemy.

Standard Quick Swap Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Vourukasha's Glow

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG will be increased by 10%. After the equipping character takes DMG, the aforementioned DMG Bonus is increased by 80% for 5s. This effect increase can have 5 stacks. The duration of each stack is counted independently. These effects can be triggered even when the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge/HP%
  • Goblet: Pyro Damage Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

On paper, Vourukasha's Glow deals more damage compared to the Emblem of Severed Fate for Dehya. However, this comes at the cost of losing Energy Recharge, which the Emblem Set helps a lot with.

Vourukasha's Glow is your best choice if you don't need +180% Energy Recharge or if you are only relying on Dehya's Elemental Skill for her source of damage.

You should only consider HP% on the Sands artifact piece if you have her at C1. At C0, she will deal more damage with ATK% instead.

Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%/Pyro Damage Bonus
  • Circlet: HP%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

With its ability to increase her HP and provide off-field ATK buffs for the team, Dehya in a support build should use Tenacity of the Millelith to buff her teammates and mitigate the damage they get effectively.

You can opt to use Triple HP% main stats if you want to sacrifice her damage to tank more damage.

Dehya's Teams

Main DPS 1 Team

Dehya

Main DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Dehya can be used as a Main DPS if she has proper support buffers. Her damage multipliers are a bit lackluster, so it's very important that she has the right teammates for the job. For Elemental Reaction teams, Dehya can use EM% Main Stats instead of ATK% or HP% if she can consistently trigger Elemental Reactions.

Main DPS 2 Team

Dehya

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Dehya can be used as a Main DPS if she has proper support buffers. Her damage multipliers are a bit lackluster, so it's very important that she has the right teammates for the job. For Elemental Reaction teams, Dehya can use EM% Main Stats instead of ATK% or HP% if she can consistently trigger Elemental Reactions.

Main DPS 3 Team

Dehya

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Dehya can be used as a Main DPS if she has proper support buffers. Her damage multipliers are a bit lackluster, so it's very important that she has the right teammates for the job. For Elemental Reaction teams, Dehya can use EM% Main Stats instead of ATK% or HP% if she can consistently trigger Elemental Reactions.

In Burn teams, Dehya functions more as the Pyro enabler and driver, but can nevertheless function as the main damage dealer if built properly.

In Burn teams, Dehya functions more as the Pyro enabler and driver, but can nevertheless function as the main damage dealer if built properly.

Melt Team

Dehya

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This Dehya team comp focuses on providing consistent burning reactions when paired with Nahida. As the enemy burns, Ganyu is free to trigger Melt with her Charged Attacks while in the comfort of the strong stagger resistance provided by Dehya.

Vaporize Team

Dehya

Support

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Support

Dehya can work in a Vaporize team alongside Hu Tao if it's in a double Hydro team comp. Dehya's Elemental Skill triggers slow enough that it can't override a Hydro Aura on the enemy. Dehya can direct some of the damage to herself while Hu Tao is on the field and both can characters benefit from the Double Hydro Resonance.

Burgeon 1 Team

Dehya

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support/Sub-DPS

This team comp centers around enabling the formation of Dendro Cores for Dehya to trigger Burgeon while off-field. To not cause Burning, two Hydro Characters (or an Anemo to swirl Hydro) are recommended to facilitate the reaction. For Burgeon teams, it is highly recommended to Dehya to use triple EM main stats to maximize Dendro Core damage.

Burgeon 2 Team

Dehya

Support

Nahida

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support/Sub-DPS

This team comp centers around enabling the formation of Dendro Cores for Dehya to trigger Burgeon while off-field. To not cause Burning, two Hydro Characters (or an Anemo to swirl Hydro) are recommended to facilitate the reaction. For Burgeon teams, it is highly recommended to Dehya to use triple EM main stats to maximize Dendro Core damage.
