Dehya

Support

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Support/Sub-DPS

This team comp centers around enabling the formation of Dendro Cores for Dehya to trigger Burgeon while off-field. To not cause Burning, two Hydro Characters (or an Anemo to swirl Hydro) are recommended to facilitate the reaction. For Burgeon teams, it is highly recommended to Dehya to use triple EM main stats to maximize Dendro Core damage.

Free-to-Play Team

Dehya

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Main DPS

Sucrose

Support

Bennett

Support

This free-to-play team comp for Dehya focuses on dealing a lot of Pyro DMG as much as possible. Sucrose increases Pyro DMG by equipping the Viridescent Venerer artifact set while triggering Swirl.

Dehya's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • One of the highest base HP characters in the game.
  • Provides strong interruption resistance
  • Provides consistent off-field Pyro Damage that can also be repositioned.

Weaknesses

  • Below-average damage without buffs.
  • Longer fights reduce her solo support utility, making it a requirement to run a healer.
  • High Elemental Burst cost.
  • Below average Elemental Particle generation.

Diluc's Weapons

Pyro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Redhorn Stonethresher

    DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

Comment

The Crimson Witch of Flames set fits perfectly with Diluc's playstyle for reactions like Vaporize or Melt. If maximizing Diluc's damage is the goal, then Crimson Witch of Flames is the set that should be farmed for.

For teams with Furina and Xianyun, Marechaussee Hunter is an alternative build for him to maximize the CRIT Rate buffs immediately so he can focus on other important stats like Elemental Mastery and CRIT DMG.

Diluc's Artifacts

Pyro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%.

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Secondary Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery or ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

The Crimson Witch of Flames set fits perfectly with Diluc's playstyle for reactions like Vaporize or Melt. If maximizing Diluc's damage is the goal, then Crimson Witch of Flames is the set that should be farmed for.

For teams with Furina and Xianyun, Marechaussee Hunter is an alternative build for him to maximize the CRIT Rate buffs immediately so he can focus on other important stats like Elemental Mastery and CRIT DMG.

Diluc's Teams

Xianyun 1 Team

Diluc

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xianyun

Support

Diluc with Xianyun's plunging buffs is his new best team as he has the highest Plunging Attack multiplier in the game. Combined with Bennett and Furina's buffs, he will hit more than twice the damage he does for regular Vaporize. Melt is also a viable option as he can now choose when to plunge.

Xianyun 2 Team

Diluc

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xianyun

Support

Diluc with Xianyun's plunging buffs is his new best team as he has the highest Plunging Attack multiplier in the game. Combined with Bennett and Furina's buffs, he will hit more than twice the damage he does for regular Vaporize. Melt is also a viable option as he can now choose when to plunge.

Regular Vaporize Team

Diluc

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Kazuha

Support

Xingqiu can easily apply Hydro on enemies with his Elemental Burst while Diluc uses his Elemental Skill to trigger the Vaporise Reaction. Anemo user that has a Viridescent Venerer Set equipped can also be replaced by Zhongli or a shielder.

Regular Melt Team

Diluc

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Sucrose

Support

If Xingqiu or Xianyun is not available, a melt team could be possible with the help of an Anemo user swirling Cryo!

Overload Team

Diluc

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

Bennett

Support

With the introduction of Chevreuse, Diluc can now be a Main DPS in Overload centric teams. A shielder or a healer can also be placed in this team, but do be aware that Overload causes enemies to be knocked back further away from you.

Free-to-Play Team

Diluc

Main DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Geo)

Support

Noelle

Support

This f2p team still focuses on trying to create melt reactions for Diluc with Kaeya as the Cryo applier. Noelle will provide the needed shields to stay in the fight and act as the healer for the party.

Diluc's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Can trigger repeat Elemental Reaction with constant Pyro infusion via his Elemental Skill and Burst, allowing him to reliable trigger Vaporize and Melt.
  • Elemental Burst has low ER requirements and low cooldown, ensuring almost constant Pyro Infusion uptime.
  • Ascends with CRIT Rate, making it easier to build him as your Main DPS.

Weaknesses

  • Low Attack Speed, this may be an issue with supports with limited buff times.
  • Lacks a weapon that he can perfectly synergize with, compared to other 5-Star Main-DPS.

Diona's Weapons

Support

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Recurve Bow

    Defeating an opponent restores 8% HP.

Comment

This build utilizes Diona as both a buffer thanks to Noblesse Oblige, and a dedicated healer and shielder thanks to the Artifact stats. Most of her ER requirements will be covered by her weapon, allowing her to slot into more HP.

If someone else is already using Noblesse Oblige, Diona can instead opt for a two-piece mix of different HP and/or Energy Recharge sets.

Diona's Artifacts

Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus/CRIT Rate

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Comment

This build utilizes Diona as both a buffer thanks to Noblesse Oblige, and a dedicated healer and shielder thanks to the Artifact stats. Most of her ER requirements will be covered by her weapon, allowing her to slot into more HP.

If someone else is already using Noblesse Oblige, Diona can instead opt for a two-piece mix of different HP and/or Energy Recharge sets.

Main DPS

Mona

Sub-DPS

Venti

Support

Diona can function in almost any Cryo team comp to function as a shielder, healer, and a battery tp recharge the energy of the Cryo Main DPS.

Main DPS

Support

Diona can function in almost any Cryo team comp to function as a shielder, healer, and a battery tp recharge the energy of the Cryo Main DPS.

Fridge 1 Team

Diona

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Support

Diona is also an excellent support for any Freeze + Dendro core type team comps. Diona can freeze enemies who have Hydro applied to them since Dendro does not interact with cryo. At C6, she can further improve Bloom damage from her Elemental Burst.

Fridge 2 Team

Diona

Support

Kokomi

Main DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

Diona is also an excellent support for any Freeze + Dendro core type team comps. Diona can freeze enemies who have Hydro applied to them since Dendro does not interact with cryo. At C6, she can further improve Bloom damage from her Elemental Burst.

Physical 1 Team

Diona

Support

Eula

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Similar to the freeze team, Diona functions as a shield and healer unit for Physical team. In this example Diona provides Energy for Eula's high Elemental Burst cost while protecting Eula with a shield while she deals damage.

Physical 2 Team

Diona

Support

Freminet

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Similar to the freeze team, Diona functions as a shield and healer unit for Physical team. In this example Diona provides Energy for Eula's high Elemental Burst cost while protecting Eula with a shield while she deals damage.

Diona's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • All around generalist support unit that can slot in for Cryo resonance, provide decent Cryo application, and ample healing and shields.
  • Most of Diona's kit scales with her HP, making her very simple to build and not even requiring a proper set for potency.
  • C6 constellation allows her to provide another form of buffing to the team by increasing their Elemental Mastery by 200 while inside her Elemental Burst.

Weaknesses

  • Signature Mix is a stationary AoE, making her less effective against moving targets, or large monsters that knock the player off her healing circle.
  • Low DMG potential, locking her down to only be played as an off-field Cryo support.

Dori's Weapons

Support - Buffer

Best Weapon

Favonius Greatsword

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

    The Bell

    Taking DMG generates a shield which absorbs DMG up to 20% of Max HP. This shield lasts for 10s or until broken, and can only be triggered once every 45s. While protected by the shield, the character gains 12% increased DMG.

Comment

This Dori build is best suited for fully supporting the team through Energy Recharge and attack buffs. Dori doesn't deal a lot of damage, so it's best to maximize her healing and ensuring her burst is available off cooldown.

Ideally, you will need around +200% ER on Dori, but it's best to get as much as you can.

Burst Uptime

Best Weapon

Favonius Greatsword

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Bell

    Taking DMG generates a shield which absorbs DMG up to 20% of Max HP. This shield lasts for 10s or until broken, and can only be triggered once every 45s. While protected by the shield, the character gains 12% increased DMG.

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

    Katsuragikiri Nagamasa

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

A general purpose artifact build for Dori consists of simply improving her healing capability and her Energy Recharge. You can use any 2pc. +HP% and a 2pc. +ER% artifact to accomplish this. You will need around +200% ER on Dori.

Pure Healer

Best Weapon

Favonius Greatsword

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Bell

    Taking DMG generates a shield which absorbs DMG up to 20% of Max HP. This shield lasts for 10s or until broken, and can only be triggered once every 45s. While protected by the shield, the character gains 12% increased DMG.

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

    Katsuragikiri Nagamasa

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

This Dori Healer focuses more on increasing her healing capabilities and slightly increasing her personal damage. Realistically, Dori cannot cap the 30k HP limit due to her single target healing. However, this is still a good option if healing is a priority.

Dori's Artifacts

Support - Buffer

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus%

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • ATK%

Comment

This Dori build is best suited for fully supporting the team through Energy Recharge and attack buffs. Dori doesn't deal a lot of damage, so it's best to maximize her healing and ensuring her burst is available off cooldown.

Ideally, you will need around +200% ER on Dori, but it's best to get as much as you can.

Burst Uptime

Best Artifact Set

&

Emblem of Severed Fate & Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%.

2-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus%

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • ATK%

Comment

A general purpose artifact build for Dori consists of simply improving her healing capability and her Energy Recharge. You can use any 2pc. +HP% and a 2pc. +ER% artifact to accomplish this. You will need around +200% ER on Dori.

Pure Healer

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Secondary Artifact Set

Song of Days Past

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the equipping character heals a party member, the Yearning effect will be created for 6s, which records the total amount of healing provided (including overflow healing). When the duration expires, the Yearning effect will be transformed into the Waves of Days Past effect: When your active party member hits an opponent with a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Plunging Attack, Elemental Skill, or Elemental Burst, the DMG dealt will be increased by 8% of the total healing amount recorded by the Yearning effect. The Waves of Days Past effect is removed after it has taken effect 5 times or after 10s. A single instance of the Yearning effect can record up to 15,000 healing, and only a single instance can exist at once, but it can record the healing from multiple equipping characters. Equipping characters on standby can still trigger this effect.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus%

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • ATK%

Comment

This Dori Healer focuses more on increasing her healing capabilities and slightly increasing her personal damage. Realistically, Dori cannot cap the 30k HP limit due to her single target healing. However, this is still a good option if healing is a priority.

Dori's Teams

Physical Support Team

Dori

Support

Eula

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Dori in any physical team will act as the enabler for the Superconduct Elemental Reaction. In this particular build, she will help reduce Eula's Energy Recharge while also providing her with healing.

Spread Team

Dori

Support

Tighnari

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Dori can also fit in any Dendro + Electro team comp as an enabler for the Quicken Elemental Reaction. You will have full control of when Electro will apply on the enemy by controlling the tether between you and the Jinni, which helps you trigger Spread much more consistently.

Hyperbloom Support Team

Dori

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Support

Dori can be somewhat used as an Electro Trigger for the Hyperbloom Reaction. Simply move between Dendro Cores with the Hydro Main DPS to trigger the reaction. Dori will need to be stacked with as much Elemental Mastery as possible for this build. Her healing will suffer for this, but it can be offset by another healer.

Dori's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Universal Energy Recharge supporter.
  • Helpful to any Main DPS that needs mid to high Energy Recharge.
  • Good single target healing.
  • Full control on Electro application.

Weaknesses

  • Low Energy Particle generation and high Elemental Burst cost, but can be fixed by her passive.
  • No multi-target healing.
  • Low Elemental Burst damage multipliers.
  • Offers a lot of utility to the team, however is a "Jack of All Trades and Master of None" character.

Emilie's Weapons

Burning Dendro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Lumidouce Elegy

ATK increased by 15%. After the equipping character triggers Burning on an opponent or deals Dendro DMG to Burning opponents, the DMG dealt is increased by 18%. This effect lasts for 8s, max 2 stacks. When 2 stacks are reached or when the duration is refreshed at 2 stacks, restore 12 Energy. Energy can be restored this way once every 12s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Calamity Queller

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

    Staff of the Scarlet Sands

    The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    Missive Windspear

    Within 10s after an Elemental Reaction is triggered, ATK is increased by 12% and Elemental Mastery is increased by 48.

    Kitain Cross Spear

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

Emilie should build to prioritize ATK due to her synergy with 4-pc. Unfinished Reverie, as well as her weapon options helping her personal damage.

This synergy and priority on her ATK and likely CRIT comes from her kit and passives contributing to her personal damage, as well as Unfinished Reverie's set bonuses contributing to the burning reaction and ATK.

Dendro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Lumidouce Elegy

ATK increased by 15%. After the equipping character triggers Burning on an opponent or deals Dendro DMG to Burning opponents, the DMG dealt is increased by 18%. This effect lasts for 8s, max 2 stacks. When 2 stacks are reached or when the duration is refreshed at 2 stacks, restore 12 Energy. Energy can be restored this way once every 12s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Calamity Queller

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    Missive Windspear

    Within 10s after an Elemental Reaction is triggered, ATK is increased by 12% and Elemental Mastery is increased by 48.

    Kitain Cross Spear

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

For non-burning teams, Emilie can make use of the 4-pc. Deepwood Memories set to support her team with off-field Dendro damage and Dendro resistance shred.

She should still opt to run stats and substats that can improve her personal damage as she will be contributing a significant amount towards the team's damage.

Emilie's Artifacts

Burning Dendro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Unfinished Reverie

2-Piece: ATK+18%

4-Piece: After leaving combat for 3s, DMG dealt increases by 50%. In combat, if no Burning opponents are nearby for more than 6s, this DMG Bonus will decrease by 10% per second until it reaches 0%. When a Burning opponent exists, it will increase by 10% instead until it reaches 50%. This effect still triggers if the equipping character is off-field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Emilie should build to prioritize ATK due to her synergy with 4-pc. Unfinished Reverie, as well as her weapon options helping her personal damage.

This synergy and priority on her ATK and likely CRIT comes from her kit and passives contributing to her personal damage, as well as Unfinished Reverie's set bonuses contributing to the burning reaction and ATK.

Dendro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

For non-burning teams, Emilie can make use of the 4-pc. Deepwood Memories set to support her team with off-field Dendro damage and Dendro resistance shred.

She should still opt to run stats and substats that can improve her personal damage as she will be contributing a significant amount towards the team's damage.

Emilie's Teams

Burn Melt 1 Team

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Burn Melt teams offer the most benefits for Emilie's damage due to her 2nd passive talent that increases DMG to burning opponents. It also offers the most benefits for her Lumidouce Case as it collects scents which strengthens her off-field damage even more, and keeps up the burning reactions against enemies so that the Cryo DPS can constantly melt them.

Burn Melt 2 Team

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Burn Melt teams offer the most benefits for Emilie's damage due to her 2nd passive talent that increases DMG to burning opponents. It also offers the most benefits for her Lumidouce Case as it collects scents which strengthens her off-field damage even more, and keeps up the burning reactions against enemies so that the Cryo DPS can constantly melt them.

Burning 1 Team

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Burning teams are a solid choice for Emilie, being able to supplement the team's Pyro DMG with consistent Burn ticks and formidable buffed Dendro damage. This is also one of the few teams that allows her Lumidouce Case to collect scents and reach its full potential as an off-field Damage source.

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Lyney

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Burning teams are a solid choice for Emilie, being able to supplement the team's Pyro DMG with consistent Burn ticks and formidable buffed Dendro damage. This is also one of the few teams that allows her Lumidouce Case to collect scents and reach its full potential as an off-field Damage source.

Cyno

Main DPS

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Emilie can also slot into Quicken teams as a Dendro unit, being able to support the team with her own off-field Damage. Her presence can also help keep up a consistent Dendro aura on opponents that can easily be refreshed.

Emilie can also slot into Quicken teams as a Dendro unit, being able to support the team with her own off-field Damage. Her presence can also help keep up a consistent Dendro aura on opponents that can easily be refreshed.

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Emilie's Dendro application allows her to function in Hyperbloom teams due to being able to help supplement the Dendro application needed to generate bloom cores at a rapid pace.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS/Support

Kokomi

Sub-DPS/Support

Emilie's Dendro application allows her to function in Hyperbloom teams due to being able to help supplement the Dendro application needed to generate bloom cores at a rapid pace.

Bloom Team

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Emilie can also slot into normal Bloom teams due to her reliable and refreshable Lumidouce Cases, allowing for more consistent bloom triggers and off-field dendro application.

Emilie's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill has great single-target Dendro Application that has more than 100% uptime to keep an enemy burning indefinitely.
  • The special attacks from one of Emilie's ascension passives are an incredibly potent source of Dendro damage in her kit.
  • 85% Pyro RES in Burning Teams with Emilie allows them to thrive even in areas where they would normally take plenty of self-damage.

Weaknesses

  • Non-burning teams lack the same damage potential that Emilie provides otherwise, locking her best DPS potential to within Burning Teams.
  • Elemental Skill can only target one opponent at a time, lowering her effectiveness especially in multi-target scenarios with multiple Elite enemies.

Eula's Weapons

Main DPS

Best Weapon

Song of Broken Pines

Increases ATK by 16%. When Normal or Charged Attacks hit opponents, the character gains a Sigil of Whispers (once every 0.3s). When you reach 4 Sigils, all will be consumed and all nearby party members will get increased Normal ATK SPD by 12% and ATK by 20% for 12s. Once this triggers, you gain no Sigils for 20s. Buffs of the same type won’t stack. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Comment

The Pale Flame build for Eula is synergistic for activating the artifact set bonus, as she can get a total of 50% Physical DMG and 18% ATK with this set alone.

Alternatively, Eula can run a mix of Pale Flame and Bloodstained Chivalry at a similar effect. Depending on your substats, this can outperform 4-piece Pale Flame.

Eula's Artifacts

Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Pale Flame

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

4-Piece: When an Elemental skill hits an opponent, ATK is increased by 9% for 7s. This effect stacks up to 2 times and can be triggered once every 0.3s. Once 2 stacks are reached, 2-set effect is doubled.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Pale Flame & Bloodstained Chivalry

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Physical DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

The Pale Flame build for Eula is synergistic for activating the artifact set bonus, as she can get a total of 50% Physical DMG and 18% ATK with this set alone.

Alternatively, Eula can run a mix of Pale Flame and Bloodstained Chivalry at a similar effect. Depending on your substats, this can outperform 4-piece Pale Flame.

Eula's Teams

Superconduct 1 Team

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

Zhongli

Support

Superconduct is one of the best ways to maximize Eula's Physical DMG, taking her Cryo vision into consideration. By pairing her up with Electro units that constantly apply Electro on opponents, each and every one of Eula's strikes will be amplified. Among all of the characters you can pair Eula with, Mika is hands-down one of your best options. Not only can he provide support through healing and recharging Eula's energy, but his talents also synergize perfectly with Eula's Physical prowess.

Main DPS

Support

Superconduct is one of the best ways to maximize Eula's Physical DMG, taking her Cryo vision into consideration. By pairing her up with Electro units that constantly apply Electro on opponents, each and every one of Eula's strikes will be amplified. Among all of the characters you can pair Eula with, Mika is hands-down one of your best options. Not only can he provide support through healing and recharging Eula's energy, but his talents also synergize perfectly with Eula's Physical prowess.

Among all of the characters you can pair Eula with, Mika is hands-down one of your best options. Support

Support

Superconduct is one of the best ways to maximize Eula's Physical DMG, taking her Cryo vision into consideration. By pairing her up with Electro units that constantly apply Electro on opponents, each and every one of Eula's strikes will be amplified. Among all of the characters you can pair Eula with, Mika is hands-down one of your best options. Not only can he provide support through healing and recharging Eula's energy, but his talents also synergize perfectly with Eula's Physical prowess.

Shatter 1 Team

Eula

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Support

Sucrose

Support

A Shatter party can make for easy opportunities for additional damage as a Cryo Claymore user. You can have either Yelan or Xingqiu providing Hydro applications for constant Freeze reactions, or Chongyun to keep up your Cryo fusion. Rosaria is a good alternative for setting up Cryo for reactions due to her Elemental Burst, while Sucrose can increase the DMG caused by Shatter due to her Elemental Mastery buffing capabilties.

Shatter 2 Team

Eula

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Chongyun

Support

Diona

Support

A Shatter party can make for easy opportunities for additional damage as a Cryo Claymore user. You can have either Yelan or Xingqiu providing Hydro applications for constant Freeze reactions, or Chongyun to keep up your Cryo fusion. Rosaria is a good alternative for setting up Cryo for reactions due to her Elemental Burst, while Sucrose can increase the DMG caused by Shatter due to her Elemental Mastery buffing capabilties.

Eula's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Eula's Grimheart mechanic prevents her from getting interrupted, allowing you to forego a shielder.
  • Incredibly high scalings and decent AoE range on her Elemental Burst, giving her the opportunity to one-shot content.
  • Elemental Skill deals reduce enemy's Physical and Cyro Resistance, and stacks with an Elemental Reaction like Superconduct.

Weaknesses

  • Huge damage loss if her Elemental Burst misses or doesn't crit.
  • High Energy Cost for her Elemental Burst.
  • Long Cooldown on her Elemental Skill (Hold).
  • Physical Damage Teams face a lot of challenges to be able to clear out content, which makes Eula a Niche character and requires significant investment and planning.

Faruzan's Weapons

Buffer

Best Weapon

Favonius Warbow

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Fading Twilight

    Has three states, Evengleam, Afterglow, and Dawnblaze, which increases DMG dealt by 6%/10%/14% respectively. When attacks hit opponents, this weapon will switch to the next state. This weapon can change states once every 7s. The character equipping this weapon can still trigger the state switch while not on the field.

    End of the Line

    Triggers the Flowrider effect after using an Elemental Skill, dealing 80% ATK as AoE DMG upon hitting an opponent with an attack. Flowrider will be removed after 15s or after causing 3 instances of AoE DMG. Only 1 instance of AoE DMG can be caused every 2s in this way. Flowrider can be triggered once every 12s.

Comment

Faruzan as a Support is her best build, which works especially well on teams that utilize Anemo to deal DMG. She uses the Noblesse Oblige to buff her Anemo Main DPS, but you can also use Emblem of Severed Fate should you need more Energy Recharge.

Swirl Support

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Fading Twilight

    Has three states, Evengleam, Afterglow, and Dawnblaze, which increases DMG dealt by 6%/10%/14% respectively. When attacks hit opponents, this weapon will switch to the next state. This weapon can change states once every 7s. The character equipping this weapon can still trigger the state switch while not on the field.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

Comment

This alternative Faruzan build is meant on teams that utilize Swirl to deal DMG. She uses the Viridescent Venerer to debuff the respective Swirl Element. It's recommended to have her at C6 to gain her fullest potential.

C6 Support

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Favonius Warbow (F2P Option)

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

Comment

If you have unlocked all of Faruzan's constellations, the Tenacity of the Millelith will be her best set thanks to the effect of her 6th constellation that allows her to deal consistent hits

While Faruzan won't be able to deal much DMG, she'll make up for it with providing ATK buffs with full uptime.

Faruzan's Artifacts

Buffer

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge or ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±250~300% Energy Recharge (Pre-C6)

Comment

Faruzan as a Support is her best build, which works especially well on teams that utilize Anemo to deal DMG. She uses the Noblesse Oblige to buff her Anemo Main DPS, but you can also use Emblem of Severed Fate should you need more Energy Recharge.

Swirl Support

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge or ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±250~300% Energy Recharge (Pre-C6

Comment

This alternative Faruzan build is meant on teams that utilize Swirl to deal DMG. She uses the Viridescent Venerer to debuff the respective Swirl Element. It's recommended to have her at C6 to gain her fullest potential.

C6 Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge or ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

If you have unlocked all of Faruzan's constellations, the Tenacity of the Millelith will be her best set thanks to the effect of her 6th constellation that allows her to deal consistent hits

While Faruzan won't be able to deal much DMG, she'll make up for it with providing ATK buffs with full uptime.

Faruzan's Teams

Hypercarry Anemo 1 Team

Faruzan

Support

Xiao

Main DPS

Furina

Support

Xianyun

Support

This team focuses on dealing high Anemo DMG thanks to the Anemo RES shred from Faruzan. You can build Faruzan with less Energy Recharge with this team.

Support

Main DPS

Thoma

Support

Bennett

Support

This team focuses on dealing high Anemo DMG thanks to the Anemo RES shred from Faruzan. You can build Faruzan with less Energy Recharge with this team.

Faruzan

Support

Heizou

Main DPS

Jean

Support

Bennett

This team focuses on dealing high Anemo DMG thanks to the Anemo RES shred from Faruzan. You can build Faruzan with less Energy Recharge with this team.

Double Anemo Double Pyro 1 Team

Faruzan

Support

Wanderer

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Faruzan's role in this team comp involves buffing both Anemo and Pyro characters thanks to the Viridescent Venerer artifact set. The Pyro Resonance is beneficial in increasing overall ATK for the party.

Double Anemo Double Pyro 2 Team

Faruzan

Support

Heizou

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Faruzan's role in this team comp involves buffing both Anemo and Pyro characters thanks to the Viridescent Venerer artifact set. The Pyro Resonance is beneficial in increasing overall ATK for the party.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Faruzan

Support

Wanderer

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

This team comp focuses on taking out mobs of enemies through Swirls and the Electro-charged reaction while also dealing high Anemo DMG.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Faruzan

Support

Heizou

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Support

This team comp focuses on taking out mobs of enemies through Swirls and the Electro-charged reaction while also dealing high Anemo DMG.

Faruzan's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Buffs Anemo DMG and decreases enemy Anemo RES for Anemo DPS carries.
  • Minor crowd control with her Elemental Skill's Special Charged Attacks.
  • C6 gives a massive spike in damage, Energy regeneration, and buffing. Making it one of the best constellations for a 4-star character.

Weaknesses

  • High energy cost for her Elemental Burst, and Elemental Skill generates only a few elemental particles. This makes her reliant on getting over 300% Energy Recharge before C6.
  • Full potential is unlocked at C6, at C5 and below she is faced with heavy Energy Recharge issues.

Fischl's Weapons

Electro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

Comment

This is a generalist build for Fischl that can work for both Main DPS and Sub-DPS. An Electro Goblet should be prioritized when Fischl unlocks C6.

Physical DPS

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Rust

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 40% but decreases Charged Attack DMG by 10%.

    Mitternachts Waltz

    Normal Attack hits on opponents increase Elemental Skill DMG by 20% for 5s. Elemental Skill hits on opponents increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 5s.

Comment

This Main DPS build for Fischl focuses on dealing a lot of Physical DMG through Normal Attacks. The 4 piece Pale Flame will furtherly increase overall Physical DMG.

Elemental Reaction Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

    Slingshot

    If a Normal Attack or Aimed Shot hits a target within 0.3s of being fired, increases DMG by 36%. Otherwise, decreases DMG by 10%.

Comment

This Fischl build will be her best Sub-DPS set for Dendro teams. Choose between and ATK% or EM sands piece depending on its substats.

Fischl's Artifacts

Electro Sub-DPS

&

Thundering Fury & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: Electro DMG Bonus +15%

  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • ATK

Comment

This is a generalist build for Fischl that can work for both Main DPS and Sub-DPS. An Electro Goblet should be prioritized when Fischl unlocks C6.

Physical DPS

Best Artifact Set

Pale Flame

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

4-Piece: When an Elemental skill hits an opponent, ATK is increased by 9% for 7s. This effect stacks up to 2 times and can be triggered once every 0.3s. Once 2 stacks are reached, 2-set effect is doubled.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Physical DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Main DPS build for Fischl focuses on dealing a lot of Physical DMG through Normal Attacks. The 4 piece Pale Flame will furtherly increase overall Physical DMG.

Elemental Reaction Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%

Comment

This Fischl build will be her best Sub-DPS set for Dendro teams. Choose between and ATK% or EM sands piece depending on its substats.

Fischl's Teams

Fischl

This team specializes in dealing Spread and Aggravate damage. In general, you can never go wrong with having Fischl in the party for any Dendro-Electro team comp!

Tighnari

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

This team specializes in dealing Spread and Aggravate damage. In general, you can never go wrong with having Fischl in the party for any Dendro-Electro team comp!

Taser Team

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This team specializes in taking out multiple enemies with the Electo-charged reaction. Fischl provides Electro thanks to her Elemental Skill so that a Hydro DPS like Ayato can trigger Electro-charged and provide Electro particles for Beidou.

Superconduct Team

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Eula

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Diona

Support

Fischl acts as an Electro supplement to trigger Superconduct, allowing Eula to deal more Physical DMG with her already DMG dealing Elemental Burst.

F2P Team

Fischl

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

This is Fischl's best team without any 5-star characters. A combination of Fischl and Xingqiu's Elemental Bursts combined with Fischl's Oz and Sucrose's Swirl through her Normal Attacks allows you to deal a lot of Electro-charged DMG in the process!

Fischl's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High Attack SPD.
  • Elemental Skill and Burst persist after swap.
  • Provides multiple Electro Energy Particles.
  • Consistently applies Electro and triggers Elemental Reactions.

Weaknesses

  • Requires many constellations for excellent utility.

Freminet's Weapons

Pale Flame Physical DPS

Best Weapon

Song of Broken Pines

Increases ATK by 16%. When Normal or Charged Attacks hit opponents, the character gains a Sigil of Whispers (once every 0.3s). When you reach 4 Sigils, all will be consumed and all nearby party members will get increased Normal ATK SPD by 12% and ATK by 20% for 12s. Once this triggers, you gain no Sigils for 20s. Buffs of the same type won’t stack. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Prototype Archaic

    On hit, Normal or Charge Attacks have a 50% chance to deal an additional 240% ATK DMG to enemies with a small AoE. Can only occur once every 15s.

    Snow-Tombed Starsilver

    Hitting an enemy with Normal and Charged Attacks has a 60% chance of forming and dropping an Everfrost Icicle abve them, dealing 80% AoE ATK DMG. Enemies affected by Cryo are dealt 200% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 10s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Comment

The Pale Flame artifact set would be Freminet's best build for Physical to maximize the damage of his Level 4 Elemental Skill and Normal Attacks. With his usage of Cryo, you can also make use of the Superconduct reaction to boost your Physical DMG.

Physical Freminet utilizes his Elemental Skill the best at Pers Level 4.

Blizzard Strayer Cryo DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Tidal Shadow

    After the wielder is healed, ATK will be increased by 24% for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

If you fully intend to use Freminet's Cryo vision to its fullest capacity, then building him with a full Blizzard Strayer set will work wonders for you. However, do take note that this may require party optimzation to keep the Cryo DMG constant.

Cryo Freminet spams his Elemental Skill the best at Pers Level 0.

Hybrid DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Song of Broken Pines

    Increases ATK by 16%. When Normal or Charged Attacks hit opponents, the character gains a Sigil of Whispers (once every 0.3s). When you reach 4 Sigils, all will be consumed and all nearby party members will get increased Normal ATK SPD by 12% and ATK by 20% for 12s. Once this triggers, you gain no Sigils for 20s. Buffs of the same type won’t stack. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Prototype Archaic

    On hit, Normal or Charge Attacks have a 50% chance to deal an additional 240% ATK DMG to enemies with a small AoE. Can only occur once every 15s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Tidal Shadow

    After the wielder is healed, ATK will be increased by 24% for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

Should you aim for a perfect balance between Freminet's Physical and Cryo capabilities, this build might just be right up your alley. By giving him 2 artifacts from the Blizzard Strayer and Pale Flame sets, you can take advantage of his dual sources of DMG.

Apart from the build above, you can optimize this build according to the weapon you have equipped. Should you have a weapon that gives off Physical DMG, it might be best for you to adjust your goblet accordingly by aiming for Cryo DMG Bonus.

Freminet's Artifacts

Pale Flame Physical DPS

Best Artifact Set

Pale Flame

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

4-Piece: When an Elemental skill hits an opponent, ATK is increased by 9% for 7s. This effect stacks up to 2 times and can be triggered once every 0.3s. Once 2 stacks are reached, 2-set effect is doubled.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Physical DMG Bonus/ATK
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

The Pale Flame artifact set would be Freminet's best build for Physical to maximize the damage of his Level 4 Elemental Skill and Normal Attacks. With his usage of Cryo, you can also make use of the Superconduct reaction to boost your Physical DMG.

Physical Freminet utilizes his Elemental Skill the best at Pers Level 4.

Blizzard Strayer Cryo DPS

Best Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

If you fully intend to use Freminet's Cryo vision to its fullest capacity, then building him with a full Blizzard Strayer set will work wonders for you. However, do take note that this may require party optimzation to keep the Cryo DMG constant.

Cryo Freminet spams his Elemental Skill the best at Pers Level 0.

Hybrid DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Pale Flame

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Physical DMG Bonus/Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

Should you aim for a perfect balance between Freminet's Physical and Cryo capabilities, this build might just be right up your alley. By giving him 2 artifacts from the Blizzard Strayer and Pale Flame sets, you can take advantage of his dual sources of DMG.

Apart from the build above, you can optimize this build according to the weapon you have equipped. Should you have a weapon that gives off Physical DMG, it might be best for you to adjust your goblet accordingly by aiming for Cryo DMG Bonus.

Freminet's Teams

Shatter 1 Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

Depending on your chosen build, a Shatter Team would be your best bet in dealing maximum DMG to your opponents to utilize his passive. A good Hydro unit like Xingqiu or Yelan will synergize well with Freminet's reliance on his Normal Attacks. Kokomi is also a great unit for AoE Hydro application and healing. Mika can also provide healing and can further Freminet's Physical DMG through his own talents, with Electro units like the Raiden Shogun and Shinobu adding to the Shatter DMG.

Shatter 2 Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Depending on your chosen build, a Shatter Team would be your best bet in dealing maximum DMG to your opponents to utilize his passive. A good Hydro unit like Xingqiu or Yelan will synergize well with Freminet's reliance on his Normal Attacks. Kokomi is also a great unit for AoE Hydro application and healing. Mika can also provide healing and can further Freminet's Physical DMG through his own talents, with Electro units like the Raiden Shogun and Shinobu adding to the Shatter DMG.

Shatter 3 Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Depending on your chosen build, a Shatter Team would be your best bet in dealing maximum DMG to your opponents to utilize his passive. A good Hydro unit like Xingqiu or Yelan will synergize well with Freminet's reliance on his Normal Attacks. Kokomi is also a great unit for AoE Hydro application and healing. Mika can also provide healing and can further Freminet's Physical DMG through his own talents, with Electro units like the Raiden Shogun and Shinobu adding to the Shatter DMG.

Shatterbloom Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

Because Dendro and Cryo can co-exist together when applied to an enemy, when using Freminet with an Electro character, he can apply Cryo to induce Freeze, Hyperbloom, and Shatter, all at the same time!

Physical Hypercarry 1 Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

Zhongli

Support

As Freminet is a very capable Physical DPS, an Elemental Reaction you might want to take advantage of is Superconduct, which decreases opponents' overall defense. Coordination between Mika and the Raiden Shogun will be able to provide you with as much Physical DMG as possible through talents and Superconduct. Should you need to keep Freminet's Burst up to maximize his Elemental Skill, the Raiden Shogun has your back.

Physical Hypercarry 2 Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

Shenhe

Support

As Freminet is a very capable Physical DPS, an Elemental Reaction you might want to take advantage of is Superconduct, which decreases opponents' overall defense. Coordination between Mika and the Raiden Shogun will be able to provide you with as much Physical DMG as possible through talents and Superconduct. Should you need to keep Freminet's Burst up to maximize his Elemental Skill, the Raiden Shogun has your back.

Perma-Freeze Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

A Perma-Freeze Team can also be a viable option when playing Freminet, provided that you can keep the Cryo application coming even after each Shatter. For this purpose, Shenhe will be able to keep Cryo DMG at a constant, especially with the help of Kazuha who can Swirl it around in a much larger AoE, while Hydro units like Kokomi, Xingqiu, or Yelan set up Hydro.

Melt Team

Freminet

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

One unconventional but nevertheless creative and effective team option is a Melt Team composed of Xiangling, Bennett, and Kazuha. Xiangling's excellent Pyro application matched with Bennett and Kazuha's respective DMG boosts will work wonders as Freminet continuously applies Cryo with his Elemental Skill and Burst!

Freminet's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Can utilize Frozen, Shatter and Superconduct.
  • Capable of dealing Physical and Cryo DMG simultaneously.
  • Has decent versatility; can fit into two distinct playstyles based on Elemental Skill usage.
  • Useful for underwater exploration.

Weaknesses

  • Scaling on his skill multipliers are low.
  • Susceptible to interruptions.
  • Physical build and reaction lacks an efficient support that could help the pseudo-element.

Furina's Weapons

Golden Troupe Hydro DPS

Best Weapon

Splendor of Tranquil Waters

When the equipping character's current HP increases or decreases, Elemental Skill DMG dealt will be increased by 8% for 6s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s. When other party members' current HP increases or decreases, the equipping character's Max HP will be increased by 14% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s. The aforementioned effects can be triggered even if the wielder is off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Key of Khaj-Nisut

    HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

As the source of her damage comes from her Elemental Skill, Golden Troupe with HP and CRIT stats is the best build for Furina. This maximizes the damage of her Elemental Skill as long as you keep her in her Ousia form.

Have a strong party healer to counteract the HP drain her Ousia form requires. You can always switch to Pneuma form in a pinch, although it removes her off-field DMG.

Hybrid Buffer Support

Best Weapon

Splendor of Tranquil Waters

When the equipping character's current HP increases or decreases, Elemental Skill DMG dealt will be increased by 8% for 6s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s. When other party members' current HP increases or decreases, the equipping character's Max HP will be increased by 14% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s. The aforementioned effects can be triggered even if the wielder is off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Key of Khaj-Nisut

    HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

As Furina greatly buffs characters with her Fanfare mechanic, this build plays around her Elemental Burst by having it ready every rotation. Prioritize increasing her Energy Recharge and HP% above all else, yet still maintaining a balance of CRIT.

Tenacity of the Milellith Support

Best Weapon

Splendor of Tranquil Waters

When the equipping character's current HP increases or decreases, Elemental Skill DMG dealt will be increased by 8% for 6s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s. When other party members' current HP increases or decreases, the equipping character's Max HP will be increased by 14% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s. The aforementioned effects can be triggered even if the wielder is off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Key of Khaj-Nisut

    HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

You may also use Tenacity of the Millelith to buff characters who scale on ATK, but keep Furina in her Ousia form at all times. Keep her Energy Recharge as high as possible to the point where she can use her Elemental Burst off-cooldown.

Ocean-Hued Clam Healer

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

As a support, she can act as both a healer and a team-wide buffer. Keep Furina Pneuma-aligned, then outfitting her with an Ocean-Hued Clam set will do wonders for keeping your party alive while dealing a bit of DMG on the side.

Furina's Artifacts

Golden Troupe Hydro DPS

Best Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%/Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

As the source of her damage comes from her Elemental Skill, Golden Troupe with HP and CRIT stats is the best build for Furina. This maximizes the damage of her Elemental Skill as long as you keep her in her Ousia form.

Have a strong party healer to counteract the HP drain her Ousia form requires. You can always switch to Pneuma form in a pinch, although it removes her off-field DMG.

Hybrid Buffer Support

Best Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Vourukasha's Glow & Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Comment

As Furina greatly buffs characters with her Fanfare mechanic, this build plays around her Elemental Burst by having it ready every rotation. Prioritize increasing her Energy Recharge and HP% above all else, yet still maintaining a balance of CRIT.

Tenacity of the Milellith Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%/Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Comment

You may also use Tenacity of the Millelith to buff characters who scale on ATK, but keep Furina in her Ousia form at all times. Keep her Energy Recharge as high as possible to the point where she can use her Elemental Burst off-cooldown.

Ocean-Hued Clam Healer

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

As a support, she can act as both a healer and a team-wide buffer. Keep Furina Pneuma-aligned, then outfitting her with an Ocean-Hued Clam set will do wonders for keeping your party alive while dealing a bit of DMG on the side.

Furina's Teams

HP-Drain 1 Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Furina synergizes well with characters who possess HP-fluctuations within their kit as they can reliably increase her DMG buffs. Neuvillette specifically wants his C1 so he can have full stacks of his passive even with two Hydro characters! If you're comfortable to not have a healer in your team, you may swap them into Sub-DPS or Supports like Fischl or Shenhe for Neuvillette and Wriothesley, respectively.

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Charlotte

Support

Furina synergizes well with characters who possess HP-fluctuations within their kit as they can reliably increase her DMG buffs. Neuvillette specifically wants his C1 so he can have full stacks of his passive even with two Hydro characters! If you're comfortable to not have a healer in your team, you may swap them into Sub-DPS or Supports like Fischl or Shenhe for Neuvillette and Wriothesley, respectively.

Sigewinne

Furina synergizes well with characters who possess HP-fluctuations within their kit as they can reliably increase her DMG buffs. Neuvillette specifically wants his C1 so he can have full stacks of his passive even with two Hydro characters! If you're comfortable to not have a healer in your team, you may swap them into Sub-DPS or Supports like Fischl or Shenhe for Neuvillette and Wriothesley, respectively.

Non-Fontainian HP-Drain 1 Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Jean

Support

Glass-cannon DPS teams are benefited by Furina's buffing, as long as you have a strong defensive option like Jean. Hu Tao, Xiao, and Wanderer can also equip the Marechaussee Hunter artifact set with Furina in the party.

Non-Fontainian HP-Drain 3 Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Glass-cannon DPS teams are benefited by Furina's buffing, as long as you have a strong defensive option like Jean. Hu Tao, Xiao, and Wanderer can also equip the Marechaussee Hunter artifact set with Furina in the party.

Furina-Xianyun 1 Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Gaming

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Xianyun

Support

Xianyun is one of Furina's better healer supports due to both of them being able to provide buffs to the team, with Xianyun's teamwide healing barely offsetting Furina's HP drain, giving the team all of the advantages with no downside. This duo also runs the advantage of being two premier core supports, effectively taking the roles of Sub-DPS, Buffer Supports, and Healer Supports, giving players more choices for their DPS, especially for plunge teams.

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Xiao

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS/Support

Xianyun

Support

Xianyun is one of Furina's better healer supports due to both of them being able to provide buffs to the team, with Xianyun's teamwide healing barely offsetting Furina's HP drain, giving the team all of the advantages with no downside. This duo also runs the advantage of being two premier core supports, effectively taking the roles of Sub-DPS, Buffer Supports, and Healer Supports, giving players more choices for their DPS, especially for plunge teams.

Main DPS

Xianyun
