Xianyun is one of Furina's better healer supports due to both of them being able to provide buffs to the team, with Xianyun's teamwide healing barely offsetting Furina's HP drain, giving the team all of the advantages with no downside. This duo also runs the advantage of being two premier core supports, effectively taking the roles of Sub-DPS, Buffer Supports, and Healer Supports, giving players more choices for their DPS, especially for plunge teams.

Vaporize Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS/Support

Jean

Support

Aside from Hu Tao's teams, Furina with other Pyro characters like Yoimiya replaces their usual buffers like Bennett or Yun Jin for Furina and Jean. You may still need an additional Hydro character like Yelan to guarantee Vaporize for your Pyro Main DPS.

Freeze Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Ayaka

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Charlotte

Support

Acting as a solo Hydro applicator for Freeze and a buffer, Furina in this team works as a quick-swap alternative for Wriothesley's team. Ayaka should still have the Blizzard Strayer artifact in a quick-swap team as she normally doesn't use her Normal Attacks.

Electro-Charged Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Beidou

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sayu

Support

In an Electro-Charged team-comp, you will need to have a Viridescent Venerer Anemo character who can spread and buff the reaction. Sucrose is the notable example, but as the best teams with Furina want a healer, Sayu is practically a better choice.

Bloom 1 Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

If you can't use Yelan or Xingqiu in your team, Furina is an alternative for Bloom-related teams. However, do note that Furina cannot buff the Bloom reaction's damage. As such, Furina is there to buff the Main DPS's damage instead.

Bloom 2 Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Nahida

Main DPS

Baizhu

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Support

If you can't use Yelan or Xingqiu in your team, Furina is an alternative for Bloom-related teams. However, do note that Furina cannot buff the Bloom reaction's damage. As such, Furina is there to buff the Main DPS's damage instead.

Geo Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Noelle

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

For players who run Geo or Physical team comps, Furina works as a buffer to increase her Main DPS's damage. Noelle and Mika are recommended for these respective parties as they have party-wide healing within their kit. You can now also equip Noelle or Eula with the Marechaussee Hunter artifact set with Furina's help to get the CRIT Rate you need. It further enables you to get more CRIT DMG stats especially if you have weapons like the Redhorn Stonethresher. Get a lot of Energy Recharge for the whole party as the characters needed for these teams to work have high burst costs.

Physical Team

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Eula

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

For players who run Geo or Physical team comps, Furina works as a buffer to increase her Main DPS's damage. Noelle and Mika are recommended for these respective parties as they have party-wide healing within their kit. You can now also equip Noelle or Eula with the Marechaussee Hunter artifact set with Furina's help to get the CRIT Rate you need. It further enables you to get more CRIT DMG stats especially if you have weapons like the Redhorn Stonethresher. Get a lot of Energy Recharge for the whole party as the characters needed for these teams to work have high burst costs.

Furina's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Good damage scaling for her Ousia form, and her Elemental Skill can be refreshed indefinitely.
  • Great universal buffer for damage with her Fanfare mechanic as long as you have a healer.
  • HP drain to her party members opens up unique playstyles involving HP fluctuations. Certain characters can now equip HP-change dependent artifacts and weapons, as long as you have Furina in your team.
  • Her being able to heal off-field with her Pneuma form, and her ability to walk on water with her Elemental Skill active, are highly convenient perks for overworld exploration.

Weaknesses

  • Teams with Furina require a strong party healer to help her gain Fanfare stacks as well as mitigate the HP loss dealt by her Ousia summons.
  • Switching her Arkhe removes the current summon from the field, so her team comps depend on the playstyle and build she's currently using, and therefore isn't flexible.

Gaming's Weapons

Marechaussee Hunter DPS

Best Weapon

Serpent Spine

Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea (*)

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Verdict (*)

    Increases ATK by 20%. When characters in your party obtain Elemental Shards from Crystallize reactions, the equipping character will gain 1 Seal, increasing Elemental Skill DMG by 18%. The Seal lasts for 15s, and the equipper may have up to 2 Seals at once. All of the equipper's Seals will disappear 0.2s after their Elemental Skill deals DMG.

    Redhorn Stonethresher (*)

    DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Ultimate Overlord's Mega Magic Sword

    ATK increased by 12%. That's not all! The support from all Melusines you've helped in Merusea Village fills you with strength! Based on the number of them you've helped, your ATK is increased by up to an additional 12%.

* These weapons are only used for the CRIT Main Stat as a stat stick, but their weapon effects do not necessarily work with Gaming.

Comment

With his kit having innate HP fluctations, this Gaming build uses the Marechaussee Hunter CRIT Rate artifact set, which allows him to focus on stats like CRIT Damage. This set is generally easier to build for stat balancing, even if the 2-piece set won't work for him.

Equipping Elemental Mastery sands or weapons is also recommended for Vaporize or Melt, although you can make up for it if you have enough CRIT and Elemental Mastery on your substats.

Crimson Witch of Flames DPS

Best Weapon

Serpent Spine

Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea (*)

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Verdict (*)

    Increases ATK by 20%. When characters in your party obtain Elemental Shards from Crystallize reactions, the equipping character will gain 1 Seal, increasing Elemental Skill DMG by 18%. The Seal lasts for 15s, and the equipper may have up to 2 Seals at once. All of the equipper's Seals will disappear 0.2s after their Elemental Skill deals DMG.

    Redhorn Stonethresher (*)

    DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Ultimate Overlord's Mega Magic Sword

    ATK increased by 12%. That's not all! The support from all Melusines you've helped in Merusea Village fills you with strength! Based on the number of them you've helped, your ATK is increased by up to an additional 12%.

* These weapons are only used for the CRIT Main Stat as a stat stick, but their weapon effects do not necessarily work with Gaming.

Comment

For players who want to heavily invest on Gaming, Crimson Witch of Flames is his best build in team comps focused on Elemental Reactions. If you have great rolls on this set, Crimson Witch gives a small advantage, but the stats are harder to balance than Marechaussee Hunter.

CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG weapons are generally better with Crimson Witch of Flames for stat balancing, so you may use an Elemental Mastery sands instead.

Burgeon DPS

Best Weapon

Mailed Flower

Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

Alternative Weapons

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Makhaira Aquamarine

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

Comment

As you can time whenever you want to use your Plunging Attacks, Burgeon is Gaming's alternative build should you wish to play around the reaction. Focus everything on Elemental Mastery as much as you can while also having enough Energy Recharge.

Gaming's Artifacts

Marechaussee Hunter DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

With his kit having innate HP fluctations, this Gaming build uses the Marechaussee Hunter CRIT Rate artifact set, which allows him to focus on stats like CRIT Damage. This set is generally easier to build for stat balancing, even if the 2-piece set won't work for him.

Equipping Elemental Mastery sands or weapons is also recommended for Vaporize or Melt, although you can make up for it if you have enough CRIT and Elemental Mastery on your substats.

Crimson Witch of Flames DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

For players who want to heavily invest on Gaming, Crimson Witch of Flames is his best build in team comps focused on Elemental Reactions. If you have great rolls on this set, Crimson Witch gives a small advantage, but the stats are harder to balance than Marechaussee Hunter.

CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG weapons are generally better with Crimson Witch of Flames for stat balancing, so you may use an Elemental Mastery sands instead.

Burgeon DPS

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

As you can time whenever you want to use your Plunging Attacks, Burgeon is Gaming's alternative build should you wish to play around the reaction. Focus everything on Elemental Mastery as much as you can while also having enough Energy Recharge.

Gaming's Teams

Hypercarry 1 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Xianyun

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

This team maximizes Gaming's personal damage with his Plunging Attacks and his HP drain mechanic as a hypercarry. Xianyun and Furina are good synergistic supports for him, providing big damage boost to his overall damage. Bennett also provides big ATK bonus, especially with Elemental Mastery weapons. Bennett's C6 is also great for Gaming as he can make him infuse Pyro for his regular attacks with Xianyun.

Hypercarry 2 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Jean

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

This team maximizes Gaming's personal damage with his Plunging Attacks and his HP drain mechanic as a hypercarry. Xianyun and Furina are good synergistic supports for him, providing big damage boost to his overall damage. Bennett also provides big ATK bonus, especially with Elemental Mastery weapons. Bennett's C6 is also great for Gaming as he can make him infuse Pyro for his regular attacks with Xianyun.

Vaporize 1 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Xianyun

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

If you don't have Furina, a regular Vaporize team consisting of a Hydro character, Bennett, an Anemo buffer like Sucrose or Kazuha, are good. Elemental Mastery weapons for Gaming is better in such team comp as there is an abundant of ATK bonuses already.

Vaporize 2 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Xianyun

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

If you don't have Furina, a regular Vaporize team consisting of a Hydro character, Bennett, an Anemo buffer like Sucrose or Kazuha, are good. Elemental Mastery weapons for Gaming is better in such team comp as there is an abundant of ATK bonuses already.

Melt 1 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

As you can control when to Plunge, Gaming's Pyro Application shouldn't be too fast in comparison with other Pyro characters, which means Melt teams are viable with him. Melt teams with Rosaria as the team's core Cryo applicator are best with Gaming. This team still builds Elemental Mastery and CRIT for him.

Melt 2 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS/Support

Xianyun

Support

As you can control when to Plunge, Gaming's Pyro Application shouldn't be too fast in comparison with other Pyro characters, which means Melt teams are viable with him. Melt teams with Rosaria as the team's core Cryo applicator are best with Gaming. This team still builds Elemental Mastery and CRIT for him.

Overloaded 1 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Gaming will need Chevreuse for an Overloaded team comp to function properly. This is an alternative team comp for a Hypercarry Gaming versus Xianyun/Furina. An advantage of Gaming in this team comp is that the knockback effect of Overloaded isn't a big issue for him, as his Elemental Skill allows him to close the gap, and follow enemies blown away by the reaction.

Overloaded 2 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS/Support

Chevreuse

Support

Gaming will need Chevreuse for an Overloaded team comp to function properly. This is an alternative team comp for a Hypercarry Gaming versus Xianyun/Furina. An advantage of Gaming in this team comp is that the knockback effect of Overloaded isn't a big issue for him, as his Elemental Skill allows him to close the gap, and follow enemies blown away by the reaction.

Burgeon 1 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Baizhu

Support

Burgeon team comps require decent Dendro and Hydro application. Nahida can act as your solo Dendro character, but you can also use Collei and Yaoyao if you don't have her. Any off-field Hydro character may work, but if you're using Xingqiu or Yelan, you will need to weave-in Normal Attacks in-between your Plunge Attacks to proc their Elemental Bursts.

Burgeon 2 Team

Gaming

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Kokomi

Support

Burgeon team comps require decent Dendro and Hydro application. Nahida can act as your solo Dendro character, but you can also use Collei and Yaoyao if you don't have her. Any off-field Hydro character may work, but if you're using Xingqiu or Yelan, you will need to weave-in Normal Attacks in-between your Plunge Attacks to proc their Elemental Bursts.

Gaming's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High base scalings for a 4-star Main DPS character, which is a rarity for such types.
  • One of the more reliable characters to trigger Vaporize, Melt, or Burgeon as the Skill perfectly lines up with the window needed for such a reaction to occur with him as the trigger.
  • Self-sufficient as he can heal himself from both his Elemental Skill and Burst, which lets him utilize Marechaussee Hunter even without someone like Furina.
  • Obtaining higher constellations at C6 makes him competitive against most 5-star Main DPS characters.

Weaknesses

  • By himself, he has no access to Pyro infusion, which makes him reliant on his Elemental Burst to be used off-cooldown to deal sustained damage.
  • Gaming cannot jump and plunge if the initial rush of his Skill doesn't connect to an enemy, an object, or a slope.

Ganyu's Weapons

Reverse Melt Team Main DPS

Best Weapon

Hunter's Path

Gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain the Tireless Hunt effect after hitting an opponent with a Charged Attack. This effect increases Charged Attack DMG by 160% of Elemental Mastery. This effect will be removed after 12 Charged Attacks or 10s. Only 1 instance of Tireless Hunt can be gained every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Amos' Bow

    Increases Normal Attack and Aimed Shot DMG by 12%. Increases DMG by 8% for every 0.1s that an arrow is in flight. Stacks up to 5 times on each arrow.

    Prototype Crescent

    Aimed Shot hits on weak points increase Movement SPD by 10% and ATK by 36% for 10s.

Comment

This Main DPS build for Ganyu is a relatively cheap and easy build to make that helps Ganyu do the most DPS. It only needs two core characters, Xiangling and Bennett, for the team to work. The Shimenawa's set is the best set for this build, but a Wanderer's Set can be a good substitute.

Freeze Team Main DPS

Best Weapon

Aqua Simulacra

HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

Alternative Weapons

    Polar Star

    Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

    Amos' Bow

    Increases Normal Attack and Aimed Shot DMG by 12%. Increases DMG by 8% for every 0.1s that an arrow is in flight. Stacks up to 5 times on each arrow.

    Prototype Crescent

    Aimed Shot hits on weak points increase Movement SPD by 10% and ATK by 36% for 10s.

Comment

This Freeze DPS build for Ganyu is more suited for non-boss-type enemies, stopping enemies in their tracks and dealing easy damage. One of the drawbacks of this build is it needs Mona or Kokomi and Kazuha or Venti to really make it shine.

Cryo Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Aqua Simulacra

HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

Alternative Weapons

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

Comment

Ganyu's role as a Sub-DPS is relatively simple. With her Elemental Burst, she will deal constant Cryo DMG in a wide area, while also providing a 20% Cryo DMG bonus to any character within the AoE field thanks to her Ascension Passive.

Ganyu's Artifacts

Reverse Melt Team Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: When casting an Elemental Skill, if the character has 15 or more Energy, they lose 15 Energy and Normal/Charge/Plunging Attack DMG is increased by 50% for 10s. This effect will not trigger again during that duration.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

This Main DPS build for Ganyu is a relatively cheap and easy build to make that helps Ganyu do the most DPS. It only needs two core characters, Xiangling and Bennett, for the team to work. The Shimenawa's set is the best set for this build, but a Wanderer's Set can be a good substitute.

Freeze Team Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Freeze DPS build for Ganyu is more suited for non-boss-type enemies, stopping enemies in their tracks and dealing easy damage. One of the drawbacks of this build is it needs Mona or Kokomi and Kazuha or Venti to really make it shine.

Cryo Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Noblesse Oblige & Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Ganyu's role as a Sub-DPS is relatively simple. With her Elemental Burst, she will deal constant Cryo DMG in a wide area, while also providing a 20% Cryo DMG bonus to any character within the AoE field thanks to her Ascension Passive.

Ganyu's Teams

Melt 1 Team

Ganyu

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Zhongli

Support

This is the standard Ganyu Melt Team comp. It provides increadibly high damage through the Reverse Melt reaction and is an easy team to build. Zhongli can be replaced by any support character like Diona who provides shield. This is to protect your from being interrupted while being up close to enemies.

Melt 2 Team

Ganyu

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

This is the standard Ganyu Melt Team comp. It provides increadibly high damage through the Reverse Melt reaction and is an easy team to build. Zhongli can be replaced by any support character like Diona who provides shield. This is to protect your from being interrupted while being up close to enemies.

Morgana Freeze 1 Team

Ganyu

Main DPS

Mona

Support

Venti

Support

Diona

Support

The Ganyu Freeze team, typically called Morgana, focuses on freezing enemies by having an off-field Hydro unit apply the Hydro Aura on enemies. Cryo damage resistance shred is also provided by Anemo units through Swirl. Mona can be replaced with Kokomi if you need healing and want enemies to be frozen longer.

Morgana Freeze 2 Team

Ganyu

Main DPS

Kokomi

Support

Kazuha

Support

Shenhe

Support

The Ganyu Freeze team, typically called Morgana, focuses on freezing enemies by having an off-field Hydro unit apply the Hydro Aura on enemies. Cryo damage resistance shred is also provided by Anemo units through Swirl. Mona can be replaced with Kokomi if you need healing and want enemies to be frozen longer.

Dendro Fridge Team

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Main DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Dendro)

Support

Ganyu can work as a Sub-DPS in Dendro Fridge teams by applying off-field Cryo damage on enemies.Cryo does not work on Dendro, which makes it easy for the Hydro Main DPS to freeze enemies and create Dendro cores. Shinobu applies a weak Electro Aura on enemies, which makes triggering Hyperbloom her primary function.

Freeze Team Sub-DPS Team

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Ayaka

Main DPS

Mona

Support

Venti

Support

Ganyu can fuction as a good Sub-DPS and buffer for Cryo units. Similar to Ganyu's Main-DPS freeze team, this team also focuses on freezing enemies while dealing high damage. Again, Mona can be replaced by Kokomi for more healing.

Ganyu's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Ganyu ascends with considerably high base CRIT DMG. This makes it easier to build her especially as a Freeze Main DPS.
  • Her entire kit is capable of dealing various forms of AoE. This provides some utility for the entire team as well as eases her Charged-attack based playstyle
  • Ganyu at C0 can already deal massive damage without needing any other constellations
  • With her decent energy regeneration and Off-Field capabilities, she can alternatively be built as a Cryo DMG Support.

Weaknesses

  • Ganyu has naturally Low HP. This makes her quite squishy and can sometimes be one-shotted by bosses if not careful.
  • Charge Attack takes time without C6. This makes playing her feel clunky due to the wind-up time to deal one instance of damage
  • Her Main DPS playstyle only revolves around charging up shots, this makes her always vulnerable and almost always requires a form of a shield.

Gorou's Weapons

Support

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Comment

Gorou as a support, especially at C4, maximizes his utility by having DEF% Mainstat artifacts. You can consider getting Energy Recharge as a Mainstat to ensure his Elemental Burst is available after cooldown. Make sure to invest in CRIT Rate when using the Favonius Bow!

Gorou's Artifacts

Support

Best Artifact Set

&

Husk of Opulent Dreams & Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: DEF +30%

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: DEF%
  • Circlet: DEF%/CRIT Rate

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate
  • DEF%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Gorou as a support, especially at C4, maximizes his utility by having DEF% Mainstat artifacts. You can consider getting Energy Recharge as a Mainstat to ensure his Elemental Burst is available after cooldown. Make sure to invest in CRIT Rate when using the Favonius Bow!

Gorou's Teams

Mono Geo 1 Team

Gorou

Support

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Gorou excels in buffing Geo characters to significant heights. Characters like Itto and Noelle can specially shine in Mono-Geo as to keep their bursts ready.

Mono Geo 2 Team

Gorou

Support

Noelle

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Gorou excels in buffing Geo characters to significant heights. Characters like Itto and Noelle can specially shine in Mono-Geo as to keep their bursts ready.

F2P Geo 1 Team

Gorou

Support

Noelle

Main DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Geo)

Support

Gorou can still be used as a support in a F2P-friendly team, acting as a buffer for Geo DMG. Just make sure to have at least 3 Geo characters to utilize his passive!

F2P Geo 2 Team

Gorou

Support

Ningguang

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Traveler(Geo)

Support

Gorou can still be used as a support in a F2P-friendly team, acting as a buffer for Geo DMG. Just make sure to have at least 3 Geo characters to utilize his passive!

Gorou's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Boosts DEF, interruption resistance, and Geo DMG, making him the premier support for Geo-focused teams.
  • Buffs the entire party's DEF after using Elemental Burst, and damage in the case of DEF-scaling characters.
  • C4 can heal active characters during Elemental Burst, turning Gorou into a viable healer in his otherwise healerless comps.
  • C6 can increase Geo CRIT DMG by a sizable amount.
  • Displays Inazuma Specialties on the minimap.

Weaknesses

  • Almost all of his potential is locked behind Mono Geo, severely limiting his possible comp choices.
  • Elemental Burst has a high Energy Cost, making him energy-hungry if ran anywhere else but Mono Geo.

Heizou's Weapons

Anemo CRIT DPS

Best Weapon

Tulaytullah's Remembrance

Normal Attack SPD is increased by 10%. After the wielder unleashes an Elemental Skill, Normal Attack DMG will increase by 4.8% every second for 14s. After hitting an opponent with a Normal Attack during this duration, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 9.6%. This increase can be triggered once every 0.3s. The maximum Normal Attack DMG increase per single duration of the overall effect is 48%.

Alternative Weapons

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    Solar Pearl

    Normal Attack hits increase Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 20% for 6s. Likewise, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 6s.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

Comment

Heizou with CRIT stats is generally his best build as a Main DPS, especially when fighting against bosses and other tanky targets.

This build works best on single target enemies, with only a minor difference in DMG compared to the triple Elemental Mastery build.

Swirl DPS

Best Weapon

A Thousand Floating Dreams

Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

Alternative Weapons

    Wandering Evenstar

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Sacrificial Fragments

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Mappa Mare

    Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 8% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks.

Comment

Using a Swirl build with Elemental Mastery stats works best against multiple enemies. Heizou's strength comes from his role as a driver to enable off-field characters, but enemies should be closer together to work its fullest potential.

Heizou's Artifacts

Anemo CRIT DPS

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

Heizou with CRIT stats is generally his best build as a Main DPS, especially when fighting against bosses and other tanky targets.

This build works best on single target enemies, with only a minor difference in DMG compared to the triple Elemental Mastery build.

Swirl DPS

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

Using a Swirl build with Elemental Mastery stats works best against multiple enemies. Heizou's strength comes from his role as a driver to enable off-field characters, but enemies should be closer together to work its fullest potential.

Heizou's Teams

Premium Electro-Charged Team

Heizou

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

This Heizou team comp focuses on Swirling Electro and Hydro Reactions. Shinobu can be replaced with Fischl to help with Elemental Particle generation.

F2P Electro-Charged Team

Heizou

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Support

This Heizou F2P team focuses on Swirling Electro and Hydro Reactions while also providing Heizou with shields and DMG resistance. Fischl can or Beidou can be swapped out with Shinobu if you need healing.

Main DPS Team

Heizou

Main DPS

Faruzan

Support

Bennett

Support

Zhongli

Support

This team comp focuses on improving his personal damage from the buffs given by his supports. You may replace Faruzan or Zhongli with Mona, or Jean if you have her at C4.

International Team

Heizou

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

A strong classic team comp with Heizou acting as the Main DPS in the party. Heizou driving the strong Hydro and Pyro application from his teammates can help with triggering multiple Vaporize reactions.

Heizou's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Swirl focused playstyle that synergizes well with Anemo.
  • Above average base ATK for a 4-Star character.
  • Can quickly create Declension stacks through swirled Normal Attacks, letting him deal max Elemental Skill DMG.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Burst explodes on the first enemy hit, making it require proper positioning.
  • Holding his Elemental Skill makes him open to attacks, which cancels his Skill.
  • Heizou is an Elemental Reaction enabler that requires equally invested off-field teammates.

Hu Tao's Weapons

Crimson Witch of Flames DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of the Scarlet Sands

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Ballad of the Fjords

    When there are at least 3 different Elemental Types in your party, Elemental Mastery will be increased by 120.

    Dragon's Bane

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Pyro by 20%.

Comment

This Hu Tao build increases Vaporize and Melt DMG thanks to The Crimson Witch of Flames. Despite it being best artifact set for Hu Tao, it is very tedious to get since you will have to deal with getting Lavawalker artifacts in the Hidden Palace of Zhou domain.

Shimenawa's Reminiscence DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of the Scarlet Sands

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Ballad of the Fjords

    When there are at least 3 different Elemental Types in your party, Elemental Mastery will be increased by 120.

    Dragon's Bane

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Pyro by 20%.

Comment

If you want a viable artifact set that's worth spending resin on, you can get the Shimenawa's Reminiscence set in the Momiji-Dyed Court. Even if you don't get the right artifact set, you will still get the Emblem of Severed Fate which is great for a lot of Sub-DPS characters.

Hu Tao will still be able to deal a lot of DMG in this build thanks to the Normal and Charged Attack buff, but do note that this set will make you lose energy after using your Elemental Skill, so find some Energy Recharge substats in your artifacts to make up for it.

Marechaussee Hunter DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of the Scarlet Sands

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Ballad of the Fjords

    When there are at least 3 different Elemental Types in your party, Elemental Mastery will be increased by 120.

    Dragon's Bane

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Pyro by 20%.

Comment

For teams that have Furina and Xianyun, a third build variant involving the use of Marechaussee Hunter is also recommended. Plunging Attacks with Vaporize will be her main source of damage, so you may still run a second Hydro applicator like Yelan.

While Marechaussee Hunter is recommended for such teams, you can still get by with Shimenawa's Reminiscence or Crimson Witch of Flames if you already have good stats on them.

Hu Tao's Artifacts

Crimson Witch of Flames DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Hu Tao build increases Vaporize and Melt DMG thanks to The Crimson Witch of Flames. Despite it being best artifact set for Hu Tao, it is very tedious to get since you will have to deal with getting Lavawalker artifacts in the Hidden Palace of Zhou domain.

Shimenawa's Reminiscence DPS

Best Artifact Set

Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: When casting an Elemental Skill, if the character has 15 or more Energy, they lose 15 Energy and Normal/Charge/Plunging Attack DMG is increased by 50% for 10s. This effect will not trigger again during that duration.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Comment

If you want a viable artifact set that's worth spending resin on, you can get the Shimenawa's Reminiscence set in the Momiji-Dyed Court. Even if you don't get the right artifact set, you will still get the Emblem of Severed Fate which is great for a lot of Sub-DPS characters.

Hu Tao will still be able to deal a lot of DMG in this build thanks to the Normal and Charged Attack buff, but do note that this set will make you lose energy after using your Elemental Skill, so find some Energy Recharge substats in your artifacts to make up for it.

Marechaussee Hunter DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

For teams that have Furina and Xianyun, a third build variant involving the use of Marechaussee Hunter is also recommended. Plunging Attacks with Vaporize will be her main source of damage, so you may still run a second Hydro applicator like Yelan.

While Marechaussee Hunter is recommended for such teams, you can still get by with Shimenawa's Reminiscence or Crimson Witch of Flames if you already have good stats on them.

Hu Tao's Teams

Premium Team

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Support

Xianyun

Support

Hu Tao's current best team utilizes the buffs provided by Furina, Yelan, and Xianyun, while offering a significant playstyle change involving Plunging Attacks. Note that you'll have to do a Normal Attack before a Plunging Attack to proc Yelan's coordinated attacks. Hu Tao's 50% HP mechanic is underutilized in this team comp due to Xianyun's strong healing, but their buffs are more than enough to make up for it. This ensures however that her survivability won't be a big issue.

Double Hydro 1 Team

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

All other best Hu Tao teams need Xingqiu in their party as Xingqiu's Rainswords apply Hydro faster than Hu Tao's application, allowing her to consistently Vaporize the enemy. Having Yelan not only provides even more consistent off-field Hydro application, but will also provide a DMG boost to Hu Tao's already insane single target DMG as well as HP resonance.

Double Geo Vaporize 1 Team

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Hu Tao Team Comp relies on the Geo Resonance which allows Hu Tao to deal more DMG and is effective against mobs. Albedo provides an Elemental Mastery Bonus for Hu Tao using his Elemental Burst and Zhongli protects with his strong shield.

Double Geo Vaporize 2 Team

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Hu Tao Team Comp relies on the Geo Resonance which allows Hu Tao to deal more DMG and is effective against mobs. Albedo provides an Elemental Mastery Bonus for Hu Tao using his Elemental Burst and Zhongli protects with his strong shield.

Free-to-Play 1 Team

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Thoma

Support

In Hu Tao's free-to-play team, you can use Thoma as a shielder with Sucrose acting as a debuffer. You can also use Yanfei as a shielder if you have her 4th constellation unlocked

Free-to-Play 2 Team

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Yanfei

Support

In Hu Tao's free-to-play team, you can use Thoma as a shielder with Sucrose acting as a debuffer. You can also use Yanfei as a shielder if you have her 4th constellation unlocked

Hu Tao's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • HP conversion to ATK contributes a huge amount of boost to her already good scaling and Vaporize potential.
  • Monstrous DPS against boss-type enemies or in single target situations.
  • Elemental Burst enables her to be self-sufficient especially with her high-risk, high-reward playstyle.
  • Provides CRIT Rate for other party members.

Weaknesses

  • High damage potential requires her to have low HP, making her best performances incredibly risky without a shielder, healer, or her Elemental Burst.
  • Often struggles against wild groups of enemies as she lacks AoE attacks outside of Elemental Burst or Xianyun teams.
  • Fast application of the Pyro element reduces her best team comp choices to make Vaporize more consistent for her, often necessitating either Xingqiu or Yelan.
  • Unless you have her C1, limited stamina can dampen her performance and smoothness for Charged Attacks spam playstyle.

Itto's Weapons

Main DPS

Best Weapon

Redhorn Stonethresher

DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Whiteblind

    On hit, Normal or Charged Attacks increase ATK and DEF by 6% for 6s. Max 4 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.5s.

Comment

This Itto build focuses on maximizing his DEF to deal huge damage. The Husk is the best artifact for him in this build, with DEF% being the Main stat for the Sands piece. You will want to have around 120-130% Energy Recharge to comfortably use Burst off cooldown.

Itto's Artifacts

Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Husk of Opulent Dreams

2-Piece: DEF +30%

4-Piece: A character equipped with this Artifact set will obtain the Curiosity effect in the following conditions: When on the field, the character gains 1 stack after hitting an opponent with a Geo attack, triggering a maximum of once every 0.3s. When off the field, the character gains 1 stack every 3s. Curiosity can stack up to 4 times, each providing 6% DEF and a 6% Geo DMG Bonus. When 6 seconds pass without gaining a Curiosity stack, 1 stack is lost.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%
  • Goblet: GEO DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • DEF%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Itto build focuses on maximizing his DEF to deal huge damage. The Husk is the best artifact for him in this build, with DEF% being the Main stat for the Sands piece. You will want to have around 120-130% Energy Recharge to comfortably use Burst off cooldown.

Itto's Teams

Mono Geo Team

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Zhongli

Support

This standard Mono Geo team comp focuses on dealing only Geo damage and easily regenarating everyone's Energy thanks to having a single shared Element. Zhongli works particularly well here due to his Pillar resonating with 2 other Geo structures.

Triple Geo Flex Team

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Kokomi

Support/Flex

The same principle from the Mono Geo team applies here, but with the flex role acting as the key to deal with special enemies such as ones that have Pyro or Electro Shields. This also opens up the possiblity of creating the Crystalize effect.

Solo Geo F2P Team

Itto

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Support

Diona

Support

Itto doesn't perform his best without his dedicated Geo supports (Gorou mostly), but that doesn't mean he isn't viable! Any characters that act as an off-field sub-DPS or support can still work.

Triple Geo F2P Team

Itto

Main DPS

Traveler (Geo)

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

This is Itto's best Geo team without any 5-stars other than the Geo Traveler. The Geo Traveler is a good free option if you need a third Geo character to fully utilize Gorou's skills.

Itto's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High sustained Charged Attack DMG when enhanced with Superstrength Stacks from Normal Attacks & Elemental Skill.
  • Ushi, his Elemental Skill, can deal significant damage and be easily be used and integrated into his Superstrength Stacks combos.

Weaknesses

  • High investment is needed to activate his high-cost Elemental Burst every rotation. In addition, he requires teams (especially with Gorou) to enable his full potential, which means he is not flexible as he's holed up in Mono-Geo teams.
  • Elemental Burst cancels when immediately switched out during its duration, which limits the supports he can pair with.

Jean's Weapons

Anemo Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

This Jean build capitalizes on maximizing Jean's damage from her Elemental Skill and Burst. It is mainly used in team comps where there is already another Viridescent Venerer user.

Anemo Healer Support

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

Viridescent Venerer is Jean's best artifact set as a Support, allowing her to shred elemental resistance with it. Alongside this, the focus on both healing and energy recharge allows her to maintain consistent burst uptime with buffers like Furina.

Since Jean's healing scales off of her ATK stat, players can still get the best of both worlds even if they opt into a more damage-focused build.

ATK Buffer Build

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

If Jean is being used in a team without Elemental Reactions (such as a double Anemo double Geo team with Xiao), you can opt to use the Noblesse Oblige set to buff the party after using Jean's Elemental Burst.

Jean's Artifacts

Anemo Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Gladiator's Finale & Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: ATK +18%

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Jean build capitalizes on maximizing Jean's damage from her Elemental Skill and Burst. It is mainly used in team comps where there is already another Viridescent Venerer user.

Anemo Healer Support

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Viridescent Venerer is Jean's best artifact set as a Support, allowing her to shred elemental resistance with it. Alongside this, the focus on both healing and energy recharge allows her to maintain consistent burst uptime with buffers like Furina.

Since Jean's healing scales off of her ATK stat, players can still get the best of both worlds even if they opt into a more damage-focused build.

ATK Buffer Build

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

If Jean is being used in a team without Elemental Reactions (such as a double Anemo double Geo team with Xiao), you can opt to use the Noblesse Oblige set to buff the party after using Jean's Elemental Burst.

Jean's Teams

Jean - Furina 1 Team

Jean

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

Jean and Furina synergize well together. Jean can immediately stack Fanfare with her burst while debuffing enemies with resistance shred. With these two serving as the team's core members, there is room for some flexibility in the Main DPS and Sub-DPS roles, as long as they can benefit from Furina's Hydro application.

Jean - Furina 2 Team

Jean

Support

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

Jean and Furina synergize well together. Jean can immediately stack Fanfare with her burst while debuffing enemies with resistance shred. With these two serving as the team's core members, there is room for some flexibility in the Main DPS and Sub-DPS roles, as long as they can benefit from Furina's Hydro application.

Sunfire 1 Team

Jean

Support

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Jean and Bennett's Elemental Bursts combined can cause a lot of Pyro Swirls around enemies. Jean's Burst will apply the Anemo element to the character while Bennett's will apply Pyro, which makes you automatically Swirl Pyro in the process. Make sure that Jean has significant investment in Elemental Mastery to further maximize Swirl Damage. You can use Main DPS characters like Raiden or Tartaglia to trigger multiple bouts of Overcharged or Vaporize reactions respectively.

Sunfire 2 Team

Jean

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Jean and Bennett's Elemental Bursts combined can cause a lot of Pyro Swirls around enemies. Jean's Burst will apply the Anemo element to the character while Bennett's will apply Pyro, which makes you automatically Swirl Pyro in the process. Make sure that Jean has significant investment in Elemental Mastery to further maximize Swirl Damage. You can use Main DPS characters like Raiden or Tartaglia to trigger multiple bouts of Overcharged or Vaporize reactions respectively.

Double Anemo - Double Geo Team

Jean

Support

Xiao

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This team comp synergizes well with keeping Xiao safe as he deals damage with his Elemental Burst. Jean will provide particle generation for Jean's Elemental burst and can also increase his DPS if she has her 4th Constellation unlocked. Since this is a team that doesn't use Elemental Reactions, we recommend that you equip Jean with the Noblesse Oblige 4 piece set to provide Xiao with more ATK

Mono Anemo Team

Jean

Support

Xiao

Main DPS

Faruzan

Support

Zhongli

Support

This team comp synergizes well with keeping Xiao safe as he deals damage with his Elemental Burst. Jean will provide particle generation for Jean's Elemental burst and can also increase his DPS if she has her 4th Constellation unlocked. Since this is a team that doesn't use Elemental Reactions, we recommend that you equip Jean with the Noblesse Oblige 4 piece set to provide Xiao with more ATK

Jean's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill can be used to toss enemies into the air, allowing them to take fall damage. This works even in the abyss.
  • Healing capabilities scale off ATK, incentivizing building her as a respectable Sub-DPS.
  • Ascension passive drastically lowers her ER requirements due to its energy refunding.
  • Elemental Burst provides AoE Burst Heal and DMG. This can serve as a huge benefit for Furina teams, as Jean can easily stack Fanfare points and shred resistance if required.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Burst has a long cooldown, and can sometimes limit the player from the most utilized aspect of her kit.
  • May push enemies away from each other during her combos.

Kachina's Weapons

Geo Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Footprint of the Rainbow

Using an Elemental Skill increases DEF by 16% for 15s.

Alternative Weapons

    Engulfing Lightning

    ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This build capitalizes on Kachina's Geo DMG potential by building her as a Sub-DPS that can sometimes take the field when casting her Elemental Burst.

Similar to other Geo Sub-DPS units, build Kachina with DEF% and CRIT stats in mind to take her personal damage further, but also allowing her to support the team using 4-pc. Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City.

Kachina's Artifacts

Dendro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City

2-Piece: When a nearby party member triggers a Nightsoul Burst, the equipping character regenerates 6 Elemental Energy.

4-Piece: After the equipping character triggers a reaction, all nearby party members gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for the involved Elemental Types for 15s. If the equipping character is in the Nightsoul's Blessing state when triggering this effect, all party members gain an additional 28% Elemental DMG bonus for the Elemental Types involved in the reaction for 20s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • DEF%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This build capitalizes on Kachina's Geo DMG potential by building her as a Sub-DPS that can sometimes take the field when casting her Elemental Burst.

Similar to other Geo Sub-DPS units, build Kachina with DEF% and CRIT stats in mind to take her personal damage further, but also allowing her to support the team using 4-pc. Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City.

Kachina's Teams

Rainbow 1 Team

Kachina

Sub-DPS

Mualani

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Along with Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City, Kachina is best slotted into Rainbow teams where she can trigger Crystallize and boost her team's Elemental DMG by 40% consistently. With this, Kachina is able to support them with Off-Field DMG and the Elemental DMG boost she provides via the Artifact Set.

Along with Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City, Kachina is best slotted into Rainbow teams where she can trigger Crystallize and boost her team's Elemental DMG by 40% consistently. With this, Kachina is able to support them with Off-Field DMG and the Elemental DMG boost she provides via the Artifact Set.

Double Geo teams work well for Kachina as she is able to take advantage of Geo Resonance and can still work by triggering Crystallize and boosting the team's damage with her Best-in-Slot Artifact set.

Kachina

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Zhongli

Support

Double Geo teams work well for Kachina as she is able to take advantage of Geo Resonance and can still work by triggering Crystallize and boosting the team's damage with her Best-in-Slot Artifact set.

Mono Geo 1 Team

Kachina

Sub-DPS

Noelle

Main DPS

Furina

Support

Gorou

Support

Kachina can function in Mono Geo teams due to both Geo Resonance and the presence of Gorou who buffs the team's DEF, allowing Kachina to do more damage especially when built well. Take note that if you are running Kachina in this team, consider running her with 4-pc. Husk of Opulent Dreams as she cannot trigger Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City's 4-pc. passive effectively in a full Mono Geo.

Sub-DPS

Itto

Main DPS

Gorou

Support

Zhongli

Support

Kachina can function in Mono Geo teams due to both Geo Resonance and the presence of Gorou who buffs the team's DEF, allowing Kachina to do more damage especially when built well. Take note that if you are running Kachina in this team, consider running her with 4-pc. Husk of Opulent Dreams as she cannot trigger Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City's 4-pc. passive effectively in a full Mono Geo.

Mono Geo 3 Team

Kachina

Sub-DPS

Noelle

Main DPS

Gorou

Support

Shinobu

Support

Kachina can function in Mono Geo teams due to both Geo Resonance and the presence of Gorou who buffs the team's DEF, allowing Kachina to do more damage especially when built well. Take note that if you are running Kachina in this team, consider running her with 4-pc. Husk of Opulent Dreams as she cannot trigger Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City's 4-pc. passive effectively in a full Mono Geo.

Kachina's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Turbo Twirly is a flexible Elemental Skill that can be used in multiple use cases depending if Kachina needs to be On-Field or not.
  • Can be played with good effectiveness in both Geo-centric and Rainbow comps.
  • Turbo Twirly can be manually repositioned by Kachina herself.

Weaknesses

  • Must be On-Field to make full use of her Elemental Burst.
  • Turbo Twirly has a deceptively short range unless used with her Elemental Burst, requiring Kachina to set it up precisely where the enemies are.

Kaeya's Weapons

Cryo Main DPS

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

Comment

This Main DPS Build for Kaeya enhances his Cryo DMG output. It's especially good when Chongyun is in the party to infuse Kaeya's Normal Attacks into Cryo DMG!

Freeze Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

This Kaeya Freeze Team build has him as the secondary Cryo applicator in the team. He also functions as the unit who feeds Elemental Particles to the Cryo Main DPS.

Physical Support

Best Weapon

Skyward Blade

CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Comment

Kaeya's Sub-DPS build for Physical teams requires him to use his Elemental Burst to apply constant Cryo on enemies to trigger the Superconduct Elemental Reaction.

Kaeya's Artifacts

Cryo Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%

Comment

This Main DPS Build for Kaeya enhances his Cryo DMG output. It's especially good when Chongyun is in the party to infuse Kaeya's Normal Attacks into Cryo DMG!

Main Stats

  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

  • ATK%

Best Artifact Set

&

Blizzard Strayer & Noblesse Oblige

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
