Kaeya's Teams

Freeze Hypercarry 1 Team

Kaeya

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Support

Kaeya as a Main DPS will center around Chongyun infusing Cryo on Kaeya's melee attacks while Xingqiu will help freeze enemies while being off-field. Kazuha will help reduce enemy Cryo Resistance with the Viridescent Venerer artifact set.

Freeze Hypercarry 2 Team

Kaeya

Main DPS

Chongyun

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Kaeya as a Main DPS will center around Chongyun infusing Cryo on Kaeya's melee attacks while Xingqiu will help freeze enemies while being off-field. Kazuha will help reduce enemy Cryo Resistance with the Viridescent Venerer artifact set.

Superconduct 1 Team

Kaeya

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

This Kaeya team increases Physical DMG damage as much as possible with Superconduct, Zhongli's shield applying a Physical Resistance debuff, and Shenhe's buffs and Debufs from her Elemental Burst. Kaeya is best used in this team comp for off-field damage, constant application of Cryo, and provding Energy for Shenhe.

Superconduct 2 Team

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Keqing

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Kaeya team increases Physical DMG damage as much as possible with Superconduct, Zhongli's shield applying a Physical Resistance debuff, and Shenhe's buffs and Debufs from her Elemental Burst. Kaeya is best used in this team comp for off-field damage, constant application of Cryo, and provding Energy for Shenhe.

Freeze Team

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Ayaka

Main DPS

Kokomi

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Kaeya in Freeze team comp provides the set-up for swirling Freeze and buffing Cryo with Kazuha. Ayaka, or your Cryo Main DPS, will then utilize the buffs. In addition, Kaeya's spammable Elemental Skill can provide much needed Energy for Ayaka.

Dendro Fridge Team

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Support

This Dendro team comp for Kaeya has him acting as an off-field unit that applies Cryo on enemies. Cryo does not interact with Dendro, which makes it easy for the Cryo Main DPS to freeze enemies and create Dendro Cores. Shinobu's role will be to trigger the Hyperbloom reaction with her Elemental Skill.

Kaeya's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Kaeya's short cooldowns and energy requirements allow for easy building of a reliable party member.
  • Capable of functioning as both a decent Cryo and Physical DPS due to his scalings.
  • Good off-field Cryo applications allow Kaeya to have seamless transitions in most teams.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Skill and Burst has a small area of effect, favoring a Melee DPS unit if it is not Kaeya.
  • Kaeya's Constellations are more rare than most 4-stars.

Kaveh's Weapons

Bloom DPS

Best Weapon

Mailed Flower

Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

Alternative Weapons

    Makhaira Aquamarine

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

Comment

This Kaveh DPS build focuses on increasing his Bloom damage with the Flower of Paradise Lost artifact set and Elemental Mastery stats. He can claim ownership for Dendro Core damage if you have more Hydro than Dendro.

Make sure to have a teammate use the Deepwood Memories set to increase Kaveh's Dendro Core damage. Otherwise, Kaveh should use Deepwood Memories instead.

Bloom Driver

Best Weapon

Makhaira Aquamarine

The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This is a variant of the Bloom build in teams wherein Kaveh is not the trigger for Bloom cores. All your team members (including Kaveh) must have Elemental Mastery to fully utilize his role as a driver and tank for Bloom Cores.

Spread Main DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Makhaira Aquamarine

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Forest Regalia

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

Comment

If you also want to increase Kaveh's non-bloom damage, then equipping him with the Gilded Dreams Artifact set will be your best choice. By doing this, he can can also work great in a Spread, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon team comps!

Make sure you have another Dendro character so they can equip Deepwood Memories instead. This also lowers Kaveh's energy requirement.

Kaveh's Artifacts

Bloom DPS

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Kaveh DPS build focuses on increasing his Bloom damage with the Flower of Paradise Lost artifact set and Elemental Mastery stats. He can claim ownership for Dendro Core damage if you have more Hydro than Dendro.

Make sure to have a teammate use the Deepwood Memories set to increase Kaveh's Dendro Core damage. Otherwise, Kaveh should use Deepwood Memories instead.

Bloom Driver

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus/Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG/Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This is a variant of the Bloom build in teams wherein Kaveh is not the trigger for Bloom cores. All your team members (including Kaveh) must have Elemental Mastery to fully utilize his role as a driver and tank for Bloom Cores.

Spread Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro Damage Bonus/Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG/Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

If you also want to increase Kaveh's non-bloom damage, then equipping him with the Gilded Dreams Artifact set will be your best choice. By doing this, he can can also work great in a Spread, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon team comps!

Make sure you have another Dendro character so they can equip Deepwood Memories instead. This also lowers Kaveh's energy requirement.

Kaveh's Teams

Bloom 1 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Nahida

Support

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kaveh excels in Bloom team comps. Take Hydro and Dendro characters to your team to facilitate the reaction, especially with Nilou. Take note that Bloom trigger ownership isn't predictable in these team comps so all characters must have some Elemental Mastery. If you don't have Nilou, you can also slot in Xingqiu, Kokomi, or Ayato for their off-field Hydro application.

Bloom 2 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Kokomi

Support

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kaveh excels in Bloom team comps. Take Hydro and Dendro characters to your team to facilitate the reaction, especially with Nilou. Take note that Bloom trigger ownership isn't predictable in these team comps so all characters must have some Elemental Mastery. If you don't have Nilou, you can also slot in Xingqiu, Kokomi, or Ayato for their off-field Hydro application.

Bloom 3 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Baizhu

Support

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Sub-DPS

Kaveh excels in Bloom team comps. Take Hydro and Dendro characters to your team to facilitate the reaction, especially with Nilou. Take note that Bloom trigger ownership isn't predictable in these team comps so all characters must have some Elemental Mastery. If you don't have Nilou, you can also slot in Xingqiu, Kokomi, or Ayato for their off-field Hydro application.

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Baizhu

Support

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

In a Hyperbloom team, Kaveh can act as the on-field driver to apply Dendro while on-field. You will need a second Dendro like Nahida or Yaoyao to battery Kaveh's burst and facilitate the reaction to prevent triggering Electro-Charged.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Nahida

Support

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

In a Hyperbloom team, Kaveh can act as the on-field driver to apply Dendro while on-field. You will need a second Dendro like Nahida or Yaoyao to battery Kaveh's burst and facilitate the reaction to prevent triggering Electro-Charged.

Burgeon 1 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Nahida

Support

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Similar to Bloom teams, Kaveh can drive Burgeon teams as he can mitigate the damage from the explosions due to his healing passive. Slot-in a strong Hydro applicator like Xingqiu and another Dendro to prevent Vaporize or Burning.

Burgeon 2 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Support

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Similar to Bloom teams, Kaveh can drive Burgeon teams as he can mitigate the damage from the explosions due to his healing passive. Slot-in a strong Hydro applicator like Xingqiu and another Dendro to prevent Vaporize or Burning.

Spread 1 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Zhongli

Support

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

If you wish to build Kaveh as the carry of the team, you will have to make use of the Spread reaction. Note that Spread + Hyperbloom is still the superior choice as Kaveh's base DMG on his Normal and Charged Attacks aren't as high to be used alone.

Spread 2 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Baizhu

Support

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

If you wish to build Kaveh as the carry of the team, you will have to make use of the Spread reaction. Note that Spread + Hyperbloom is still the superior choice as Kaveh's base DMG on his Normal and Charged Attacks aren't as high to be used alone.

Spread Plunge 1 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Xianyun

Support

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kaveh, by virtue of being a Claymore character, can work with Xianyun to serve as a Plunge DPS utilizing a reaction like Spread. Since Xianyun is able to buff the damage of Plunge attacks, it places the damage ceiling slightly higher than a normal Spread team, which makes this a viable choice for players who want to use Kaveh as a more traditional DPS.

Spread Plunge 2 Team

Kaveh

Main DPS

Xianyun

Support

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Kaveh, by virtue of being a Claymore character, can work with Xianyun to serve as a Plunge DPS utilizing a reaction like Spread. Since Xianyun is able to buff the damage of Plunge attacks, it places the damage ceiling slightly higher than a normal Spread team, which makes this a viable choice for players who want to use Kaveh as a more traditional DPS.

Kaveh's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Specialist for Bloom-related team comps.
  • Has self-healing to tank Bloom core explosion DMG.
  • Viable driver for other Dendro reactions.

Weaknesses

  • Main DPS only. Has no off-field capabilities.
  • Below average DMG on his Normal and Charged Attacks.
  • High Energy Requirement.
  • Infusion is locked behind his burst.
  • Replacable by current existing Dendro characters.

Kazuha's Weapons

Support

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Xiphos' Moonlight

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

Swirl Support is Kazuha's best role and this build focuses on that aspect, prioritizing his Elemental Mastery and Energy Recharge for maximum buff effectiveness and uptime.

For this, it is recommended to have around 170% Energy Recharge, as it will allow Kazuha's burst to be available off-cooldown in most scenarios.

DPS

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Freedom-Sworn

    Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    Kagotsurube Isshin

    When a Normal, Charged, or Plunging Attack hits an opponent, it will whip up a Hewing Gale, dealing AoE DMG equal to 180% of ATK and increasing ATK by 15% for 8s. This effect can be triggered once every 8s.

Comment

This DPS Build for Kazuha deals high damage to single and multiple opponents in any scenario. Using more traditional DPS stats gives Kazuha more personal damage at the cost of party DMG buffs.

As opposed to Support Kazuha, this build expects him to be on-field for a time to catch particles, thus decreasing Energy Recharge as a priority.

Kazuha's Artifacts

Support

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

Swirl Support is Kazuha's best role and this build focuses on that aspect, prioritizing his Elemental Mastery and Energy Recharge for maximum buff effectiveness and uptime.

For this, it is recommended to have around 170% Energy Recharge, as it will allow Kazuha's burst to be available off-cooldown in most scenarios.

DPS

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This DPS Build for Kazuha deals high damage to single and multiple opponents in any scenario. Using more traditional DPS stats gives Kazuha more personal damage at the cost of party DMG buffs.

As opposed to Support Kazuha, this build expects him to be on-field for a time to catch particles, thus decreasing Energy Recharge as a priority.

Kazuha's Teams

Vaporize 1 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

With proper set-up between elements, Kazuha can swirl buff both Hydro and Pyro, which combined makes Vaporize teams like with Tartaglia and Xiangling become monstrous. Bennett is Kazuha's best friend as his Burst can be used to self-swirl Pyro on command.

Vaporize 2 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

With proper set-up between elements, Kazuha can swirl buff both Hydro and Pyro, which combined makes Vaporize teams like with Tartaglia and Xiangling become monstrous. Bennett is Kazuha's best friend as his Burst can be used to self-swirl Pyro on command.

Freeze 1 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Ayaka

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Kazuha in a Freeze team allows him to Swirl Hydro and Cryo to perma-freeze enemies. This team can be flexible by slotting in other Cryo or Hydro characters like Rosaria, Layla, or Ayato. Note that this team is most effective in AoE situations.

Freeze 2 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Main DPS

Diona

Sub-DPS

Mona

Support

Kazuha in a Freeze team allows him to Swirl Hydro and Cryo to perma-freeze enemies. This team can be flexible by slotting in other Cryo or Hydro characters like Rosaria, Layla, or Ayato. Note that this team is most effective in AoE situations.

Main DPS Buffer 1 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Sara

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Kazuha's buffs in a team that can maximize a Main DPS' Elemental DMG are good teams to build for provided that they are Cryo, Electro, Pyro, or Hydro. He is recommended to be slot-in if you want your character to achieve their highest damage potential. Note that Sucrose can achieve a similar role if the team prefers her Elemental Mastery buffs.

Main DPS Buffer 2 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Zhongli

Support

Kazuha's buffs in a team that can maximize a Main DPS' Elemental DMG are good teams to build for provided that they are Cryo, Electro, Pyro, or Hydro. He is recommended to be slot-in if you want your character to achieve their highest damage potential. Note that Sucrose can achieve a similar role if the team prefers her Elemental Mastery buffs.

Mixed 1 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Because Kazuha builds Elemental Mastery and can buff two elements at the same time, mixed team comps that can trigger two Elemental Reactions at the same time like Electro-Charged and Overload are good as it can increase his personal and the team's overall DMG.

Mixed 2 Team

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Because Kazuha builds Elemental Mastery and can buff two elements at the same time, mixed team comps that can trigger two Elemental Reactions at the same time like Electro-Charged and Overload are good as it can increase his personal and the team's overall DMG.

Main DPS 1 Team

Kazuha

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS/Support

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

With the addition of Faruzan and Furina into the game, Main DPS Kazuha has become more viable due to his high damage scalings being driven higher by these supports, with C6 completely unlocking this playstyle. This allows Kazuha to function as either the Main Anemo DPS when supported by Faruzan, or as an Anemo DPS/Driver hybrid when paired with other DPS units.

Main DPS 2 Team

Kazuha

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

With the addition of Faruzan and Furina into the game, Main DPS Kazuha has become more viable due to his high damage scalings being driven higher by these supports, with C6 completely unlocking this playstyle. This allows Kazuha to function as either the Main Anemo DPS when supported by Faruzan, or as an Anemo DPS/Driver hybrid when paired with other DPS units.

Kazuha's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill is one of the best grouping skills in the game.
  • Does not suffer from extreme Energy requirements so Elemental Burst can stay up consistently.
  • Kazuha's Elemental DMG Bonus buff remains one of the most effective in the game.
  • Due to his high Elemental Mastery, he can deal significant swirl damage.
  • Can double jump; helpful in exploring the overworld.

Weaknesses

  • Cannot swirl and buff other elements when the enemy's status is static (ex. Thunder Manifestation is always affected by Electro)

Keqing's Weapons

Aggravate Main DPS

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

This Electro build focuses on Keqing's Electro infused Normal and Charged Attacks through using her Elemental Skill. It is currently her best set when paired with Dendro characters!

Non-Aggravate Main DPS

Best Weapon

Mistsplitter Reforged

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

• Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    The Black Sword

    Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 20%. Additionally, regenerates 60% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

This is Keqing's best build when not paired with any Dendro characters like in Electro-Charged team comps

Keqing's Artifacts

Aggravate Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Thundering Fury

2-Piece: Electro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases damage caused by Overloaded, Electro-Charged, Superconduct, and Hyperbloom by 40%, and the DMG Bonus conferred by Aggravate is increased by 20%. When Quicked or the aforementioned Elemental Reactions are triggered, Elemental Skill CD is decreased by 1s. Can only occur once every 0.8s

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Electro build focuses on Keqing's Electro infused Normal and Charged Attacks through using her Elemental Skill. It is currently her best set when paired with Dendro characters!

Non-Aggravate Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Thundering Fury & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: Electro DMG Bonus +15%

2-Piece: ATK +18%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This is Keqing's best build when not paired with any Dendro characters like in Electro-Charged team comps

Keqing's Teams

Aggravate 1 Team

Keqing

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Aggrevate teams are Keqing's highest performing team comps. She will need at least 1 off-field Dendro and Electro unit to help her maintain the quicken buff. The last slot can be a unit that helps improve Electro damage on the enemy.

Aggravate 2 Team

Keqing

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Aggrevate teams are Keqing's highest performing team comps. She will need at least 1 off-field Dendro and Electro unit to help her maintain the quicken buff. The last slot can be a unit that helps improve Electro damage on the enemy.

Aggravate 3 Team

Keqing

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

Aggrevate teams are Keqing's highest performing team comps. She will need at least 1 off-field Dendro and Electro unit to help her maintain the quicken buff. The last slot can be a unit that helps improve Electro damage on the enemy.

Electro Damage 1 Team

Keqing

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

This Electro DMG team comp can be used on enemies who can't be frozen. Fischl can provide Electro particles for Keqing. Kazuha and Yelan will provide DMG buffs so that Keqing can deal more Electro DMG.

Electro Damage 2 Team

Keqing

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

This Electro DMG team comp can be used on enemies who can't be frozen. Fischl can provide Electro particles for Keqing. Kazuha and Yelan will provide DMG buffs so that Keqing can deal more Electro DMG.

Keqing's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill can hit weak points and has low CD.
  • Keqing's Elemental Skill can be used to teleport to some unreachable places
  • Very fast Charge Attack with High multipliers.
  • Low Elemental Burst cost, which can both serve as an additional source of damage and last minute i-frame dodging.

Weaknesses

  • Charged Attack's stamina cost is higher than the other sword users. This can limit her DPS windows, as she can run out of stamina quickly.
  • She can only have consistent Electro DMG after her Character Ascension Phase 2, which can be an issue for building some reaction teams during the early game.

Kinich's Weapons

Burning or Burgeon Dendro DPS

Best Weapon

Fang of the Mountain King

Gain 1 stack of Canopy's Favor after hitting an opponent with an Elemental Skill. This can be triggered once every 0.5s. After a nearby party member triggers a Burning or Burgeon reaction, the equipping character will gain 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 2s and can be triggered even when the triggering party member is off-field. Canopy's Favor: Elemental Skill and Burst DMG is increased by 10% for 6s. Max 6 stacks. Each stack is counted independently.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Earth Shaker

    After a party member triggers a Pyro-related reaction, the equipping character's Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 16% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even when the triggering party member is not on the field.

Comment

In his best teams on Burning or Burgeon, Kinich uses Obsidian Codex as his best build for the massive CRIT Rate bonus every time he uses Nightsoul Points during his Elemental Skill. It also allows him to build CRIT easier building, letting him sit comfortably at +40% CRIT Rate alone.

An alternative to this is 4-pc. Unfinished Reverie for the 50% DMG increase only against Burning opponents, and Kinich will usually be running in teams that utilize Burn anyway, making this a solid option.

Dendro Quicken DPS

Best Weapon

Beacon of the Reed Sea

After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Alternative Weapons

    Fang of the Mountain King

    Gain 1 stack of Canopy's Favor after hitting an opponent with an Elemental Skill. This can be triggered once every 0.5s. After a nearby party member triggers a Burning or Burgeon reaction, the equipping character will gain 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 2s and can be triggered even when the triggering party member is off-field. Canopy's Favor: Elemental Skill and Burst DMG is increased by 10% for 6s. Max 6 stacks. Each stack is counted independently.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

    Earth Shaker

    After a party member triggers a Pyro-related reaction, the equipping character's Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 16% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even when the triggering party member is not on the field.

Comment

If you are opting to run Kinich as a standard Dendro DPS, you can opt for something like 4-pc. Gilded Dreams or other Elemental Mastery-centric Artifact Sets and run him in standard Dendro DPS comps like Spread and Hyperbloom.

Kinich fills the role of being the on-field Dendro Applicator to either deal Spread damage or generate bloom cores for the Electro unit to trigger, all while supplementing the team with his respectable damage.

Kinich's Artifacts

Burning or Burgeon Dendro DPS

Best Artifact Set

Obsidian Codex

2-Piece: While the equipping character is in Nightsoul's Blessing and is on the field, their DMG dealt is increased by 15%.

4-Piece: After the equipping character consumes 1 Nightsoul point while on the field, CRIT Rate increases by 40% for 6s. This effect can trigger once every second.

Secondary Artifact Set

Unfinished Reverie

2-Piece: ATK+18%

4-Piece: After leaving combat for 3s, DMG dealt increases by 50%. In combat, if no Burning opponents are nearby for more than 6s, this DMG Bonus will decrease by 10% per second until it reaches 0%. When a Burning opponent exists, it will increase by 10% instead until it reaches 50%. This effect still triggers if the equipping character is off-field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT DMG
  • CRIT Rate
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

In his best teams on Burning or Burgeon, Kinich uses Obsidian Codex as his best build for the massive CRIT Rate bonus every time he uses Nightsoul Points during his Elemental Skill. It also allows him to build CRIT easier building, letting him sit comfortably at +40% CRIT Rate alone.

An alternative to this is 4-pc. Unfinished Reverie for the 50% DMG increase only against Burning opponents, and Kinich will usually be running in teams that utilize Burn anyway, making this a solid option.

Dendro Quicken DPS

Best Artifact Set

Obsidian Codex

2-Piece: While the equipping character is in Nightsoul's Blessing and is on the field, their DMG dealt is increased by 15%.

4-Piece: After the equipping character consumes 1 Nightsoul point while on the field, CRIT Rate increases by 40% for 6s. This effect can trigger once every second.

Secondary Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT DMG
  • CRIT Rate
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

If you are opting to run Kinich as a standard Dendro DPS, you can opt for something like 4-pc. Gilded Dreams or other Elemental Mastery-centric Artifact Sets and run him in standard Dendro DPS comps like Spread and Hyperbloom.

Kinich fills the role of being the on-field Dendro Applicator to either deal Spread damage or generate bloom cores for the Electro unit to trigger, all while supplementing the team with his respectable damage.

Kinich's Teams

Quickbloom 1 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS/Support

Yelan

Sub-DPS

.....

Quickbloom 2 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Sub-DPS/Support

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

.....

Kinich's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Scalespiker Cannon's damage scales massively, giving Kinich great frontloaded damage potential.
  • Elemental Skill lets Kinich evade enemy attacks without sacrificing DPS.
  • Elemental Burst is a good source of off-field AoE Dendro Damage that is flexible in its use, and also extends the duration of his Nightsoul Blessing during his skill.
  • Elemental Skill latches onto opponents and automatically targets them, eliminating any nuances when it comes to ranged opponents.

Weaknesses

  • Scalespiker Cannon during his Elemental Skill can be shot 3 to 4 times per rotation, but the timing is strict and performs slower on teams that are not focused on Burning or Burgeon.
  • Movement during his Elemental Skill requires mastery for the foresight on where to go, especially when going to the glowing Blind Spot.
  • Is a single-target unit for the most part, requiring teammates or effective use of Scalespiker Cannon and Elemental Burst to deal AoE damage.

Kirara's Weapons

Bloom Driver

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Xiphos' Moonlight

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

This Kirara Bloom build is great for applying Dendro to the enemies with her Elemental Skill. She can effectively create Bloom Cores with a Hydro character like Nilou or Barbara, which is especially helpful in AoE situations.

If you have the Key of Khaj-Nisut, you may use HP main stat artifacts as the weapon increases her Elemental Mastery based on her HP.

Shield Support

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sapwood Blade

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Consciousness will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 60 Elemental Mastery for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field. The Leaf of Consciousness' effect cannot stack.

Comment

Since her Shield Strength scales off of her Max HP, this build maximizes Kirara's Shield capabilities, pumping her full of HP above all else.

This will ensure that her Shield stays up longer and protects your characters better from DMG.

Hybrid Support

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This alternative Kirara build is well balanced between providing ample protection, dealing DMG, and setting up Dendro Reactions for the other party members.

While keeping her HP up for shield reinforcement, giving her Energy Recharge should allow Kirara to constantly burst on cooldown.

Kirara's Artifacts

Bloom Driver

Best Artifact Set

&

Tenacity of the Millelith & Vourukasha's Glow

(with Key of Khaj-Nisut)

2-Piece: HP +20%

2-Piece: HP +20%

Secondary Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Third Option Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/HP%
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery/HP%
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery/HP%

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±140% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Kirara Bloom build is great for applying Dendro to the enemies with her Elemental Skill. She can effectively create Bloom Cores with a Hydro character like Nilou or Barbara, which is especially helpful in AoE situations.

If you have the Key of Khaj-Nisut, you may use HP main stat artifacts as the weapon increases her Elemental Mastery based on her HP.

Shield Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

Vourukasha's Glow

2-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • HP
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±160% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Since her Shield Strength scales off of her Max HP, this build maximizes Kirara's Shield capabilities, pumping her full of HP above all else.

This will ensure that her Shield stays up longer and protects your characters better from DMG.

Hybrid Support

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: HP%/Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: HP%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This alternative Kirara build is well balanced between providing ample protection, dealing DMG, and setting up Dendro Reactions for the other party members.

While keeping her HP up for shield reinforcement, giving her Energy Recharge should allow Kirara to constantly burst on cooldown.

Kirara's Teams

Bloom 1 Team

Kirara

Support

Kokomi

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

In Nilou Bloom team comps, Kirara can effectively minimize Bloom DMG taken with her shields as a Support, and she can also act as the driver to apply Dendro with her Hold Elemental Skill as a Sub-DPS. Xingqiu's swords ring that surround the active character can also apply Hydro when Kirara touches enemies, but Xingqiu will need Elemental Mastery as he will most likely be the one triggering the Bloom Cores. You will need some Elemental Mastery on Kirara as she can trigger cores as well.

Bloom 2 Team

Kirara

Sub-DPS

Nilou

Main DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

In Nilou Bloom team comps, Kirara can effectively minimize Bloom DMG taken with her shields as a Support, and she can also act as the driver to apply Dendro with her Hold Elemental Skill as a Sub-DPS. Xingqiu's swords ring that surround the active character can also apply Hydro when Kirara touches enemies, but Xingqiu will need Elemental Mastery as he will most likely be the one triggering the Bloom Cores. You will need some Elemental Mastery on Kirara as she can trigger cores as well.

Sub-DPS

These Kirara teams prioritize triggering Hyperbloom reactions with her as a Support, with her both providing protection and Dendro application for your party members.

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS

Slotting Kirara in Burgeon teams can minimize self inflicted DMG from Burgeon DMG. You can also on-field swap to her if you need her Elemental Skill while there's downtime.

Burgeon 2 Team

Kirara

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Slotting Kirara in Burgeon teams can minimize self inflicted DMG from Burgeon DMG. You can also on-field swap to her if you need her Elemental Skill while there's downtime.

Kirara's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Shields party members from DMG.
  • Good Dendro Application while on-field with her Skill.
  • High base DMG on her Elemental Burst.
  • Shield can be reinforced if a new one is created.
  • Exploration skill can be used to scale cliffs.

Weaknesses

  • Dendro application is minimal off-field.
  • Provides no other buffs unless she's C6.
  • Damaging abilites mainly scale with ATK, and HP-scaling passive does not increase her personal DMG that much outside of Bloom.

Klee's Weapons

Main DPS

Best Weapon

Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

Comment

This Klee Main DPS build focuses on improving her Elemental Reaction DMG. A variation of a 2pc. Crimson Witch set and a 2pc. Artifact set that provides 18% ATK DMG is also a viable, albeit a less damaging option.

Klee's Artifacts

Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Klee Main DPS build focuses on improving her Elemental Reaction DMG. A variation of a 2pc. Crimson Witch set and a 2pc. Artifact set that provides 18% ATK DMG is also a viable, albeit a less damaging option.

Klee's Teams

Vaporize 1 Team

Klee

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

A standard Vaporize Team for Klee. Kazuha is recommended as he can also collect Klee's mini bombs into one place, on top of his humungous buffs. Do note that Pyro application in this team is quite fast, and may outpace Xingqiu at times. You can replace your Sub-DPS or Supports with Yelan, Mona, Venti, or Sucrose, but do note that reactions with them would be less consistent as the recommended characters.

Vaporize 2 Team

Klee

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

A standard Vaporize Team for Klee. Kazuha is recommended as he can also collect Klee's mini bombs into one place, on top of his humungous buffs. Do note that Pyro application in this team is quite fast, and may outpace Xingqiu at times. You can replace your Sub-DPS or Supports with Yelan, Mona, Venti, or Sucrose, but do note that reactions with them would be less consistent as the recommended characters.

Overload Team

Klee

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sara

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

With Chevreuse, Klee can also now lead Overload teams. Due to her constant Pyro application, Fischl can assist Klee with triggering Overloaded. Sara can also further boost Klee's damage as the team's buffer.

Mono-Pyro Team

Klee

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

As Klee can have issues with making Elemental Reactions consistent for herself, you can opt to using her raw power with other Pyro Sub DPS like Xiangling, and Kazuha with Swirl. This team is recommended for shield breaking or if you're having issues in AoE situations.

Burning 1 Team

Klee

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Klee can also function in Burn teams with Dendro units that have good Dendro Application to keep consistent burn ticks on the enemy, as well as providing their own personal damage to help shred down opponents. Dendro units like Nahida and Emilie are perfect for these, as their kits are able to support and even buff this kind of playstyle.

Burning 2 Team

Klee

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Klee can also function in Burn teams with Dendro units that have good Dendro Application to keep consistent burn ticks on the enemy, as well as providing their own personal damage to help shred down opponents. Dendro units like Nahida and Emilie are perfect for these, as their kits are able to support and even buff this kind of playstyle.

Sub DPS/Support 1 Team

Klee

Sub-DPS/Support

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Support or Sub DPS teams are only recommended if you have her at C2, which decreases enemy DEF. You can then opt for various teams that requires a Pyro support, namely Vaporize, Melt, or Mono-Pyro.

Sub DPS/Support 2 Team

Klee

Sub-DPS/Support

Ganyu

Main DPS

Sucrose

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Support or Sub DPS teams are only recommended if you have her at C2, which decreases enemy DEF. You can then opt for various teams that requires a Pyro support, namely Vaporize, Melt, or Mono-Pyro.

Sub DPS/Support 3 Team

Klee

Sub-DPS/Support

Lyney

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Support or Sub DPS teams are only recommended if you have her at C2, which decreases enemy DEF. You can then opt for various teams that requires a Pyro support, namely Vaporize, Melt, or Mono-Pyro.

Klee's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Klee can cover a certain area and deal decent Pyro Damage through her Elemental Skill and Burst.
  • Can act as a driver for Pyro reaction teams with her quasi-permanent Pyro application, since all of her attacks can inflict Pyro.
  • Klee excels in frontloaded damage, making her a relatively good Pyro DPS for bursting through content.
  • Klee's Charged Attack is capable of stunlocking enemies, giving her a safe way to deal damage.

Weaknesses

  • Klee is locked to dealing frontloaded damage, so her kit cannot sustain high damage for long periods of time.
  • Short attack range requires good positioning and shielding.
  • Party support skill locked behind Constellations.

Kokomi's Weapons

On-Field Ocean-Hued Clam DPS

Best Weapon

Everlasting Moonglow

Healing Bonus is increased by 10%, Normal ATK DMG is increased by 1% of the Max HP of the character equipping this weapon. For 12s after using an Elemental Burst, Normal Attacks that hit opponents will restore 0.6 Energy. Energy can be restored this way once every 0.1s.

Alternative Weapons

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Ring of Yaxche

    Using an Elemental Skill grants the Jade-Forged Crown effect: Every 1,000 Max HP will increase the Normal Attack DMG dealt by the equipping character by 0.6% for 10s. Normal Attack DMG can be increased this way by a maximum of 16%.

    Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

    When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Comment

This Kokomi build focuses on dealing DMG through her Elemental Burst powered Normal Attacks and the bubble from the Ocean-Hued Clam set. Even when built as a Main DPS, Kokomi functions very well as a healer.

Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Everlasting Moonglow

Healing Bonus is increased by 10%, Normal ATK DMG is increased by 1% of the Max HP of the character equipping this weapon. For 12s after using an Elemental Burst, Normal Attacks that hit opponents will restore 0.6 Energy. Energy can be restored this way once every 0.1s.

Alternative Weapons

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Hakushin Ring

    After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 10% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

Comment

This Kokomi build is built similarly to her Main DPS build. This build sacrifices better potential healing for more off-field damage. Kokomi's Energy requirements will depend on your team comp but having around 180%-220% Energy Recharge is a good goal.

Buffer/Healer Support

Best Weapon

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

Comment

This Kokomi build specializes in pure healing while also providing an ATK buff from the Tenacity of the Millelith artifact set. You will need 180% - 220% Energy Recharge to keep her Elemental Burst up as most of her best teams don't have a Hydro battery.

Kokomi's Artifacts

On-Field Ocean-Hued Clam DPS

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Kokomi build focuses on dealing DMG through her Elemental Burst powered Normal Attacks and the bubble from the Ocean-Hued Clam set. Even when built as a Main DPS, Kokomi functions very well as a healer.

Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Kokomi build is built similarly to her Main DPS build. This build sacrifices better potential healing for more off-field damage. Kokomi's Energy requirements will depend on your team comp but having around 180%-220% Energy Recharge is a good goal.

Buffer/Healer Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands:HP% or Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Kokomi build specializes in pure healing while also providing an ATK buff from the Tenacity of the Millelith artifact set. You will need 180% - 220% Energy Recharge to keep her Elemental Burst up as most of her best teams don't have a Hydro battery.

Kokomi's Teams

Freeze 1 Team

Kokomi

Support

Ayaka

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Kokomi is one of the best Hydro characters for Freeze teams thanks to her Elemental Skill's wide range of Hydro application. With the Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers catalyst, Kokomi also acts as an ATK buffer for the Cryo DPS.

Freeze 2 Team

Kokomi

Support

Ganyu

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Venti

Support

Kokomi is one of the best Hydro characters for Freeze teams thanks to her Elemental Skill's wide range of Hydro application. With the Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers catalyst, Kokomi also acts as an ATK buffer for the Cryo DPS.

Bloom 1 Team

Kokomi

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

Kokomi can be used as an on-field or off-field unit in any type of Bloom team. She provides tremendous utility by being able to both heal and apply Hydro on the enemies.

Bloom 2 Team

Kokomi

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Kokomi can be used as an on-field or off-field unit in any type of Bloom team. She provides tremendous utility by being able to both heal and apply Hydro on the enemies.

Kokomi

Sub-DPS

Kaveh

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

Kokomi can be used as an on-field or off-field unit in any type of Bloom team. She provides tremendous utility by being able to both heal and apply Hydro on the enemies.

Taser Team

Kokomi

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

This team specializes in taking out multiple enemies with the Electo-charged reaction. Kokomi acts as both the healer and provides a lot of Hydro application for the team through her Normal Attacks.

Kokomi's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Has one of the strongest healing abilities in the game to the point that she often overheals.
  • Elemental Skill covers a wide area and can apply Hydro easily, which can make her the sole Hydro unit in some teams.
  • Elemental Skill duration can be refreshed with her Elemental Burst.

Weaknesses

  • Her emergency party healing requires her to be using Normal Attacks on-field with her Elemental Burst, which may present rotation issues if she's built as an off-field support.
  • Cannot (normally) CRIT. If built as a Main DPS, the bulk of her damage will only come from her driving reactions like Bloom or Electro-Charged.

Layla's Weapons

Shield-Bot

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Freedom-Sworn

    Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

This Layla support build takes advantage of the benefits that the Tenacity of the Millelith Artifact set can give to the party. Her Elemental Skill can enable the passive effect of the Artifact to have near-permanent up-time!

We highly suggest going with this support build since providing shields and buffs to your team outweighs maximizing her damage output. This build is even better if you unlock Layla's 4th Constellation.

You can opt to trade some HP% Main stats for a Cryo Goblet or a CRIT Circlet if you want more damage. If you're looking for a free-to-play weapon to further support this build, the Fleuve Cendre Ferryman will work wonders for you!

Cryo and Freeze Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Mistsplitter Reforged

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Key of Khaj-Nisut

    HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Layla build will help her deal the highest amount of damage she can provide if a Cryo Aura can be applied to the enemies. If that's not an option, then we recommend using the Emblem of Severed Fate instead.

An HP% Sands Main Stat is also helpful in strengthening her shields.

The Primordial Jade Cutter or Mistplitter Reforged are your best bets when it comes to increasing Layla's DMG output to the fullest, but the Fleuve Cendre Ferryman is an amazing free-to-play weapon should you require an immediate replacement.

All Purpose Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Mistsplitter Reforged

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Harbinger of Dawn (R5)

    When HP is above 90%, increases CRIT Rate by 14%.

    Key of Khaj-Nisut

    HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

This is Layla's all-purpose Sub-DPS build that you can use in any team if you simply want her to deal damage. Ensuring that she has ample balance in her stats as giving her weapons that synergize well with her Talents will make all the difference!

This build provides great versatility to Layla in accordance with her capabilities, ranging from her shields to dealing DMG off-field and setting up Cryo-related Elemental Reactions.

Layla's Artifacts

Shield-Bot

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%/Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: HP%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±130% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Layla support build takes advantage of the benefits that the Tenacity of the Millelith Artifact set can give to the party. Her Elemental Skill can enable the passive effect of the Artifact to have near-permanent up-time!

We highly suggest going with this support build since providing shields and buffs to your team outweighs maximizing her damage output. This build is even better if you unlock Layla's 4th Constellation.

You can opt to trade some HP% Main stats for a Cryo Goblet or a CRIT Circlet if you want more damage. If you're looking for a free-to-play weapon to further support this build, the Fleuve Cendre Ferryman will work wonders for you!

Cryo and Freeze Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±130% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Layla build will help her deal the highest amount of damage she can provide if a Cryo Aura can be applied to the enemies. If that's not an option, then we recommend using the Emblem of Severed Fate instead.

An HP% Sands Main Stat is also helpful in strengthening her shields.

The Primordial Jade Cutter or Mistplitter Reforged are your best bets when it comes to increasing Layla's DMG output to the fullest, but the Fleuve Cendre Ferryman is an amazing free-to-play weapon should you require an immediate replacement.

All Purpose Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±130% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This is Layla's all-purpose Sub-DPS build that you can use in any team if you simply want her to deal damage. Ensuring that she has ample balance in her stats as giving her weapons that synergize well with her Talents will make all the difference!

This build provides great versatility to Layla in accordance with her capabilities, ranging from her shields to dealing DMG off-field and setting up Cryo-related Elemental Reactions.
