Layla's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Low Elemental Burst Cost.
  • Very strong shields.
  • Able to have her Elemental Skill and Burst almost always activated.
  • High HP.

Weaknesses

  • Slightly below average damage.
  • Breaking the shield ends her Elemental Skill.

Lisa's Weapons

Electro Burst Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Kagura's Verity

Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Hakushin Ring

    After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 10% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

Comment

This Lisa Sub-DPS build focuses on dealing DMG from her Elemental Burst and is suited for almost any team comp. You will need around 160% Energy Recharge to reliably user her burst off cooldown.

Electro Reaction Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Kagura's Verity

Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Fruit of Fulfillment

    Obtain the "Wax and Wane" effect after an Elemental Reaction is triggered, gaining 24 Elemental Mastery while losing 5% ATK. For every 0.3s, 1 stack of Wax and Wane can be gained. Max 5 stacks. For every 6s that go by without an Elemental Reaction being triggered, 1 stack will be lost. This effect can be triggered even when the character is off-field.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

Comment

This build for Lisa is specialized for Overloaded and Dendro-Electro Reactions. At the minimum, you will need at least 2 or more non-Electro characters. You will also need around 160% Energy Recharge, which can be reduced depending on your team.

For a Sub-DPS Aggravate Lisa, you should use ATK%/Electro DMG/CRIT for Mainstats. This is because Aggravate damage has better scaling with those stats.

For Sub-DPS Hyperbloom and Overloaded Lisa, you should use EM/EM/EM Mainstats and use Elemental Mastery Weapons or the Fruit of Fulfillment. This is because Hyperbloom and Overloaded damage only scales based on your Level and Elemental Mastery.

Burst Support

Best Weapon

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    Hakushin Ring

    After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 10% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

Comment

This Support build for Lisa is all about providing as many buffs to her team as possible. You will also want to ensure that you have enough Energy Recharge to use her Elemental Burst off-cooldown!

Lisa's Artifacts

Electro Burst Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Lisa Sub-DPS build focuses on dealing DMG from her Elemental Burst and is suited for almost any team comp. You will need around 160% Energy Recharge to reliably user her burst off cooldown.

Electro Reaction Sub DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus/Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG/Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This build for Lisa is specialized for Overloaded and Dendro-Electro Reactions. At the minimum, you will need at least 2 or more non-Electro characters. You will also need around 160% Energy Recharge, which can be reduced depending on your team.

For a Sub-DPS Aggravate Lisa, you should use ATK%/Electro DMG/CRIT for Mainstats. This is because Aggravate damage has better scaling with those stats.

For Sub-DPS Hyperbloom and Overloaded Lisa, you should use EM/EM/EM Mainstats and use Elemental Mastery Weapons or the Fruit of Fulfillment. This is because Hyperbloom and Overloaded damage only scales based on your Level and Elemental Mastery.

Burst Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%.

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: ATK%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Support build for Lisa is all about providing as many buffs to her team as possible. You will also want to ensure that you have enough Energy Recharge to use her Elemental Burst off-cooldown!

Lisa's Teams

Lisa Sub-DPS 1 Team

Lisa

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Lisa utilizes her Elemental Burst to reduce DEF% and deal as much damage as she can before Raiden takes the reins. Bennett and Kazuha also give buffs to Lisa and Raiden to maximize damage! Lisa also complements Raiden's Elemental Burst downtime with her Elemental Skill, and having Electro Resonance takes care of her required Energy Recharge!

Lisa Sub-DPS 2 Team

Lisa

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

Lisa utilizes her Elemental Burst to reduce DEF% and deal as much damage as she can before Raiden takes the reins. Bennett and Kazuha also give buffs to Lisa and Raiden to maximize damage! Lisa also complements Raiden's Elemental Burst downtime with her Elemental Skill, and having Electro Resonance takes care of her required Energy Recharge!

Superconduct Team

Lisa

Sub-DPS

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Diona

Support

Lisa in a Superconduct team comp can work to debuff Physical resistance of enemies. In this team comp, Lisa utilizes her 15% DEF shred! You can also slot in Fischl instead of Raiden in this team comp, but the recommended ER will stay the same!

Lisa's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Large AoE on Elemental Skill and Burst.
  • Can drive multiple Elemental Reactions and effects with Normal Attacks.
  • Good F2P option for dendro-focused teams.
  • Elemental Burst decreases the DEF resistance of enemies, which is a rarity.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst energy cost. Investing in Energy Recharge sacrifices her potential for greater damage.
  • Holding down the Elemental Skill makes Lisa vulnerable to attacks.
  • Hard to get constellations.

Lynette's Weapons

Swirl Debuffer

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Xiphos' Moonlight

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

    Toukabou Shigure

    After an attack hits opponents, it will inflict an instance of Cursed Parasol upon one of them for 10s. This effect can be triggered once every 15s. If this opponent is taken out during Cursed Parasol’s duration, Cursed Parasol’s CD will be refreshed immediately. The character wielding this weapon will deal 16% more DMG to the opponent affected by Cursed Parasol.

Comment

The Viridescent Venerer debuffer build is best for Lynette to increase team damage for Pyro, Cryo, Electro, or Hydro parties. If you have a DPS manning the front lines and want to increase their DMG, this build is for you.

Pumping Lynette full of Elemental Mastery is key for this build. Not only will it maximize her Swirl DMG, but also provide Elemental buffs to your other party members using this set!

Burst Damage

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Freedom-Sworn

    Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

Lynette's strongest asset is her Elemental Burst, which is able to deal a summative amount of DMG even when she's off the field. You may use Viridescent Venerer if you wish to promote team damage more than her personal damage.

Should you wish to have Lynette deal high DMG without relying on elemental absorption, it would be best to focus on ATK and CRIT stats and weapons and aim for Elemental Mastery only as a substat.

Lynette's Artifacts

Swirl Debuffer

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery/Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

The Viridescent Venerer debuffer build is best for Lynette to increase team damage for Pyro, Cryo, Electro, or Hydro parties. If you have a DPS manning the front lines and want to increase their DMG, this build is for you.

Pumping Lynette full of Elemental Mastery is key for this build. Not only will it maximize her Swirl DMG, but also provide Elemental buffs to your other party members using this set!

Burst Damage

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Secondary Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus/Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • HP%

Comment

Lynette's strongest asset is her Elemental Burst, which is able to deal a summative amount of DMG even when she's off the field. You may use Viridescent Venerer if you wish to promote team damage more than her personal damage.

Should you wish to have Lynette deal high DMG without relying on elemental absorption, it would be best to focus on ATK and CRIT stats and weapons and aim for Elemental Mastery only as a substat.

Lynette's Teams

Rainbow-Swirl Team

Lynette

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

This Rainbow-Swirl team maximizes Lynette's first ascension passive, and her Elemental Burst to take your elemental damage to the next level! And being an Anemo character, she can easily Swirl these elements to ensure consistent damage in a massive AoE. Lynette acts as the main DPS of the team, while Xiangling and Ganyu serve as the Sub-DPS who can apply their corresponding elements easily. Kokomi provides top-tier sustain thru her heals, as well as excellent Hydro application for the team!

Perma-Freeze Team

Lynette

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

This Perma-Freeze team utilizes Lynette's excellent off-field potential, which converts her into an Anemo-driver who constantly Swirls Hydro or Cryo, to set an excellent field for Freeze. Since Ayato and Ganyu already make for an awesome Freeze duo, Lynette helps them increase the uptime of either of their skills thru Swirl to maximize their damage. Kokomi, on the other hand, provides sustain, and an additional off-field Hydro applicator!

Vape Team

Lynette

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Although this Vape-team hinges on Lynette's excellent potential in elemental reaction teams, Hu Tao acts as the main-DPS who consistently triggers Vaporize with Yelan. Zhongli ensures Hu Tao stays alive throughout the rotation, while Lynette buffs elemental DMG! Just like the Rainbow-Swirl team, this team-comp also maximizes Lynette's first ascension passive and burst, but keep in mind that this team's caveat is that it works better against single-enemies than with mobs!

Lynette's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • DMG scaling is decent.
  • Very agile and can move around the field quickly.
  • Provides DMG support through Swirl reactions.
  • Able to provide DMG support through Burst even when off-field
  • Useful for underwater exploration.

Weaknesses

  • Consumes HP after every usage of Elemental Skill.
  • High skill CD and Energy cost may be detrimental to performance.

Lyney's Weapons

Mono Pyro DPS

Best Weapon

The First Great Magic

DMG dealt by Charged Attacks increased by 16%. For every party member with the same Elemental Type as the wielder (including the wielder themselves), gain 1 Gimmick stack. For every party member with a different Elemental Type from the wielder, gain 1 Theatrics stack. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Gimmick stacks, ATK will be increased by 16%/32%/48%. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Theatrics stacks, Movement SPD will be increased by 4%/7%/10%.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Thundering Pulse

    Increases ATK by 20% and grants Thunder Emblem. At stacks 1/2/3, Normal Attack DMG is further increased by 12/24/40%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s)

    • Casting an Elemental Skill (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Scion of the Blazing Sun

    After a Charged Attack hits an opponent, a Sunfire Arrow will descend upon the opponent hit, dealing 60% ATK as DMG, and applying the Heartsearer effect to the opponent damaged by said Arrow for 10s. Opponents affected by Heartsearer take 28% more Charged Attack DMG from the wielder. A Sunfire Arrow can be triggered once every 10s.

    Song of Stillness

    After the wielder is healed, they will deal 16% more DMG for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

Taking advantage of Lyney's Pyro capabilities, this is the best build for him as a Pyro DPS. CRIT Rate should be a Low Priority stat as Lyney has a lot of CRIT Rate from ascension and the Marechaussee Hunter set.

While Lyney's healing scales on his HP, it's not a necessary stat to get as he can get healing from other party members.

Alternative Pyro DPS

Best Weapon

The First Great Magic

DMG dealt by Charged Attacks increased by 16%. For every party member with the same Elemental Type as the wielder (including the wielder themselves), gain 1 Gimmick stack. For every party member with a different Elemental Type from the wielder, gain 1 Theatrics stack. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Gimmick stacks, ATK will be increased by 16%/32%/48%. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Theatrics stacks, Movement SPD will be increased by 4%/7%/10%.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Scion of the Blazing Sun

    After a Charged Attack hits an opponent, a Sunfire Arrow will descend upon the opponent hit, dealing 60% ATK as DMG, and applying the Heartsearer effect to the opponent damaged by said Arrow for 10s. Opponents affected by Heartsearer take 28% more Charged Attack DMG from the wielder. A Sunfire Arrow can be triggered once every 10s.

    Song of Stillness

    After the wielder is healed, they will deal 16% more DMG for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

This alternative build allows Lyney to deal more DMG after consuming his own HP. You will have to use his Elemental Burst first before attacking to make the most out of the ATK buff from the Vermillion Hereafter set.

Lyney's Artifacts

Mono Pyro DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±130% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Taking advantage of Lyney's Pyro capabilities, this is the best build for him as a Pyro DPS. CRIT Rate should be a Low Priority stat as Lyney has a lot of CRIT Rate from ascension and the Marechaussee Hunter set.

While Lyney's healing scales on his HP, it's not a necessary stat to get as he can get healing from other party members.

Alternative Pyro DPS

Best Artifact Set

Vermillion Hereafter

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: After using an Elemental Burst, this character will gain the Nascent Light effect, increasing their ATK by 8% for 16s. When the character's HP decreases, their ATK will further increase by 10%. This further increase can occur this way a maximum of 4 times. This effect can be triggered once every 0.8s. Nascent Light will be dispelled when the character leaves the field. If an Elemental Burst is used again during the duration of Nascent Light, the original Nascent Light will be dispelled.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±130% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This alternative build allows Lyney to deal more DMG after consuming his own HP. You will have to use his Elemental Burst first before attacking to make the most out of the ATK buff from the Vermillion Hereafter set.

Lyney's Teams

Mono-Pyro 1 Team

Lyney

Main DPS

Dehya

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Kazuha

Support

One of Lyney's passive Talents is a dramatic DMG boost based on the number of Pyro characters present in the party. This build not only provides even more DMG as well as healing through Bennett's Elemental Burst, but also additional support from Kazuha and resistance to interruption from Dehya to keep Charged Attacks from being disrupted.

Mono-Pyro 2 Team

Lyney

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Zhongli

Support

One of Lyney's passive Talents is a dramatic DMG boost based on the number of Pyro characters present in the party. This build not only provides even more DMG as well as healing through Bennett's Elemental Burst, but also additional support from Kazuha and resistance to interruption from Dehya to keep Charged Attacks from being disrupted.

Mono-Pyro 3 Team

Lyney

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Venti

Support

One of Lyney's passive Talents is a dramatic DMG boost based on the number of Pyro characters present in the party. This build not only provides even more DMG as well as healing through Bennett's Elemental Burst, but also additional support from Kazuha and resistance to interruption from Dehya to keep Charged Attacks from being disrupted.

Burn 1 Team

Lyney

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Lyney can function as a Pyro Enabler in burn teams, contributing his own personal damage and allowing Dendro Sub-DPS units like Emilie and Nahida to support the team with the Burning reaction and their own damage.

Burn 2 Team

Lyney

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Lyney can function as a Pyro Enabler in burn teams, contributing his own personal damage and allowing Dendro Sub-DPS units like Emilie and Nahida to support the team with the Burning reaction and their own damage.

Melt Team

Lyney

Main DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Layla

Support

When creating Melt teams for Lyney, pairing him with units that provide constant Cryo application such as Ganyu and Layla will be in your best interest. However, you will most likely have to Swirl Cryo instead to ensure constant Cryo application. Do take note that Lyney's DMG output decreases due to having fewer Pyro characters in the party.

Lyney's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • DMG scaling is among one of the highest for Charged Attack and Pyro users, and only scales higher the more Pyro characters there are on the team.
  • Grin-Malkin Hat can easily be refreshed via Charged Attacks or Elemental Burst, allowing for at least 2 sources of DPS at any time.
  • 5-stack Charge Level passive increases Lyney's Elemental Skill Damage, letting Lyney nuke down content with ease provided he has a healer.
  • The Grin-Malkin Hat can grab enemy attention, allowing Lyney to focus down opponents.
  • Useful for gathering local specialties in Fontaine.

Weaknesses

  • Passive Talent locks his best teams down to a variation of Mono Pyro.
  • Consumes HP every Charged Shot, and needs to have a healer to be able to reach 5 stacks on his Charge Level.
  • Being interrupted while aiming results in a DPS loss, requiring the use of a shielder like Zhongli to let Lyney fire shots with no consequences.
  • Charged Attack-centric means that if the player misses the Aimed Shot, it is a DPS loss.

Mika's Weapons

Support Healer

Best Weapon

Favonius Lance

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Dialogues of the Desert Sages

    When the wielder performs healing, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Black Tassel

    Increases DMG against slimes by 40%.

Comment

This Mika build has him use the Noblesse Oblige to further buff his teammates when he uses his Elemental Burst. Focus on providing him the required Energy Recharge that will let him use his Elemental Burst off cooldown based on your team comp.

If you already have a party member using the Noblesse Oblige set or don't need the ATK% buff that it provides, you can instead equip Mika with a Healing Bonus and HP% artifact set for more healing.

Mika's healing is definitely not enough to let you face-tank certain attack combos, so commit to using dashes to avoid big damage when you can.

Mika's Artifacts

Support Healer

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Ocean-Hued Clam & Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

2-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Mika build has him use the Noblesse Oblige to further buff his teammates when he uses his Elemental Burst. Focus on providing him the required Energy Recharge that will let him use his Elemental Burst off cooldown based on your team comp.

If you already have a party member using the Noblesse Oblige set or don't need the ATK% buff that it provides, you can instead equip Mika with a Healing Bonus and HP% artifact set for more healing.

Mika's healing is definitely not enough to let you face-tank certain attack combos, so commit to using dashes to avoid big damage when you can.

Mika's Teams

Hypercarry Eula Team

Mika

Support

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Support

Mika is highly recommended for supporting Eula in her Hypercarry team. Adding Raiden to this team will greatly reduce the energy requirements for this energy-hungry team comp.

Mika-Furina Team

Mika

Support

Wanderer

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Faruzan

Support

With the release of Furina, Mika is now viable as a healer in multiple teams besides Physical Damage teams. Any DPS can work, as long as they can benefit from both Furina and Mika.

Razor-Mika Team

Mika

Support

Razor

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Support

Mika provides some much-needed buffs for improving Razor as a Main DPS. When paired with Fischl and Rosaria, the three of them can more or less cover for each other when it comes to recharging their Elemetal Bursts.

Mika's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Provides Physical DMG Bonus and ATK Speed buffs with just the use of his skill, the latter being rare.
  • Good party-wide burst healing to keep the team alive.
  • Effective even at minimal investment as Elemental Skill's Physical DMG Bonus remains the same.
  • Decent Cryo particle generation for a support character.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst cost.
  • Long Elemental Skill cooldown.
  • Can feel like a sidegrade support versus other premier options that also function as Sub-DPS units.

Mona's Weapons

Hydro and Burst Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Skyward Atlas

Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Oathsworn Eye

    Increases Energy Recharge by 24% for 10s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Mappa Mare

    Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 8% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks.

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for Mona will provide her with the highest Elemental Burst DMG without Elemental Reactions. For Emblem of Severed Fate users, we recommend meeting your Energy Recharge needs (+150%) through substats.

For non-Emblem users, the 2nd build is best used when Mona only requires her base Energy Recharge to use her Burst off-cooldown. Between our two Sub-DPS builds, choose the one you have better substats for!

Burst Support

Best Weapon

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Hakushin Ring

    After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 10% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Support build for Mona sacrifices her DMG for more team-wide utility by stacking as much Energy Recharge (~200-300%) as she can for her to have her Elemental Burst ready off-cooldown.

With enough Energy Recharge, she can also gain enough Hydro DMG Bonus to the point where ATK Goblet would be a better slot.

Mona's Artifacts

Hydro and Burst Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Heart of Depth & Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Hydro DMG Bonus +15%

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for Mona will provide her with the highest Elemental Burst DMG without Elemental Reactions. For Emblem of Severed Fate users, we recommend meeting your Energy Recharge needs (+150%) through substats.

For non-Emblem users, the 2nd build is best used when Mona only requires her base Energy Recharge to use her Burst off-cooldown. Between our two Sub-DPS builds, choose the one you have better substats for!

Burst Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Support build for Mona sacrifices her DMG for more team-wide utility by stacking as much Energy Recharge (~200-300%) as she can for her to have her Elemental Burst ready off-cooldown.

With enough Energy Recharge, she can also gain enough Hydro DMG Bonus to the point where ATK Goblet would be a better slot.

Mona's Teams

Freeze 1 Team

Mona

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Main DPS

Layla

Support

Venti

Support

Freeze remains one of Mona's best options for a team because of how Freeze interacts with her Elemental Burst. Using Freeze can keep enemies in their place, as well as artificially extending her buff duration, hereby increasing the overall DPS of the Freeze team.

Freeze 2 Team

Mona

Sub-DPS

Ayaka

Main DPS

Shenhe

Support

Kazuha

Support

Freeze remains one of Mona's best options for a team because of how Freeze interacts with her Elemental Burst. Using Freeze can keep enemies in their place, as well as artificially extending her buff duration, hereby increasing the overall DPS of the Freeze team.

Vaporize 1 Team

Mona

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xianyun

Support

Mona can either function as the on-field DPS in a Xiangling vaporize team, or as a buffer when paired with another On-Field Pyro DPS like Gaming or Diluc. As an On-Field DPS, it is generally recommended to build her with Elemental Mastery in mind for more vaporize damage.

Vaporize 2 Team

Mona

Support

Gaming

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Xianyun

Support

Mona can either function as the on-field DPS in a Xiangling vaporize team, or as a buffer when paired with another On-Field Pyro DPS like Gaming or Diluc. As an On-Field DPS, it is generally recommended to build her with Elemental Mastery in mind for more vaporize damage.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Mona

Support (Driver)

Beidou

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

This team strives in sustained damage as each member of the team can amplify the Electro-charged reaction ensuring greater ticks of damage against enemies. Mona can easily apply Hydro consistently as long as both of her Electro teammates are able to apply their element.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Mona

Support (Driver)

Beidou

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

This team strives in sustained damage as each member of the team can amplify the Electro-charged reaction ensuring greater ticks of damage against enemies. Mona can easily apply Hydro consistently as long as both of her Electro teammates are able to apply their element.

Hyperbloom Team

Mona

Support (Driver)

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

With Dendro being added to the mix, Mona quickswap teams have seen more success, as each member is capable of doing great on-field and off-field damage. Since Mona's off-field hydro application is not as frequent, she takes the role of an on-field driver, using a mix of her attacks and dashes to generate bloom cores.

Mona's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Burst is still one of the best teamwide buffs in the game, and only scales with talent level.
  • Generally only needs ER to be effective as a support, but can be a good Sub-DPS unit with proper CRIT stats.
  • Offers crowd control through Elemental Skill and Burst.
  • Elemental Burst duration can be artificially extended via crowd control, which allows her to slot into Freeze teams.

Weaknesses

  • Alternate sprint may be off-putting for some players.
  • Requires elemental reactions to maximize damage output.
  • Subpar Hydro application may stunt her damage contribution in teams like Hyperbloom if off-field.

Mualani's Weapons

Hydro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Surf's Up

Max HP increased by 20%. Once every 15s, for the 14s after using an Elemental Skill: Gain 4 Scorching Summer stacks. Each stack increases Normal Attack DMG by 12%. For the duration of the effect, once every 1.5s, lose 1 stack after a Normal Attack hits an opponent; once every 1.5s, gain 1 stack after triggering a Vaporize reaction on an opponent. Max 4 Scorching Summer stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Jade

    When not on the field for more than 5s, Max HP will be increased by 32% and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 40. These effects will be canceled after the wielder has been on the field for 10s.

    Ring of Yaxche

    Using an Elemental Skill grants the Jade-Forged Crown effect: Every 1,000 Max HP will increase the Normal Attack DMG dealt by the equipping character by 0.6% for 10s. Normal Attack DMG can be increased this way by a maximum of 16%.

    Ring of Yaxche

    HP is increased by 16%. When current HP increases or decreases, Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 14% for 4s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character has 3 stacks or a third stack's duration refreshes, 8 Energy will be restored. This Energy restoration effect can be triggered once every 12s.

    A Thousand Floating Dreams

    Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

    Ash-Graven Drinking Horn

    When an attack hits an opponent, deals AoE damage equal to 40% of Max HP at the target location. This effect can be triggered once every 15 seconds.

Comment

The Obsidian Codex artifact set is Mualani's best build, which provides an abundance of CRIT Rate and lets you stack CRIT DMG from substats. Focus on HP% and Elemental Mastery stats as well to ensure that her most important attacks benefit from as many multipliers as possible.

Mualani's Artifacts

Hydro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Obsidian Codex

2-Piece: While the equipping character is in Nightsoul's Blessing and is on the field, their DMG dealt is increased by 15%.

4-Piece: After the equpping character consumes 1 Nightsoul point while on the field, CRIT Rate increases by 40% for 6s. This effect can trigger once every second.

Secondary Artifact Set

Heart of Depth

2-Piece: Hydro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After using Elemental Skill, increases Normal Attack and Charged Attack DMG by 30% for 15s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus/HP%
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

The Obsidian Codex artifact set is Mualani's best build, which provides an abundance of CRIT Rate and lets you stack CRIT DMG from substats. Focus on HP% and Elemental Mastery stats as well to ensure that her most important attacks benefit from as many multipliers as possible.

Mualani's Teams

Vaporize 1 Team

Mualani

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Mualani works best in Vaporize teams due to most of her damage being front-loaded into her Shark's lunging bites. With that in mind, pairing her with characters with good Pyro application like Xiangling with Bennett, and a buffer like Kazuha can help ensure that she can always Vaporize this instance of attack. Note that Bennett only helps Xiangling in this case due to Mualani not needing ATK. If you have enough Energy Recharge on Xiangling, you may use someone else like Dehya.

Vaporize 2 Team

Mualani

Main DPS

Sucrose

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Dehya

Support

Mualani works best in Vaporize teams due to most of her damage being front-loaded into her Shark's lunging bites. With that in mind, pairing her with characters with good Pyro application like Xiangling with Bennett, and a buffer like Kazuha can help ensure that she can always Vaporize this instance of attack. Note that Bennett only helps Xiangling in this case due to Mualani not needing ATK. If you have enough Energy Recharge on Xiangling, you may use someone else like Dehya.

Burning-Vaporize 1 Team

Mualani

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Dehya

Support

A variant of Mualani's Vaporize team utilizing the constant Pyro application of Burning with a Dendro character. Make sure to Burn the enemy first with Emilie and Xiangling before using Mualani as she may accidentally extinquish the Burn effect or make Bloom cores instead.

Burning-Vaporize 2 Team

Mualani

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Zhongli

Support

A variant of Mualani's Vaporize team utilizing the constant Pyro application of Burning with a Dendro character. Make sure to Burn the enemy first with Emilie and Xiangling before using Mualani as she may accidentally extinquish the Burn effect or make Bloom cores instead.

Hypercarry 1 Team

Mualani

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS/Support

Sigewinne

Support

Mualani can also be paired up with a full buffer support team to scale her own damage. As an added bonus, pairing her with someone like Furina can benefit both characters due to Hydro Resonance directly increasing both of their damage.

Hypercarry 2 Team

Mualani

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS/Support

Jean

Support

Mualani can also be paired up with a full buffer support team to scale her own damage. As an added bonus, pairing her with someone like Furina can benefit both characters due to Hydro Resonance directly increasing both of their damage.

Mualani's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Sharky's Bite lets Mualani deal damage and mark opponents while increasing the damage she deals to them with the number of marks.
  • Damage is frontloaded, making her an extremely good choice for an Elemental Reaction like Vaporize.
  • Mualani's damage source comes from her own HP, which can be easily stacked with leveling, artifacts, weapons, and even Hydro Resonance.
  • Elemental Skill allows Mualani to ride through water, providing a quick way to travel around watery areas.

Weaknesses

  • Her Sharky's Bite during Elemental Skill can miss when the enemy suddenly moves. Proper timing is required especially with the build-up she requires.

Nahida's Weapons

Sub-DPS and Support

Best Weapon

A Thousand Floating Dreams

Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Fragments

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Magic Guide

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 12%.

    Wandering Evenstar

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Mappa Mare

    Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 8% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks.

    The Widsith (RNG)

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

Comment

Nahida's best build as a Sub-DPS and Support role will have her use the Deepwood Memories with Elemental Mastery Stats. Your goal should be to get around 800 to 1000 Elemental Mastery on Nahida.

Generally, EM Mainstats are her best choice, but since Nahida's passive lets any character share Elemental Mastery with the character on-field, you can also opt to use a Dendro Goblet or a Crit Circlet to increase her damage.

It is better to invest in CRIT stats rather than going past 1000 EM since it provides more value if you have gone past that point.

Main DPS

Best Weapon

A Thousand Floating Dreams

Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

Alternative Weapons

    Kagura's Verity

    Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    Solar Pearl

    Normal Attack hits increase Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 20% for 6s. Likewise, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 6s.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Mappa Mare

    Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 8% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks.

Comment

This Nahida build lets her act as an on-field unit to enable Dendro reactions like Quicken (Spread and Aggravate), Bloom variations (Standard Bloom, Hyperbloom, Burgeon), and Burning.

You won't have to focus as much on EM substats for this build since a teammate with a very high EM stat can share their Elemental Mastery with Nahida.

Nahida's Artifacts

Sub-DPS and Support

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery/Dendro Damage Bonus
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±110% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Nahida's best build as a Sub-DPS and Support role will have her use the Deepwood Memories with Elemental Mastery Stats. Your goal should be to get around 800 to 1000 Elemental Mastery on Nahida.

Generally, EM Mainstats are her best choice, but since Nahida's passive lets any character share Elemental Mastery with the character on-field, you can also opt to use a Dendro Goblet or a Crit Circlet to increase her damage.

It is better to invest in CRIT stats rather than going past 1000 EM since it provides more value if you have gone past that point.

Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±110% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Nahida build lets her act as an on-field unit to enable Dendro reactions like Quicken (Spread and Aggravate), Bloom variations (Standard Bloom, Hyperbloom, Burgeon), and Burning.

You won't have to focus as much on EM substats for this build since a teammate with a very high EM stat can share their Elemental Mastery with Nahida.

Nahida's Teams

Off-Field Hyperbloom 1 Team

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS/Support

Nahida is staple in many Bloom teams, and often can act as the solo Dendro applicator for teams that require high frequency of Dendro. Alhaitham, Yelan, Xingqiu, and Shinobu are some of the best characters for the reaction.

Off-Field Hyperbloom 2 Team

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Cyno

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Nahida is staple in many Bloom teams, and often can act as the solo Dendro applicator for teams that require high frequency of Dendro. Alhaitham, Yelan, Xingqiu, and Shinobu are some of the best characters for the reaction.

Off-Field Hyperbloom 3 Team

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Sub-DPS/Support

Nahida is staple in many Bloom teams, and often can act as the solo Dendro applicator for teams that require high frequency of Dendro. Alhaitham, Yelan, Xingqiu, and Shinobu are some of the best characters for the reaction.

Off-Field Aggravate/Quicken 1 Team

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Nahida's excellent off-field Dendro DPS is perfect for her role as a Sub-DPS in Quicken Teams. Enabling the Quicken Aura on enemies will let Electro characters deal more damage through Aggravate reactions!

Main DPS

Nahida's excellent off-field Dendro DPS is perfect for her role as a Sub-DPS in Quicken Teams. Enabling the Quicken Aura on enemies will let Electro characters deal more damage through Aggravate reactions!

Nahida's excellent off-field Dendro DPS is perfect for her role as a Sub-DPS in Quicken Teams. Enabling the Quicken Aura on enemies will let Electro characters deal more damage through Aggravate reactions!

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Nahida's off-field Dendro damage is great for creating Dendro Cores. You will need sufficient on or off-field Hydro damage to apply or maintain the Hydro Aura on enemies to prevent a Pyro Aura from applying.

Nahida Nilou 1 Team

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Collei

Support

Nahida is also excellent for creating Bountiful Cores in a Nilou team due to her constant Dendro damage. Given how fast Nahida can make Bountiful Cores, there's a danger that she might kill herself, so bring a healer.

Nahida Nilou 2 Team

Nahida

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS
