Nahida is also excellent for creating Bountiful Cores in a Nilou team due to her constant Dendro damage. Given how fast Nahida can make Bountiful Cores, there's a danger that she might kill herself, so bring a healer.

On-Field Hyperbloom 1 Team

Nahida

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Nahida is for creating Dendro Cores. With Dendro Cores on the field, you will simply need an Electro character who can periodically deal Electro damage to trigger the Hyperbloom reaction. The Electro character will need to stack Elemental Mastery stats.

On-Field Hyperbloom 2 Team

Nahida

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

Nahida is for creating Dendro Cores. With Dendro Cores on the field, you will simply need an Electro character who can periodically deal Electro damage to trigger the Hyperbloom reaction. The Electro character will need to stack Elemental Mastery stats.

On-Field Quicken 1 Team

Nahida

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Nahida can act as an on-field unit for Dendro-Electro teams to enable Spread and Aggravate reactions. Since Spread and Aggravate scales better with raw damage, you will get better value with CRIT substats on your Main and Sub-DPS characters than EM substats.

On-Field Quicken 2 Team

Nahida

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Jean

Support

Nahida can act as an on-field unit for Dendro-Electro teams to enable Spread and Aggravate reactions. Since Spread and Aggravate scales better with raw damage, you will get better value with CRIT substats on your Main and Sub-DPS characters than EM substats.

On-Field Burgeon Team

Nahida

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Playing to her advantage as a great enabler for Dendro Cores, Nahida can also be an on-field unit for Burgeon teams. Burgeon teams simply need to create Dendro Cores through Hydro and Dendro interactions and then deal AoE Pyro damage to the Dendro Cores on the field. In this team comp, Thoma will need to use EM/EM/EM Mainstats since he is the trigger for the Burgeon explosion.

Nahida's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Best applicator for Dendro with great off-field damage as a Sub-DPS, especially with C2.
  • Converts Elemental Mastery as additional CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG, making her extremely versatile by acting as a great damage dealer and a support at the same time.
  • Elemental Skill lasts for a long duration while also having a low cooldown. The mark can be applied to an enemy indefinitely after every team rotations.
  • Provides a huge Elemental Mastery Bonus to the active character inside her Elemental Burst, which also increases the effectiveness of the team's Dendro Reactions.
  • Elemental Skill allows you to collect materials in the overworld easily, especially for items that hang on walls.

Weaknesses

  • Dealing with waves of enemies requires her to reapply her Elemental Skill mark, which is disadvantagous for characters who require long on-field time.
  • Low base HP, which makes her vulnerable to high hits especially on Bloom teams.

Navia's Weapons

Nighttime Whispers DPS

Best Weapon

Verdict

Increases ATK by 20%. When characters in your party obtain Elemental Shards from Crystallize reactions, the equipping character will gain 1 Seal, increasing Elemental Skill DMG by 18%. The Seal lasts for 15s, and the equipper may have up to 2 Seals at once. All of the equipper's Seals will disappear 0.2s after their Elemental Skill deals DMG.

Alternative Weapons

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    The Unforged

    Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, ATK increase effect is increased by 100%.

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Ultimate Overlord's Mega Magic Sword

    ATK increased by 12%. That's not all! The support from all Melusines you've helped in Merusea Village fills you with strength! Based on the number of them you've helped, your ATK is increased by up to an additional 12%.

Comment

As a DPS focused on the Crystallize mechanic, Nighttime Whispers is Navia's best build as it is tailor-made to increase her overall damage with her Elemental Skill and synergy with the reaction.

You can use a mix of Archaic Petra, Golden Troupe, or any ATK sets like Gladiator's Finale while farming for the new set.

As always, the new 5-star claymore weapon, Verdict, is Navia's best-in-slot weapon to further increase her synergy with Crystallize.

Marechausee Hunter DPS with Furina

Best Weapon

Verdict

Increases ATK by 20%. When characters in your party obtain Elemental Shards from Crystallize reactions, the equipping character will gain 1 Seal, increasing Elemental Skill DMG by 18%. The Seal lasts for 15s, and the equipper may have up to 2 Seals at once. All of the equipper's Seals will disappear 0.2s after their Elemental Skill deals DMG.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Tidal Shadow

    After the wielder is healed, ATK will be increased by 24% for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

    Ultimate Overlord's Mega Magic Sword

    ATK increased by 12%. That's not all! The support from all Melusines you've helped in Merusea Village fills you with strength! Based on the number of them you've helped, your ATK is increased by up to an additional 12%.

Comment

If you have Furina, Marechaussee Hunter is a great specialzied build for Navia as a Main DPS to increase her Normal Attacks as well as ease her CRIT Rate requirements. This also allows her to equip weapons that are best used with HP fluctuations.

Quick-swap Geo Burst DPS

Best Weapon

Verdict

Increases ATK by 20%. When characters in your party obtain Elemental Shards from Crystallize reactions, the equipping character will gain 1 Seal, increasing Elemental Skill DMG by 18%. The Seal lasts for 15s, and the equipper may have up to 2 Seals at once. All of the equipper's Seals will disappear 0.2s after their Elemental Skill deals DMG.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Ultimate Overlord's Mega Magic Sword

    ATK increased by 12%. That's not all! The support from all Melusines you've helped in Merusea Village fills you with strength! Based on the number of them you've helped, your ATK is increased by up to an additional 12%.

    Akuoumaru

    For every point of the entire party's combined maximum Energy capacity, the Elemental Burst DMG of the character equipping this weapon is increased by 0.12%. A maximum of 40% increased Elemental Burst DMG can be achieved this way.

    Tidal Shadow

    After the wielder is healed, ATK will be increased by 24% for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

Adopting a quick-swap burst playstyle, Navia can build a mix of the new set, or Golden Troupe, Archaic Petra, or even Noblesse Oblige. We recommend having another Geo DPS and any elemental applicator to supply her with the Crystallize shards.

Navia's Artifacts

Nighttime Whispers DPS

Best Artifact Set

Nighttime Whispers in the Echoing Woods

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: After using an Elemental Skill, gain a 20% Geo DMG Bonus for 10s. While under a shield granted by the Crystallize reaction, the above effect will be increased by 150%, and this additional increase disappears 1s after that shield is lost.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Gladiator's Finale & Archaic Petra

2-Piece: ATK +18%

2-Piece: Gain a 15% Geo DMG Bonus

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

As a DPS focused on the Crystallize mechanic, Nighttime Whispers is Navia's best build as it is tailor-made to increase her overall damage with her Elemental Skill and synergy with the reaction.

You can use a mix of Archaic Petra, Golden Troupe, or any ATK sets like Gladiator's Finale while farming for the new set.

As always, the new 5-star claymore weapon, Verdict, is Navia's best-in-slot weapon to further increase her synergy with Crystallize.

Marechausee Hunter DPS with Furina

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

If you have Furina, Marechaussee Hunter is a great specialzied build for Navia as a Main DPS to increase her Normal Attacks as well as ease her CRIT Rate requirements. This also allows her to equip weapons that are best used with HP fluctuations.

Quick-swap Geo Burst DPS

Best Artifact Set

Nighttime Whispers in the Echoing Woods

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: After using an Elemental Skill, gain a 20% Geo DMG Bonus for 10s. While under a shield granted by the Crystallize reaction, the above effect will be increased by 150%, and this additional increase disappears 1s after that shield is lost.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Golden Troupe & Archaic Petra

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

2-Piece: Gain a 15% Geo DMG Bonus

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Adopting a quick-swap burst playstyle, Navia can build a mix of the new set, or Golden Troupe, Archaic Petra, or even Noblesse Oblige. We recommend having another Geo DPS and any elemental applicator to supply her with the Crystallize shards.

Navia's Teams

Hypercarry 1 Team

Navia

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

These Navia team combinations centers on dealing damage through various elements being applied on enemies for Navia to Crystallize. Navia in these teams will be played mostly on-field and after setting up her teammate's Elemental Skills or Bursts. Characters like Xiangling and Yelan work well in this as they are capable in dealing Off-Field damage as Navia takes the field.

Hypercarry 2 Team

Navia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

These Navia team combinations centers on dealing damage through various elements being applied on enemies for Navia to Crystallize. Navia in these teams will be played mostly on-field and after setting up her teammate's Elemental Skills or Bursts. Characters like Xiangling and Yelan work well in this as they are capable in dealing Off-Field damage as Navia takes the field.

Hypercarry 3 Team

Navia

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Albedo

Support

These Navia team combinations centers on dealing damage through various elements being applied on enemies for Navia to Crystallize. Navia in these teams will be played mostly on-field and after setting up her teammate's Elemental Skills or Bursts. Characters like Xiangling and Yelan work well in this as they are capable in dealing Off-Field damage as Navia takes the field.

Furina 1 Team

Navia

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Charlotte

Support

As Navia can be suitable user of the Marechaussee Hunter set, she can synergize well with Furina and utilize her off-field application. You may choose to have a teamwide healer like Charlotte to amplify Furina's damage bonus, but usual buffers like Bennett should still work.

Furina 2 Team

Navia

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

As Navia can be suitable user of the Marechaussee Hunter set, she can synergize well with Furina and utilize her off-field application. You may choose to have a teamwide healer like Charlotte to amplify Furina's damage bonus, but usual buffers like Bennett should still work.

Sub-DPS 1 Team

Navia

Sub-DPS

Noelle

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

With her quickswap abilities, Navia can also play a Sub-DPS role in teams with other notable DPS. You can also add Furina in her team with Noelle as the Main DPS for a well-rounded team comp that can heal, damage, provide resonance, and buff Navia's damage! She can also equip the Archaic Petra set and buff her teammates Off-Field, only swapping to her to apply Geo from different elements.

Sub-DPS 1 Team

Navia

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

With her quickswap abilities, Navia can also play a Sub-DPS role in teams with other notable DPS. You can also add Furina in her team with Noelle as the Main DPS for a well-rounded team comp that can heal, damage, provide resonance, and buff Navia's damage! She can also equip the Archaic Petra set and buff her teammates Off-Field, only swapping to her to apply Geo from different elements.

Navia's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Excellent damage from her Elemental Skill, and this can be used twice per rotation with decent AoE, which is best used against bosses.
  • Comfortable playstyle, as her teams will almost always have a Crystallize shield up.
  • Her teams have easy access to free-to-play characters with minimal investment to supply her with Crystallize shards.
  • Access to elements other than Geo provides her with more flexibility in team building, and therefore not hindered by mono-Geo limitations.

Weaknesses

    Navia requires significant investment in her CRIT stats, failing to land a critical hit from her Elemental Skill can be a significant DPS loss.
  • Frontloaded damage means that teams where she is the main damage dealer will not have the same level of sustained DPS over time for longer fights, which evens out the exceptional burst damage from her Elemental Skill.

Neuvillette's Weapons

Marechausee Hunter Hydro DPS

Best Weapon

Tome of the Eternal Flow

HP is increased by 16%. When current HP increases or decreases, Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 14% for 4s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character has 3 stacks or a third stack's duration refreshes, 8 Energy will be restored. This Energy restoration effect can be triggered once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Jade

    When not on the field for more than 5s, Max HP will be increased by 32% and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 40. These effects will be canceled after the wielder has been on the field for 10s.

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Ballad of the Boundless Blue

    Within 6s after Normal or Charged Attacks hit an opponent, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 8% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 6%. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s.

Comment

By easing up his CRIT Rate requirements, Marechaussee Hunter is the best build for Neuvillette as it can dramatically increase his DMG output. His HP mechanic can easily activate the artifact's effects, allowing him to build more CRIT damage.

The higher Neuvillette's current HP is at the time of casting his Charged ATK, the more DMG it will inflict on enemies. Hence, try to focus more on increasing his HP when building him.

Wanderer's Troupe DPS

Best Weapon

Tome of the Eternal Flow

HP is increased by 16%. When current HP increases or decreases, Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 14% for 4s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character has 3 stacks or a third stack's duration refreshes, 8 Energy will be restored. This Energy restoration effect can be triggered once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Jade

    When not on the field for more than 5s, Max HP will be increased by 32% and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 40. These effects will be canceled after the wielder has been on the field for 10s.

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    Prototype Amber

    Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

    Ballad of the Boundless Blue

    Within 6s after Normal or Charged Attacks hit an opponent, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 8% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 6%. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s.

Comment

If you wish to pay less attention to Neuvillette's HP mechanic and purely focus on his DMG output and playing around Elemental Reactions, a full Wanderer's Troupe set that is also filled with HP might be right up your alley.

The Wanderer's Troupe set's Charged Attack increase is unconditional and will always be present no matter the situation. Additionally, more Elemental Mastery couldn't hurt, especially if you'll be matching Neuvillette's attacks up with Elemental Reactions!

Neuvillette's Artifacts

Marechausee Hunter Hydro DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus/HP%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

By easing up his CRIT Rate requirements, Marechaussee Hunter is the best build for Neuvillette as it can dramatically increase his DMG output. His HP mechanic can easily activate the artifact's effects, allowing him to build more CRIT damage.

The higher Neuvillette's current HP is at the time of casting his Charged ATK, the more DMG it will inflict on enemies. Hence, try to focus more on increasing his HP when building him.

Wanderer's Troupe DPS

Best Artifact Set

Wanderer's Troupe

2-Piece: Increases Elemental Mastery by 80.

4-Piece: Increases Charged Attack DMG by 35% if the character uses a Catalyst or a Bow.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus/HP%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

If you wish to pay less attention to Neuvillette's HP mechanic and purely focus on his DMG output and playing around Elemental Reactions, a full Wanderer's Troupe set that is also filled with HP might be right up your alley.

The Wanderer's Troupe set's Charged Attack increase is unconditional and will always be present no matter the situation. Additionally, more Elemental Mastery couldn't hurt, especially if you'll be matching Neuvillette's attacks up with Elemental Reactions!

Neuvillette's Teams

Hypercarry 1 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

These teams specialize around buffing and enabling Neuvillette's passive as a hypercarry unit. We recommend going for Neuvillette's C1 if you have Furina in your team, but it is otherwise not necessary, as her buffs are enough to compensate its base power. Other Furina-less teams can be centered around Electro-Charged, as Neuvillette revolves around multiple supports to maximize his DMG output.

Hypercarry 2 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

These teams specialize around buffing and enabling Neuvillette's passive as a hypercarry unit. We recommend going for Neuvillette's C1 if you have Furina in your team, but it is otherwise not necessary, as her buffs are enough to compensate its base power. Other Furina-less teams can be centered around Electro-Charged, as Neuvillette revolves around multiple supports to maximize his DMG output.

Hyperbloom Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

Taking advantage of one of the most powerful and versatile elemental reactions in the game, Neuvillette's AoE Hydro application per tick is strong enough for Hyperbloom teams. One Electro and Dendro are enough to round up your party, although you may add someone like Yae Miko or Fischl for more Aggravate damage, or Baizhu for extra protection.

Vaporize 1 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

It's a good thing to remember that Hydro does twice as much DMG when triggering Vaporize. Units that provide Pyro application and Anemo characters who can spread it easy using Anemo will perfectly set Neuvillette up for increased DMG output. Note that Bennett's ATK buffs doesn't affect Neuvillette but only as Xiangling's best partner for energy and ATK buffs.

Vaporize 2 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

It's a good thing to remember that Hydro does twice as much DMG when triggering Vaporize. Units that provide Pyro application and Anemo characters who can spread it easy using Anemo will perfectly set Neuvillette up for increased DMG output. Note that Bennett's ATK buffs doesn't affect Neuvillette but only as Xiangling's best partner for energy and ATK buffs.

Freeze 1 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Charlotte

Support

Freezing opponents is always a sound strategy to minimize as much DMG as possible while still dealing DMG of your own. Since Neuvillette specializes in AoE attacks, it would be best to pair him up with Cryo units with wide coverage like Charlotte, Rosaria, or Layla. You can either use Anemo swirlers like Kazuha, Sucrose, or Venti, so long as you equip them with Viridescent Venerer artifact.

Freeze 2 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Venti

Sub-DPS

Layla

Support

Freezing opponents is always a sound strategy to minimize as much DMG as possible while still dealing DMG of your own. Since Neuvillette specializes in AoE attacks, it would be best to pair him up with Cryo units with wide coverage like Charlotte, Rosaria, or Layla. You can either use Anemo swirlers like Kazuha, Sucrose, or Venti, so long as you equip them with Viridescent Venerer artifact.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Another good option for taking down mobs of enemies is through the Electro-Charged reaction as long as you have an Anemo or an Electro who can spread the reaction in the amount of time Neuvillette uses his Charged Attacks. Fischl, Beidou, or Yae Miko are one of the best off-field Electro DPS for Neuvillette, with Zhongli providing shields to prevent interruption.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Another good option for taking down mobs of enemies is through the Electro-Charged reaction as long as you have an Anemo or an Electro who can spread the reaction in the amount of time Neuvillette uses his Charged Attacks. Fischl, Beidou, or Yae Miko are one of the best off-field Electro DPS for Neuvillette, with Zhongli providing shields to prevent interruption.

Neuvillette's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High scaling and fast tick of his Charged Attacks can output high amounts of damage per second.
  • Can fit into multiple Hydro-related team comps due to his passive talent.
  • Hovers during casting of Charged Attack; contributes to fast mobility in the battlefield.
  • Floating state can help traverse over waters in overworld exploration. Passive talent greatly helps underwater exploration as well.

Weaknesses

  • Highly susceptible to interruption when casting Charged Attack unless you have his C1 or a shielder.

Nilou's Weapons

Sub-DPS Build for Off-Field

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    Freedom-Sworn

    Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Xiphos' Moonlight

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Iron Sting (F2P Option)

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

This Nilou build focuses on her best role as a Sub-DPS who enables the creation of Bountiful Cores. You will want to stack HP% Main Stats and use a 2pc Tenacity of the Millelith set with a 2pc Vourukasha's Glow set to increase her Bountiful Core damage.

Main DPS Build for On-Field

Best Weapon

Key of Khaj-Nisut

HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Xiphos' Moonlight

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

Nilou can work as an on-field unit that can create Bountiful Cores by applying Hydro via her Sword Dance form. The Sacrificial Sword is a very good weapon here since it enables you to use both Elemental Skill forms for Nilou to maximize her Hydro application on enemies.

Nilou can take advantage of the Vourukasha's Glow 4pc effect due to self damage from her Bountiful cores. But you can also stick to the standard 2pc. HP%/HP% artifact set combo to reduce the amount of resin you need to farm!

Nilou's Artifacts

Sub-DPS Build for Off-Field

Best Artifact Set

&

Tenacity of the Millelith & Vourukasha's Glow

2-Piece: HP +20%

2-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • HP
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±170% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Nilou build focuses on her best role as a Sub-DPS who enables the creation of Bountiful Cores. You will want to stack HP% Main Stats and use a 2pc Tenacity of the Millelith set with a 2pc Vourukasha's Glow set to increase her Bountiful Core damage.

Main DPS Build for On-Field

Best Artifact Set

Vourukasha's Glow

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG will be increased by 10%. After the equipping character takes DMG, the aforementioned DMG Bonus is increased by 80% for 5s. This effect increase can have 5 stacks. The duration of each stack is counted independently. These effects can be triggered even when the equipping character is not on the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Tenacity of the Millelith & Vourukasha's Glow

2-Piece: HP +20%

2-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±150% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Nilou can work as an on-field unit that can create Bountiful Cores by applying Hydro via her Sword Dance form. The Sacrificial Sword is a very good weapon here since it enables you to use both Elemental Skill forms for Nilou to maximize her Hydro application on enemies.

Nilou can take advantage of the Vourukasha's Glow 4pc effect due to self damage from her Bountiful cores. But you can also stick to the standard 2pc. HP%/HP% artifact set combo to reduce the amount of resin you need to farm!

Nilou's Teams

Double Hydro 1 Team

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

A double Hydro and double Dendro Team has the potential to make more Bountiful cores compared to the triple Hydro team. However ownership of Bountiful cores becomes more messy, making it mandatory for everyone to at least invest some stats into Elemental Mastery.

Double Hydro 2 Team

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

A double Hydro and double Dendro Team has the potential to make more Bountiful cores compared to the triple Hydro team. However ownership of Bountiful cores becomes more messy, making it mandatory for everyone to at least invest some stats into Elemental Mastery.

Double Hydro 3 Team

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Candace

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

A double Hydro and double Dendro Team has the potential to make more Bountiful cores compared to the triple Hydro team. However ownership of Bountiful cores becomes more messy, making it mandatory for everyone to at least invest some stats into Elemental Mastery.

Triple Hydro 1 Team

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Nilou works great in a triple Hydro team with a single Dendro damage dealer. This ensures that all Bountiful cores comes from the Dendro unit, making it very easy to maximize Bountiful Core damage by simply equiping the Dendro unit with Triple EM Artifacts

Triple Hydro 2 Team

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

Nilou works great in a triple Hydro team with a single Dendro damage dealer. This ensures that all Bountiful cores comes from the Dendro unit, making it very easy to maximize Bountiful Core damage by simply equiping the Dendro unit with Triple EM Artifacts

Triple Hydro 3 Team

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Support

Nilou works great in a triple Hydro team with a single Dendro damage dealer. This ensures that all Bountiful cores comes from the Dendro unit, making it very easy to maximize Bountiful Core damage by simply equiping the Dendro unit with Triple EM Artifacts

Nilou On-Field Team

Nilou

Main DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

Nilou as a Main DPS will have her act as the primary enabler for applying Hydro on Enemies. It is best if Nilou uses a Sacrificial Sword as an on-field unit so that she can use her two Dance Forms to apply Hydro on enemies. Once her Sword Dance form's duration has ended, you can swap to Barbara to keep applying Hydro on enemies.

Nilou's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Changes Dendro Cores into a more powerful version called Bountiful Cores.
  • Applies strong debuffs to enemies from her second constellation.
  • Bountiful Cores do great damage against multiple enemies.

Weaknesses

  • Requires a fixed team build (Hydro + Dendro) to fully utilize her talents.
  • Requires a healer to recover from friendly fire damage due to Dendro Core explosions.

Ningguang's Weapons

Geo Main DPS

Best Weapon

Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Solar Pearl

    Normal Attack hits increase Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 20% for 6s. Likewise, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 6s.

    Mappa Mare

    Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 8% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks.

Comment

This Main DPS build for Ningguang aims at increasing her overall DMG with the new Nighttime Whispers in the Echoing Woods artifact set released in Version 4.3, which is her new best-in-slot in an ideal situation where she can keep up its conditional buffs.

If you don't have this set yet, you can work with a 2-piece Archaic Petra and any 2-piece ATK artifacts (like Gladiator's Finale). If you already have godly rolls on your previous set's substats, you may choose not to farm the new set if it can make up the slight difference.

Ningguang's Artifacts

Geo Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Nighttime Whispers in the Echoing Woods

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: After using an Elemental Skill, gain a 20% Geo DMG Bonus for 10s. While under a shield granted by the Crystallize reaction, the above effect will be increased by 150%, and this additional increase disappears 1s after that shield is lost.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%

Comment

This Main DPS build for Ningguang aims at increasing her overall DMG with the new Nighttime Whispers in the Echoing Woods artifact set released in Version 4.3, which is her new best-in-slot in an ideal situation where she can keep up its conditional buffs.

If you don't have this set yet, you can work with a 2-piece Archaic Petra and any 2-piece ATK artifacts (like Gladiator's Finale). If you already have godly rolls on your previous set's substats, you may choose not to farm the new set if it can make up the slight difference.

Ningguang's Teams

Main DPS 1 Team

Ningguang

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Bennett

Support

With her capability to deal decent Geo DMG, Ningguang can lead a team as the Main DPS. Ningguang works well with units that can assist her in adding additional damage Off-Field.

Main DPS 2 Team

Ningguang

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Support

Bennett

Support

With her capability to deal decent Geo DMG, Ningguang can lead a team as the Main DPS. Ningguang works well with units that can assist her in adding additional damage Off-Field.

F2P Team

Ningguang

Main DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Support

Noelle

Support

Ningguang can also shine in F2P teams. Both Xiangling and Kaeya re valuable team mates offering Melt damage along with Crystalize shards for the team to use.

Ningguang's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Skill provides protection against ranged attacks.
  • Can increase the party's Geo DMG with Jade Screen.
  • High Elemental Burst DMG.
  • Useful for fighting from a long range.

Weaknesses

  • Slow ATK Speed.
  • Auto target Normal Attacks are not great vs multiple enemies.

Noelle's Weapons

Geo Main DPS

Best Weapon

Redhorn Stonethresher

DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

Alternative Weapons

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    Whiteblind

    On hit, Normal or Charged Attacks increase ATK and DEF by 6% for 6s. Max 4 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.5s.

Comment

Noelle's Main DPS build relies on her Normal Attacks during Elemental Burst. This build requires Noelle to have all of her constellations unlocked to dish out the most DMG, as well as put most of her scalings towards DEF.

Alternatively, you can run Marechaussee Hunter when paired with a support like Furina who can significantly increase Noelle's damage and provide her own.

Shield and Healing Support

Best Weapon

Whiteblind

On hit, Normal or Charged Attacks increase ATK and DEF by 6% for 6s. Max 4 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.5s.

Alternative Weapons

    Redhorn Stonethresher

    DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    White Iron Greatsword

    Defeating an opponent restores 8% HP.

Comment

NO COMMENT YET

Noelle's Artifacts

Geo Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Husk of Opulent Dreams

2-Piece: DEF +30%

4-Piece: A character equipped with this Artifact set will obtain the Curiosity effect in the following conditions: When on the field, the character gains 1 stack after hitting an opponent with a Geo attack, triggering a maximum of once every 0.3s. When off the field, the character gains 1 stack every 3s. Curiosity can stack up to 4 times, each providing 6% DEF and a 6% Geo DMG Bonus. When 6 seconds pass without gaining a Curiosity stack, 1 stack is lost.

Secondary Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • DEF%
  • ATK%

Comment

Noelle's Main DPS build relies on her Normal Attacks during Elemental Burst. This build requires Noelle to have all of her constellations unlocked to dish out the most DMG, as well as put most of her scalings towards DEF.

Alternatively, you can run Marechaussee Hunter when paired with a support like Furina who can significantly increase Noelle's damage and provide her own.

Shield and Healing Support

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%
  • Goblet: DEF%
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/DEF%

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • DEF%
  • DEF

Comment

NO COMMENT YET

Noelle's Teams

Noelle-Furina 1 Team

Noelle

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Albedo

Support

Noelle can synergize very well with Furina. Stacking both buffs provided by Furina and Gorou can make Noelle dish out significant personal damage, while also being the team's healer. The other two slots in the team can be flexible. just remember that Noelle cannot effiectively generate enough particles on her own and most require a battery.

Noelle-Furina 2 Team

Noelle

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Yelan

Support

Noelle can synergize very well with Furina. Stacking both buffs provided by Furina and Gorou can make Noelle dish out significant personal damage, while also being the team's healer. The other two slots in the team can be flexible. just remember that Noelle cannot effiectively generate enough particles on her own and most require a battery.

Noelle-Furina 3 Team

Noelle

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Gorou

Support

Noelle can synergize very well with Furina. Stacking both buffs provided by Furina and Gorou can make Noelle dish out significant personal damage, while also being the team's healer. The other two slots in the team can be flexible. just remember that Noelle cannot effiectively generate enough particles on her own and most require a battery.

Mono-Geo Team

Noelle

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Fischl

Support

This team specializes in providing particles and buffs before Noelle takes the stage with her Elemental Burst to take out enemies. Albedo and Fischl provide additional DMG and particles to generate Noelle's energy while Gorou provides DEF buffs to increase Noelle's DMG.

F2P Team

Noelle

Main DPS

Traveler (Geo)

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Bennett

Support

This is Noelle's best team without any 5-star characters aside from the Traveler. It works almost similarly to the previous team except that Albedo's place gets replaced by the Traveler and Bennett is here to provide healing and an ATK buff.

Noelle's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Stacking DEF increases her damage, shielding, and healing all at once.
  • Wide AoE attacks when using Charged Attacks.
  • Healing is party-wide and not only for the active character.
  • Emergency shielding when active character goes below 30%.

Weaknesses

  • Low Base DMG when not on C6.
  • Elemental Skill has a high cooldown, and not ideal for panic shielding or healing.
  • Has to be on-field to heal your party, especially if built only as a support.
  • High Elemental Burst energy cost.

Qiqi's Weapons

Damage Healer

Best Weapon

Skyward Blade

CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Summit Shaper

    Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, ATK increase effect is increased by 100%.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Qiqi build takes advantage of her massive overhealing capabilities to convert it into damage. More enemies increases Qiqi's likelihood of reaching the 30k healing max limit for the Ocean-Hued Clam.

Qiqi's Artifacts

Damage Healer

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: ATK%/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • ATK%
  • ATK
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Qiqi build takes advantage of her massive overhealing capabilities to convert it into damage. More enemies increases Qiqi's likelihood of reaching the 30k healing max limit for the Ocean-Hued Clam.

Main DPS

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS

With her Off-Field healing that periodically applies Cryo to enemies, Qiqi can be used in Superconduct teams. She would need to have another Cryo character just in case, as her Cryo application might have some downtime.

With her Off-Field healing that periodically applies Cryo to enemies, Qiqi can be used in Superconduct teams. She would need to have another Cryo character just in case, as her Cryo application might have some downtime.

With her Off-Field healing that periodically applies Cryo to enemies, Qiqi can be used in Superconduct teams. She would need to have another Cryo character just in case, as her Cryo application might have some downtime.

Perma-Freeze 1 Team
