Support

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Qiqi is able to perform as both a Cryo Applicator and a Healer for certain Freeze teams, including one featuring Wriothesley and Furina due to Qiqi's Healing Marks that both units can use.

Perma-Freeze 2 Team

Qiqi

Support

Chongyun

Main DPS

Mona

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Qiqi is able to perform as both a Cryo Applicator and a Healer for certain Freeze teams, including one featuring Wriothesley and Furina due to Qiqi's Healing Marks that both units can use.

Qiqi's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Strong Overall Healing
  • Elemental Skill provides heals over time
  • Elemental Burst provides great Heals espeicially in Co-op.

Weaknesses

  • Skills have long cooldowns
  • Energy regeneration and Cryo Application is less than average

Raiden's Weapons

Energy Recharge Main DPS

Best Weapon

Engulfing Lightning

ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Wavebreaker's Fin

    For every point of the entire party's combined maximum Energy capacity, the Elemental Burst DMG of the character equipping this weapon is increased by 0.12%. A maximum of 40% increased Elemental Burst DMG can be achieved this way.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

Emblem of Severed Fate is the best artifact for Raiden Shogun as a Main DPS. Her support capabilities are also amplified by stacking Energy Recharge with this build, which should be around 200% to 250%, which in turn also gives her Electro DMG Bonus.

If you have Engulfing Lighting, it is strictly better to use an Energy Recharge mainstat for the Sands piece and an Electro Goblet. If you don't have the weapon, you have the option of using a combination of ER Sands and an ATK% Goblet or ATK% Sands and an Electro Goblet.

Hyperbloom Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Dragon's Bane

Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Pyro by 20%.

Alternative Weapons

    Kitain Cross Spear

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

    Ballad of the Fjords

    When there are at least 3 different Elemental Types in your party, Elemental Mastery will be increased by 120.

    Moonpiercer

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Revival will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 16% ATK for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field.

Comment

Hyperbloom is Raiden Shogun's best build as a Sub DPS with Flower of Paradise Lost or Gilded Dreams artifacts to amplify the reaction's damage. No other stat other than Elemental Mastery is important, but you can still stack Energy Recharge for the party.

Theoretically speaking, Flower of Paradise Lost would give you more damage, but Gilded Dreams is generally better to farm if you need Deepwood Memories for your Dendro Support.

Raiden's Artifacts

Energy Recharge Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/ATK
  • Goblet: ATK%/Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

200%-250% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Emblem of Severed Fate is the best artifact for Raiden Shogun as a Main DPS. Her support capabilities are also amplified by stacking Energy Recharge with this build, which should be around 200% to 250%, which in turn also gives her Electro DMG Bonus.

If you have Engulfing Lighting, it is strictly better to use an Energy Recharge mainstat for the Sands piece and an Electro Goblet. If you don't have the weapon, you have the option of using a combination of ER Sands and an ATK% Goblet or ATK% Sands and an Electro Goblet.

Hyperbloom Sub DPS

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Secondary Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Hyperbloom is Raiden Shogun's best build as a Sub DPS with Flower of Paradise Lost or Gilded Dreams artifacts to amplify the reaction's damage. No other stat other than Elemental Mastery is important, but you can still stack Energy Recharge for the party.

Theoretically speaking, Flower of Paradise Lost would give you more damage, but Gilded Dreams is generally better to farm if you need Deepwood Memories for your Dendro Support.

Raiden's Teams

International Team

Raiden

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

The premier F2P team for Raiden Shogun that can rival other high-end team comps, especially with her C2. This team focuses on dealing constant Burst type damage thanks to Raiden's ability to nearly fully recharging the team's high burst cost.

Hypercarry Team

Raiden

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Sara

Support

Bennett

Support

This team focuses on increasing Raiden Shogun's personal damage to the max, using Kazuha's elemental damage bonus, and Sara and Bennett's ATK bonus buffs before landing Raiden's burst damage. You will need heavy investment for all these characters, especially Sara's C6 and Raiden's C2 to make it worthwhile.

Overloaded 1 Team

Raiden

Main DPS

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Sara

Support

For building teams around Raiden with Chevreuse, she works as a Hypercarry greatly buffed by the latter's new mechanics plus buffer supports like Bennett and Sara. Chevreuse essentially replaces Kazuha in her normal Hypercarry team. If you're looking to run Raiden as a Sub-DPS, a ranged character like Yoimiya will work as her Main DPS as she can target enemies even after they have been knockbacked by the Overloaded effect.

Overloaded 2 Team

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Chevreuse

Support

Sara

Support

For building teams around Raiden with Chevreuse, she works as a Hypercarry greatly buffed by the latter's new mechanics plus buffer supports like Bennett and Sara. Chevreuse essentially replaces Kazuha in her normal Hypercarry team. If you're looking to run Raiden as a Sub-DPS, a ranged character like Yoimiya will work as her Main DPS as she can target enemies even after they have been knockbacked by the Overloaded effect.

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Support

This Raiden team comp focuses on increasing her personal damage through the Hyperbloom reaction. Strong Dendro and Hydro characters who can create a lot of Dendro Cores are recommended.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

This Raiden team comp focuses on increasing her personal damage through the Hyperbloom reaction. Strong Dendro and Hydro characters who can create a lot of Dendro Cores are recommended.

Superconduct Team

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Eula

Main DPS

Shenhe

Support

Diona

Support

Raiden can be slotted into any team comp that needs an Electro element, a Sub-DPS burst unit, and a support unit that can help recharge the Elemental Burst of the team. One sample is the Eula-Raiden team comp where Raiden triggers superconduct and recharges Eula and Shenhe's Elemental Burst.

Raiden's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Energy Recharge scaling benefits her damage and overall utlity for her party members. She can supply energy while also being extremely potent with her personal DPS.
  • Has one of the most impactful constellations at C2.
  • Pseudo-permanent Elemental Skill with active Electro application, which makes her one of the best for Hyperbloom team comps.
  • Passively increases the team's Elemental Burst DMG from her Skill.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Burst does not work with certain characters, like Beidou's burst.

Razor's Weapons

Main DPS

Best Weapon

Song of Broken Pines

Increases ATK by 16%. When Normal or Charged Attacks hit opponents, the character gains a Sigil of Whispers (once every 0.3s). When you reach 4 Sigils, all will be consumed and all nearby party members will get increased Normal ATK SPD by 12% and ATK by 20% for 12s. Once this triggers, you gain no Sigils for 20s. Buffs of the same type won’t stack. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

Comment

This build relies on Razor dealing fast Normal Attacks while building up Pale Flame stacks by using his Elemental Skill to gain more Physical DMG.

Quickbloom Dendro DPS

Best Weapon

Mailed Flower

Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

Alternative Weapons

    Makhaira Aquamarine

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

Comment

Damage potential for Dendro reactions like Hyperbloom and Aggravate is high, and Razor in this build can work similarly like Cyno to trigger both reactions during his Elemental Burst.

Because this build focuses on Elemental Mastery, Razor's core use for Physical DMG would be ignored.

Razor's Artifacts

Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Pale Flame

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

4-Piece: When an Elemental skill hits an opponent, ATK is increased by 9% for 7s. This effect stacks up to 2 times and can be triggered once every 0.3s. Once 2 stacks are reached, 2-set effect is doubled.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This build relies on Razor dealing fast Normal Attacks while building up Pale Flame stacks by using his Elemental Skill to gain more Physical DMG.

Quickbloom Dendro DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Damage potential for Dendro reactions like Hyperbloom and Aggravate is high, and Razor in this build can work similarly like Cyno to trigger both reactions during his Elemental Burst.

Because this build focuses on Elemental Mastery, Razor's core use for Physical DMG would be ignored.

Razor's Teams

Superconduct 1 Team

Razor

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

This Razor superconduct team focuses on dealing maximum Physical damage. Mika acts as a support with healing and attack speed buffs, while Rosaria provides CRIT Rate through her Elemental Skill and double Cryo resonance. Fischl acts as another Sub-DPS and a battery to recharge Razor's Elemental Burst.

Superconduct 2 Team

Razor

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Razor superconduct team focuses on dealing maximum Physical damage. Mika acts as a support with healing and attack speed buffs, while Rosaria provides CRIT Rate through her Elemental Skill and double Cryo resonance. Fischl acts as another Sub-DPS and a battery to recharge Razor's Elemental Burst.

Hyperbloom + Aggravate 1 Team

Razor

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

DPS-wise, Razor gets more value if placed in a Dendro Team as he can build Elemental Mastery and CRIT Stats to trigger Hyperbloom and Aggravate during his Elemental Burst. As such, his Physical DMG would be irrelevant in this team, but the high damage potential from Dendro Reactions compensates this loss.

Hyperbloom + Aggravate 2 Team

Razor

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

DPS-wise, Razor gets more value if placed in a Dendro Team as he can build Elemental Mastery and CRIT Stats to trigger Hyperbloom and Aggravate during his Elemental Burst. As such, his Physical DMG would be irrelevant in this team, but the high damage potential from Dendro Reactions compensates this loss.

Razor's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Being an Electro unit, Razor can easily trigger Superconduct, favoring his natural Physical DMG scaling
  • Elemental Burst deals decent damage and defense boost to Razor.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Burst disappears upon switching characters.
  • Attacks and skills have a short-range, which might cause some difficulty when dealing with waves of enemies.

Rosaria's Weapons

Freeze or All-Purpose Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

    On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

    Wavebreaker's Fin

    For every point of the entire party's combined maximum Energy capacity, the Elemental Burst DMG of the character equipping this weapon is increased by 0.12%. A maximum of 40% increased Elemental Burst DMG can be achieved this way.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This Sub-DPS Rosaria build focuses on dealing as much DMG as possible through her Elemental Burst. Rosaria should use a 4pc. Blizzard Strayer in Freeze teams while the Emblem of Severed Fate for others.

Reverse Melt DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of the Scarlet Sands

The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

    On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This Melt DPS build for Rosaria uses her Elemental Skill and Burst to Reverse Melt opponents as her main source of damage. With this, finding a mix of CRIT and EM stats are a must so that her elemental reaction damage is potent.

All-Purpose Support

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Spine

    Increases CRIT Rate by 8% and increases Normal ATK SPD by 12%. Additionally, Normal and Charged Attacks hits on enemies have a 50% chance to trigger a vacuum blade that deals 40% of ATK as DMG in a small AoE. This effect can occur no more than once every 2s.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

Comment

This Support build for Rosaria is all about providing as many buffs to her team as possible. Other than ensuring you have enough Energy Recharge to burst off-cooldown, try to reach 100% CRIT Rate to provide the team a 15% CRIT buff!

Rosaria's Artifacts

Freeze or All-Purpose Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Blizzard Strayer

2-Piece: Cryo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When a character attacks an enemy affected by Cryo, their CRIT Rate is increased by 20%. If the enemy is Frozen, CRIT Rate is increased by an additional 20%.

Secondary Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Sub-DPS Rosaria build focuses on dealing as much DMG as possible through her Elemental Burst. Rosaria should use a 4pc. Blizzard Strayer in Freeze teams while the Emblem of Severed Fate for others.

Reverse Melt DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Melt DPS build for Rosaria uses her Elemental Skill and Burst to Reverse Melt opponents as her main source of damage. With this, finding a mix of CRIT and EM stats are a must so that her elemental reaction damage is potent.

All-Purpose Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Support build for Rosaria is all about providing as many buffs to her team as possible. Other than ensuring you have enough Energy Recharge to burst off-cooldown, try to reach 100% CRIT Rate to provide the team a 15% CRIT buff!

Rosaria's Teams

Freeze 1 Team

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Ayaka

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

With Cryo resonance and Rosaria's passive talent, her team can stack up a good amount of CRIT rate for your team!

Freeze 2 Team

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Jean

Support

With Cryo resonance and Rosaria's passive talent, her team can stack up a good amount of CRIT rate for your team!

Melt 1 Team

Rosaria

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Rosaria can also act as a Main DPS in a Melt Team! With this team, it is important to have rotations mastered as to apply the right elements to maximize melt as well as to have no downtime due to cooldowns.

Melt 2 Team

Rosaria

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Rosaria can also act as a Main DPS in a Melt Team! With this team, it is important to have rotations mastered as to apply the right elements to maximize melt as well as to have no downtime due to cooldowns.

Rosaria's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill and Burst is strong against mobs.
  • Talents provide consistent Cryo Application and CRIT Rate, making her a strong option for any Cryo-focused teams.
  • C6 talent allows her to shred opponents Physical RES, allowing her to function as a viable Physical DPS or support.
  • Passive Talent increases party's Movement SPD at night.(18:00-6:00)

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Skill does not work against larger enemies and bosses.
  • Due to being one of the older characters, she is both outshined in her supportive and damage roles by more recent characters.

Sara's Weapons

Electro Burst ATK Support

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Polar Star

    Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

    Mouun's Moon

    For every point of the entire party's combined maximum Energy capacity, the Elemental Burst DMG of the character equipping this weapon is increased by 0.12%. A maximum of 40% increased Elemental Burst DMG can be achieved this way.

    Alley Hunter

    While the character equipped with this weapon is in the party but not on the field, their DMG increases by 2% every second up to a max of 20%. When the character is on the field for more than 4s, the aforementioned DMG buff decreases by 4% per second until it reaches 0%.

Comment

This Sara Build allows you to buff your party's ATK and burst your opponents through her skills. Aim for the weapons with the highest base ATK, but also aim for good Energy Recharge as her burst is costly.

If your party already has a 4 piece Noblesse Oblige user, then you can use the 4-piece Emblem of Severed Fate as an alternative.

Sara's Artifacts

Electro Burst ATK Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Secondary Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Sara Build allows you to buff your party's ATK and burst your opponents through her skills. Aim for the weapons with the highest base ATK, but also aim for good Energy Recharge as her burst is costly.

If your party already has a 4 piece Noblesse Oblige user, then you can use the 4-piece Emblem of Severed Fate as an alternative.

Sara's Teams

Raiden Hypercarry 1 Team

Sara

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS/Support

Sara is mostly a staple for Raiden's Hypercarry team where her buffs are just enough for Raiden's Elemental Burst duration. Raiden also supplies Sara the Energy Recharge she needs to use her burst off-cooldown. Other Supports like Bennett, Kazuha, or Chevreuse (for Overloaded teams), stack as much buffs as possible with Sara for Raiden's DPS to skyrocket. Because her buffs only last for 6 seconds, try to use her skills last before swapping to Raiden Shogun.

Raiden Hypercarry 2 Team

Sara

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Sara is mostly a staple for Raiden's Hypercarry team where her buffs are just enough for Raiden's Elemental Burst duration. Raiden also supplies Sara the Energy Recharge she needs to use her burst off-cooldown. Other Supports like Bennett, Kazuha, or Chevreuse (for Overloaded teams), stack as much buffs as possible with Sara for Raiden's DPS to skyrocket. Because her buffs only last for 6 seconds, try to use her skills last before swapping to Raiden Shogun.

Raiden Hypercarry 3 Team

Sara

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS/Support

Sara is mostly a staple for Raiden's Hypercarry team where her buffs are just enough for Raiden's Elemental Burst duration. Raiden also supplies Sara the Energy Recharge she needs to use her burst off-cooldown. Other Supports like Bennett, Kazuha, or Chevreuse (for Overloaded teams), stack as much buffs as possible with Sara for Raiden's DPS to skyrocket. Because her buffs only last for 6 seconds, try to use her skills last before swapping to Raiden Shogun.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Sara

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS/Support

Aside from Raiden-focused team comps, Electro-Charged teams are also good with Sara with a Hydro DPS. As this team is without Raiden, you will need an energy battery in the likes of Fischl, and stacking Energy Recharge for her burst to be used off-cooldown.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Sara

Support

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Aside from Raiden-focused team comps, Electro-Charged teams are also good with Sara with a Hydro DPS. As this team is without Raiden, you will need an energy battery in the likes of Fischl, and stacking Energy Recharge for her burst to be used off-cooldown.

Sara's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Huge ATK buffs comparable to Bennett's buffing.
  • Both Elemental Skill and Burst applies the same buffs, giving her two ways to buff the party.
  • Landing your Elemental Skill restores energy to the whole party.

Weaknesses

  • Her Elemental Skill can be awkward to use, and it'll only be eased if you get her automatic buffing at C2.
  • Buff only lasts for 6 seconds.
  • Extremely high Energy Recharge requirement.
  • Has less support abilities compared to others like Bennett.

Sayu's Weapons

Swirl Driver

Best Weapon

Makhaira Aquamarine

The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

    Rainslasher

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 20%

    Sacrificial Greatsword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Comment

Elemental Mastery build for Sayu enables her to drive reactions with her Elemental Skill or Burst. As such, you will need Elemental Mastery artifacts and weapons. Makhaira Aquamarine specifically increases both her ATK and Elemental Mastery!

Crit Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Wolf's Gravestone

Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Beacon of the Reed Sea

    After the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. After the character takes DMG, their ATK will be increased by 20% for 8s. The 2 aforementioned effects can be triggered even when the character is not on the field. Additionally, when not protected by a shield, the character's Max HP will be increased by 32%.

    Tidal Shadow

    After the wielder is healed, ATK will be increased by 24% for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

A crit build paves way for Sayu to get more ATK, which in turn provides a bit of healing on her Elemental Burst. This is one of the builds you can do to balance damage, debuff, and healing at pre-C6, although with much less impact.

Healer Support (Pre-C6)

Best Weapon

Wolf's Gravestone

Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Katsuragikiri Nagamasa

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

    Tidal Shadow

    After the wielder is healed, ATK will be increased by 24% for 8s. This can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

If not on C6, Sayu on a healer build stacks as much ATK% as she can to increase her healing. You will also need around 200% Energy Recharge so she can have her burst ready. You may also use Maiden Beloved should you wish to further increase her healing.

Healer Support (C6)

Best Weapon

Makhaira Aquamarine

The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf's Gravestone

    Increases ATK by 20%. On hit, attacks against enemies with less than 30% HP increases all party members' ATK by 40% for 12s. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Greatsword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Mailed Flower

    Within 8s after the character's Elemental Skill hits an opponent or the character triggers an Elemental Reaction, their ATK and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 12% and 48 respectively.

Comment

At C6, building Elemental Mastery stats become more desirable alongside ATK due to its added healing effect, which scales on the amount of Elemental Mastery she has. It also enables her to unlock the damage for her Swirls without a huge trade-off on her healing.

Sayu's Artifacts

Swirl Driver

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Elemental Mastery build for Sayu enables her to drive reactions with her Elemental Skill or Burst. As such, you will need Elemental Mastery artifacts and weapons. Makhaira Aquamarine specifically increases both her ATK and Elemental Mastery!

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

A crit build paves way for Sayu to get more ATK, which in turn provides a bit of healing on her Elemental Burst. This is one of the builds you can do to balance damage, debuff, and healing at pre-C6, although with much less impact.

Healer Support (Pre-C6)

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge or ATK%
  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: ATK%

Sub Stats

  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

If not on C6, Sayu on a healer build stacks as much ATK% as she can to increase her healing. You will also need around 200% Energy Recharge so she can have her burst ready. You may also use Maiden Beloved should you wish to further increase her healing.

Healer Support (C6)

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery/ATK%

Sub Stats

  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

At C6, building Elemental Mastery stats become more desirable alongside ATK due to its added healing effect, which scales on the amount of Elemental Mastery she has. It also enables her to unlock the damage for her Swirls without a huge trade-off on her healing.

Sayu's Teams

Driver 1 Team

Sayu

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

When using Sayu with her Swirl build, she can use her Elemental Skill while having an off-field Electro, Pyro, Hydro, or Cryo ability to drive and combine reactions. As her ascension passive can already heal the entire party, you may swap a healer for another character.

Driver 2 Team

Sayu

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Ganyu

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Support

When using Sayu with her Swirl build, she can use her Elemental Skill while having an off-field Electro, Pyro, Hydro, or Cryo ability to drive and combine reactions. As her ascension passive can already heal the entire party, you may swap a healer for another character.

Healer 1 Team

Sayu

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Sayu in a healer build supports the party by buffing reactions that can be affected by Swirl with Viridescent Venerer, like Freeze, Vaporize, Melt, or Electro-Charged, while also acting as your healer. Building ATK is recommended for these teams at pre-C6.

Healer 2 Team

Sayu

Support

Ayaka

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Mona

Sub-DPS

Sayu in a healer build supports the party by buffing reactions that can be affected by Swirl with Viridescent Venerer, like Freeze, Vaporize, Melt, or Electro-Charged, while also acting as your healer. Building ATK is recommended for these teams at pre-C6.

Sayu's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Able to fill both the healer and buffer roles when using Viridescent Venerer.
  • Swirl reactions restore HP when Sayu is active.
  • Able to act as an on-field driver to spread elemental reactions with her Elemental Skill.
  • Activating her Burst triggers an emergency party-wide healing.

Weaknesses

  • Simultaneous healing and swirling on her Burst is locked behind C1.
  • Without C6, ATK and Elemental Mastery split-scaling limits the effectiveness of either her healing or her swirl damage
  • High energy requirement.

Sethos's Weapons

Cryo Main DPS

Best Weapon

Hunter's Path

Gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain the Tireless Hunt effect after hitting an opponent with a Charged Attack. This effect increases Charged Attack DMG by 160% of Elemental Mastery. This effect will be removed after 12 Charged Attacks or 10s. Only 1 instance of Tireless Hunt can be gained every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    The First Great Magic

    DMG dealt by Charged Attacks increased by 16%. For every party member with the same Elemental Type as the wielder (including the wielder themselves), gain 1 Gimmick stack. For every party member with a different Elemental Type from the wielder, gain 1 Theatrics stack. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Gimmick stacks, ATK will be increased by 16%/32%/48%. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Theatrics stacks, Movement SPD will be increased by 4%/7%/10%.

    Amos' Bow

    Increases Normal Attack and Aimed Shot DMG by 12%. Increases DMG by 8% for every 0.1s that an arrow is in flight. Stacks up to 5 times on each arrow.

    Cloudforged

    After Elemental Energy is decreased, the equipping character's Elemental Mastery will increase by 40 for 18s. Max 2 stacks.

    Scion of the Blazing Sun

    After a Charged Attack hits an opponent, a Sunfire Arrow will descend upon the opponent hit, dealing 60% ATK as DMG, and applying the Heartsearer effect to the opponent damaged by said Arrow for 10s. Opponents affected by Heartsearer take 28% more Charged Attack DMG from the wielder. A Sunfire Arrow can be triggered once every 10s.

    Slingshot

    If a Normal Attack or Aimed Shot hits a target within 0.3s of being fired, increases DMG by 36%. Otherwise, decreases DMG by 10%.

Comment

Sethos' best build consists of building a mix of CRIT and Elemental Mastery to serve as an Aggravate DPS character, utilizing both his Charged Attack and Normal Attack strengths.

For this, we recommend grabbing an Elemental Mastery Sands, then prioritizing his Electro DMG and CRIT stats afterwards.

Sethos's Artifacts

Dendro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Wanderer's Troupe

2-Piece: Increases Elemental Mastery by 80

4-Piece: Increases Charged Attack DMG by 35% if the character uses a Catalyst or a Bow.

Secondary Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

Sethos' best build consists of building a mix of CRIT and Elemental Mastery to serve as an Aggravate DPS character, utilizing both his Charged Attack and Normal Attack strengths.

For this, we recommend grabbing an Elemental Mastery Sands, then prioritizing his Electro DMG and CRIT stats afterwards.

Sethos's Teams

Aggravate 1 Team

Sethos

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS/Support

Kazuha

Support

With Electro application almost guaranteed when using Sethos, Aggravate becomes a shining spot for one of his most consistent teams due to how well his damage can be augmented by the reaction. This is especially potent for his Charged Attack playstyle, where he can take slow, highly empowered hits towards enemies from far away.

Sethos

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

With Electro application almost guaranteed when using Sethos, Aggravate becomes a shining spot for one of his most consistent teams due to how well his damage can be augmented by the reaction. This is especially potent for his Charged Attack playstyle, where he can take slow, highly empowered hits towards enemies from far away.

Sethos

Main DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS/Support

Dori

Support

With Electro application almost guaranteed when using Sethos, Aggravate becomes a shining spot for one of his most consistent teams due to how well his damage can be augmented by the reaction. This is especially potent for his Charged Attack playstyle, where he can take slow, highly empowered hits towards enemies from far away.

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Sethos

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS/Support

Xingqiu

Support

With Sethos building Elemental Mastery, any stray shots made during his Empowered Normal Attacks can trigger bloom cores and result in Hyperbloom damage. This playstyle is more geared towards his Electro-infused Normal Attacks playstyle, where he can rapidly apply Electro with every shot taken.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Sethos

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Baizhu

Support

With Sethos building Elemental Mastery, any stray shots made during his Empowered Normal Attacks can trigger bloom cores and result in Hyperbloom damage. This playstyle is more geared towards his Electro-infused Normal Attacks playstyle, where he can rapidly apply Electro with every shot taken.

Hyperbloom 3 Team

Sethos

Main DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Dori

Support

With Sethos building Elemental Mastery, any stray shots made during his Empowered Normal Attacks can trigger bloom cores and result in Hyperbloom damage. This playstyle is more geared towards his Electro-infused Normal Attacks playstyle, where he can rapidly apply Electro with every shot taken.

Sethos's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Piercing DMG gives Sethos a good avenue to deal multi-target damage, even allowing him to hit Bloom Cores in the arrow's flight path.
  • Elemental Skill gives Sethos a swift exit out of bad positions and regenerates Elemental Energy to be used by his Empowered Shots.
  • Scales on Elemental Mastery and is an Electro unit, granting him access to Aggravate and Hyperbloom in his playstyles.
  • Has two distinct playstyles that focus on either frontloaded damage with his Charged Shots, or sustained damage with his Elemental Burst.

Weaknesses

  • Energy-hungry due to how quickly he eats up Elemental Energy, requiring an Electro battery to keep him topped up.
  • Level 2 Charged Shot forces Sethos to become immobile, rendering him susceptible to interruption and damage.
  • The Charged Shots cost some of Sethos' Elemental Energy, delaying the usage of his next combo if he cannot recover it.

Shenhe's Weapons

Pure ATK Support

Best Weapon

Calamity Queller

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

Alternative Weapons

    Engulfing Lightning

    ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Support Shenhe build focuses on getting as much ATK stats as possible to buff Cryo DMG. If you're using Shenhe in a Freeze team, we recommend using the Blizzard Strayer artifact set to be able to deal more DMG.

Cryo Burst Support

Best Weapon

Calamity Queller

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

Alternative Weapons

    Engulfing Lightning

    ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This other Support Shenhe build focuses on increasing overall party DMG thanks to the Noblesse artifact. If other members in the party don't have the 4-piece Noblesse Oblige equipped, then this is Shenhe's best option.

Shenhe's Artifacts

Pure ATK Support

Best Artifact Set

&

Gladiator's Finale & Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%

2-Piece: ATK +18%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: ATK%

Sub Stats

  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±110% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Support Shenhe build focuses on getting as much ATK stats as possible to buff Cryo DMG. If you're using Shenhe in a Freeze team, we recommend using the Blizzard Strayer artifact set to be able to deal more DMG.

Cryo Burst Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%/Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: ATK%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • ATK%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This other Support Shenhe build focuses on increasing overall party DMG thanks to the Noblesse artifact. If other members in the party don't have the 4-piece Noblesse Oblige equipped, then this is Shenhe's best option.

Shenhe's Teams

Freeze Team

Shenhe

Support

Ayaka

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Shenhe is Ayaka's best Cryo teammate since Shenhe can buff Ayaka's already exceptional Cryo DMG. This team comp focuses on freezing enemies while also being able to deal a ton of DMG thanks to Shenhe's Cryo DMG buffs and Kazuha's Elemental DMG buff.

Physical DMG Team

Shenhe

Support

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This team comp focuses on creating Superconduct reactions but with the added benefit of having Shenhe's and Zhongli's Physical RES shred to enemies.

Free-to-Play Team

Shenhe

Support

Chongyun

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

This team comp is the free-to-play version of Shenhe's Best Freeze team. Shenhe can buff Chongyun's Cryo DMG while Xingqiu and Sucrose can help spread reactions for Freezing.

Shenhe's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Provides large amounts of Cryo and Physical resistance shred.
  • Tailor made for mono Cryo teams.
  • Elemental Burst covers a wide area.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst cost.
  • Non-Cryo party members cannot take full advantage of her support buffs.

Shinobu's Weapons

Hyperbloom Build

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Xiphos' Moonlight

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

    Toukabou Shigure

    After an attack hits opponents, it will inflict an instance of Cursed Parasol upon one of them for 10s. This effect can be triggered once every 15s. If this opponent is taken out during Cursed Parasol’s duration, Cursed Parasol’s CD will be refreshed immediately. The character wielding this weapon will deal 16% more DMG to the opponent affected by Cursed Parasol.

Comment

This Shinobu Sub-DPS build focuses on maximizing her damage for Hyperbloom teams. Shinobu only needs to use her Elemental Skill for this role, so needing high Energy Recharge isn't necessary.

Healer Support

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Key of Khaj-Nisut

    HP increased by 20%. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, you gain the Grand Hymn effect for 20s. This effect increases the equipping character's Elemental Mastery by 0.12% of their Max HP. This effect can trigger once every 0.3s. Max 3 stacks. When this effect gains 3 stacks, or when the third stack's duration is refreshed, the Elemental Mastery of all nearby party members will be increased by 0.2% of the equipping character's max HP for 20s.

    The Dockhand's Assistant

    When the wielder is healed or heals others, they will gain a Stoic's Symbol for 30s, max 3 Symbols. Upon Elemental Skill or Burst usage, consume all Symbols to get the Roused effect for 10s. For each Symbol consumed, gain 40 Elemental Mastery, and after 2s, restore 2 Energy per Symbol. The Roused effect can be triggered once every 15s, and Symbols can be gained even when the character is off-field.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Shinobu healer support build provides a consistent +20% ATK DMG bonus to the entire party from the 4pc. effect of the Artifact. An Electro DMG Cup with an HP% Circlet can be used for more DMG.

Make sure to get CRIT Rate if you're using the Favonius Sword!

Shinobu's Artifacts

Hyperbloom Build

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Shinobu Sub-DPS build focuses on maximizing her damage for Hyperbloom teams. Shinobu only needs to use her Elemental Skill for this role, so needing high Energy Recharge isn't necessary.

Healer Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%/Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Shinobu healer support build provides a consistent +20% ATK DMG bonus to the entire party from the 4pc. effect of the Artifact. An Electro DMG Cup with an HP% Circlet can be used for more DMG.

Make sure to get CRIT Rate if you're using the Favonius Sword!

This Shinbou Aggravate team focuses on keeping the Quicken Aura applied on the enemy. It's recommended to build the healer Tenacity build as she won't be able to deal any meaningful damage like that of Hyperbloom.

Itto Geo Team

Shinobu

Support

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

This Shinobu team comp brings together the leader and deputy officer of the Arataki gang! Without a C4 Gorou, the usual problem of an Itto-Gorou team is a lack of healing. Shinobu in the party fixes that issue by providing healing and triggering a Crystalize reaction for shields!

Eula Superconduct Team

Shinobu

Support

Eula

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Shinobu in Superconduct teams is a perfect role for her as an off-field Electro support character. By swapping Diona for Shinobu, you can add more Cryo DPS and buffs for Eula's damage.

Electro-Charged Team

Shinobu

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Shinobu is an excellent choice as the 2nd electro unit for any Electro-Charged team comp. Having Shinobu constantly deal Electro DMG while off-field ensures there isn't any gap in between applying Hydro and Electro!

Shinobu's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Consistent off-field Electro DMG.
  • Elemental Skill synergizes very well in Hyperbloom teams.
  • Low Elemental Burst Cost.
  • Reliable Healing.

Weaknesses

  • Low Energy Particle generation.
  • Constantly using her Elemental Skill keeps her health low.
  • No party-wide healing.

Sigewinne's Weapons

Full Healer Support

Best Weapon

Silvershower Heartstrings

The equipping character can gain the Remedy effect. When they possess 1/2/3 Remedy stacks, Max HP will increase by 12%/24%/40%. 1 stack may be gained when the following conditions are met: 1 stack for 25s when using an Elemental Skill; 1 stack for 25s when the value of a Bond of Life increases; 1 stack for 20s for performing healing. Stacks can still be triggered when the equipping character is not on the field. Each stack's duration is counted independently. In addition, when 3 stacks are active, Elemental Burst CRIT Rate will be increased by 28%. This effect will be canceled 4s after falling under 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Recurve Bow

    Defeating an opponent restores 8% HP.

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Comment

Sigewinne's best build fully focuses on getting as much HP as possible up to a maximum of 65,000 HP to utilize the full effects of her Passive Talent, which increases your party members' off-field Elemental Skill damage. If your team have Hydro Resonance, this goal would be easier to aim and you can focus on other stats like Energy Recharge.

To maximize her healing and off-field buffs, Song of Days Past with full HP stats is the best build for support buffer, but you may use Ocean-Hued Clam to add her own personal DPS, or a mix of 2-pc HP artifact sets if you lack such stats.

Emblem of Severed Fate Burst Hybrid

Best Weapon

Silvershower Heartstrings

The equipping character can gain the Remedy effect. When they possess 1/2/3 Remedy stacks, Max HP will increase by 12%/24%/40%. 1 stack may be gained when the following conditions are met: 1 stack for 25s when using an Elemental Skill; 1 stack for 25s when the value of a Bond of Life increases; 1 stack for 20s for performing healing. Stacks can still be triggered when the equipping character is not on the field. Each stack's duration is counted independently. In addition, when 3 stacks are active, Elemental Burst CRIT Rate will be increased by 28%. This effect will be canceled 4s after falling under 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Recurve Bow

    Defeating an opponent restores 8% HP.

    Sacrificial Bow

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Fading Twilight

    Has three states, Evengleam, Afterglow, and Dawnblaze, which increases DMG dealt by 6%/10%/14% respectively. When attacks hit opponents, this weapon will switch to the next state. This weapon can change states once every 7s. The character equipping this weapon can still trigger the state switch while not on the field.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

Sigewinne's Elemental Burst only deals damage, which you can utilize for a quick-swap DPS-Support hybrid build. Thankfully, Sigewinne's Burst also scales with HP, so get as much HP and CRIT stats to balance her heals, buffs, and damage.

Sigewinne's Artifacts

Full Healer Support

Best Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Secondary Artifact Set

Song of Days Past

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the equipping character heals a party member, the Yearning effect will be created for 6s, which records the total amount of healing provided (including overflow healing). When the duration expires, the Yearning effect will be transformed into the Waves of Days Past effect: When your active party member hits an opponent with a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Plunging Attack, Elemental Skill, or Elemental Burst, the DMG dealt will be increased by 8% of the total healing amount recorded by the Yearning effect. The Waves of Days Past effect is removed after it has taken effect 5 times or after 10s. A single instance of the Yearning effect can record up to 15,000 healing, and only a single instance can exist at once, but it can record the healing from multiple equipping characters. Equipping characters on standby can still trigger this effect.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Sigewinne's best build fully focuses on getting as much HP as possible up to a maximum of 65,000 HP to utilize the full effects of her Passive Talent, which increases your party members' off-field Elemental Skill damage. If your team have Hydro Resonance, this goal would be easier to aim and you can focus on other stats like Energy Recharge.

To maximize her healing and off-field buffs, Song of Days Past with full HP stats is the best build for support buffer, but you may use Ocean-Hued Clam to add her own personal DPS, or a mix of 2-pc HP artifact sets if you lack such stats.

Emblem of Severed Fate Burst Hybrid

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Emblem of Severed Fate & Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

2-Piece: HP +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%/Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: HP%/CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Comment

Sigewinne's Elemental Burst only deals damage, which you can utilize for a quick-swap DPS-Support hybrid build. Thankfully, Sigewinne's Burst also scales with HP, so get as much HP and CRIT stats to balance her heals, buffs, and damage.

Sigewinne's Teams

Sigewinne-Furina Double-Geo 1 Team

Sigewinne

Support

Navia

Main DPS

Chiori

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Slotting Sigewinne and Furina in a double-Geo team with Navia and Chiori (preferably with C1) offers one of Navia's best possible premium teams with enough Hydro application to supply her with Crystallize shards. Sigewinne can specifically buff both Chiori and Furina's main source of damage on their Skills.

Support

Navia

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Slotting Sigewinne and Furina in a double-Geo team with Navia and Chiori (preferably with C1) offers one of Navia's best possible premium teams with enough Hydro application to supply her with Crystallize shards. Sigewinne can specifically buff both Chiori and Furina's main source of damage on their Skills.

Sigewinne-Furina Hyperbloom/Quicken 1 Team

Sigewinne

Support

Nahida

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

For a classic team with Hyperbloom teams, any Dendro or Electro characters who can create and trigger the bloom cores, or trigger Quicken by themselves are good. Nahida specifically is the best Dendro for such teams as Sigewinne gives a sizable buff to her Elemental Skill procs.

Furina

For a classic team with Hyperbloom teams, any Dendro or Electro characters who can create and trigger the bloom cores, or trigger Quicken by themselves are good. Nahida specifically is the best Dendro for such teams as Sigewinne gives a sizable buff to her Elemental Skill procs.

Support

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Sigewinne in a Freeze team generally only helps with Furina's buffs and healing while also offering a miniscule amount of Hydro application off-field. Regardless, she can replace someone like Charlotte from Wriothesley teams, or Kokomi in a regular Freeze team to a lesser degree.

Sigewinne in a Freeze team generally only helps with Furina's buffs and healing while also offering a miniscule amount of Hydro application off-field. Regardless, she can replace someone like Charlotte from Wriothesley teams, or Kokomi in a regular Freeze team to a lesser degree.

Quick-Swap 1 Team

Sigewinne

Support

Yae Miko

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS/Support

Team comps with an abundance of off-field Elemental Skill appliers can make up a decent quick-swap teams. A team with Yae Miko, Fischl, Nahida for example can form a Quickbloom team with Sigewinne to buff all their main sources of damage. This also allows you to run Sigewinne as a pseudo-DPS with her Burst after every rotations.

Support

Beidou

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS/Support

Team comps with an abundance of off-field Elemental Skill appliers can make up a decent quick-swap teams. A team with Yae Miko, Fischl, Nahida for example can form a Quickbloom team with Sigewinne to buff all their main sources of damage. This also allows you to run Sigewinne as a pseudo-DPS with her Burst after every rotations.

Main DPS

Sub-DPS/Support

Sigewinne can be a general healer for any teams that don't necessarily require the fourth spot for another member, such as Itto Triple-Geo teams, or as a comfortable option in the overworld.

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS/Support

Sigewinne can be a general healer for any teams that don't necessarily require the fourth spot for another member, such as Itto Triple-Geo teams, or as a comfortable option in the overworld.

Sigewinne-Neuvillette Team

Sigewinne

Support

Neuvillette

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS/Support

As Sigewinne can spawn Sourcewater Droplets for Neuvillette, you can use Sigewinne to slightly prolong Neuvillette's uptime. It is recommended for Neuvillette to be at C1 in this team to maximize his passive talent effect. Kazuha can be swapped with Furina for Mono-Hydro team comps as well.

Sigewinne's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Sigewinne provides comfortable party-wide healing in the overworld as it's available on her Elemental Skill.
  • Provides a niche for buffing off-field Elemental Skill talents.
  • Can trap troublesome lightweight enemies with her hold Elemental Skill.

Weaknesses

  • Hydro Application is minimal, which doesn't allow her to be the solo applicator for teams like Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Vaporize.
  • Elemental Skill uptime is very short, with a very long cooldown. She's also susceptible to interruptions while holding her skill at C0.
  • Her buff for off-field Elemental Skills is capped to 10 procs across the board, which gets consumed quickly the more characters you have in the party who can activate this effect.
  • Special Charged Attack currently does not offer any useful utility nor any practical use in combat.
  • Elemental Burst contributes a bit of damage in quick-swap comps. Otherwise, she uses too much on-field time. Without her signature or enough investment on her equipment to increase its damage, the value of her Elemental Burst diminishes greatly.

Sucrose's Weapons

On-Field Driver

Best Weapon

Sacrificial Fragments

After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    A Thousand Floating Dreams

    Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

    Wandering Evenstar

    The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

    Magic Guide

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro by 12%.

Comment

This Sucrose build allows you to use Sucrose as an on-field Swirl reactor. This is recommended on teams that use Electro-charged, Overload, and Dendro reactions.

Swirl Support

Best Weapon

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Alternative Weapons

    A Thousand Floating Dreams

    Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

    Sacrificial Fragments

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Sucrose build is her best build that specializes in buffing your party's Elemental Mastery while also decreasing the enemies' Elemental RES, taking advantage of Thrilling Tales' quickswap buffs during team rotations.

Sucrose's Artifacts

On-Field Driver

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Sucrose build allows you to use Sucrose as an on-field Swirl reactor. This is recommended on teams that use Electro-charged, Overload, and Dendro reactions.

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
