This Sucrose build is her best build that specializes in buffing your party's Elemental Mastery while also decreasing the enemies' Elemental RES, taking advantage of Thrilling Tales' quickswap buffs during team rotations.

Sucrose's Teams

Driver 1 Team

Sucrose

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

In this team, Sucrose takes most of the field time enabling swirl and resistance shred while her teammates cause their respective elemental reactions with their abilities. Unlike her supportive role, this requires Sucrose to have high amounts of Elemental Mastery to remain effective, so be sure to invest a little more into your Sucrose if using her as a Driver.

Driver 2 Team

Sucrose

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

In this team, Sucrose takes most of the field time enabling swirl and resistance shred while her teammates cause their respective elemental reactions with their abilities. Unlike her supportive role, this requires Sucrose to have high amounts of Elemental Mastery to remain effective, so be sure to invest a little more into your Sucrose if using her as a Driver.

Vaporize 1 Team

Sucrose

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Sucrose acts as a grouper and shredder for the team, setting up her Main DPS to be able to deal increased Elemental Reaction damage to opponents.

Vaporize 2 Team

Sucrose

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Sucrose acts as a grouper and shredder for the team, setting up her Main DPS to be able to deal increased Elemental Reaction damage to opponents.

Sucrose's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • As a catalyst user, Sucrose is able to apply Anemo with ease, making her an effective on-field driver for Swirl.
  • Is able to increase the Elemental Mastery of the party through ability usage, making her an extremely formidable support.
  • Is as effective as her premier 5-start counterparts if built and played correctly.
  • C1 gives her more Crowd Control and RES shred opportunities, as well as making her rotations more flexible.

Weaknesses

  • Mechanically intensive to play, requiring the player to understand the fundamentals of her Elemental Infusion to use her effectively.
  • Cannot function well if she is not able to swirl an element.

Tartaglia's Weapons

Hydro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Polar Star

Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

Alternative Weapons

    Thundering Pulse

    Increases ATK by 20% and grants Thunder Emblem. At stacks 1/2/3, Normal Attack DMG is further increased by 12/24/40%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s)

    • Casting an Elemental Skill (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    The Viridescent Hunt

    Upon hit, Normal and Aimed Shot Attacks have a 50% chance to generate a Cyclone, which will continuously attract surrounding enemies, dealing 40% of ATK as DMG to these enemies every 0.5s for 4s. This effect can only occur once every 14s.

    Scion of the Blazing Sun

    After a Charged Attack hits an opponent, a Sunfire Arrow will descend upon the opponent hit, dealing 60% ATK as DMG, and applying the Heartsearer effect to the opponent damaged by said Arrow for 10s. Opponents affected by Heartsearer take 28% more Charged Attack DMG from the wielder. A Sunfire Arrow can be triggered once every 10s.

Comment

This is Tartaglia's best build thanks to the synergizing effects of the Nymph's Dream, which allows him to gain attack and Hydro damage bonus by hitting opponents with different types of attacks, like Charged Attacks and Elemental Skills.

While Nymph's Dream is best suited with him, you may still use the Heart of Depth set if the substats of your artifacts are exceptionally higher.

Tartaglia's Artifacts

Hydro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Nymph's Dream

2-Piece: Hydro DMG bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attacks, Elemental Skills, and Elemental Bursts hit opponents, 1 stack of Mirrored Nymph will be triggered, lasting 8s. When under the effect of 1, 2, or 3 or more Mirrored Nymph Stacks, ATK will be increased by 7%/16%/25%, and Hydro DMG bonus will be increased by 4%/9%/15%. Mirrored Nymph stacks created by Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attacks, Elemental Skills, and Elemental Bursts exist independently.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This is Tartaglia's best build thanks to the synergizing effects of the Nymph's Dream, which allows him to gain attack and Hydro damage bonus by hitting opponents with different types of attacks, like Charged Attacks and Elemental Skills.

While Nymph's Dream is best suited with him, you may still use the Heart of Depth set if the substats of your artifacts are exceptionally higher.

Tartaglia's Teams

Vaporize Team

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Kazuha

Support

Tartaglia works extremely well with Xiangling as he can keep the enemy affected by Hydro while she deals off-field Burst DMG to enemies. This team works in conjuction to deal an absurd amount of damage, but only if the rotation is handled correctly. We recommend having Kazuha buff both Pyro and Hydro at the same time by Swirling after Bennett and Tartaglia applies their own elements, before using your team's bursts.

Tazer Team

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This team comp works similarly to the Vaporize team and works better on multiple enemies. Beidou provides off-field Electro DMG for Tartaglia to trigger Vaporize. Fischl provides additional Electro DMG while acting as Beidou's battery to recover Elemental Burst energy.

Bloom 1 Team

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Support

Tartaglia can function as the main Hydro applier in any Bloom team comp, whether if it's Hyperbloom or Burgeon. His damage may be lower compared to a standard vaporize Team comp, but the reactions itself can make up for it.

Bloom 2 Team

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

Tartaglia can function as the main Hydro applier in any Bloom team comp, whether if it's Hyperbloom or Burgeon. His damage may be lower compared to a standard vaporize Team comp, but the reactions itself can make up for it.

Tartaglia's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Melee stance and Riptide provide incredibly fast Hydro application to set up reactions like Vaporize or Electro-Charged.
  • Riptide damage increases exponentially the more enemies there are.
  • High damage scaling on the multipliers of his Elemental Burst.

Weaknesses

  • Rotation requires careful planning and cooldown management to master.
  • Cooldown reduction is locked behind constellations.

Thoma's Weapons

Burgeon Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Kitain Cross Spear

Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Dragon's Bane

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Pyro by 20%.

    Moonpiercer

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Revival will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 16% ATK for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

One of Thoma's most popular Sub-DPS role is in a Burgeon Team Comp with him as the triggerer. He will need to use as much Elemental Mastery as possible in order to max out his Burgeon damage, and Energy Recharge to refill his Elemental Burst as soon as possible especially if he's not at C4.

Paradise Lost is only slightly better then Gilded Dreams, so feel free to choose whichever artifact set has the better substats for you.

Shielder Support

Best Weapon

Favonius Lance

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Black Tassel

    Increases DMG against slimes by 40%.

    Engulfing Lightning

    ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

Comment

This Thoma Support build is all about the shields he generates to protect the entire party. Focus on getting HP, and Energy Recharge stats of more than 200%, for stronger shields and faster energy renegeration for his Elemental Burst.

You may also equip Noblesse Oblige instead should you wish for more offensive buffs.

Thoma's Artifacts

Burgeon Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

One of Thoma's most popular Sub-DPS role is in a Burgeon Team Comp with him as the triggerer. He will need to use as much Elemental Mastery as possible in order to max out his Burgeon damage, and Energy Recharge to refill his Elemental Burst as soon as possible especially if he's not at C4.

Paradise Lost is only slightly better then Gilded Dreams, so feel free to choose whichever artifact set has the better substats for you.

Shielder Support

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Secondary Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Thoma Support build is all about the shields he generates to protect the entire party. Focus on getting HP, and Energy Recharge stats of more than 200%, for stronger shields and faster energy renegeration for his Elemental Burst.

You may also equip Noblesse Oblige instead should you wish for more offensive buffs.

Thoma's Teams

Burgeon 1 Team

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

This Burgeon Team comp has Thoma acting as the Pyro Trigger for the reaction. You'll have to use powerful Hydro applications from characters like Xingqiu to prevent Thoma from accidentally Burning the enemy instead.

Burgeon 2 Team

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

This Burgeon Team comp has Thoma acting as the Pyro Trigger for the reaction. You'll have to use powerful Hydro applications from characters like Xingqiu to prevent Thoma from accidentally Burning the enemy instead.

Pyro Shielder Support 1 Team

Thoma

Support

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

In this team comp, Thoma provides shields to protect your Main DPS. It is especially decent to use if you have his buffs at C6. You'll have to be careful as to not have him steal reactions from your Main DPS due to his slow application however.

Pyro Shielder Support 2 Team

Thoma

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Kazuha

Support

Bennett

Support

In this team comp, Thoma provides shields to protect your Main DPS. It is especially decent to use if you have his buffs at C6. You'll have to be careful as to not have him steal reactions from your Main DPS due to his slow application however.

Triple-Geo Flex Support Team

Thoma

Support

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Thoma is an excellent choice for this Triple Geo team comp for Itto. Thoma will work as the Shielder and off-field Pyro damage that will put the Pyro Aura on enemies to trigger the Crystalize reaction, and activate Geo resonance.

Thoma's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Provide shields with Elemental Skill and Burst.
  • Can apply off-field Pyro reactions with Elemental Burst.
  • C6 provides a boost to party's Normal, Charged, and Plunge Attacks.

Weaknesses

  • High Energy Cost for his Elemental Burst.
  • Long Elemental Skill CD.
  • Lackluster DMG scaling outside of Burgeon.

Tighnari's Weapons

Dendro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Hunter's Path

Gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain the Tireless Hunt effect after hitting an opponent with a Charged Attack. This effect increases Charged Attack DMG by 160% of Elemental Mastery. This effect will be removed after 12 Charged Attacks or 10s. Only 1 instance of Tireless Hunt can be gained every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s

    Scion of the Blazing Sun

    After a Charged Attack hits an opponent, a Sunfire Arrow will descend upon the opponent hit, dealing 60% ATK as DMG, and applying the Heartsearer effect to the opponent damaged by said Arrow for 10s. Opponents affected by Heartsearer take 28% more Charged Attack DMG from the wielder. A Sunfire Arrow can be triggered once every 10s.

Comment

This Main DPS build for Tighnari focuses on increasing his overall damage from all sources. This is the best set for Tighnari only if there are other Dendro characters who can carry the Deepwood Memories set for him.

Charged Attack Main DPS

Best Weapon

Hunter's Path

Gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain the Tireless Hunt effect after hitting an opponent with a Charged Attack. This effect increases Charged Attack DMG by 160% of Elemental Mastery. This effect will be removed after 12 Charged Attacks or 10s. Only 1 instance of Tireless Hunt can be gained every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    The First Great Magic

    DMG dealt by Charged Attacks increased by 16%. For every party member with the same Elemental Type as the wielder (including the wielder themselves), gain 1 Gimmick stack. For every party member with a different Elemental Type from the wielder, gain 1 Theatrics stack. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Gimmick stacks, ATK will be increased by 16%/32%/48%. When the wielder has 1/2/3 or more Theatrics stacks, Movement SPD will be increased by 4%/7%/10%.

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    Scion of the Blazing Sun

    After a Charged Attack hits an opponent, a Sunfire Arrow will descend upon the opponent hit, dealing 60% ATK as DMG, and applying the Heartsearer effect to the opponent damaged by said Arrow for 10s. Opponents affected by Heartsearer take 28% more Charged Attack DMG from the wielder. A Sunfire Arrow can be triggered once every 10s.

Comment

This Main DPS build for Tighnari focuses more on his Charged Attacks and triggering the Spread Elemental Reaction. This set should only be used if a second Dendro character is already carrying the Deepwood set.

Tighnari's Artifacts

Dendro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Main DPS build for Tighnari focuses on increasing his overall damage from all sources. This is the best set for Tighnari only if there are other Dendro characters who can carry the Deepwood Memories set for him.

Charged Attack Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Wanderer's Troupe

2-Piece: Increases Elemental Mastery by 80

4-Piece: Increases Charged Attack DMG by 35% if the character uses a Catalyst or a Bow.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Main DPS build for Tighnari focuses more on his Charged Attacks and triggering the Spread Elemental Reaction. This set should only be used if a second Dendro character is already carrying the Deepwood set.

Tighnari's Teams

Spread Team

Tighnari

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This premium Tighnari Team Comp focuses on the Spread Dendro reaction. Fischl and Yae Miko will ensure that the Quicken Aura will remain active on the enemy, which helps Tighnari trigger the Spread reaction from his Charged Attacks and Burst. Zhongli can be replaced with characters that don't interfere with Dendro Reactions like Kazuha for Anemo or Diona for Cryo.

Quicken Team

Tighnari

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

This Tighnari team comp focuses on creating Quicken-type reactions and with Nahida acting as a debuffer by equiping the Deepwood artifact set. This team will chip away at the enemy's health with constant Spread and Aggravate damage!

Tighnari's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Strong ranged Charge Attacks.
  • Great single target damage.
  • Applies Dendro from multiple sources on his toolkit.
  • Strong Elemental Burst with a low Burst cost.

Weaknesses

  • Relies heavily on level 2 charged attacks.
  • Level 2 charged shot has a long windup without his Elemental Skill buff.

Traveler (Anemo)'s Weapons

Anemo Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Blade

    CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

This Traveler (Anemo) build focuses on shreding enemy RES through the use of the Viridescent Venerer set while also dealing a decent chunk of Anemo DMG.

Traveler (Anemo)'s Artifacts

Anemo Sub DPS

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Traveler (Anemo) build focuses on shreding enemy RES through the use of the Viridescent Venerer set while also dealing a decent chunk of Anemo DMG.

Traveler (Anemo)'s Teams

Premium Team

Traveler (Anemo)

Support

Klee

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Anemo Traveler can shred the elemental resistance of the enemies enabling Klee & Yelan to execute them easily. She can also apply elemental resistance debuff based on the absorbed element. Klee acts as the main DPS who can consistently deal Pyro DMG that can be swirled by Anemo Traveler & proc vaporize with Yelan. In addition, the remaining mines from her Skill can be displaced with Anemo Traveler's Skill & Burst. Can decrease the enemies' DEF at constellation 2. Bennett enables Pyro resonance with Klee. He can also provide cleansing heal & ATK buff with his Burst. Yelan's Burst can perform coordinated Hydro attacks with Klee that can inflict powerful vaporize DMG.

Free-to-Play Team

Traveler (Anemo)

Support

Lisa

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

Anemo Traveler can shred the elemental resistance of enemies. Lisa is a great Electro DPS that can decrease the enemies' DEF with her Burst. In addition, Electro is great to pair with Pyro & Hydro as the synergy between the 3 mentioned elements compliments each other. Xiangling's abilities can deal strong Pyro DMG that can also proc overload & vaporize. Barbara is a great healer & Hydro applicator.

Traveler (Anemo)'s Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill and Burst offers crowd control.
  • Normal Attack combo can apply Anemo.
  • Elemental Skill and Burst can absorb and deal addititonal Elemental DMG.
  • 6th Constellation can reduce enemy Elemental RES.

Weaknesses

  • Unable to move when charging up Elemental Skill.
  • Skills have a long cooldown.
  • Elemental Burst can easily miss, if not careful with positioning.

Traveler (Geo)'s Weapons

Geo Burst Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Summit Shaper

    Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, ATK increase effect is increased by 100%.

    Festering Desire

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 16% and Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Harbinger of Dawn

    When HP is above 90%, increases CRIT Rate by 14%.

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for the Traveler focuses on quickly dealing Elemental Skill and Burst DMG to enemies and then swapping out. It's important to have their Elemental Burst always ready for this build since it provides a big chunk of DMG.

Traveler (Geo)'s Artifacts

Geo Burst Sub DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%.

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for the Traveler focuses on quickly dealing Elemental Skill and Burst DMG to enemies and then swapping out. It's important to have their Elemental Burst always ready for this build since it provides a big chunk of DMG.

Traveler (Geo)'s Teams

Premium Team

Traveler (Geo)

Support

Yae Miko

Main DPS

Mona

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

The Traveler's role is to use Elemental Skill & Burst which produces Geo construct that pulsates with Zhongli's monolith that deals Geo DMG. Zhongli's shield can be sustained so it is ok to not use any healer. Geo resonance with the Geo Traveler can also increase damage output of the team. Yae Miko's Skill & Burst can damage the enemies without getting blocked by the Geo construct created by Geo Traveler & Zhongli. Mona' Skill can proc electro-charged with Yae Miko. She can deal powerful Hydro damage while boosting the team's overall damage with her Burst.

Free-To-Play Team

Traveler (Geo)

Support

Noelle

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Consistently use Geo Traveler's Skill & Burst. Stay inside the radius of Burst Geo construct to gain additional CRIT Rate. Noelle is a great healer who has a shield and can also act as a main DPS. Xiangling is a great off-field Pyro DPS who can proc melt reaction with Kaeya. Kaeya is a great Cryo DPS who can apply Cryo that can proc melt and deal additional damage.

Traveler (Geo)'s Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill creates a platform.
  • Elemental Burst can be used to block DMG.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Skill can block your teammates.
  • Overall firepower is not that impressive.

Traveler (Electro)'s Weapons

Electro Burst Support

Best Weapon

Skyward Blade

CRIT Rate increased by 4%. Gains Skypiercing Might upon using an Elemental Burst: Increases Movement SPD by 10%, increases ATK SPD by 10%, and increases the DMG of Normal and Charged Attack hits by 20% for 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Comment

As a support, the Electro Traveler's goal is to increase the party's Energy Recharge with the Elemental Skill. The Elemental Burst can also be used to lower Electro RES, increase Energy Recharge, and even trigger Noblesse Oblige.

Traveler (Electro)'s Artifacts

Electro Burst Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

As a support, the Electro Traveler's goal is to increase the party's Energy Recharge with the Elemental Skill. The Elemental Burst can also be used to lower Electro RES, increase Energy Recharge, and even trigger Noblesse Oblige.

Traveler (Electro)'s Teams

Premium Team

Traveler (Electro)

Support

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Kazuha

Support

Diona

Support

Electro Traveler is a great energy support due to his skill. He can easily work with any team comp especially those who requires energy for Elemental Burst. Childe is able to apply hydro to multiple enemies, making him great with Traveler as they can easily Electrocharge enemies. Crowd control to easily apply elemental combos and bursts to enemies. Use Kazuha's skill to group enemies and buff the team. Diona can provide powerful shields and healing sustaining the team.

Free To Play Team

Traveler (Electro)

Support

Xiangling

Main DPS

Kaeya

Sub-DPS

Barbara

Support

Xiangling will act as the main DPS. Overcharged and additional damage with Electro Traveler. Can easily work as a sub-dps and create Superconduct with Electro Traveler. Heal Electro Traveler both when she's in and out of the field.

Traveler (Electro)'s Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill and Burst provides a boost to energy recharge and elemental energy recovery.
  • Elemental Burst provides continuous off-field Electro DMG.

Weaknesses

  • High Energy Cost in their Elemental Burst.
  • Low Base DMG.

Traveler (Dendro)'s Weapons

All-Rounder Dendro Build

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

This is the best Sub-DPS and Support build for the Dendro Traveler if ther are no other Dendro characters are using the Deepwood artifact set. You will need +180% Energy Recharge to Burst off cooldown, but this can be flexible depending on who your other teammates are.

Dendro Reaction Build

Best Weapon

Freedom-Sworn

Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    Sacrificial Sword

    After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

Comment

This is the best build and artifact set for the Dendro Traveler if there is already another Dendro character using the Deepwood artifact set. This build is more suited for a Sub-DPS build. You will still need around +180% Energy Recharge to Burst off cooldown.

Traveler (Dendro)'s Artifacts

All-Rounder Dendro Build

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge%
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This is the best Sub-DPS and Support build for the Dendro Traveler if ther are no other Dendro characters are using the Deepwood artifact set. You will need +180% Energy Recharge to Burst off cooldown, but this can be flexible depending on who your other teammates are.

Dendro Reaction Build

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Dendro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge%
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This is the best build and artifact set for the Dendro Traveler if there is already another Dendro character using the Deepwood artifact set. This build is more suited for a Sub-DPS build. You will still need around +180% Energy Recharge to Burst off cooldown.

Traveler (Dendro)'s Teams

Premium Aggravate Team

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Jean

Support

This premium Dendro Traveler team focuses on the Aggravate Dendro reaction. Raiden tremendously helps in lowering the Traveler's Elemental Recharge requirements. Jean will serve as a debuffer and healer with the Viridescent Venerer set. Kazuha can replace Jean if you need more damage..

Hyperbloom Team

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

This Dendro team comp focuses on triggering the Electro-Charged reaction to create Dendro Cores and triggering Sprawling Shots. Any Hydro character can fill the role of Main DPS as the enabler for triggering the reactions!

Bloom Team

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

This team focuses on applying Dendro on Wet enemies while attacking with an On-Field Hydro character. This will enable Dendro Cores to explode on their own by creating multiple other Dendro Cores. Nilou is key to this team as she can significantly boost Bloom damage with her passive.

Burning Team

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

This Burning team with the Dendro Traveler has Collei or any other Dendro character acting as the Main DPS to help apply Dendro on enemies. Thoma or Xinyan will provide addtional off-field Pyro DMG and shields.

Traveler (Dendro)'s Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Good off-field Dendro damage.
  • Viable as second Sub-DPS character in any Dendro team comp.
  • Higher Constellations unlocks more support tools.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst Cost.
  • Lea Lotus Lamp has slow attacks without the Electro Transfiguration.

Traveler (Hydro)'s Weapons

All-Purpose Hydro

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Cutter

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Wolf-Fang

    DMG dealt by Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst is increased by 16%. When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. When an Elemental Burst hits an opponent, its CRIT Rate will be increased by 2%. Both of these effects last 10s separately, have 4 max stacks, and can be triggered once every 0.1s.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Finale of the Deep

    When using an Elemental Skill, ATK will be increased by 12% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 25% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, a maximum of 150 ATK will be gained based on 2.4% of the Bond when cleared for 15s.

    Fleuve Cendre Ferryman

    Increases Elemental Skill CRIT Rate by 8%. Additionally, increases Energy Recharge by 16% for 5s after using an Elemental Skill.

Comment

This Sub DPS build for Hydro Traveler lets you take advantage on increasing the damage of their Elemental Skill on Hydro-related reactions except Bloom. Using the Golden Troupe won't benefit your Burst, but the damage potential of your Skill compensates the loss.

You may also use another 2-piece of Heart of Depth if you wish to balance the Burst damage.

Bloom Driver

Best Weapon

Xiphos' Moonlight

The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 0.036% Energy Recharge for each point of Elemental Mastery they possess for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Iron Sting

    Dealing Elemental DMG increases all DMG by 6% for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can occur once every 1s.

    Toukabou Shigure

    After an attack hits opponents, it will inflict an instance of Cursed Parasol upon one of them for 10s. This effect can be triggered once every 15s. If this opponent is taken out during Cursed Parasol’s duration, Cursed Parasol’s CD will be refreshed immediately. The character wielding this weapon will deal 16% more DMG to the opponent affected by Cursed Parasol.

Comment

If you wish to use Hydro Traveler for Bloom Teams, build Elemental Mastery and Energy Recharge to increase their efficiency in creating bloom cores.

Note that the Hydro Traveler's Burst travels in a straight line with a short duration, so it's unreliable to use as your sole Hydro applicator.

Traveler (Hydro)'s Artifacts

All-Rounder Dendro Build

Best Artifact Set

&

Nymph's Dream & Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Hydro DMG bonus +15%

4-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/HP%
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%/HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±180% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Sub DPS build for Hydro Traveler lets you take advantage on increasing the damage of their Elemental Skill on Hydro-related reactions except Bloom. Using the Golden Troupe won't benefit your Burst, but the damage potential of your Skill compensates the loss.

You may also use another 2-piece of Heart of Depth if you wish to balance the Burst damage.

Bloom Driver

Best Artifact Set

Flower of Paradise Lost

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: The equipping character's Bloom, Hyperbloom, and Burgeon reaction DMG are increased by 40%. Additionally, after the equipping character triggers Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, they will gain another 25% bonus to the effect mentioned prior. Each stack of this lasts 10s. Max 4 stacks simultaneously. This effect can only be triggered once per second. The character who equips this can still trigger its effects when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery/CRIT Rate (if using Favonius Sword)

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate (if using Favonius Sword)
  • Energy Recharge%
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

If you wish to use Hydro Traveler for Bloom Teams, build Elemental Mastery and Energy Recharge to increase their efficiency in creating bloom cores.

Note that the Hydro Traveler's Burst travels in a straight line with a short duration, so it's unreliable to use as your sole Hydro applicator.

Traveler (Hydro)'s Teams

Freeze Team

Traveler (Hydro)

Sub-DPS

Ayaka

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Diona

Support

In a Freeze team, the Hydro Traveler can act as a second DPS after a Cryo Main DPS like Ayaka unleshes their Elemental Burst. You can swirl both Hydro and Cryo with Kazuha, which should compensate the Traveler's lack of AoE outside of their burst.

Nilou Bloom 1 Team

Traveler (Hydro)

Sub-DPS

Nilou

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Support

These team compositions specialize in the use of Dendro cores. Nilou and Nahida can help generate Dendro Cores easily, while a healer like Yaoyao or Baizhu can restore the party's HP.

Nilou Bloom 2 Team

Traveler (Hydro)

Sub-DPS

Nilou

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

These team compositions specialize in the use of Dendro cores. Nilou and Nahida can help generate Dendro Cores easily, while a healer like Yaoyao or Baizhu can restore the party's HP.

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Traveler (Hydro)

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Yaoyao

Support

The Hydro Traveler can function as a Bloom enabler. They can work together with Dendro characters like Nahida or Alhaitham to generate Bloom cores. Xingqiu or Yelan can provide extra Hydro application to help with said reaction. Raiden or Shinobu can trigger the the Dendro cores created by the characters mentioned and the latter can provide healing to keep the party alive.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Traveler (Hydro)

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

The Hydro Traveler can function as a Bloom enabler. They can work together with Dendro characters like Nahida or Alhaitham to generate Bloom cores. Xingqiu or Yelan can provide extra Hydro application to help with said reaction. Raiden or Shinobu can trigger the the Dendro cores created by the characters mentioned and the latter can provide healing to keep the party alive.

Traveler (Hydro)'s Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • F2P alternative Sub-DPS in any Bloom team comps aside from Burgeon.
  • Higher Constellations unlock more support tools.

Weaknesses

  • Lackluster Hydro Application.
  • DMG Split Scales from HP and ATK stats.
  • High Elemental Burst Cost.
  • Short Elemental Burst duration below C2.
  • Relatively low DMG scaling.

Venti's Weapons

Elemental Mastery Swirl

Best Weapon

Elegy for the End

Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

Alternative Weapons

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%

    Fading Twilight

    Has three states, Evengleam, Afterglow, and Dawnblaze, which increases DMG dealt by 6%/10%/14% respectively. When attacks hit opponents, this weapon will switch to the next state. This weapon can change states once every 7s. The character equipping this weapon can still trigger the state switch while not on the field.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This sub-DPS build for Venti focuses on stacking as much Elemental Mastery as possible for his Elemental Absorption damage. Using Elemental Mastery offers the best damage against multiple enemies.

Crit Burst DPS

Best Weapon

Aqua Simulacra

HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

Alternative Weapons

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Skyward Harp

    Increases CRIT DMG by 20%. Hits have a 60% chance to inflict a small AoE attack, dealing 125% Physical ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 4s.

    The Stringless

    Increases Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 24%.

Comment

You may use a CRIT build if you cannot find Elemental Mastery main stat artifacts yet. It still offers good damage and may compete with the Elemental Mastery build with enough investment.

Venti's Artifacts

Elemental Mastery Swirl

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This sub-DPS build for Venti focuses on stacking as much Elemental Mastery as possible for his Elemental Absorption damage. Using Elemental Mastery offers the best damage against multiple enemies.

Crit Burst DPS

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

You may use a CRIT build if you cannot find Elemental Mastery main stat artifacts yet. It still offers good damage and may compete with the Elemental Mastery build with enough investment.

Venti's Teams

Venti is a staple for different Freeze comps thanks to his ability to absorb and Swirl Cryo while enemies are applied with Hydro.

Venti is a staple for different Freeze comps thanks to his ability to absorb and Swirl Cryo while enemies are applied with Hydro.

Venti

Support

Raiden

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

While this team does not have a set DPS, the Hyperbloom team can pull off significant instances of damage. Just be sure to have investment in Elemental Mastery for Fischl or Raiden, as they are the designated drivers for Hyperbloom.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Venti

Support

Fischl

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Collei

Support

While this team does not have a set DPS, the Hyperbloom team can pull off significant instances of damage. Just be sure to have investment in Elemental Mastery for Fischl or Raiden, as they are the designated drivers for Hyperbloom.

Rainbow Team

Venti

Sub-DPS

Ayato

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Team comps consisting of multiple unique elements to create concoctions of Elemental Reactions like Electro-Charged + Vaporize are good with Venti's Elemental Burst. Characters like Ayato or Layla can provide wide AoE coverage to multiple enemies at once.

Venti's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Regenerates Energy fast to use his burst off-cooldown.
  • Best Crowd Control for lighter enemies with Elemental Burst.
  • Can fit in any team comp if AoE crowd control is required.
  • Elemental Skill creates a wind current for exploration.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Burst is not good against heavier enemies or single-target bosses.

Wanderer's Weapons

Standard Anemo DPS

Best Weapon

Tulaytullah's Remembrance

Normal Attack SPD is increased by 10%. After the wielder unleashes an Elemental Skill, Normal Attack DMG will increase by 4.8% every second for 14s. After hitting an opponent with a Normal Attack during this duration, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 9.6%. This increase can be triggered once every 0.3s. The maximum Normal Attack DMG increase per single duration of the overall effect is 48%.

Alternative Weapons

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Ballad of the Boundless Blue

    Within 6s after Normal or Charged Attacks hit an opponent, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 8% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 6%. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s.

    Mappa Mare (F2P Option)

    Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 8% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks

Comment

The Wanderer (Scaramouche)'s best DPS build uses the Desert Pavilion artifact set with Anemo DMG and CRIT stats for maximum damage.

Ideally, you would want at least 120% Energy Recharge plus another Anemo character in the party to be able to use the Wanderer's Elemental Burst often.

Marechaussee Hunter DPS

Best Weapon

Cashflow Supervision

ATK is increased by 16%. When current HP increases or decreases, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 16% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 14% for 4s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the wielder has 3 stacks, ATK SPD will be increased by 8%.

Alternative Weapons

    Tulaytullah's Remembrance

    Normal Attack SPD is increased by 10%. After the wielder unleashes an Elemental Skill, Normal Attack DMG will increase by 4.8% every second for 14s. After hitting an opponent with a Normal Attack during this duration, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 9.6%. This increase can be triggered once every 0.3s. The maximum Normal Attack DMG increase per single duration of the overall effect is 48%.

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Blackcliff Agate

    After defeating an enemy, ATK is increased by 12% for 30s. This effect has a maximum of 3 stacks, and the duration of each stack is independent of the others.

Comment

Wanderer is a viable user of Marechaussee Hunter when paired with Furina, giving him higher damage potentials and allowing him to forego some CRIT Rate for more CRIT DMG.

When Wanderer is running this build, Cashflow Supervision becomes his best-in-slot, overtaking Tulaytullah's Remembrance if Wanderer's HP consistently increases and decreases.

Wanderer's Artifacts

Standard Anemo DPS

Best Artifact Set

Desert Pavilion Chronicle

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When Charged Attacks hit opponents, the equipping character's Normal Attack speed will increase by 10% while Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG will increase by 40% for 15s

Secondary Artifact Set

Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: When casting an Elemental Skill, if the character has 15 or more Energy, they lose 15 Energy and Normal/Charge/Plunging Attack DMG is increased by 50% for 10s. This effect will not trigger again during that duration.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±120% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

The Wanderer (Scaramouche)'s best DPS build uses the Desert Pavilion artifact set with Anemo DMG and CRIT stats for maximum damage.

Ideally, you would want at least 120% Energy Recharge plus another Anemo character in the party to be able to use the Wanderer's Elemental Burst often.

Marechaussee Hunter DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±130% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Wanderer is a viable user of Marechaussee Hunter when paired with Furina, giving him higher damage potentials and allowing him to forego some CRIT Rate for more CRIT DMG.

When Wanderer is running this build, Cashflow Supervision becomes his best-in-slot, overtaking Tulaytullah's Remembrance if Wanderer's HP consistently increases and decreases.

Wanderer's Teams

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Thoma

Support

Because of his below average resistance to interruption when floating, having Wanderer be protected with a shield is an option to ease this worry, but you will need Faruzan and Bennett to cover the lack of DPS from the shielders.
