Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Zhongli

Support

Because of his below average resistance to interruption when floating, having Wanderer be protected with a shield is an option to ease this worry, but you will need Faruzan and Bennett to cover the lack of DPS from the shielders.

Double Pyro 1 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Use Faruzan and Bennett's Elemental Bursts to buff the Wanderer's ATK and Anemo DMG. Xiangling can provide additional off-field DPS that compliment well with Wanderer's Normal Attacks. You can also replace Faruzan with Xingqiu or Yelan for a Standard Vaporize team composition.

Double Pyro 2 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Use Faruzan and Bennett's Elemental Bursts to buff the Wanderer's ATK and Anemo DMG. Xiangling can provide additional off-field DPS that compliment well with Wanderer's Normal Attacks. You can also replace Faruzan with Xingqiu or Yelan for a Standard Vaporize team composition.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

Focus on Swirling both Electro and Hydro to trigger multiple bouts of Electro-Charged reactions. You can choose either Fischl for DMG and particle generation or Shinobu for healing and survivability.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Focus on Swirling both Electro and Hydro to trigger multiple bouts of Electro-Charged reactions. You can choose either Fischl for DMG and particle generation or Shinobu for healing and survivability.

Hypercarry 1 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Jean

Support

Bennett

Support

Due to being an Anemo unit with Faruzan as a premier support, Wanderer is able to function as a hypercarry when given proper units to work with. The third members of each team provide different potencies to their buffs, with C4 Jean decreasing Anemo resistance, Yun Jin providing Normal Attack damage, and Furina giving an overall damage buff.

Hypercarry 2 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Bennett

Support

Due to being an Anemo unit with Faruzan as a premier support, Wanderer is able to function as a hypercarry when given proper units to work with. The third members of each team provide different potencies to their buffs, with C4 Jean decreasing Anemo resistance, Yun Jin providing Normal Attack damage, and Furina giving an overall damage buff.

Hypercarry 3 Team

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

Bennett

Support

Due to being an Anemo unit with Faruzan as a premier support, Wanderer is able to function as a hypercarry when given proper units to work with. The third members of each team provide different potencies to their buffs, with C4 Jean decreasing Anemo resistance, Yun Jin providing Normal Attack damage, and Furina giving an overall damage buff.

Wanderer's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Normal Attacks have a wide AoE and can home in on enemies.
  • Can do an infinite number of strong Charged Attacks when floating.
  • Flexible rotations due to low cooldowns.
  • Amazing toolkit for exploration.

Weaknesses

  • Low Base DMG without buffs or reactions.
  • Low Base HP and DEF.
  • No resistance to interruption.
  • Even when floating, Wanderer can still get hit by attacks.
  • Recommended to have at least one shielder or healer in any team comp to avoid unnecessary dodging.

Wriothesley's Weapons

Marechaussee Hunter Cryo DPS

Best Weapon

Cashflow Supervision

ATK is increased by 16%. When current HP increases or decreases, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 16% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 14% for 4s. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the wielder has 3 stacks, ATK SPD will be increased by 8%.

Alternative Weapons

    Tulaytullah's Remembrance

    Normal Attack SPD is increased by 10%. After the wielder unleashes an Elemental Skill, Normal Attack DMG will increase by 4.8% every second for 14s. After hitting an opponent with a Normal Attack during this duration, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 9.6%. This increase can be triggered once every 0.3s. The maximum Normal Attack DMG increase per single duration of the overall effect is 48%.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

Comment

Taking his HP sacrificing mechanic into account, Marechaussee Hunter is the best build for Wriothesley as it allows him to build more CRIT DMG to maximize his Normal and Charged Attack damage.

Apart from that, pairing him up with a second Cryo character for Cryo Resonance will give him even more CRIT Rate. This will give you more leeway for focusing on other stats, mainly CRIT DMG.

Wriothesley's Artifacts

Marechaussee Hunter Cryo DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Cryo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

Taking his HP sacrificing mechanic into account, Marechaussee Hunter is the best build for Wriothesley as it allows him to build more CRIT DMG to maximize his Normal and Charged Attack damage.

Apart from that, pairing him up with a second Cryo character for Cryo Resonance will give him even more CRIT Rate. This will give you more leeway for focusing on other stats, mainly CRIT DMG.

Wriothesley's Teams

Freeze 1 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Charlotte

Support

Freeze teams excel with Wriothesley especially if he has Furina, as her buffs complement Wriothesley's HP increase and decrease mechanic. You will also need a strong healer to counteract Furina's HP drain, but you may opt in using characters like Yelan or Xingqiu should you wish to run other supports.

Freeze 2 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Sub-DPS

Mika

Support

Freeze teams excel with Wriothesley especially if he has Furina, as her buffs complement Wriothesley's HP increase and decrease mechanic. You will also need a strong healer to counteract Furina's HP drain, but you may opt in using characters like Yelan or Xingqiu should you wish to run other supports.

Freeze 3 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Freeze teams excel with Wriothesley especially if he has Furina, as her buffs complement Wriothesley's HP increase and decrease mechanic. You will also need a strong healer to counteract Furina's HP drain, but you may opt in using characters like Yelan or Xingqiu should you wish to run other supports.

Melt Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Another viable option for maximizing Wriothesley's DMG output is through the Melt reaction, whether it be direct Melt or reverse Melt. Kazuha can Swirl elements around for easier reactions. Xiangling is undoubtedly one of the best Pyro applicators in the game, and Bennett can provide a myriad of supports for Wriothesley, from DMG boosts to helping with the fluctuation of his HP. Thoma is also reliable for Pyro and shield support.

Burning Melt 1 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

An alternative team for Melt is the Burning combination of Dendro and Pyro to create a strong Pyro Aura that Wriothesley can Melt. As long as you can sustain both elements to the enemy, it's easy for Wriothesley to trigger that reaction and deal massive damage!

Burning Melt 2 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

An alternative team for Melt is the Burning combination of Dendro and Pyro to create a strong Pyro Aura that Wriothesley can Melt. As long as you can sustain both elements to the enemy, it's easy for Wriothesley to trigger that reaction and deal massive damage!

Hyperfridge 1 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS/Support

Pairing Cryo with a Bloom or Hyperbloom team can add reactions into the mix, ranging from Frozen to Superconduct along with the Dendro-related reactions. Yelan and Xingqiu will apply Hydro to enemies with every hit Wriothesley's Normal Attack does, and Nahida and Collei will apply Dendro regularly. You will need an Electro who can trigger the cores off-field as well, like Shinobu or Raiden!

Hyperfridge 2 Team

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Collei

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS/Support

Pairing Cryo with a Bloom or Hyperbloom team can add reactions into the mix, ranging from Frozen to Superconduct along with the Dendro-related reactions. Yelan and Xingqiu will apply Hydro to enemies with every hit Wriothesley's Normal Attack does, and Nahida and Collei will apply Dendro regularly. You will need an Electro who can trigger the cores off-field as well, like Shinobu or Raiden!

Wriothesley's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Constant Cryo usage useful for Elemental Reactions such as Freeze due to being a catalyst user.
  • Relies on Normal Attacks for big and constant DMG, which lessens dependence on Elemental Skill and Burst CD.
  • High DMG scaling and potential for Melt.
  • Capable of self-healing should his HP fall too low.
  • Can easily cross waters by ice-bridging as a catalyst user.

Weaknesses

  • Normal Attack AoE is relatively small; better suited against bosses than mobs, unless you can group those enemies together.
  • Without C1, his Special Charged Attack and self-healing has a 5s cooldown and cannot be activated efficiently with certain healers.

Xiangling's Weapons

Pyro Sub DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of the Scarlet Sands

The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Engulfing Lightning

    ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for Xiangling focuses on increasing the DMG she provides with her Elemental Burst. Elemental Mastery Main Stats should only be considered if Xiangling will be triggering Elemental Reactions. Generally, ATK% for the Sands piece will be the better choice.

Burst Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Engulfing Lightning

ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Staff of the Scarlet Sands

    The equipping character gains 52% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. When an Elemental Skill hits opponents, the Dream of the Scarlet Sands effect will be gained for 10s: The equipping character will gain 28% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK. Max 3 stacks.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

Comment

Compared to the Pyro Sub-DPS build, this one is more suited for Xiangling if she needs more Energy Recharge to reliably have her Elemental Burst ready after cooldown. This build is best used for teams where there isn't much Pyro Energy Particles to go around like in solo Pyro Team comps.

Xiangling's Artifacts

Pyro Sub DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for Xiangling focuses on increasing the DMG she provides with her Elemental Burst. Elemental Mastery Main Stats should only be considered if Xiangling will be triggering Elemental Reactions. Generally, ATK% for the Sands piece will be the better choice.

Burst Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Compared to the Pyro Sub-DPS build, this one is more suited for Xiangling if she needs more Energy Recharge to reliably have her Elemental Burst ready after cooldown. This build is best used for teams where there isn't much Pyro Energy Particles to go around like in solo Pyro Team comps.

Xiangling's Teams

Xiangling Bennett-Duo 1 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xiangling is often paired with Bennett due to his ability to enhance nearly all aspects of her kit, allowing her the chance to forego stats such as ATK and Energy Recharge in exchange for more CRIT and Elemental Mastery. These two are then slotted into teams together, with Vaporize teams being the more common choice due to Xiangling's Off-Field Pyro Application in tandem with the Hydro DPS raw damage.

Xiangling Bennett-Duo 2 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xiangling is often paired with Bennett due to his ability to enhance nearly all aspects of her kit, allowing her the chance to forego stats such as ATK and Energy Recharge in exchange for more CRIT and Elemental Mastery. These two are then slotted into teams together, with Vaporize teams being the more common choice due to Xiangling's Off-Field Pyro Application in tandem with the Hydro DPS raw damage.

Xiangling Bennett-Duo 3 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Navia

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xiangling is often paired with Bennett due to his ability to enhance nearly all aspects of her kit, allowing her the chance to forego stats such as ATK and Energy Recharge in exchange for more CRIT and Elemental Mastery. These two are then slotted into teams together, with Vaporize teams being the more common choice due to Xiangling's Off-Field Pyro Application in tandem with the Hydro DPS raw damage.

Overvape 1 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xiangling can also be placed in Overvape teams together, most often paired with an On-Field DPS like Raiden Shogun, or with two other Sub-DPS units like Xingqiu and Fischl for a quickswap team. These teams excel at triggering multiple elemental reactions due to the strong Off-Field presence of the units involved, and can even be paired with an Anemo Driver to enhance the damage.

Overvape 2 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Xiangling can also be placed in Overvape teams together, most often paired with an On-Field DPS like Raiden Shogun, or with two other Sub-DPS units like Xingqiu and Fischl for a quickswap team. These teams excel at triggering multiple elemental reactions due to the strong Off-Field presence of the units involved, and can even be paired with an Anemo Driver to enhance the damage.

Melt 1 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Xiangling's Off-Field Pyro Application makes her a prime candidate for any form of a Melt team, serving as either the trigger for Reverse Melt by applying Pyro first, or being the Main Melt unit.

Melt 2 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Wriothesley

Main DPS

Rosaria

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Xiangling's Off-Field Pyro Application makes her a prime candidate for any form of a Melt team, serving as either the trigger for Reverse Melt by applying Pyro first, or being the Main Melt unit.

Burning 1 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

With the addition of Dendro units like Nahida and Emilie, Xiangling can be used as a Burning team trigger in addition to already having good damage. Being able to apply Burning results in the enemy having less downtime between damage as they will always be taking damage from the Burn while also taking damage from Xiangling's abilities.

Burning 2 Team

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

With the addition of Dendro units like Nahida and Emilie, Xiangling can be used as a Burning team trigger in addition to already having good damage. Being able to apply Burning results in the enemy having less downtime between damage as they will always be taking damage from the Burn while also taking damage from Xiangling's abilities.

Xiangling's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • High AoE Elemental Burst DMG.
  • Elemental Burst has strong Pyro application on enemies.
  • Elemental Burst retains its DMG buffs even after switching out.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst energy cost.
  • Elemental Skill does not deal consistent Pyro DMG.
  • Elemental Skill's attacks can be difficult to manage.

Xianyun's Weapons

Plunging Attack Support

Best Weapon

Crane's Echoing Call

After the equipping character hits an opponent with a Plunging Attack, all nearby party members' Plunging Attacks will deal 28% increased DMG for 20s. When nearby party members hit opponents with Plunging Attacks, they will restore 2.5 Energy to the equipping character. Energy can be restored this way every 0.7s, and can be triggered off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Memory of Dust

    Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, this ATK increase effect is increased by 100%

    Oathsworn Eye

    Increases Energy Recharge by 24% for 10s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

As the scaling of her healing and plunging buffs are based on her total ATK, Xianyun's best build are weapons that have an abundance of such stat like Oathsworn Eye. Try to have as much ATK and Energy Recharge as possible to fund her Elemental Burst!

Your artifacts depend on whether or not your party can benefit from Viridescent Venerer's res shred. Use Song of Days Past if your main damage dealer is a non-reactive DPS like Xiao. Otherwise, use Viridescent Venerer if your DPS can react with Anemo's swirls like Gaming or Diluc.

Burst Healer Support

Best Weapon

Crane's Echoing Call

After the equipping character hits an opponent with a Plunging Attack, all nearby party members' Plunging Attacks will deal 28% increased DMG for 20s. When nearby party members hit opponents with Plunging Attacks, they will restore 2.5 Energy to the equipping character. Energy can be restored this way every 0.7s, and can be triggered off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Oathsworn Eye

    Increases Energy Recharge by 24% for 10s after using an Elemental Skill.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Hakushin Ring

    After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 10% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

    Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

    When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Comment

This full healer build is for players who don't necessarily have Plunging characters and just wishes to play her as a generalist healer support. Her build will be similar but her circlet should use Healing Bonus instead for more healing.

She can also use Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers for the ATK buffs for her Main DPS. Otherwise, use ATK or Energy Recharge weapons if you don't have enough artifacts that can satisfy her energy cost requirements.

Plunging Attack DPS

Best Weapon

Crane's Echoing Call

After the equipping character hits an opponent with a Plunging Attack, all nearby party members' Plunging Attacks will deal 28% increased DMG for 20s. When nearby party members hit opponents with Plunging Attacks, they will restore 2.5 Energy to the equipping character. Energy can be restored this way every 0.7s, and can be triggered off-field.

Alternative Weapons

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

Comment

For players who want to strengthen plunging and jump buffs for herself, this Xianyun Main DPS build focuses on her personal DPS with CRIT, especially with her C6. Desert Pavilion Chronicle would be her best-in-slot to buff her Plunging Attacks.

Xianyun's Artifacts

Plunging Attack Support

Best Artifact Set

Viridescent Venerer

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Swirl DMG by 60%. Decreases opponent's Elemental RES to the element infused in the Swirl by 40% for 10s.

Secondary Artifact Set

Song of Days Past

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the equipping character heals a party member, the Yearning effect will be created for 6s, which records the total amount of healing provided (including overflow healing). When the duration expires, the Yearning effect will be transformed into the Waves of Days Past effect: When your active party member hits an opponent with a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Plunging Attack, Elemental Skill, or Elemental Burst, the DMG dealt will be increased by 8% of the total healing amount recorded by the Yearning effect. The Waves of Days Past effect is removed after it has taken effect 5 times or after 10s. A single instance of the Yearning effect can record up to 15,000 healing, and only a single instance can exist at once, but it can record the healing from multiple equipping characters. Equipping characters on standby can still trigger this effect.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%
  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: ATK%/Healing Bonus%

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

As the scaling of her healing and plunging buffs are based on her total ATK, Xianyun's best build are weapons that have an abundance of such stat like Oathsworn Eye. Try to have as much ATK and Energy Recharge as possible to fund her Elemental Burst!

Your artifacts depend on whether or not your party can benefit from Viridescent Venerer's res shred. Use Song of Days Past if your main damage dealer is a non-reactive DPS like Xiao. Otherwise, use Viridescent Venerer if your DPS can react with Anemo's swirls like Gaming or Diluc.

Burst Healer Support

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Secondary Artifact Set

Ocean-Hued Clam

2-Piece: Healing Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When the character with this artifact set heals a party member, 1 Foam will appear. It accumulates healed HP for 3 seconds, then explodes and deals 90% of the HP healed as DMG to nearby enemies. Max accumulated healing is 30,000 HP, including over-heal. There can only be 1 Foam active, but it stays even if you swap out. Foam CD is 3.5s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/ATK%
  • Goblet: ATK%
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus%

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

This full healer build is for players who don't necessarily have Plunging characters and just wishes to play her as a generalist healer support. Her build will be similar but her circlet should use Healing Bonus instead for more healing.

She can also use Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers for the ATK buffs for her Main DPS. Otherwise, use ATK or Energy Recharge weapons if you don't have enough artifacts that can satisfy her energy cost requirements.

Plunging Attack DPS

Best Artifact Set

Desert Pavilion Chronicle

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: When Charged Attacks hit opponents, the equipping character's Normal Attack speed will increase by 10% while Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG will increase by 40% for 15s

Secondary Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter (with Furina)

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

For players who want to strengthen plunging and jump buffs for herself, this Xianyun Main DPS build focuses on her personal DPS with CRIT, especially with her C6. Desert Pavilion Chronicle would be her best-in-slot to buff her Plunging Attacks.

Xianyun's Teams

Vaporize 1 Team

Xianyun

Sub-DPS

Gaming

Main DPS

Bennett

Support

Furina

Support

Teams with characters who can benefit from Xianyun's plunging utility and healing in tandem with Furina's buffs are her best teams for Viridescent Venerer teams. Vaporize is one such team comp. We recommend having a Main DPS that have high plunging attack scalings like Diluc, who also benefits from reactions with Hydro, are good to slot-in. Gaming, like Xiao, also plays around plunging attacks, and it is expected that they will pair well together. You may also play around Melt by having off-field applicators like Rosaria and Layla.

Vaporize 2 Team

Xianyun

Sub-DPS

Diluc

Main DPS

Bennett

Support

Furina

Support

Teams with characters who can benefit from Xianyun's plunging utility and healing in tandem with Furina's buffs are her best teams for Viridescent Venerer teams. Vaporize is one such team comp. We recommend having a Main DPS that have high plunging attack scalings like Diluc, who also benefits from reactions with Hydro, are good to slot-in. Gaming, like Xiao, also plays around plunging attacks, and it is expected that they will pair well together. You may also play around Melt by having off-field applicators like Rosaria and Layla.

Vaporize 3 Team

Xianyun

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Support

Furina

Support

Teams with characters who can benefit from Xianyun's plunging utility and healing in tandem with Furina's buffs are her best teams for Viridescent Venerer teams. Vaporize is one such team comp. We recommend having a Main DPS that have high plunging attack scalings like Diluc, who also benefits from reactions with Hydro, are good to slot-in. Gaming, like Xiao, also plays around plunging attacks, and it is expected that they will pair well together. You may also play around Melt by having off-field applicators like Rosaria and Layla.

Xianyun - Xiao Premium Team

Xianyun

Support

Xiao

Main DPS

Faruzan

Support

Furina

Sub-DPS/Support

Xiao has been the only character (before Gaming's release in 4.4) whose kit is designed around using Plunging Attacks. With Xianyun, his damage gets a big boost thanks to her. This team uses Song of Days Past for Xianyun. Xianyun and Xiao also synergize well with Furina, as the former can replenish the party's HP, and the latter can decrease his own by himself. Having Faruzan in this team, especially at C6, maximizes the damage you can possibly have for him!

Plunge 1 Team

Xianyun

Support

Freminet

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS/Support

Shenhe

Support

All Claymore characters tend to have high Plunging Attack modifiers than most weapon types, so as long as they can infuse themselves with their own element, they are all viable as your Main DPS enabled by Xianyun.

Main DPS Team

Xianyun

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Xianyun as a Main DPS will act as a Hypercarry Driver, so you will need one Anemo Support, and other buffers like Furina and Bennett. You can also mix in other Sub-DPS like Fischl or Xiangling if you want to play as a Swirl driver, although you will want Elemental Mastery.

Free-to-Play Team

Xianyun

Support

Gaming

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Most of Xianyun's best team comps consist with Furina in mind. If you don't have her, you may use the usual characters who can apply elements or buff your party members like Xingqiu, Bennett, Sucrose, or Xiangling.

Xianyun's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Enables the Plunge Attack playstyle for any character. She also gives big damage buffs for such playstyles while also having access to Viridescent Venerer.
  • Healing is for all characters in your party, which makes her a good pair with Furina.
  • ATK scaling benefits everything in her kit, including her healing, buffs, and damage. This also allows her to focus on as much Energy Recharge as she can get so she can use her Burst off-cooldown.
  • Gives CRIT Rate to all party members if enemies are hit by her Elemental Skill
  • Great exploration ability to access high areas.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst cost, which requires her to have a lot of Energy Recharge.
  • Her Elemental Skill can be interrupted by stray heavy attacks.

Xiao's Weapons

Vermillion Hereafter DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Calamity Queller

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    Lithic Spear

    For every character in the party who hails form Liyue, the character who equips this weapons gains 7% ATK increase and a 3% CRIT Rate increase. This effect stacks up to 4 times.

    Blackcliff Pole

    After defeating an enemy, ATK is increased by 12% for 30s. This effect has a maximum of 3 stacks, and the duration of each stack is independent of the others.

Comment

As his Elemental Burst lets him decrease his own HP, Xiao best builds the Vermillion Hereafter set to maximize its 4-piece effect. Like most Main DPS, he needs as much CRIT stats while also having enough Energy Recharge especially if you don't have a battery.

Depending on your team comp, as he already gets an abundance of ATK from the Vermillion Hereafter set, Xiao can also equip an Energy Recharge sands should you need more of it to fund his burst cost.

Alternative Build for Xiao DPS

Best Weapon

Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

Alternative Weapons

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

    Calamity Queller

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

    Deathmatch

    If there are at least 2 enemies nearby, ATK and DEF is increased by 16%. If there are less than 2 enemies nearby, ATK is increased by 24%.

    Lithic Spear

    For every character in the party who hails form Liyue, the character who equips this weapons gains 7% ATK increase and a 3% CRIT Rate increase. This effect stacks up to 4 times.

    Blackcliff Pole

    After defeating an enemy, ATK is increased by 12% for 30s. This effect has a maximum of 3 stacks, and the duration of each stack is independent of the others.

Comment

All of Xiao's best artifacts are simple stat increases, so you may use a mix of any 2-piece ATK and Anemo DMG Bonus artifact set combos, or the Marechaussee Hunter artifact set for easier CRIT stat balancing.

If you already have amazing substats on these artifacts, you may opt on skipping farming for Vermillion Hereafter unless you want to min-max his damage output.

Xiao's Artifacts

Vermillion Hereafter DPS

Best Artifact Set

Vermillion Hereafter

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: After using an Elemental Burst, this character will gain the Nascent Light effect, increasing their ATK by 8% for 16s. When the character's HP decreases, their ATK will further increase by 10%. This further increase can occur this way a maximum of 4 times. This effect can be triggered once every 0.8s. Nascent Light will be dispelled when the character leaves the field. If an Elemental Burst is used again during the duration of Nascent Light, the original Nascent Light will be dispelled.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

As his Elemental Burst lets him decrease his own HP, Xiao best builds the Vermillion Hereafter set to maximize its 4-piece effect. Like most Main DPS, he needs as much CRIT stats while also having enough Energy Recharge especially if you don't have a battery.

Depending on your team comp, as he already gets an abundance of ATK from the Vermillion Hereafter set, Xiao can also equip an Energy Recharge sands should you need more of it to fund his burst cost.

Alternative Build for Xiao DPS

Best Artifact Set

Marechaussee Hunter

2-Piece: Normal and Charged Attack DMG +15%

4-Piece: When current HP increases or decreases, CRIT Rate will be increased by 12% for 5s. Max 3 stacks.

Secondary Artifact Set

&

Viridescent Venerer & Gladiator's Finale

2-Piece: Anemo DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: ATK +18%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Anemo DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

All of Xiao's best artifacts are simple stat increases, so you may use a mix of any 2-piece ATK and Anemo DMG Bonus artifact set combos, or the Marechaussee Hunter artifact set for easier CRIT stat balancing.

If you already have amazing substats on these artifacts, you may opt on skipping farming for Vermillion Hereafter unless you want to min-max his damage output.

Xiao's Teams

Faruzan and Xianyun Team

Xiao

Main DPS

Furina

Sub-DPS

Faruzan

Support

Xianyun

Support

Faruzan is a welcome addition to Xiao's party thanks to her Anemo DMG buffs. If Faruzan is below C6, you may need another Anemo character like Jean or Sucrose to fill up Xiao's energy easily. Furina and Xianyun can further boost Xiao's damage for plunging playstyles, as well as provide off-field damage, but if you don't have Xianyun or Furina, you may use Zhongli, Jean, or Bennett as well.

Double Anemo & Double Geo Team

Xiao

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Jean

Support

Zhongli

Support

This team comp synergizes well with keeping Xiao safe as he deals damage with his Elemental Burst. Jean will provide particle generation for Xiao's Elemental burst and can also increase his DPS if she has her 4th Constellation unlocked.

Free-to-Play Team

Xiao

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Bennett

Support

As his best teams are rather expensive, you can use 4-star characters like Bennett and Sucrose as alternatives. Sucrose's Elemental Mastery buffs won't really work for Xiao, but she does provide a lot of energy especially with a Favonius Codex and constellations.

Xiao's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Burst allows him to take advantage of his high multipliers on his Plunging Attacks.
  • Great AoE coverage, often being one of the best picks against a large wave of enemies.
  • Elemental Skill and passive talent makes it easier to explore mountainous regions like Liyue.

Weaknesses

  • Reliant on his Elemental Burst to be used every rotation, but he has a relatively high energy cost. While under his Elemental Burst, it also disables the energy particle generation on his Skill. He will need more Energy Recharge than usual unless you have triple Anemo team comps or an abundance of Energy Recharge weapons on your support.
  • His fragile playstyle may be a turn-off for some players who wants a safer pick, as he has no way to sustain himself and is susceptible to interruptions.
  • Plunges can push back lighter enemies, which may spread enemies farther away from your position.

Xilonen's Weapons

Geo Shredder Support

Best Weapon

Peak Patrol Song

Gain "Ode to Flowers" after Normal or Plunging Attacks hit an opponent: DEF increases by 8% and gain a 10% All Elemental DMG Bonus for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can trigger once per 0.1s. When this effect reaches 2 stacks or the 2nd stack's duration is refreshed, increase all nearby party members' All Elemental DMG Bonus by 8% for every 1,000 DEF the equipping character has, up to a maximum of 25.6%, for 15s.

Alternative Weapons

    Freedom-Sworn

    Increases DMG by 10%. When characters with Freedom-Sworn trigger Elemental Reactions, they gain a Sigil of Rebellion (once every 0.5s). This triggers even if they aren't on the field. When you reach 2 Sigils, they will be consumed which grants nearby party members 20% ATK and 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunging Attack DMG for 12s. Once triggered, you gain no Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Favonius Sword

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Flute of Ezpitzal

    Using an Elemental Skill increases DEF by 16% for 15s.

Comment

Xilonen thrives off of the 4-pc. Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City, letting her and her teammates benefit off of the Elemental DMG Bonus stacked with Xilonen's Resistance shred.

This build assumes that you are double-downing on Xilonen's role as a shredder-healer support, maximizing her supportive capabilities to aid the team.

Geo DPS

Best Weapon

Peak Patrol Song

Gain "Ode to Flowers" after Normal or Plunging Attacks hit an opponent: DEF increases by 8% and gain a 10% All Elemental DMG Bonus for 6s. Max 2 stacks. Can trigger once per 0.1s. When this effect reaches 2 stacks or the 2nd stack's duration is refreshed, increase all nearby party members' All Elemental DMG Bonus by 8% for every 1,000 DEF the equipping character has, up to a maximum of 25.6%, for 15s.

Alternative Weapons

    Uraku Misugiri

    Normal Attack DMG is increased by 16% and Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 24%. After a nearby active character deals Geo DMG, the aforementioned effects increase by 100% for 15s. Additionally, the wielder's DEF is increased by 20%.

    Mistsplitter Reforged

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Cinnabar Spindle

    Elemental Skill DMG is increased by 40% of DEF. The effect will be triggered no more than once every 1.5s and will be cleared 0.1s after the Elemental Skill deals DMG.

    Flute of Ezpitzal

    Using an Elemental Skill increases DEF by 16% for 15s.

Comment

If using Xilonen as a DPS, you can instead opt for a DEF-scaling CRIT build, with the standard DEF% Sands, Geo DMG Goblet, and CRIT Circlet.

This also has the added benefit of still being formidable as a support, but even more so since she has the personal damage to contribute in a fight.

Xilonen's Artifacts

Geo Shredder Support

Best Artifact Set

Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City

2-Piece: When a nearby party member triggers a Nightsoul Burst, the equipping character regenerates 6 Elemental Energy.

4-Piece: After the equipping character triggers a reaction, all nearby party members gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for the involved Elemental Types for 15s. If the equipping character is in the Nightsoul's Blessing state when triggering this effect, all party members gain an additional 28% Elemental DMG bonus for the Elemental Types involved in the reaction for 20s.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: DEF%
  • Circlet: Healing Bonus/DEF%

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • DEF%

Recommended Energy Recharge

180-220% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Xilonen thrives off of the 4-pc. Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City, letting her and her teammates benefit off of the Elemental DMG Bonus stacked with Xilonen's Resistance shred.

This build assumes that you are double-downing on Xilonen's role as a shredder-healer support, maximizing her supportive capabilities to aid the team.

Geo DPS

Best Artifact Set

Husk of Opulent Dreams

2-Piece: DEF +30%

4-Piece: A character equipped with this Artifact set will obtain the Curiosity effect in the following conditions: When on the field, the character gains 1 stack after hitting an opponent with a Geo attack, triggering a maximum of once every 0.3s. When off the field, the character gains 1 stack every 3s. Curiosity can stack up to 4 times, each providing 6% DEF and a 6% Geo DMG Bonus. When 6 seconds pass without gaining a Curiosity stack, 1 stack is lost.

Secondary Artifact Set

Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City

2-Piece: When a nearby party member triggers a Nightsoul Burst, the equipping character regenerates 6 Elemental Energy.

4-Piece: After the equipping character triggers a reaction, all nearby party members gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for the involved Elemental Types for 15s. If the equipping character is in the Nightsoul's Blessing state when triggering this effect, all party members gain an additional 28% Elemental DMG bonus for the Elemental Types involved in the reaction for 20s.h

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT DMG/CRIT Rate

Sub Stats

  • CRIT DMG
  • CRIT Rate
  • DEF%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

If using Xilonen as a DPS, you can instead opt for a DEF-scaling CRIT build, with the standard DEF% Sands, Geo DMG Goblet, and CRIT Circlet.

This also has the added benefit of still being formidable as a support, but even more so since she has the personal damage to contribute in a fight.

Xilonen's Teams

Quickbloom 1 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Sub-DPS/Support

Yelan

Sub-DPS

.....

Quickbloom 2 Team

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Baizhu

Sub-DPS/Support

Shinobu

Sub-DPS

.....

Xilonen's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Provides an easy-to-trigger RES shred that does not need any intricate rotations to benefit off of.
  • RES shred scales on nothing but Elemental Skill level, making her a high-impact character even with low investment.
  • Can fill both the Healer and Buffer roles in most teams, with the potential to also take up a Burst Sub-DPS role.
  • Elemental Burst conditionally provides on-demand heal when needed, on top of being decent damage.

Weaknesses

  • Requires two characters that are not Geo) in order to activate her RES shred buffs and on-field Elemental Burst healing.
  • Healing is only single-target unless she is at C6.

Xingqiu's Weapons

Hydro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Sacrificial Sword

After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Primordial Jade Cutter

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder’s Max HP.

    Mistsplitter Reforged

    Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for a character's Elemental Type. At stacks 1/2/3, Elemental DMG is further increased by 8/16/28%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

    • Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s))

    • Casting an Elemental Burst (duration 10s)

    • Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

    Amenoma Kageuchi

    After casting an Elemental Skill, gain 1 Succession Seed. This effect can be triggered once every 5s. The Succession Seed lasts for 30s. Up to 3 Succession Seeds may exist simultaneously. After using an Elemental Burst, all Succession Seeds are consumed and after 2s, the character regenerates 6 Energy for each seed consumed.

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for Xingqiu maximizes his DMG from his Elemental Burst. Xingqiu needs about +200% Energy Recharge without the Sacrificial Sword but only around 150% with it. Choose the Mainstat of your Sands piece accordingly!

Xingqiu's Artifacts

Hydro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Sub-DPS build for Xingqiu maximizes his DMG from his Elemental Burst. Xingqiu needs about +200% Energy Recharge without the Sacrificial Sword but only around 150% with it. Choose the Mainstat of your Sands piece accordingly!

Xingqiu's Teams

Premium Team

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Xingqiu and Yelan produces Hydro Resonance increasing the HP and boosting the damage of Hu Tao through reaction. Xingqiu and Hu Tao produces consistent Vaporize reaction. Hydro Resonance also affects the HP shield of Zhongli. Zhongli can also increase the damage that Xingqiu produces because of its universal debuff from shields.

Free-To-Play Team

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Chongyun

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This team is one of the most powerful teams in-game. Xingqiu, Xiangling, & Chongyun can trigger continuous reactions such as Vaporize, Melt, & Freeze. Bennett greatly boosts all of the damage produced by the team.

Xingqiu's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill provides DMG reduction.
  • Elemental Burst provides consistent Hydro application.
  • Elemental Skill provides multiple Elemental Particles.

Weaknesses

  • Low Base DMG on Normal Attacks.
  • Long Elemental Skill CD.
  • Requires Constellations for consistent utility.

Xinyan's Weapons

Physical Main DPS

Best Weapon

Redhorn Stonethresher

DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Pride

    Increases all DMG by 8%. After using an Elemental Burst, Normal, or Charged Attack, on hit, creates a vacuum blade that does 80% of ATK as DMG to enemies along its path. Lasts for 20s or 8 vacuum blades.

    Snow-Tombed Starsilver

    Hitting an enemy with Normal and Charged Attacks has a 60% chance of forming and dropping an Everfrost Icicle abve them, dealing 80% AoE ATK DMG. Enemies affected by Cryo are dealt 200% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 10s.

    Prototype Archaic

    On hit, Normal or Charge Attacks have a 50% chance to deal an additional 240% ATK DMG to enemies with a small AoE. Can only occur once every 15s.

Comment

This Xinyan build finds use in both her Normal Attacks and her Elemental Burst to deal the most damage possible while being on the field.

Burst Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Redhorn Stonethresher

DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

Alternative Weapons

    The Unforged

    Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, ATK increase effect is increased by 100%.

    Serpent Spine

    Every 4s a character is on the field, they will deal 6% more DMG and take 3% more DMG. This effect has a maximum of 5 stacks and will not be reset if the character leaves the field, but will be reduced by 1 stack when the character takes DMG.

    The Bell

    Taking DMG generates a shield which absorbs DMG up to 20% of Max HP. This shield lasts for 10s or until broken, and can only be triggered once every 45s. While protected by the shield, the character gains 12% increased DMG.

Comment

This Xinyan build focuses on dealing high Physical DMG through using her Elemental Burst. This build is very effective when you have her 2nd Constellation unlocked.

Shield Support

Best Weapon

Sacrificial Greatsword

After damaging an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 40% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 30s.

Alternative Weapons

    Redhorn Stonethresher

    DEF is increased by 28%. Normal and Charged Attack DMG is increased by 40% of DEF.

    Whiteblind

    On hit, Normal or Charged Attacks increase ATK and DEF by 6% for 6s. Max 4 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.5s.

Comment

This Xinyan build utilizes her Elemental Skill to provide a strong shield and to trigger the Tenacity of the Millelith artifact set buffs. This is only effective when you manage to hit more than one enemy with her Elemental Skill.

Physical Main DPS

&

Pale Flame & Bloodstained Chivalry

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

2-Piece: Physical DMG +25%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: ATK%/Physical DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK

Comment

This Xinyan build finds use in both her Normal Attacks and her Elemental Burst to deal the most damage possible while being on the field.

Burst Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Physical DMG Bonus/ATK%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK

Comment

This Xinyan build focuses on dealing high Physical DMG through using her Elemental Burst. This build is very effective when you have her 2nd Constellation unlocked.

Shield Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: DEF%
  • Circlet: DEF%

Sub Stats

  • DEF%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Xinyan build utilizes her Elemental Skill to provide a strong shield and to trigger the Tenacity of the Millelith artifact set buffs. This is only effective when you manage to hit more than one enemy with her Elemental Skill.

Xinyan's Teams

Premium Team

Xinyan

Sub-DPS

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Support

Bennett

Support

Xinyan can increase the Physical DMG of DPS with her shields making her a great Sub-DPS for Eula. Eula will be the main DPS and can also deal Melt with Xinyan. Raiden can activate super-conduct with Eula enabling Xinyan's burst to deal more DMG. Bennett's Elemental Burst will work well with Xinyan as it can heal her and amp up her damage further.

Free To Play Team

Xinyan

Main DPS

Lisa

Sub-DPS

Kaeya

Support

Barbara

Support

Xinyan will act as the team's main damage dealer. She can provide powerful Physical Attacks for the team. Lisa and Kaeya can produce superconduct further increasing the damage of Xinyan.

Xinyan's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Can provide Shields and Physical DMG Boost.
  • Elemental Skill and Burst deal a combination of Physical and Pyro DMG.

Weaknesses

  • Split scales off of either DEF for shields or ATK for DMG.
  • Must hit multiple enemies to maximize Pyro DMG on her Elemental Skill.

Yae Miko's Weapons

General Electro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Kagura's Verity

Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

    Sacrificial Jade

    When not on the field for more than 5s, Max HP will be increased by 32% and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 40. These effects will be canceled after the wielder has been on the field for 10s.

Comment

Focusing on the damage of her Elemental Skill, Yae Miko best builds the Golden Troupe artifact to boost her off-field damage. As this set provides big buffs only for her Elemental Skill, her Burst will not benefit much from this artifact.

You may use an Elemental Mastery sands if your team comp is centered around Dendro, otherwise use ATK%.

Aggravate Electro Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Kagura's Verity

Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Alternative Weapons

    A Thousand Floating Dreams

    Equipping Character gains buffs based on other party members' elemental type. If their elemental type is the same as the equipping character, Elemental Mastery is increased by 32. If not, the equipping character's elemental DMG Bonus is increased by 10%. Each effect can stack by a maximum of 3. All nearby party members will also gain an additional 40 Elemental Mastery.

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

    Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

    Sacrificial Jade

    When not on the field for more than 5s, Max HP will be increased by 32% and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 40. These effects will be canceled after the wielder has been on the field for 10s.

    The Widsith

    When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 60%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 48%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 240.

Comment

Elemental Mastery weapons and Gilded Dreams become more enticing to build for Yae Miko on teams that focus on Dendro reactions like Aggravate, especially since it also benefits her Elemental Burst damage.

While the overall damage should be near Golden Troupe on such teams, it's generally more resin efficient to farm this set with Deepwood Memories for your support.

Yae Miko's Artifacts

General Electro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Golden Troupe

2-Piece: Elemental Skill DMG +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 25%. Additionally when not on the field, Elemental Skill DMG will be further increased by 25%. This effect will be cleared 2s after taking the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • ATK%

Comment

Focusing on the damage of her Elemental Skill, Yae Miko best builds the Golden Troupe artifact to boost her off-field damage. As this set provides big buffs only for her Elemental Skill, her Burst will not benefit much from this artifact.

You may use an Elemental Mastery sands if your team comp is centered around Dendro, otherwise use ATK%.

Aggravate Electro Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Gilded Dreams

2-Piece: Elemental Mastery +80

4-Piece: Within 8s of triggering an Elemental Reaction, the character equipping this will obtain buffs based on the Elemental Type of the other party members. ATK is increased by 14% for each member whose Elemental Type is the same as the equipping character, and EM is increased by 50 for every member with a different Elemental Type. Each of the buffs will count up to 3 characters. This effect can be triggered once every 8s and even when not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Elemental Mastery/ATK%
  • Goblet: Electro DMG Bonus%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Elemental Mastery weapons and Gilded Dreams become more enticing to build for Yae Miko on teams that focus on Dendro reactions like Aggravate, especially since it also benefits her Elemental Burst damage.

While the overall damage should be near Golden Troupe on such teams, it's generally more resin efficient to farm this set with Deepwood Memories for your support.

Yae Miko's Teams

Aggravate 1 Team

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Tighnari

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

This Dendro Team comp has Nahida apply the Dendro Aura on the enemy while Alhaitham applies Quicken and triggers the Aggravate reaction from Yae Miko's totems. Zhongli can be replaced by Fischl for more Aggravate procs and energy.

Aggravate 2 Team

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Alhaitham

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

This Dendro Team comp has Nahida apply the Dendro Aura on the enemy while Alhaitham applies Quicken and triggers the Aggravate reaction from Yae Miko's totems. Zhongli can be replaced by Fischl for more Aggravate procs and energy.

Overloaded 1 Team

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

On teams that are focused on Overloaded, Chevreuse is the staple team member for such teams to enable the niche. Yae Miko's Elemental Skill can still target enemies even if they're flung away by the Overloaded knockback.

Overloaded 2 Team

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Chevreuse

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

On teams that are focused on Overloaded, Chevreuse is the staple team member for such teams to enable the niche. Yae Miko's Elemental Skill can still target enemies even if they're flung away by the Overloaded knockback.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Kokomi

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Electro-Charged is also a viable team comp option for Yae Miko as she can virtually apply high off-field Electro after every rotations! While Raiden and Tartaglia should provide the most damage and fast reactions to proc Electro-Charged, their positions can be replaced with other Hydro or Electro characters like Xingqiu or Fischl instead.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Tartaglia

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Support

Electro-Charged is also a viable team comp option for Yae Miko as she can virtually apply high off-field Electro after every rotations! While Raiden and Tartaglia should provide the most damage and fast reactions to proc Electro-Charged, their positions can be replaced with other Hydro or Electro characters like Xingqiu or Fischl instead.

Yae Miko's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Great off-field Electro damage and application especially on Aggravate or Quicken teams.
  • Elemental Skill totems have wide targetting range and may hit any enemies in the vicinity. It also hits foes randomly, which can be an advantagous perk if you're battling against enemies that are spread out.

Weaknesses

  • Elemental Burst has an extremely high energy cost just for extra damage. It also removes the totems, which requires you to set them up again.
  • Setup for placing her Elemental Skill require more on-field time, which may lead to team rotation issues.
  • Elemental Skill totems may unintentionally hit objects and animals in the overworld.

Yanfei's Weapons

Pyro Main DPS

Best Weapon

Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

    Ballad of the Boundless Blue

    Within 6s after Normal or Charged Attacks hit an opponent, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 8% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 6%. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s.

Comment

Yanfei's best build includes the 4-piece Crimson Witch of Flames which allows her to deal more damage through Pyro induced reactions like Vaporize or Melt.

Getting the artifacts however is inefficient, as you will have to deal with getting Lavawalker artifacts in the Hidden Palace of Zhou. So have a lot of patience in getting the best substats for Yanfei.

Charged Attack DPS

Best Weapon

Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds

Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

Alternative Weapons

    Skyward Atlas

    Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds, which actively seeks out nearby enemies to attack for 15s. Dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

    Flowing Purity

    When using an Elemental Skill, All Elemental DMG Bonus will be increased by 8% for 15s, and a Bond of Life worth 24% of Max HP will be granted. This effect can be triggered once every 10s. When the Bond of Life is cleared, every 1,000 HP cleared in the process will provide 2% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Max 12% All Elemental DMG can be gained this way, and lasts 15s.

    Ballad of the Boundless Blue

    Within 6s after Normal or Charged Attacks hit an opponent, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 8% and Charged Attack DMG will be increased by 6%. Max 3 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s.

Comment

This is Yanfei's second best build since it involves the Shimenawa's Reminiscence which increases her Charged Attack DMG allowing Yanfei to still deal a lot of DMG.

It may not be Yanfei's best artifact in terms of DMG, but getting the Shimenawa's Reminiscence through the Momiji-Dyed Court domain will be more efficient since you can use the Emblem of Severed Fate set for Yanfei's Sub-DPS characters such as Xingqiu.

Shield Support (C4)

Best Weapon

Prototype Amber

Using an Elemental Burst regenerates 4 Energy every 2s for 6s. Additionally, all party members will regenerate 4% HP every 2s for this duration.

Alternative Weapons

    Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

    When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 24% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

    Favonius Codex

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

If you unlocked Yanfei's 4th constellation, Yanfei can be classified as a shielder through her Elemental Burst. Equip her with the Prototype Amber, and she can heal a decent amount of HP making her a somewhat competent Support.

If you don't have a Noblesse Oblige user in the party, you can use it on Yanfei to increase your party's ATK.

Yanfei's Artifacts

Pyro Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%

Comment

Yanfei's best build includes the 4-piece Crimson Witch of Flames which allows her to deal more damage through Pyro induced reactions like Vaporize or Melt.

Getting the artifacts however is inefficient, as you will have to deal with getting Lavawalker artifacts in the Hidden Palace of Zhou. So have a lot of patience in getting the best substats for Yanfei.

Charged Attack DPS

Best Artifact Set

Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: When casting an Elemental Skill, if the character has 15 or more Energy, they lose 15 Energy and Normal/Charge/Plunging Attack DMG is increased by 50% for 10s. This effect will not trigger again during that duration.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%

Comment

This is Yanfei's second best build since it involves the Shimenawa's Reminiscence which increases her Charged Attack DMG allowing Yanfei to still deal a lot of DMG.

It may not be Yanfei's best artifact in terms of DMG, but getting the Shimenawa's Reminiscence through the Momiji-Dyed Court domain will be more efficient since you can use the Emblem of Severed Fate set for Yanfei's Sub-DPS characters such as Xingqiu.

Shield Support (C4)

Best Artifact Set

Noblesse Oblige

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Using an Elemental Burst increases all party members' ATK by 20% for 12s. This effect cannot stack.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%
  • HP

Comment

If you unlocked Yanfei's 4th constellation, Yanfei can be classified as a shielder through her Elemental Burst. Equip her with the Prototype Amber, and she can heal a decent amount of HP making her a somewhat competent Support.

If you don't have a Noblesse Oblige user in the party, you can use it on Yanfei to increase your party's ATK.

Yanfei's Teams

Vaporize 1 Team

Yanfei

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Kazuha

Support

With vaporize, Yanfei's damage is further amplified with Off-Field supports. Yelan or Xingqiu are crucial teammates for this team for their Hydro Application.

Vaporize 2 Team

Yanfei

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Sucrose

Support

With vaporize, Yanfei's damage is further amplified with Off-Field supports. Yelan or Xingqiu are crucial teammates for this team for their Hydro Application.

Overloaded Team

Yanfei

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

Sara

Support

Yanfei can also lead an Overloaded team, but you will need Chevreuse for this specific team comp for her Pyro Damage increase from her passive.

Burn Team

Yanfei

Main DPS

Emilie

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Zhongli

Support

With the addition of units like Nahida and Emilie, Burning teams become a viable option for Yanfei due to the consistent burn damage she can cause, as well as the supportive Sub-DPS damage from their Dendro partner.

Burgeon Team

Yanfei

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Support

Bennett

Support

With her AoE capabilities, Yanfei can lead a Burgeon team, as long as Nahida applies Dendro first then followed by Xingqiu's Hydro application to secure a Dendro core. Keep in mind that Yanfei needs to be built around stacking Elemental Mastery as much as possible for this to amplify Burgeon Damage.

Yanfei's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Attacks can lock on targets.
  • Solid starter DPS even as a 4-star character.
  • Can be built as a shield support with C4.

Weaknesses

  • Use of Charged Attacks will need proper stamina management without C1.
  • Constant Pyro Attacks can disrupt reactions that would have been useful if she was the trigger.

Yaoyao's Weapons

Dendro Healer

Best Weapon

Favonius Lance

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Dialogues of the Desert Sages

    When the wielder performs healing, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Black Tassel

    Increases DMG against slimes by 40%.

    Kitain Cross Spear

    Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Comment

Yaoyao with Deepwood Memories is generally her best build as a support healer, especially when paired with other Dendro characters. Having Yaoyao use the Deepwood Memories gives your other Dendro character more damage-dealing Artifact options.

Feel free to use a CRIT Circlet to help the Favonious Lance trigger its passive more consistently.

Tenacity Healer

Best Weapon

Favonius Lance

CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Alternative Weapons

    Dialogues of the Desert Sages

    When the wielder performs healing, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Rightful Reward

    When the wielder is healed, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Black Tassel

    Increases DMG against slimes by 40%.

Comment

Yaoyao can use the Tenacity of the Millelith if another party member needs to use Deepwood Memories set.

This set can also be used in Aggravate team comps where providing more ATK% to the Electro Main DPS is far more valuable than increasing Yaoyao's damage.

Bloom Support

Best Weapon

Kitain Cross Spear

Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 6%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 3 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Alternative Weapons

    Dragon's Bane

    Increases DMG against enemies affected by Hydro or Pyro by 20%.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Moonpiercer

    After triggering Burning, Quicken, Aggravate, Spread, Bloom, Hyperbloom, or Burgeon, a Leaf of Revival will be created around the character for a maximum of 10s. When picked up, the Leaf will grant the character 16% ATK for 12s. Only 1 Leaf can be generated this way every 20s. This effect can still be triggered if the character is not on the field.

Comment

Yaoyao has the potential to create a lot of Dendro cores during her Elemental Burst when against multiple enemies. This build is tailored more for a Nilou team where she acts as a second Dendro character to trigger blooms.

Yaoyao's Artifacts

Dendro Healer

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • Elemental Mastery
  • HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Yaoyao with Deepwood Memories is generally her best build as a support healer, especially when paired with other Dendro characters. Having Yaoyao use the Deepwood Memories gives your other Dendro character more damage-dealing Artifact options.

Feel free to use a CRIT Circlet to help the Favonious Lance trigger its passive more consistently.

Tenacity Healer

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge%/HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/Healing Bonus

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Yaoyao can use the Tenacity of the Millelith if another party member needs to use Deepwood Memories set.

This set can also be used in Aggravate team comps where providing more ATK% to the Electro Main DPS is far more valuable than increasing Yaoyao's damage.

Bloom Support

Best Artifact Set

Deepwood Memories

2-Piece: Dendro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: After Elemental Skills or Bursts hit opponents, the targets' Dendro RES will be decreased by 30% for 8s. This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: Energy Recharge/Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Recommended Energy Recharge

±220% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

Yaoyao has the potential to create a lot of Dendro cores during her Elemental Burst when against multiple enemies. This build is tailored more for a Nilou team where she acts as a second Dendro character to trigger blooms.

Support

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Beidou

Sub-DPS

Spread Teams focus on creating Quicken reactions followed by Dendro DMG. Dendro DPS characters like Alhaitham, Nahida, and Tighnari will benefit from increased Dendro DMG and healing from Yaoyao.

Yaoyao

Support

Nahida

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sub-DPS

Spread Teams focus on creating Quicken reactions followed by Dendro DMG. Dendro DPS characters like Alhaitham, Nahida, and Tighnari will benefit from increased Dendro DMG and healing from Yaoyao.

Yaoyao

Support

Tighnari

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Spread Teams focus on creating Quicken reactions followed by Dendro DMG. Dendro DPS characters like Alhaitham, Nahida, and Tighnari will benefit from increased Dendro DMG and healing from Yaoyao.

Aggravate 1 Team

Yaoyao

Support

Cyno

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Sub-DPS

Aggravate Teams focus on creating Quicken reactions followed by Electro application to increase overall Electro DMG. Electro characters like Cyno, Keqing, and Fischl will benefit from increased Electro DMG from Aggravate and healing from Yaoyao.
