Support

Keqing

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Aggravate Teams focus on creating Quicken reactions followed by Electro application to increase overall Electro DMG. Electro characters like Cyno, Keqing, and Fischl will benefit from increased Electro DMG from Aggravate and healing from Yaoyao.

Bountiful Cores 1 Team

Yaoyao

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Candace

Support

This Yaoyao team focuses on creating Bountiful Cores with Nilou on the team. A healer like Yaoyao and the damage reduction from Xingqiu are important as the Bountiful Cores can also damage your active character! Candace enables Yaoyao to be viable in Nilou Bloom teams as Candace can infuse Yaoyao's polearm with Hydro, letting her constantly apply Hydro while Yaoyao's Elemental burst is active.

Bountiful Cores 2 Team

Yaoyao

Support

Nahida

Main DPS

Nilou

Sub-DPS

Xingqiu

Support

This Yaoyao team focuses on creating Bountiful Cores with Nilou on the team. A healer like Yaoyao and the damage reduction from Xingqiu are important as the Bountiful Cores can also damage your active character! Candace enables Yaoyao to be viable in Nilou Bloom teams as Candace can infuse Yaoyao's polearm with Hydro, letting her constantly apply Hydro while Yaoyao's Elemental burst is active.

Hyperbloom 1 Team

Yaoyao

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Support

This Yaoyao team focuses on the Hyperbloom reaction. Along with Yaoyao, you must have at least one Hydro and one Electro character to create Dendro Cores and the Hyperbloom reaction respectively. Raiden and Shinobu are perfect Hyperbloom triggers as they can periodically deal AoE Electro damage while off-field to hit Dendro Cores.

Hyperbloom 2 Team

Yaoyao

Support

Yelan

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Shinobu

Support

This Yaoyao team focuses on the Hyperbloom reaction. Along with Yaoyao, you must have at least one Hydro and one Electro character to create Dendro Cores and the Hyperbloom reaction respectively. Raiden and Shinobu are perfect Hyperbloom triggers as they can periodically deal AoE Electro damage while off-field to hit Dendro Cores.

Burgeon 1 Team

Yaoyao

Support

Yelan

Main DPS

Nahida

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

This Yaoyao team focuses on the Burgeon reaction. Along with Yaoyao, you must have at least one Hydro and one Pyro character to create Dendro Cores and the Burgeon reaction respectively. Yaoyao is an essential member of the Burgeon team as the reaction can also damage your active character.

Burgeon 2 Team

Yaoyao

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Traveler (Dendro)

Sub-DPS

Thoma

Support

This Yaoyao team focuses on the Burgeon reaction. Along with Yaoyao, you must have at least one Hydro and one Pyro character to create Dendro Cores and the Burgeon reaction respectively. Yaoyao is an essential member of the Burgeon team as the reaction can also damage your active character.

Yaoyao's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Elemental Skill deals off-field Dendro damage while healing the active character.
  • C1 provides a Dendro DMG Buff.
  • Dendro Resistance from her Elemental Burst helps a lot in reducing self-inflicted Dendro Core damage.
  • Passive talent lets you sneak up on some wildlife.

Weaknesses

  • High energy cost for her Elemental Burst.
  • Elemental Skill does not heal off-field characters.
  • Swapping out of Yaoyao's Elemental Burst state will end it early and remove the summoned Yuguei's.
  • Damage and Healing split scales with ATK and HP respectively.

Yelan's Weapons

Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Aqua Simulacra

HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

Alternative Weapons

    Elegy for the End

    Increased Elemental Mastery by 60. Gain sigils when dealing damage with Elemental Skill or Burst every .2s even when off-field. At 4 sigils, all sigils will be consumed and Elemental Mastery is increased by 100 and ATK increased by 20% for 12s. Once the effect is triggered, you cannot gain Sigils for 20s. The same buffs from the Millennial Movement series does not stack.

    Favonius Warbow

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Slingshot

    If a Normal Attack or Aimed Shot hits a target within 0.3s of being fired, increases DMG by 36%. Otherwise, decreases DMG by 10%.

Comment

This Yelan build focuses on maximizing her Skill, Burst, and Barbed Charge Attack DMG. If not running 4-pc. Emblem of Severed Fate, you can opt for 2-pc. Emblem and 2-pc. Noblesse for the Elemental Burst damage.

This is more or less the same build regardless of how you build Yelan, with the only exception being the amount of priority you put into her HP and the amount of ER she needs. You typically want around 170-200% Energy Recharge.

Yelan's Artifacts

Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

Emblem of Severed Fate

2-Piece: Energy Recharge +20%

4-Piece: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 25% of Energy Recharge. A maximum of 75% bonus DMG can be obtained in this way.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: Hydro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • HP%

Recommended Energy Recharge

±170-200% Total Energy Recharge

Comment

This Yelan build focuses on maximizing her Skill, Burst, and Barbed Charge Attack DMG. If not running 4-pc. Emblem of Severed Fate, you can opt for 2-pc. Emblem and 2-pc. Noblesse for the Elemental Burst damage.

This is more or less the same build regardless of how you build Yelan, with the only exception being the amount of priority you put into her HP and the amount of ER she needs. You typically want around 170-200% Energy Recharge.

Vaporize Team

International Team

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

This classic team replaces Xingqiu with Yelan as the character who hails from Liyue. What's great about this build is that Yelan can provide amazing DPS while Raiden's Elemental Burst is on cooldown.

Electro-Charged 1 Team

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Raiden

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Yelan can act as an on-field or off-field unit in an Electro-Charged team comp. Electro-Charged teams still does very good damage in the current meta, given how much reactions are triggered during rotations.

Electro-Charged 2 Team

Yelan

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Sucrose

Sub-DPS

Kokomi

Support

Yelan can act as an on-field or off-field unit in an Electro-Charged team comp. Electro-Charged teams still does very good damage in the current meta, given how much reactions are triggered during rotations.

Yelan's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Amazing Sub-DPS character.
  • Her Talents help fill in the downtime of Main DPS characters.
  • Elemental Burst directly increases an active character's personal DMG.

Weaknesses

  • High Elemental Burst cost which can be fixed with C1.
  • Slightly inconsistent Hydro application from her Elemental Burst without C2.

Yoimiya's Weapons

Normal Attack Main DPS

Best Weapon

Thundering Pulse

Increases ATK by 20% and grants Thunder Emblem. At stacks 1/2/3, Normal Attack DMG is further increased by 12/24/40%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s)

• Casting an Elemental Skill (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Polar Star

    Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Rust

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 40% but decreases Charged Attack DMG by 10%.

Comment

This is currently the best Main DPS build for Yoimiya. This is at a cost of not being able to use her Elemental Burst reliably off cooldown but is less of an issue for Sub-DPS characters that don't need the ATK% buff from Yoimiya's burst (like Yelan).

Though the Echoes set could fix the issue, its rng nature makes it too unreliable.

Pyro Reactions DPS

Best Weapon

Thundering Pulse

Increases ATK by 20% and grants Thunder Emblem. At stacks 1/2/3, Normal Attack DMG is further increased by 12/24/40%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s)

• Casting an Elemental Skill (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Polar Star

    Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Rust

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 40% but decreases Charged Attack DMG by 10%.

Comment

This build for Yoimiya takes advantage of her Pyro-infused normal attacks from her Elemental Skill.

It's slightly behind in damage compared to the Shimenawa set, but outshines it when using an Overloaded or Vaporize team comp, as long as you have characters like Chevreuse or Xingqiu.

Mix and Match Set

Best Weapon

Thundering Pulse

Increases ATK by 20% and grants Thunder Emblem. At stacks 1/2/3, Normal Attack DMG is further increased by 12/24/40%. Each stack has an individual duration and are gotten through:

• Normal Attacks with Elemental DMG (duration 5s)

• Casting an Elemental Skill (duration 10s)

• Having less than 100% Energy (disappears at full Energy)

Alternative Weapons

    Polar Star

    Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG increased by 12%. After a Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits an opponent, 1 stack of Ashen Nightstar will be gained for 12s. When 1/2/3/4 stacks of Ashen Nightstar are present, ATK is increased by 10/20/30/48%. The stack of Ashen Nightstar created by the Normal Attack, Charged Attack, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst will be counted independently of the others.

    Aqua Simulacra

    HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

    Rust

    Increases Normal Attack DMG by 40% but decreases Charged Attack DMG by 10%.

Comment

Mixing different 2pc. sets together for Yoimiya can be a good middle ground when you don't want to farm for complete sets, especially if you already have perfect substats for each piece.

Yoimiya's Artifacts

Normal Attack Main DPS

Best Artifact Set

Shimenawa's Reminiscence

2-Piece: ATK +18%

4-Piece: When casting an Elemental Skill, if the character has 15 or more Energy, they lose 15 Energy and Normal/Charge/Plunging Attack DMG is increased by 50% for 10s. This effect will not trigger again during that duration.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This is currently the best Main DPS build for Yoimiya. This is at a cost of not being able to use her Elemental Burst reliably off cooldown but is less of an issue for Sub-DPS characters that don't need the ATK% buff from Yoimiya's burst (like Yelan).

Though the Echoes set could fix the issue, its rng nature makes it too unreliable.

Pyro Reactions DPS

Best Artifact Set

Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%

4-Piece: Increases Overloaded, Burning, and Burgeon DMG by 40%. Increases Vaporize and Melt DMG by 15%. Using an Elemental Skill increases 2-Piece Set effects by 50% for 10s. Max 3 stacks.

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • Elemental Mastery
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This build for Yoimiya takes advantage of her Pyro-infused normal attacks from her Elemental Skill.

It's slightly behind in damage compared to the Shimenawa set, but outshines it when using an Overloaded or Vaporize team comp, as long as you have characters like Chevreuse or Xingqiu.

Mix and Match Set

Best Artifact Set

&

Shimenawa's Reminiscence & Crimson Witch of Flames

2-Piece: ATK +18%

2-Piece: Pyro DMG Bonus +15%

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Pyro DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • Energy Recharge
  • ATK%

Comment

Mixing different 2pc. sets together for Yoimiya can be a good middle ground when you don't want to farm for complete sets, especially if you already have perfect substats for each piece.

Yoimiya's Teams

Reverse-Vaporize 1 Team

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Yun Jin

Support

Yelan provides strong off-field Hydro DMG and buffs while Yun Jin or Bennett applies a very strong buffs for Yoimiya. Zhongli provides a strong shield and applies a universal damage resistance decrease on enemies.

Reverse-Vaporize 2 Team

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Zhongli

Support

Yelan provides strong off-field Hydro DMG and buffs while Yun Jin or Bennett applies a very strong buffs for Yoimiya. Zhongli provides a strong shield and applies a universal damage resistance decrease on enemies.

Overloaded Team

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yae Miko

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Chevreuse

Support

This Yoimiya team comp focuses on dealing damage through Overloaded, but you will need Chevreuse for this specific team comp. You may also use Bennett to add more buffs for Yoimiya.

Reverse-Vaporize Anemo Team

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Kazuha

Support

Thoma

Support

This Anemo Reverse Vaporize team will have Kazuha absorb Hydro in his Elemental Burst. After, swap to Thoma to apply pyro with his Elemental Burst and then swap back to Kazuha to use his Elemental Skill to Swirl Pyro. This is to ensure Yoimiya gets full Pyro Buffs from Kazuha's Viridescent Venerer Set.

Reverse-Vaporize F2P Team

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Yun Jin

Support

Thoma

Support

This is a more free to play friendly team for Yoimiya's ideal team comp. Yun Jin can be replaced with Bennett if you need her somewhere else. This build also works wonders if you have Thoma at C6.

Yoimiya's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • One of the best single-target damage dealers versus bosses and other Elite enemies.
  • Specializes in Normal Attacks from a distance.
  • Special Charged Attack can be used for homing against farther enemies in the Overworld.

Weaknesses

  • As she's only single-target focused, she lacks AoE and would struggle against groups of larger enemies.
  • She must remain stationary as dodging or moving breaks up her Normal Attack string, which loses a large part of her damage as her largest scaling is on the last part of its combo.
  • Elemental Burst effect and ATK buffs don't apply to herself without constellations.
  • Elemental Burst exists solely to fill her downtime, and her Special Charged Attacks is only realistically usable for exploration, but both abilities are otherwise inessential to her Normal Attacks, which makes up the bulk of her damage.

Yun Jin's Weapons

Support

Best Weapon

Engulfing Lightning

ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

Alternative Weapons

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Footprint of the Rainbow

    Using an Elemental Skill increases DEF by 16% for 15s.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Prototype Starglitter

    After using an Elemental Skill, increases Normal and Charged Attack DMG by 8% for 12s. Max 2 stacks.

Comment

This Burst Support build provides the most DMG she can give from her Elemental Burst. The Sands piece can be swapped to Energy Recharge to meet your requirements. Crit Rate should only be taken if you are using the Favonius Lance.

Yun Jin's Artifacts

Support

Best Artifact Set

Husk of Opulent Dreams

2-Piece: DEF +30%

4-Piece: A character equipped with this Artifact set will obtain the Curiosity effect in the following conditions: When on the field, the character gains 1 stack after hitting an opponent with a Geo attack, triggering a maximum of once every 0.3s. When off the field, the character gains 1 stack every 3s. Curiosity can stack up to 4 times, each providing 6% DEF and a 6% Geo DMG Bonus. When 6 seconds pass without gaining a Curiosity stack, 1 stack is lost.

Main Stats

  • Sands: DEF%/Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: DEF%
  • Circlet: DEF%/CRIT Rate

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate
  • DEF%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Burst Support build provides the most DMG she can give from her Elemental Burst. The Sands piece can be swapped to Energy Recharge to meet your requirements. Crit Rate should only be taken if you are using the Favonius Lance.

Yun Jin's Teams

Yun Jin & Yoimiya 1 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Yoimiya will benefit having Yun Jin in the team as the former will get Normal Attack buffs from the latter. You can either create a team with four elements to fully utilize Yun Jin's Normal Attack DMG bonus or go for Geo Resonance to increase overall DMG.

Yun Jin & Yoimiya 2 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Yoimiya

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Fischl

Support

Yoimiya will benefit having Yun Jin in the team as the former will get Normal Attack buffs from the latter. You can either create a team with four elements to fully utilize Yun Jin's Normal Attack DMG bonus or go for Geo Resonance to increase overall DMG.

Yun Jin & Arlecchino 1 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS/Support

Bennett

Support

Yun Jin is a viable support option for a Normal Attack-centric unit like Arlecchino, with the second recommended team having the benefit of both pyro and geo resonance. It should be worth noting that with this team, the damage ceiling scales with Yun Jin's constellation and it is recommended to get her to C2 to reap all the benefits of this team comp.

Yun Jin & Arlecchino 2 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Arlecchino

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS/Support

Zhongli

Support

Yun Jin is a viable support option for a Normal Attack-centric unit like Arlecchino, with the second recommended team having the benefit of both pyro and geo resonance. It should be worth noting that with this team, the damage ceiling scales with Yun Jin's constellation and it is recommended to get her to C2 to reap all the benefits of this team comp.

Yun Jin & Ayato Team

Yun Jin

Support

Ayato

Main DPS

Xiangling

Sub-DPS

Bennett

Support

Ayato can also benefit from Yun Jin as he also specializes in Normal Attacks. The Normal Attack buff from Yun Jin combined with Pyro application for Vaporize will help deal tons of DMG.

Yun Jin & Noelle 1 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Noelle

Main DPS

Gorou

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

Noelle and Yun Jin can have some variety in their team combos. With the introduction of Furina, Noelle can be boosted by both Furina and Yun Jin into new heights. Yun Jin and Gorou can provide DMG buffs to Noelle while Fischl can deal supplementary Electro DMG and provide a lot of energy particles.

Yun Jin & Noelle 2 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Noelle

Main DPS

Fischl

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

Noelle and Yun Jin can have some variety in their team combos. With the introduction of Furina, Noelle can be boosted by both Furina and Yun Jin into new heights. Yun Jin and Gorou can provide DMG buffs to Noelle while Fischl can deal supplementary Electro DMG and provide a lot of energy particles.

Yun Jin & Wanderer 1 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Wanderer

Main DPS

Bennett

Sub-DPS

Furina

Support

Wanderer can be especially supported by Yun Jin due to both her Normal Attack buffs. This fully complements Wanderer due to his main source of damage being his Normal Attacks. At C6, this duo becomes even more potent with Yun Jin increasing Wanderer's Attack Speed, therefore increasing the amount of damage he can do during his Elemental Skill.

Yun Jin & Wanderer 2 Team

Yun Jin

Support

Wanderer

Main DPS

Faruzan

Sub-DPS

Zhongli

Support

Wanderer can be especially supported by Yun Jin due to both her Normal Attack buffs. This fully complements Wanderer due to his main source of damage being his Normal Attacks. At C6, this duo becomes even more potent with Yun Jin increasing Wanderer's Attack Speed, therefore increasing the amount of damage he can do during his Elemental Skill.

Yun Jin's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Is one of the few supports that exclusively buff Normal Attacks, allowing her to slot into certain teams that do not have access to Bennett.
  • Elemental Skill can mitigate large Burst damage from enemies due to Parry mechanic.
  • Strong Constellations, letting her not only buff Normal Attack DMG, but also Normal ATK Speed at C6 which is a rarity.

Weaknesses

  • Energy Recharge-hungry due to low particle generation from her Elemental Skill.
  • Less potent before C2 and C6.
  • 30 Limited Triggers for buff. Each hit on a separate enemy counts as 1 instance of Normal Attack Buff used. This can be an issue when faced with continuous waves of enemies.

Zhongli's Weapons

Shield Support

Best Weapon

Black Tassel

Increases DMG against slimes by 40%.

Alternative Weapons

    Dialogues of the Desert Sages

    When the wielder performs healing, restore 8 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

    Staff of Homa

    HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Comment

This support build for Zhongli focuses on strengthening the shields for the entire party. Though it does not offer the best damage, it enables you to have the most comfortable playstyle because of its near-unbreakable strength.

Dialogues of the Desert Sages offers a better HP bonus than most weapons, but since Zhongli can only use half of its effect, players can opt for Rightful Reward if they are searching for a weapon to use at full effect.

Geo Sub-DPS

Best Weapon

Staff of Homa

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder’s Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK Bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Alternative Weapons

    Engulfing Lightning

    ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

    The Catch

    Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 16% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 6%.

    Favonius Lance

    CRIT Hits have a 60% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 12s.

Comment

This Sub-DPS build is focused on dealing as much damage as possible from his Elemental Burst. Your shields won't be as strong, but that won't matter if you can beat your enemies faster.

Zhongli's Artifacts

Shield Support

Best Artifact Set

Tenacity of the Millelith

2-Piece: HP +20%

4-Piece: When an Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the ATK of all nearby party members is increased by 20% and their Shield Strength is increased by 30% for 3s. This effect can be triggered once every 0.5s. This effect can still be triggered even when the character who is using this artifact set is not on the field.

Main Stats

  • Sands: HP%
  • Goblet: HP%
  • Circlet: HP%

Sub Stats

  • HP%
  • HP
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This support build for Zhongli focuses on strengthening the shields for the entire party. Though it does not offer the best damage, it enables you to have the most comfortable playstyle because of its near-unbreakable strength.

Dialogues of the Desert Sages offers a better HP bonus than most weapons, but since Zhongli can only use half of its effect, players can opt for Rightful Reward if they are searching for a weapon to use at full effect.

Geo Sub-DPS

Best Artifact Set

&

Noblesse Oblige & Archaic Petra

2-Piece: Elemental Burst DMG +20%

4-Piece: Gain a 15% Geo DMG Bonus

Main Stats

  • Sands: ATK%
  • Goblet: Geo DMG Bonus
  • Circlet: CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG

Sub Stats

  • CRIT Rate/CRIT DMG
  • ATK%
  • HP%
  • Energy Recharge

Comment

This Sub-DPS build is focused on dealing as much damage as possible from his Elemental Burst. Your shields won't be as strong, but that won't matter if you can beat your enemies faster.

Zhongli's Teams

Mono-Geo 1 Team

Zhongli

Sub-DPS

Itto

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Mono-Geo teams usually require only three Geo characters and a flex role with a different element to create the Crystalize effect, but with Zhongli in the party, not only will he provide shields, but also reduce the Geo DMG resistance of enemies. Zhongli also creates a unique mechanic when his Pillar interacts with other Geo Constructs, in which the pulsing effect spreads across all constructs. This effect can be used with Geo Traveler's Elemental Skill and Burst to cover a wide area and deal lots of Geo damage!

Mono-Geo 2 Team

Zhongli

Sub-DPS

Traveler (Geo)

Main DPS

Albedo

Sub-DPS

Gorou

Support

Mono-Geo teams usually require only three Geo characters and a flex role with a different element to create the Crystalize effect, but with Zhongli in the party, not only will he provide shields, but also reduce the Geo DMG resistance of enemies. Zhongli also creates a unique mechanic when his Pillar interacts with other Geo Constructs, in which the pulsing effect spreads across all constructs. This effect can be used with Geo Traveler's Elemental Skill and Burst to cover a wide area and deal lots of Geo damage!

Vaporize Team

Zhongli

Support

Hu Tao

Main DPS

Xingqiu

Sub-DPS

Yelan

Sub-DPS

True to lore, Liyue's Wangsheng Funeral Parlor team, along with Xingqiu and Yelan's massive buffs for Hu Tao, is one of the best single-target team comps you can use with Zhongli.

Physical Team

Zhongli

Support

Eula

Main DPS

Raiden

Sub-DPS

Shenhe

Support

Zhongli's shield can also reduce the Physical Resistance of enemies. A big issue with Eula is how open she is to attacks during her combos, but not anymore when Zhongli is on the team. This can apply to any Phys DMG team comp.

Zhongli's Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths

  • Near-unbreakable shields that can withstand most attacks.
  • Shield gives an unconditional All Elemental RES, which makes him extremely flexible to most team comps.
  • Large AoE Geo Damage on Burst that can also petrify enemies.
  • His Geo Pillar can resonate without other Geo constructs, which adds more DPS to mono-Geo teams.

Weaknesses

  • Shields are weak to Riftwolves' corrosion and Black Serpent Knight anti-shield mechanics.
  • Long Elemental Burst animation that leads to DPS loss when built as a Support.
  • Low Elemental Particle generation.
